content: गच्छता मातुलकुलं भरतेन तदाऽनघ।शत्रुघ्नो नित्यशत्रुघ्नो नीतः प्रीतिपुरस्कृतः।।2.1.1।।
explanation: Bharata set out for his maternal uncle's house. He took with him the sinless Satrughna who is always successful in destroying foes and on whom he had bestowed his love and affection.

content: तत्र न्यवसद्भ्रात्रा सह सत्कारसत्कृतः।मातुलेनाश्वपतिना पुत्रस्नेहेन लालितः।।2.1.2।।
explanation: Treated with warm hospitality and fatherly affection by his maternal uncle Aswapati, Bharata stayed on there along with his brother.

content: तत्रापि निवसन्तौ तौ तर्प्यमाणौ च कामतः।भ्रातरौ स्मरतां वीरौ वृद्धं दशरथं नृपम्।।2.1.3।।
explanation: Though both the heroic brothers stayed there satisfied on their own they constantly remembered their aged father.

content: राजाऽपि तौ महातेजा स्सस्मार प्रोषितौ सुतौ।उभौ भरतशत्रुघ्नौ महेन्द्रवरुणोपमौ।।2.1.4।।
explanation: The glorious king Dasaratha also remembered his sons, Bharata and Satrughna, who  were like the great Indra and Varuna, (now) away from home.

content: सर्व एव तु तस्येष्टा श्चत्वारः पुरुषर्षभाः।स्वशरीराद्विनिर्वृत्ताश्चत्वार इव बाहवः।।2.1.5।।
explanation: Dasaratha, a bull among men, loved all his four sons equally just as the  arms of his own body.

content: तेषामपि महातेजा रामो रतिकरःपितुः।स्वयम्भूरिव भूतानां बभूव गुणवत्तरः।।2.1.6।।
explanation: Even among them the brilliant Rama was a source of delight to his father like the Selfborn (Brahma) to all living beings.

content: स हि देवैरुदीर्णस्य रावणस्य वधार्थिभिः।अर्थितो मानुषे लोके जज्ञे विष्णुस्सनातनः।।2.1.7।।
explanation: Entreated by the devatas desirous of slaying arrogant Ravana, the eternal Visnu was indeed born in the mortal world as Rama.

content: कौशल्या शुशुभे तेन पुत्रेणामिततेजसा।यथा वरेण देवानामदितिर्वज्रपाणिना।।2.1.8।।
explanation: Kausalya looked splendid with her son, Rama of boundless energy, as did Aditi with the chief of the gods Indra, wielder of thunder.

content: स हि रूपोपपन्नश्च वीर्यवाननसूयकः।भूमौवनुपमस्सूनुर्गुणैर्दशरथोपमः।।2.1.9।।
explanation: Endowed with beauty and strengh, free from envy, and in virtues equal to Dasaratha, Rama was verily an incomparable son on earth.

content: स तु नित्यं प्रशान्तात्मा मृदुपूर्वं च भाषते।उच्यमानोऽपि परुषं नोत्तरं प्रतिपद्यते।।2.1.10।।
explanation: With an unfailing serenity of mind, Rama never paid back harshness with harshness.

content: कथञ्चिदुपकारेण कृतेनैकेन तुष्यति।न स्मरत्यपकाराणां शतमप्यात्मवत्तया।।2.1.11।।
explanation: Gifted with selfrestraint, Rama was pleased even with a single benefit done somehow to him, yet did not remember even a hundred offences  committed by others.

content: शीलवृद्धैर्ज्ञानवृद्धैर्वयोवृद्धैश्च सज्जनैः।कथयन्नास्त वै नित्यमस्त्रयोग्यान्तरेष्वपि।।2.1.12।।
explanation: Even during intervals of  his practice of weapons he never failed to interact with saintly persons and with people advanced in age, virtue and wisdom.

content: बुद्धिमान्मधुराभाषी पूर्वभाषी प्रियंवदः।वीर्यवान्न च वीर्येण महता स्वेन विस्मितः।।2.1.13।।
explanation: Wise and softspoken, he was the first to speak to others words pleasing to hear. Though mighty, he was never proud of his overwhelming strength.

content: नचानृतकथो विद्वान् वृद्धानां प्रतिपूजकः।अनुरक्तः प्रजाभिश्च प्रजाश्चाप्यनुरञ्जते।।2.1.14।।
explanation: Rama never told lies. He was a learned man. He honoured elders by going forward to them. He loved his subjects as much as his subjects loved him.

content: सानुक्रोशो जितक्रोधो ब्राह्मणप्रतिपूजकः।दीनानुकम्पी धर्मज्ञो नित्यं प्रग्रहवांश्चुचिः।।2.1.15।।
explanation: He was kindhearted and compassionate to the distressed, coolheaded and righteous. A worshipper of brahmins he was always selfrestrained and pure in spirit.

content: कुलोचितमतिः क्षात्रं धर्मं स्वं बहुमन्यते।मन्यते परया कीर्त्या महत्स्वर्गफलं ततः।।2.1.16।।
explanation: He entertained thoughts befitting his (great) dynasty and honoured the code of conduct of a kshatriya. He believed one could attain heavenly abode through his great achievements.

content: नाऽऽश्रेयसि रतो विद्वान्नविरुद्धकथारुचिः।उत्तरोत्तरयुक्तौ च वक्ता वाचस्पतिर्यथा।।2.1.17।।
explanation: A learned man, he evinced no interest in pursuits that did not contribute to one's welfare or had he any liking for speaking against others. But in debates his oratorical flourish was comparable to Brihaspati's.

content: अरोगस्तरुणो वाग्मी वपुष्मान्देशकालवित्।लोके पुरुषसारज्ञ स्साधुरेको विनिर्मितः।।2.1.18।।
explanation: He was young, eloquent, healthy and free from disease. He was conscious of (right) time and place (for his pursuits). He was capable of ascertaining the potentiality of men. He was born a sage in this world.

content: स तु श्रेष्ठैर्गुणैर्युक्तः प्रजानां पार्थिवात्मजः।बहिश्चर इव प्राणो बभूव गुणतः प्रियः।।2.1.19।।
explanation: Bestowed with such excellent qualities, the prince (Rama) became a favourite of his subjects.  He was like their vital life outside their bodies.

content: सम्यग्विद्याव्रतस्नातो यथावत्साङ्गवेदवित्।इष्वस्त्रे च पितु श्श्रेष्ठो बभूव भरताग्रजः।।2.1.20।।
explanation: With the appropriate sacred ablution marking the completion of the vow relating to the respective branches of learning in accordance with tradition, this elder brother of Bharata achieved proficiency in the Vedas and its auxiliary sciences. He surpassed his father in archery.

content: कल्याणाभिजन स्साधुरदीन स्सत्यवागृजुः।वृद्धैरभिविनीतश्च द्विजैर्धर्मार्थदर्शिभिः।।2.1.21।।
explanation: Born in a family of noble descent, he was saintly. A man without meanness.He was truthful and a man of rectitude. The training he received under aged brahmins conversant with dharma and artha made him welldisciplined.

content: धर्मकामार्थतत्त्वज्ञः स्मृतिमान्प्रतिभानवान्।लौकिके समयाचारे कृतकल्पो विशारदः।।2.1.22।।
explanation: He knew the true nature of dharma, artha and kama. With a sharp memory,  he was a genius. He was highly skilled in accomplishing tasks related to social practices and customs.

content: निभृत स्संवृताकारो गुप्तमन्त्र स्सहायवान्।अमोघक्रोधहर्षश्च त्यागसंयमकालवित्।।2.1.23।।
explanation: He (Rama) was modest and did not reveal his inner feelings. He counselled in secrecy and had good friends. Never was his anger or pleasure in vain. He knew the occasion  when to sacrifce and when to exercise restraint.

content: दृढभक्ति स्स्थिरप्रज्ञो नासद्ग्राही न दुर्वचाः।निस्तन्द्रिरप्रमत्तश्च स्वदोषपरदोषवित्।।2.1.24।।
explanation: He was firm in his devotion and steady in intellect. He accepted nothing ignoble nor used bad words. He was not swayed by emotions or prone to idleness. He knew his faults as well as of others.

content: शास्त्रज्ञश्च कृतज्ञश्च पुरुषान्तरकोविदः।यः प्रग्रहानुग्रहयोर्यथान्यायं विचक्षणः।।2.1.25।।
explanation: He was versed in scriptures. He was grateful (to those who did him some good) and skilled in differentiating the comparative merits of men. Fair in his judgement he dispensed justice in accordance with law by reprimanding (the delinquent) and favouring (the honest).

content: सत्सङ्ग्रहप्रग्रहणे स्थानविन्निग्रहस्य च।आयकर्मण्युपायज्ञ स्सन्दृष्टव्ययकर्मवित्।।2.1.26।।
explanation: He was skilled in  receiving and encouraging the righteous and in punishing (the wicked). He knew  whom to punish. He knew the right means of raising revenue and also expending money in the prescribed manner.

content: श्रैष्ठ्यं शास्त्रसमूहेषु प्राप्तो व्यामिश्रकेषु च।अर्थधमौ च सङ्गृह्य सुखतन्त्रो न चालसः।।2.1.27।।
explanation: He obtained proficiency in scriptures and interconnected (mutually contradictory) branches of learning. Only after having grasped the (philosophy of) artha (statecraft) and dharma (righteousness), he sought pleasure. He was never indolent.

content: वैहारिकाणां शिल्पानां विज्ञाताऽऽर्थविभागवित्।आरोहे विनये चैव युक्तो वारणवाजिनाम्।।2.1.28।।
explanation: He had understanding of art and craft useful for entertainment. He knew proper  ways of dispensing wealth. He was experienced in riding elephants and horses and in humbling them.

content: धनुर्वेदविदां श्रेष्ठो लोकेऽतिरथसम्मतः।अभियाता प्रहर्ता च सेनानयविशारदः।।2.1.29।।
explanation: He was the best among those skilled in archery in this world. He was reckoned as a great wielder of warchariots and one who strikes at the enemies by advancing towards them. He was an expert in commanding troops. (Atiratha is an excellent warrior who can manage his chariot, horses and the charioteer.)

content:
अप्रधृष्यश्च सङ्ग्रामे क्रुध्दैरपि सुरासुरैः।

अनसूयो जितक्रोधो न दृप्तो न च मत्सरी।

न चावमन्ता भूतानां न च कालवशानुगः।।।2.1.30।।
explanation: He was incapable of being repressed even by the enraged devatas or rakshasas in the battle. He was free from envy and had subdued his anger and pride. He was never malicious and he never slighted any living being nor did he bow to the pressure of time.

content: एवं श्रेष्ठगुणैर्युक्तः प्रजानां पार्थिवात्मजः।सम्मतस्त्रिषु लोकेषु वसुधायाः क्षमागुणैः।।2.1.31।।बुद्ध्या बृहस्पतेस्तुल्यो वीर्येणापि शचीपतेः।
explanation: Thus endowed with such excellent qualities, the subjects in the three worlds held him in high esteem. In forbearance he was like the earth, in wisdom like Brihaspati and in prowess like the consort of Sachi (Indra).

content: तथा सर्वप्रजाकान्तैः प्रीतिसंजननैः पितुः।।2.1.32।।गुणैर्विरुरुचे रामो दीप्तस्सूर्य इवांशुभिः।
explanation: Rama whose virtues were cherished by all his subjects was a source of delight to his father and he shone like the rays of the resplendent Sun.

content: तमेवं व्रतसम्पन्नमप्रधृष्यपराक्रमम्।।2.1.33।।लोक पालोपमं नाथमकामयत मेदिनी।
explanation: The earth desired him as her lord, for he was bestowed with such avowed virtues and with indomitable prowess equal to all the guardians of the quarters.

content: एतैस्तु बहुभिर्युक्तं गुणैरनुपमैस्सुतम्।।2.1.34।।दृष्ट्वा दशरथो राजा चक्रे चिन्तां परन्तपः।
explanation: Observing his son endowed with such innumerable and incomparable virtues, king Dasaratha, subduer of enemies started thinking.

content:
अथ राज्ञो बभूवैवं वृद्धस्य चिरजीविनः।।2.1.35।।

प्रीतिरेषा कथं रामो राजा स्यान्मयि जीवति।
explanation: Thereafter, flashed in the mind of that aged king who had (already) lived long this pleasant thought as to how Rama will become king while he was alive.

content: एषा ह्यस्य परा प्रीतिर्हृदि संपरिवर्तते।।2.1.36।।कदा नाम सुतं द्रक्ष्याम्यभिषिक्तमहं प्रियम्।
explanation: The thought of seeing his dear son coronated repeatedly surfaced his mind so great was his affection (for Rama).

content: वृद्धिकामो हि लोकस्य सर्वभूतानुकम्पनः।।2.1.37।।मत्तः प्रियतरो लोके पर्जन्य इव वृष्टिमान्।
explanation: (He said to himself) 'his (Rama's) only desire is to promote the prosperity of this world. He is one who shows compassion to all beings and is like the raingod dearer than me to the people of the world'.

content: यमशक्रसमो वीर्ये बृहस्पतिसमो मतौ।।2.1.38।।महीधरसमो धृत्यां मत्तश्च गुणवत्तरः।
explanation: 'In prowess he is equal to Yama and Indra,in wisdom to Brihaspati and in firmness to a mountain and in virtues greater than me'.

content: महीमहमिमां कृत्स्नामधितिष्ठन्तमात्मजम्।।2.1.39।।अनेन वयसा दृष्ट्वा यथास्वर्गमवाप्नुयाम्।
explanation: 'Seeing my son ruling this entire dominion of the earth, I will experience the bliss of attaining heaven at this age.'

content: इत्येतैर्विविधैस्तैस्तैरन्यपार्थिवदुर्लभैः।।2.1.40।।शिष्टैरपरिमेयैश्च लोके लोकोत्तरैर्गुणैः।तं समीक्ष्य महाराजो युक्तं समुदितैश्शुभैः।।2.1.41।।निश्चित्य सचिवैस्सार्धं युवराजममन्यत।
explanation: King Dasaratha in consultation with his ministers observed that Rama is endowed  with various virtues not found in other kings, immeasurable virtues which are praiseworthy, and exemplary. He is distinguished in this world as all qualities seem to have merged in him. The king then made up his mind to make him princeregent.

content: दिव्यन्तरिक्षे भूमौ च घोरमुत्पातजं भयम्।।2.1.42।।स़ञ्चचक्षेऽथ मेधावी शरीरे चात्मनो जराम्।
explanation: The sagacious king, too perceived his body ageing and the portentous omens in the heaven, in the sky and on the earth causing dreadful concern.

content: पूर्णचन्द्राननस्याथ शोकापनुदमात्मनः।।2.1.43।।लोके रामस्य बुबुधे सम्प्रियत्वं महात्मनः।
explanation: The king realised afterwards that his grief would be dispelled if noble Rama whose countenance resembled the full moon and who was a favourite of the people is crowned.

content: आत्मनश्च प्रजानां च श्रेयसे च प्रियेण च।।2.1.44।।प्राप्तकालेन धर्मात्मा भक्त्या त्वरितवान् नृपः।
explanation: Longing for it, the noble king realized that the time was ripe for the acceleration of the process of safeguarding his own and his subjects' welfare.

content:
नानानगरवास्तव्यान्पृथग्जानपदानपि।।2.1.45।।

समानिनाय मेदिन्याः प्रधानान्पृथिवीपतीन्।
explanation: He summoned individually kings and all important citizens residing in various cities and villages of this earth.

content: न तु केकयराजानं जनकं वा नराधिपः।।2.1.46।।त्वरया चानयामास पश्चात्तौ श्रोष्यतः प्रियम्।
explanation: The king did not invite both the kings of Kekaya and Janaka  in  haste with an  intention that they would hear the glad news at a later date.

content: तान्वेश्मनानाभरणैर्यथाऽर्हं प्रतिपूजितान्।।2.1.47।।ददर्शालङ्कृतो राजा प्रजापतिरिव प्रजाः।
explanation: The king who received them in a befitting manner and provided them with residence and ornaments looked like lord Brahma adorned by the people.

content: अथोपविष्टे नृपतौ तस्मिन्परबलार्दने।।2.1.48।।ततः प्रविविशु श्शेषा राजानो लोकसम्मताः।
explanation: After the king (Dasaratha) who was a tormenter of enemy forces was seated, the rest of the kings beloved of their subjects entered (the assembly hall).

content: अथ राजवितीर्णेषु विविधेष्वासनेषु च।।2.1.49।।राजानमेवाभिमुखाः निषेदुर्नियता नृपाः।
explanation: Then  the kings (who entered the assembly) took the seats assigned to them facing the king (Dasaratha), following the royal tradition.

content: सलब्धमानैर्विनयान्वितैर्नृपैःपुरालयैर्जानपदैश्च मानदैः।   उपोपविष्टैर्नृपतिर्वृतो बभौसहस्रचक्षुर्भगवानिवामरैः।।2.1.50।।
explanation: Surrounded by those feudatory kings endowed with modesty, and received with due honour and by the respectful residents of cities and villages, the king (Dasaratha), resembled lord Indra, the thousand eyed encircled by the gods.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे प्रथमस्सर्गः।Thus ends the first sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Dasaratha commends to the assembly of elders and counsellors for installation of Rama as Prince Regent-- Assembly approves the proposal of Dasaratha with delight describing the virtues of Rama in support of their approval.]ततः परिषदं सर्वामामन्त्र्य वसुधाधिपः।हितमुद्धर्षणं चैवमुवाच प्रथितं वचः।।2.2.1।।
explanation: Thereafter, the lord of the earth (king Dasaratha) addressed the entire assembly of  invitees. He spoke these pleasing words aimed at their welfare which thrilled and delighted the hearts (of the assembled kings):

content: दुन्दुभिस्वनकल्पेन गम्भीरेणानुनादिना।स्वरेण महता राजा जीमूत इव नादयन्।।2.2.2।।राजलक्षणयुक्तेन कान्तेनानुपमेन च।उवाच रसयुक्तेन स्वरेण नृपतिर्नृपान्।।2.2.3।।
explanation: Lord of men (king Dasaratha) addressed the feudatory kings with words deep, resonant, loud like the kettledrum or the rumbling cloud, in a delightful, incomparable and attractive voice that carried all the dignity of royalty:

content: विदितं भवतामेतद्यथा मे राज्यमुत्तमम्।पूर्वकैर्मम राजेन्द्रैस्सुतवत्परिपालितम्।।2.2.4।।
explanation: It is wellknown to all of you that people of this greatest kingdom were ruled by my predecessors who were great kings, who looked after the subjects as though they were their own children.

content: सोऽहमिक्ष्वाकुभि स्सर्वैर्नरेन्द्रैः परिपालितम्।श्रेयसा योक्तुकामोऽस्मि सुखार्हमखिलं जगत्।।2.2.5।।
explanation: I desire to  accomplish the welfare of this entire world which deserves the happiness brought about by the rule of all the Ikshvaku kings.

content: मयाप्याचरितं पूर्वैः पन्थानमनुगच्छता।प्रजा नित्यमनिद्रेण यथाशक्त्यभिरक्षिताः।।2.2.6।।
explanation: Following the path of my forefathers I protected the people to the best of my ability by being ever vigilant.

content: इदं शरीरं कृत्स्नस्य लोकस्य चरता हितम्।पाण्डुरस्याऽतपत्रस्यच्छायायां जरितं मया।।2.2.7।।
explanation: My body has attained old age after ruling the entire world ensuring the welfare of the people under the shade of royal white parasol.

content: प्राप्य वर्षसहस्राणि बहून्यायूंषि जीवतः।जीर्णस्यास्य शरीरस्य विश्रान्तिमभिरोचये।।2.2.8।।
explanation: Having lived for thousands of years this body is now worn out  due to old age and therefore I want rest.

content: राजप्रभावजुष्टां हि दुर्वहामजितेन्द्रियैः।परिश्रान्तोऽस्मि लोकस्य गुर्वीं धर्मधुरं वहन्।।2.2.9।।
explanation: I am weary of carrying on the heavy burden of duty and find it difficult to sustain the rule of dharma. It can be shouldered by those who have royal qualities (of might, courage etc) and not by those who have not controlled their senses.

content: सोऽहं विश्रममिच्छामि पुत्रं कृत्वा प्रजाहिते।सन्निकृष्टानिमान्सर्वाननुमान्य द्विजर्षभान्।।2.2.10।।
explanation: Therefore, after convincing all of you, the best of (learned) brahmins present here, I intend to take rest by installing my son to look after the welfare of the people.

content: अनुजातो हि मां सर्वैर्गुणैर्ज्येष्ठो ममात्मजः।पुरन्दरसमो वीर्ये रामः परपुरञ्जयः।।2.2.11।।
explanation: My eldest son Rama, inheriting every virtue of mine, is a conqueror of enemy cities  and is equal to Indra in prowess.

content: तं चन्द्रमिव पुष्येण युक्तं धर्मभृतां वरम्।यौवराज्ये नियोक्ताऽस्मि प्रीतः पुरुषपुङ्गवम्।।2.2.12।।
explanation: I propose to install him (Rama), foremost among upholders of righteousness and the best of men who resembles the Moon in brightness when in conjunction with Pushya star, as heirapparent to the throne.

content: अनुरूपस्स वै नाथो लक्ष्मीवान् लक्ष्मणाग्रजः।त्रैलोक्यमपि नाथेन येन स्यान्नाथवत्तरम्।।2.2.13।।
explanation: With him (Rama) as ruler, all the three worlds will also have a better protector.That elder brother of Lakshmana with signs of greatness is certainly the most befitting to rule this kingdom.

content: अनेन श्रेयसा सद्यस्संयोज्यैवमिमां महीम्।गतक्लेशो भविष्यामि सुते तस्मिन्निवेश्य वै।।2.2.14।।
explanation: I shall be relieved of my anxiety  by entrusting the land (ruled by me) to my son (Rama) without any more delay and thus ensure the continued welfare of this world.

content: यदिदं मेऽनुरूपार्थं मया साधु सुमन्त्रितम्।भवन्तो मेऽनुमन्यन्तां कथं वा करवाण्यहम्।।2.2.15।।
explanation: Although it (this decision) is personally favourable to me and I have decided after seeking good counsel, you should also give me your consent and tell me what I should do.

content: यद्यप्येषा मम प्रीतिर्हितमन्यद्विचिन्त्यताम्।अन्या मध्यस्थचिन्ता हि विमर्दाभ्यधिकोदया।।2.2.16।।
explanation: Although this is what I would like to do, please suggest alternative ways of achieving the welfare (of this kingdom). Deliberations by the unbiased (on this issue) may bring good.

content: इति ब्रुवन्तं मुदिताः प्रत्यनन्दन्नृपा नृपम्।वृष्टिमन्तं महामेघं नर्दन्त इव बर्हिणः।।2.2.17।।
explanation: Having thus heard king Dasaratha speak, the kings acclaimed him with delight, like peacocks crying (in joy) to see thick clouds.

content: स्निग्धोऽनुनादी संजज्ञे तत्र हर्षसमीरितः।जनौघोद्घुष्टसन्नादो विमानं कम्पयन्निव।।2.2.18।।
explanation: There emanated cries of love and joy from the multitude of people (conveying their approval) whose reverberation seemed to shake the palace.

content: तस्य धर्मार्थविदुषो भावमाज्ञाय सर्वशः।ब्राह्मणा जनमुख्याश्च पौरजानपदै स्सह।।2.2.19।।समेत्य मन्त्रयित्वा तु समतागतबुद्धयः।ऊचुश्च मनसा ज्ञात्वा वृद्धं दशरथं नृपम्।।2.2.20।।
explanation: Brahmins, kings and other prominent men, inhabitants of towns and villages  having  fully known the views of Dasaratha who was conversant with artha and dharma  joined together and deliberated. They thought out well and having arrived at unanimity in their thinking thus addressed the aged king Dasaratha.

content: अनेकवर्षसाहस्रो वृद्धस्त्वमसि पार्थिव।स रामं युवराजानमभिषिञ्चिस्व पार्थिवम्।।2.2.21।।
explanation: O mighty king, you have grown many thousands of years old. Therefore, you should coronate Rama as prince regent of this kingdom.

content: इच्छामो हि महाबाहुं रघुवीरं महाबलम्।गजेन महताऽयान्तं रामं छत्रावृताननम्।।2.2.22।।
explanation: We cherish to see the mightyarmed hero among the Raghus, Rama, riding on a majestic elephant, his countenance shadowed by the royal parasol.

content: इति तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राजा तेषां मनःप्रियं।अजानन्निव जिज्ञासुरिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.2.23।।
explanation: Having heard them king Dasaratha, pretending as though he was not aware of their heart's desire but was now wishing to ascertain it, spoke these words:

content: श्रुत्वैव वचनं यन्मे राघवं पतिमिच्छथ।राजान स्संशयोऽयं मे किमिदं ब्रूत तत्त्वतः।।2.2.24।।
explanation: O kings, soon after listening to my words, all of you wish Rama to be king. (But) I doubt (in my mind) whether you have said it from your heart৷৷

content: कथं नु मयि धर्मेण पृथिवीमनुशासति।भवन्तो द्रष्टुमिच्छन्ति युवराजं ममात्मजम्।।2.2.25।।
explanation: When the earth is being ruled righteously by me why indeed you intend to see my son as prince regent?

content: ते तमूचुर्महात्मानं पौरजानपदैस्सह।बहवो नृप कल्याणा गुणाः पुत्रस्य सन्ति ते।।2.2.26।।
explanation: Those kings along with the inhabitants of towns and villages answered the  magnanimous king: O king your son, indeed has many auspicious and admirable  virtues.

content: गुणान् गुणवतो देव देवकल्पस्य धीमतः।प्रियानानन्दनान्कृत्स्नान्प्रवक्ष्यामोऽद्य तान् शृणु।।2.2.27।।
explanation: O king, we shall now speak about those great virtues of the sagacious (Rama). Comparable to those of the gods, they are dear and a source of delight for every one. Please listen.

content: दिव्यैर्गुणैश्शक्रसमो रामस्सत्यपराक्रमः।इक्ष्वाकुभ्योऽपि सर्वेभ्यो ह्यतिरिक्तो विशांपते।।2.2.28।।
explanation: Lord of the people Rama with his divine virtues is equal to Indra. He with his  proven valour is exceptional among all the descendents of the Iksvakus.

content: राम स्सत्पुरुषो लोके सत्यधर्मपरायणः।साक्षाद्रामाद्विनिर्वृत्तो धर्मश्चापि श्रिया सह।।2.2.29।।
explanation: Devoted to truth and righteousness Rama is the most venerable among men in this world. Even righteousness along with prosperity flows directly from Rama.

content: प्रजासुखत्त्वे चन्द्रस्य वसुधायाः क्षमागुणैः।बुद्ध्या बृहस्पतेस्तुल्यो वीर्ये साक्षाच्छचीपतेः।।2.2.30।।
explanation: He is equal to the Moon in causing happiness to the people, to the earth in forbearance, to Brihaspati in wisdom and to Indra in prowess.

content: धर्मज्ञ स्सत्यसन्धश्च शीलवाननसूयकः।क्षान्त स्सान्त्वयिता श्लक्ष्णः कृतज्ञो विजितेन्द्रियः।।2.2.31।।
explanation: Rama knows the ways of righteousness. He is true to his word and free from envy. He possesses a sound character with forbearance, gentleness and a sense of gratitude. With his senses under control, he is a source of consolation (in stressful times).

content: मृदुश्च स्थिरचित्तश्च सदा भव्योऽनसूयकः।प्रियवादी च भूतानां सत्यवादी च राघवः।।2.2.32।।बहुश्रुतानां वृद्धानां ब्राह्मणानामुपासिता।तेनास्येहाऽतुला कीर्तिर्यशस्तेजश्च वर्धते।।2.2.33।।
explanation: This son of the Raghus (Rama) is softspoken, steadfast, always serene, truthful and  free from envy. He is pleasing to all beings. He serves those elderly brahmins versed in many lores. With these virtues his incomparable glory, fame and splendour have steadily grown.

content: देवासुरमनुष्याणां सर्वास्त्रेषु विशारदः।सम्यग्विद्याव्रतस्नातो यथावत्साङ्गवेदवित्।।2.2.34।।
explanation: He is an expert in wielding all kinds of weapons available to devas, asuras and  men. He has achieved mastery over all sciences and has appropriately acquired knowledge of the Vedas and its ancillary sciences.

content: गान्धर्वे च भुवि श्रेष्ठो बभूव भरताग्रजः।कल्याणाभिजन स्साधुरदीनात्मा महामतिः।।2.2.35।।
explanation: This elder brother of Bharata is the greatest exponent in music on earth. Pious, sagacious, free from meanness, he is of noble descent.

content: द्विजैरभिविनीतश्च श्रेष्ठैर्धर्मार्थनैपुणैः।यदा व्रजति सङ्ग्रामं ग्रामार्थे नगरस्य वा।।2.2.36।।गत्वा सौमित्रिसहितो नाऽविजित्य निवर्तते।
explanation: Whenever he, wellinstructed in all matters by the best of brahmins wellversed in dharma and artha proceeds along with Lakshmana to wage a war for the sake of a village or a town, he never returns without conquering the enemy.

content: सङ्ग्रामात्पुनरागम्य कुञ्जरेण रथेन वा।2.2.37।।पौरान् स्वजनवन्नित्यं कुशलं परिपृच्छति।।पुत्रेष्वग्निषु दारेषु प्रेष्यशिष्यगणेषु च।2.2.38।।निखिलेनानुपूर्व्याच्च पितापुत्रानिवौरसान्।।
explanation: While returning from the battlefield, either on a chariot or an elephant Rama stops and  enquires in detail and in order, the welfare of the citizens as he would do for his kith and kin. He enquires about the welfare of their children, sacred  rituals, wives, their servants and disciples as a father would enquire of his sons.

content: शुश्रूषन्ते च व श्शिष्याः कच्चित्कर्मसु दंशिताः।।2.2.39।।इति नः पुरुषव्याघ्र स्सदा रामोऽभिभाषते।
explanation: Rama, a tiger among men, always enquires whether our disciples discharge their duties.

content: व्यसनेषु मनुष्याणां भृशं भवति दुःखितः।।2.2.40।।उत्सवेषु च सर्वेषु पितेव परितुष्यति।
explanation: He grieves profoundly whenever people are afflicted by misfortunes (and) rejoices like a father on festive occasions.

content: सत्यवादी महेष्वासो वृद्धसेवी जितेन्द्रियः।।2.2.41।।स्मितपूर्वाभिभाषी च धर्मं सर्वात्मना श्रितः।
explanation: .He is one who speaks the truth. He is a great archer, one who has conquered his senses and serves the aged. He speaks with a  smile and protects dharma with all his heart.

content: सम्यग्योक्ता श्रेयसां च न विगृह्य कथारुचिः।।2.2.42।।उत्तरोत्तरयुक्तौ च वक्ता वाचस्पतिर्यथा।
explanation: He helps those who take refuge in him. He is not  interested in conversation leading to  dissentions. But during debates he is eloquent like Brihaspati (establing the truth on the basis of reasoning).

content: सुभ्रूरायत ताम्राक्ष स्साक्षाद्विष्णुरिव स्वयम्।।2.2.43।।रामो लोकाभिरामोऽयं शौर्यवीर्यपराक्रमैः।
explanation: Rama, who is the source of delight to the world, has charming eyebrows and large coppercoloured eyes. He is endowed with heroism, bravery and valour like Visnu manifested.

content: प्रजापालनतत्त्वज्ञो न रागोपहतेन्द्रियः।।2.2.44।।शक्तस्त्रैलोक्यमप्येको भोक्तुं किन्नु महीमिमाम्।
explanation: He is proficient in the ways and means of ruling the people. His senses are not overpowered by passion. He alone is capable of ruling the three worlds, what to speak the earth

content: नास्य क्रोधः प्रसादश्च निरर्थोऽस्ति कदाचन।।2.2.45।।हन्त्येव नियमाद्वध्यानवध्ये न च कुप्यति।
explanation: His anger or favour never goes in vain. He kills those who rightly deserve to be killed  and flares not at those whose life is to be spared.

content: युनक्त्यर्थैः प्रहृष्टश्च तमसौ यत्र तुष्यति।।2.2.46।।शान्तै स्सर्वप्रजाकान्तैः प्रीतिसञ्जननैर्नृणाम्।गुणैर्विरुरुचे रामो दीप्त स्सूर्य इवांशुभिः।।2.2.47।।
explanation: When pleased, Rama bestows wealth. Like the Sun shining with his rays, He shines  with his qualities of tranquil, charming and loving nature.

content: तमेवंगुणसम्पन्नं रामं सत्यपराक्रमम्।लोकपालोपमं नाथमकामयत मेदिनी।।2.2.48।।
explanation: The earth desired to have Rama, richly endowed with such virtues, possessing proven  prowess, comparable to Indra and other regents of the world, as her lord.

content: वत्सश्श्रेयसि जातस्ते दिष्ट्याऽसौ तव राघव।दिष्ट्या पुत्रगुणैर्युक्तो मारीच इव काश्यपः।।2.2.49।।
explanation: O son of the Raghus (Dasaratha), because of  your good  fortune that Rama, endowed with the qualities of an ideal son like Kasyapa to Maricha was born to you for the welfare of this world.

content: बलमारोग्यमायुश्च रामस्य विदितात्मनः।देवासुरमनुष्येषु सगन्धर्वोरगेषु च।।2.2.50।।आशंसते जनस्सर्वो राष्ट्रे पुरवरे तथा।आभ्यन्तरश्च बाह्यश्च पौरजानपदो जनः।।2.2.51।।
explanation: Gandharvas, uragas, devas, asuras, the inhabitants of towns and villages, all men living  in neighbouring or distant regions are wish the illustrious Rama strength, health and long life.

content: स्त्रियो वृद्धास्तरुण्यश्च सायं प्रातस्समाहिताः।सर्वान् देवान् नमस्यन्ति रामस्यार्थे यशस्विनः।।2.2.52।।
explanation: Women, young and old alike devoutly invoke at dusk and at dawn all the gods for the sake of the celebrated Rama.

content: तेषामायाचितं देव त्वत्प्रसादात्समृद्ध्यताम्।राममिन्दीवरश्यामं सर्वशत्रुनिबर्हणम्।।2.2.53।।पश्यामो यौवराज्यस्थं तव राजोत्तमात्मजम्।
explanation: O Lord let the peoples' prayer be fulfilled by your blessings. We would like to see your son Rama of the complexion of a bluelotus and destroyer of enemies as prince regent.

content: तं देव देवोपममात्मजं तेसर्वस्य लोकस्य हिते निविष्टम्।हिताय नः क्षिप्रमुदारजुष्टंमुदाऽभषेक्तुं वरद त्वमर्हसि।।2.2.54।।
explanation: O bestower of boons it behoves you to install with delight and without delay your son (Rama) endowed with all virtues equal to god of the gods and committed to our wellbeing and to the welfare of this world, as your heirapparent. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे द्वितीयस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the second sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Dasaratha  requests Vasistha and Vamadeva to make preparations for installation of Rama-- Orders for procurement of necessary materials--Sumantra brings Rama to the assembly--Dasaratha counsels  Rama.]तेषामञ्जलिपद्मानि प्रगृहीतानि सर्वशः।प्रतिगृह्याब्रवीद्राजा तेभ्यः प्रियहितं वचः।।2.3.1।।
explanation: The citizens held out their palms folded like lotuses in reverence and urged  king Dasaratha in all possible ways (to coronate Rama). He reciprocated their respect with words preasing and beneficial to them:

content: अहोऽस्मि परमप्रीतः प्रभावश्चातुलो मम।यन्मे ज्येष्ठं प्रियं पुत्रं यौवराज्यस्थमिच्छथ।।2.3.2।।
explanation: I am immensely happy that you have added to my incomparable resilience with your  desire to see my beloved eldest son installed heirapparent.

content: इति प्रत्यर्च्य तान्राजा ब्राह्मणानिदमब्रवीत्।वसिष्ठं वामदेवं च तेषामेवोपशृण्वताम्।।2.3.3।।
explanation: Having honoured them (the invitees) in return for their response, king Dasaratha  addressed Vasistha, Vamadeva and other brahmins.

content: चैत्रश्श्रीमानयं मासः पुण्यः पुष्पितकाननः।यौवराज्याय रामस्य सर्वमेवोपकल्प्यताम्।।2.3.4।।राज्ञस्तूपरते वाक्ये जनघोषो महानभूत्।
explanation: This auspicious month of Chaitra is sacred with its blossoming groves. Let all the arrangements be made for the installation of Rama as heirapparent. On hearing this, all the members of the assembly applauded the king tumultously.

content: शनैस्तस्मिन्प्रशान्ते च जनघोषे जनाधिपः।।2.3.5।।वसिष्ठं मुनिशार्दूलं राजा वचनमब्रवीत्।
explanation: With the tumult gradually calmed down, the lord of the people, the king (Dasaratha) spoke this to Vasistha, a tiger among ascetics:

content: अभिषेकाय रामस्य यत्कर्म सपरिच्छदम्।।2.3.6।।तदद्य भगवन् सर्वमाज्ञापयितु मर्हसि।
explanation: O revered one, you should issue appropriate orders to keep ready the necessary articles required for the performance of installation ceremony of Rama.

content: तच्छ्रुत्वा भूमिपालस्य वसिष्ठो द्विजसत्तमः।।2.3.7।।आदिदेशाग्रतो राज्ञ स्स्थितान्युक्तान् कृताञ्जलीन्।
explanation: Hearing the words of  the king, Vasistha, best of the brahmins thus ordered the counsellors who stood in front of the king with folded palms:

content: सुवर्णादीनि रत्नानि बलीन् सर्वौषधीरपि।।2.3.8।।शुक्लमाल्यांश्च लाजांश्च पृथक्च मधुसर्पिषी।अहतानि च वासांसि रथं सर्वायुधान्यपि।।2.3.9।।चतुरङ्गबलं चैव गजं च शुभलक्षणम्।चामरव्यजने श्वेते ध्वजं छत्रं च पाण्डुरम्।।2.3.10।।शतं च शातकुम्भानां कुम्भानाग्निवर्चसाम्।हिरण्यशृङ्गमृषभं समग्रं व्याघ्रचर्म च।।2.3.11।।उपस्थापयत प्रातरग्न्यगारं महीपतेः।
explanation: By tomorrow early morning arrange in the place set aside for sacred fire in the king's palace gold and other metals, gems, articles of worship, also herbs, garlands of white flowers, roasted corn, honey and clarified butter in separate containers, fresh clothes, chariot, weapons of every kind, army of four divisions, an elephant possessing auspicious marks, white fans made of Yak's hair, a standard, white parasol, a hundred golden vessels shining like fire, a bull with goldplated horns and a tiger skin.

content: यच्चान्यत्किञ्चिदेष्टव्यं तत्सर्वमुपकल्प्यताम्।।2.3.12।।अन्तःपुरस्य द्वाराणि सर्वस्य नगरस्य च।चन्दनस्रग्भिरर्च्यन्तां धूपैश्च घ्राणहारिभिः।।2.3.13।।
explanation: Even the smallest items required be arranged. Let the gates of the inner apartment and of the entire city be decorated with sandalpaste and garlands. Let fragrant incense be burnt for worship.

content: प्रशस्तमन्नं गुणवद्दधिक्षीरोपसेचनम्।   द्विजानां शतसाहस्रे यत्प्रकाममलं भवेत्।।2.3.14।।
explanation: Arrange fine rice cooked with milk and curd sufficient for a hundred thousand brahmins to eat to their heart's content.

content: सत्कृत्य द्विजमुख्यानां श्वःप्रभाते प्रदीयताम्।घृतं दधि च लाजाश्च दक्षिणाश्चापि पुष्कलाः।।2.3.15।।
explanation: At dawn tomorrow the best of brahmins be honoured with cooked rice clarified butter, curd, roasted corn and gifts in abundance.

content: सूर्येऽभ्युदितमात्रे श्वो भविता स्वस्तिवाचनम्।ब्राह्मणाश्च निमन्त्र्यन्तां कल्प्यन्तामासनानि च।।2.3.16।।
explanation: As soon as the Sun rises tomorrow, arrangements be made for Swastivachana (a benedictory utterance). Brahmins be invited and seats provided to them.

content: आबध्यन्तां पताकाश्च राजमार्गश्च सिंच्यताम्।सर्वे च तालावचरा गणिकाश्च स्वलङ्कृताः।।2.3.17।।कक्ष्यां द्वितीयामासाद्य तिष्ठन्तु नृपवेश्मनः।
explanation: Banners be fastened and royal highways be sprinkled with water. All  actors and beautifully adorned courtesans should reach the second inner apartment of the king's residence and remain seated there.

content: देवायतनचैत्येषुसान्नभक्षा स्सदक्षिणाः।।2.3.18।।उपस्थापयितव्या स्स्युर्माल्ययोग्याः पृथक्पृथक्।
explanation: Persons to cater food and other eatables and to hold garlands and gifts be stationed at all temples and other places of worship.

content: दीर्घासिबद्धा योधाश्च सन्नद्धा मृष्टवाससः।।2.3.19।।महाराजाङ्गणं सर्वे प्रविशन्तु महोदयम्।
explanation: Let all the warriors in fresh clothes, armed with long swords and fully alert enter the courtyard of the glorious king.

content: एवं व्यादिश्य विप्रौ तौ क्रियास्तत्र सुनिष्ठितौ।।2.3.20।।चक्रतुश्चैव यच्छेषं पार्थिवाय निवेद्य च।
explanation: The two highly selfdisciplined ascetics (Vasistha and Vamadeva), having ordered the tasks to be performed and whatever remained to be done reported to the king.

content: कृतमित्येव चाब्रूतां अभिगम्य जगत्पतिम्।।2.3.21।।यथोक्तवचनं प्रीतौ हर्षयुक्तौ द्विजर्षभौ।
explanation: Satisfied with the arrangements, the two illustrious brahmins(Vasistha and Vamadeva) approached the lord of the earth (Dasaratha) with delight and said All things have been arranged in accordance with your word of command.

content: ततस्सुमन्त्रं द्युतिमान्राजा वचनमब्रवीत्।रामः कृतात्मा भवता शीघ्रमानीयतामिति।।2.3.22।।
explanation: Thereafter the glorious king said to Sumantra, Bring immediately the selfpossessed Rama.

content: स तथेति प्रतिज्ञाय सुमन्त्रो राजशासनात्।।2.3.23।।रामं तत्रानयाञ्चक्रे रथेन रथिनां वरम्।
explanation: In response to the king's command Sumantra, the best of charioteers said, 'so be it'  and fetched Rama in a chariot.

content: अथ तत्र समासीना स्तदा दशरथं नृपम्।।2.3.24।।प्राच्योदीच्याः प्रतीच्याश्च दाक्षिणात्याश्च भूमिपाः।म्लेच्छाश्चार्याश्च ये चान्ये वनशैलान्तवासिनः।।2.3.25।।उपासाञ्चक्रिरे सर्वे तं देवा इव वासवम्।
explanation: After Sumantra had gone, the kings from eastern, northern, western, southern  nonAryan and Aryan countries, rulers from forests and mountains paid homage to king Dasaratha, as devatas do to Indra.

content: तेषां मध्ये स राजर्षिर्मरुतामिव वासवः।।2.3.26।।प्रासादस्थो रथगतं ददर्शायान्तमात्मजम्।
explanation: The rajarsi, (Dasaratha), seated among the kings like Indra amidst maruts, beheld his son Rama sitting in a chariot and approaching him.

content: गन्धर्वराजप्रतिमं लोके विख्यातपौरुषम्।।2.3.27।।दीर्घबाहुं महासत्त्वं मत्तमातङ्गगामिनम्।चन्द्रकान्ताननं राममतीव प्रियदर्शनम्।।2.3.28।।रूपौदार्यगुणैः पुंसां दृष्टिचित्तापहारिणम्।घर्माभितप्ताः पर्जन्यं ह्लादयन्तमिव प्रजाः।।2.3.29।।न ततर्प समायान्तं पश्यमानो नराधिपः।
explanation: Rama appeared as the very image of king of the gandharvas known for his courage in this world. With his long arms, he was extremely handsome with a countenance of the colour of moonstone possessed of immense strength, he walked with the  gait of  an intoxicated elephant. He captivated the eyes and hearts of men with his beauty and generosity. He looked like Parjanya (raingod), gladdening men scorched by heat. Even after (intensely) gazing at Rama approaching, the king (Dasaratha) was not satiated.

content: अवतार्य सुमन्त्रस्तं राघवं स्यन्दनोत्तमात्।।2.3.30।।पितुस्समीपं गच्छन्तं प्राञ्जलिः पृष्ठतोऽन्वगात्।
explanation: Sumantra assisted Rama while alighting from that splendid chariot and followed him  with folded palms as Rama was proceeding towards his father.

content: स तं कैलासशृङ्गाभं प्रासादं नरपुङ्गवः।।2.3.31।।आरुरोह नृपं द्रष्टुं सह सूतेन राघवः।
explanation: Best among men, Rama  accompanied by charioteer Sumantra ascended that palace that was lofty as the peak of Kailasa mountain in order to see the king.

content: स प्राञ्जलिरभिप्रेत्य प्रणतः पितुरन्तिके।।2.3.32।।नाम स्वं श्रावयन्रामो ववन्दे चरणौ पितुः।
explanation: Rama, approached his father with folded palms and bowed low near him, pronounced his (own) name and touched his father's feet with reverence.

content: तं दृष्ट्वा प्रणतं पार्श्वे कृताञ्जलिपुटं नृपः।।2.3.33।।गृह्याञ्जलौ समाकृष्य सस्वजे प्रियमात्मजम्।
explanation: Seeing his beloved son Rama who was standing by his side with folded hands in supplication, king Dasaratha, held his folded hands and drew him near and embraced him.

content: तस्मै चाभ्युदितं दिव्यं मणिकाञ्चनभूषितम्।।2.3.34।।दिदेश राजा रुचिरं रामाय परमासनम्।
explanation: The king (Dasaratha) offered Rama a seat on the lofty, glorious throne splendidly  decorated with gold and gems.

content: तदासनवरं प्राप्य व्यदीपयत राघवः।।2.3.35।।स्वयैव प्रभया मेरुमुदये विमलो रविः।
explanation: The lofty seat Rama occupied was illuminated by him resplenderce like mount Meru in the translucent rays of the morning Sun.

content: तेन विभ्राजता तत्र सा सभाऽभिव्यरोचत।।2.3.36।।विमलग्रहनक्षत्रा शारदी द्यौरिवेन्दुना।
explanation: That assembly was illumined by (the presence of) Rama like the Moon dazzling the clear autumnal sky bespangled with sparkling planets and stars.

content: तं पश्यमानो नृपतिस्तुतोष प्रियमात्मजम्।।2.3.37।।अलङ्कृतमिवात्मानमादर्शतलसंस्थितम्।
explanation: The king was delighted to see his beloved son as though he saw his own reflection adorning a mirror.

content: स तं सस्मितमाभाष्य पुत्रं पुत्रवतां वरः।।2.3.38।।उवाचेदं वचो राजा देवेन्द्रमिव काश्यपः।
explanation: The best among fathers, he (Dasaratha) said these words to his son with a smile, like Kasyapa addressing Devendra.

content: ज्येष्ठायामसि मे पत्न्यां सदृश्यां सदृशस्सुतः।।2.3.39।।उत्पन्नस्त्वं गुणश्रेष्ठो मम रामात्मजः प्रियः।
explanation: A worthy son of my worthy eldest wife, O Rama, your great virtues have endeared you to me.

content: यतस्त्वया प्रजाश्चेमा स्स्वगुणैरनुरञ्जिताः।।2.3.40।।तस्मात्त्वं पुष्ययोगेन यौवराज्यमवाप्नुहि।
explanation: As you have endeared yourself to these subjects with your virtues, you shall assume the office of heirapparent when Pushya star is in conjunction with the Moon.

content: कामतस्त्वं प्रकृत्यैव विनीतो गुणवानसि।।2.3.41।।गुणवत्यपि तु स्नेहात्पुत्र वक्ष्यामि ते हितम्।
explanation: Admittedly gentle by nature, you are gifted with virtues. O son, even though virtuous,   I shall offer you counsel for your good out of affection for you.

content: भूयो विनयमास्थाय भव नित्यं जितेन्द्रियः।।2.3.42।।कामक्रोधसमुत्थानि त्यजेथा व्यसनानि च।
explanation: With humility, always keep your senses under control. Keep off all violations arising out of lust and anger.

content: परोक्षया वर्तमानो वृत्त्या प्रत्यक्षया तथा।।2.3.43।।अमात्यप्रभृतीस्सर्वाःप्रकृतीश्चानुरञ्जय।
explanation: With your behaviour keep the ministers and the people satisfied by means direct or indirect.

content: कोष्ठागारायुधागारैःकृत्वा सन्निचयान्बहून्।।2.3.44।।तुष्टानुरक्तप्रकृतिर्यः पालयति मेदिनीम्।तस्यनन्दन्ति मित्राणि लब्ध्वाऽमृतमिवामराः।।2.3.45।।तस्मात्त्वमपि चात्मानं नियम्यैवं समाचर।
explanation: You shall rule the earth by filling granaries of foodgrains and arsenals and keeping the subjects loyal and contented. The friends of such a person will memain pleased like devatas with nectar. Hence conduct yourself with your mind under control.

content: तच्छ्रुत्वा सुहृदस्तस्य रामस्य प्रियकारिणः।।2.3.46।।त्वरिता श्शीघ्रमभ्येत्य कौशल्यायै न्यवेदयन्।
explanation: Having heard this, Rama's friends quickly reported the matter to Kausalya so that she might be happy.

content: सा हिरण्यं च गाश्चैव रत्नानि विविधानि च।।2.3.47।।व्यादिदेश प्रियाख्येभ्यः कौशल्या प्रमदोत्तमा।
explanation: The foremost of women, Kausalya ordered gifts of gold, cows and various kinds of gems to be given to the messengers who brought this good tiding.

content: अथाऽभिवाद्य राजानं रथमारुह्य राघवः।।2.3.48।।ययौ स्वं द्युतिमद्वेश्म जनौघैः प्रतिपूजितः।
explanation: Having paid his obeisance to the king, Rama ascended the chariot amidst the acclaim of multitudes of men and left for his splendid abode.

content: ते चापि पौरा नृपतेर्वचस्तच्छृत्वा तथा लाभमिवेष्टमाशु।नरेन्द्रमामन्त्र्य गृहाणि गत्वा देवान्समानर्चुरतिप्रहृष्टाः।।2.3.49।।
explanation: On hearing such pronouncement by the king, the citizens also felt they have got something beneficial for themselves. They took leave of the king (Dasaratha) and hastening home,  full of joy, began worshipping their gods.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे तृतीयस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the third sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Dasaratha sends Sumantra to bring Rama again-- briefs him on certain matters and sends him -- Rama visits Kausalya and informs her about the coronation and seeks her blessings.]गतेष्वथ नृपो भूयः पौरेषु सह मन्त्रिभिः।मन्त्रयित्वा ततश्चक्रे निश्चयज्ञस्सनिश्चयम्।।2.4.1।।श्व एव पुष्यो भविताश्वोऽभिषेच्यस्तु मे सुतः।रामो राजीवताम्राक्षो यौवराज्य इति प्रभुः।।2.4.2।।
explanation: After the citizens departed, the king, an expert in decisionmaking again consulted his counsellors and said, Tomorrow Pushya star is in the ascendence and my son, Rama (handsome) with coppercoloured eyes which resemble red lotus petals will be installed heirapparent.

content: गतेष्वथ नृपो भूयः पौरेषु सह मन्त्रिभिः।मन्त्रयित्वा ततश्चक्रे निश्चयज्ञस्सनिश्चयम्।।2.4.1।।श्व एव पुष्यो भविताश्वोऽभिषेच्यस्तु मे सुतः।रामो राजीवताम्राक्षो यौवराज्य इति प्रभुः।।2.4.2।।
explanation: After the citizens departed, the king, an expert in decisionmaking again consulted his counsellors and said, Tomorrow Pushya star is in the ascendence and my son, Rama (handsome) with coppercoloured eyes which resemble red lotus petals will be installed heirapparent.

content: अथाऽन्तर्गृहमाविश्य राजा दशरथस्तदा।सूतमामन्त्रयामास रामं पुनरिहानय।।2.4.3।।
explanation: Therafter king Dasaratha on retiring to his private apartment, ordered Sumantra to bring Rama  once again.

content: प्रतिगृह्य स तद्वाक्यं सूतः पुनरुपाययौ।रामस्य भवनं शीघ्रं राममानयितुं पुनः।।2.4.4।।
explanation: In obedience to the command  of the king charioteer Sumantra set out speedily  to the palace of Rama to fetch him  back once again.

content: द्वार्स्थैरावेदितं तस्य रामायाऽऽगमनं पुनः।श्रुत्वैव चापि रामस्तं प्राप्तं शङ्कान्वितोऽभवत्।।2.4.5।।
explanation: The doorkeepers informed Rama of Sumantra's arrival. As soon as he learnt that Sumantra was back again, Rama was filled with apprehensions.

content: प्रवेश्य चैनं त्वरितं रामो वचनमब्रवीत्।यदागमनकृत्यं ते भूयस्तद्ब्रूह्यशेषतः।।2.4.6।।
explanation: Rama  got Sumantra admitted  and said to him, What is the  purpose of your coming back so quickly ? Tell me whatever is there without holding back.

content: तमुवाच तत स्सूतो राजा त्वां द्रष्टुमिच्छति।श्रुत्वा प्रमाणमत्र त्वं गमनायेतराय वा।।2.4.7।।
explanation: Then Sumantra replied, 'The king desires to see you. To go or not to go, the decision is yours'.

content: इति सूतवच श्श्रुत्वा रामोऽथ त्वरयाऽन्वितः।प्रययौ राजभवनं पुनर्द्रष्टुं नरेश्वरम्।।2.4.8।।
explanation: On hearing the words of the charioteer, Rama immediately set out for the royal  palace to see the king again.

content: तं श्रुत्वा समनुप्राप्तं रामं दशरथो नृपः।प्रवेशयामास गृहं विवक्षुः प्रियमुत्तमम्।।2.4.9।।
explanation: Having heard of Rama's arrival, king Dasaratha got him admitted into his apartment to tell him something very pleasant.

content: प्रविशन्नेव च श्रीमान्राघवो भवनं पितुः।ददर्श पितरं दूरात्प्रणिपत्य कृताञ्जलिः।।2.4.10।।
explanation: On entering his father's palace, glorious Rama, folded his hands and bent low in reverence from a distance and beheld his father.

content: प्रणमन्तं समुत्थाप्य तं परिष्वज्य भूमिपः।प्रदिश्य चास्मै रुचिरमासनं पुनरब्रवीत्।।2.4.11।।
explanation: As he (Rama) was bending (with reverence), Dasaratha lifted him up and embraced him. Thereafter, he offered him a splendid seat and said again:

content: राम वृद्धोऽस्मि दीर्घायुर्भुक्ता भोगा मयेप्सिताः।अन्नवद्भिः क्रतुशतै स्तथेष्टं भूरिदक्षिणैः।।2.4.12।।
explanation: O Rama after a long life I have grown old. I have enjoyed all the pleasures I desired. I have also performed hundreds of rituals which enjoined distribution of abundant food and gifts.

content: जातमिष्टमपत्यं मे त्वमद्यानुपमं भुवि।दत्तमिष्टमधीतं च मया पुरुषसत्तम।।2.4.13।।
explanation: O best of men I have obtained now a progeny of my liking in you and you have no equal on earth. I have given gifts, performed rituals and also studied (the Vedas) .

content: अनुभूतानि चेष्टानि मया वीर सुखान्यपि।देवर्षिपितृविप्राणामनृणोऽस्मि तथाऽत्मनः।।2.4.14।।
explanation: O mighty son I have experienced all the pleasures I longed for. I redeemed my debt to the gods, the sages, my ancestors, brahmins and to myself.

content: न किञ्चिन्मम कर्तव्यं तवान्यत्राभिषेचनात्।अतो यत्त्वामहं ब्रूयां तन्मे त्वं कर्तुमर्हसि।।2.4.15।।
explanation: There is nothing left to be done by me except your consecration Hence you should perform what I  tell you.

content: अद्य प्रकृतयस्सर्वास्त्वामिच्छन्ति नराधिपम्।अतस्त्वां युवराजानमभिषेक्ष्यामि पुत्रक।।2.4.16।।
explanation: Today  all the subjects expresed their desire to see you as their king. Therefore, my dear son, I wish to coronate  you heirapparent.

content: अपि चाद्याऽशुभान्राम स्वप्ने पश्यामि दारुणान्।सनिर्घाता दिवोल्का च पततीह महास्वना।।2.4.17।।
explanation: Moreover Rama, these days I see frightening and ominous events in dreams during day time. I see meteors accompanied by thunders falling, generating great sounds.

content: अवष्टब्धं च मे राम नक्षत्रं दारुणैर्ग्रहैः।आवेदयन्ति दैवज्ञाः सूर्याङ्गारकराहुभिः।।2.4.18।।
explanation: O Rama astrologers also tell me that formidable planets Sun, Mars and Rahu have afflicted my birth star.

content: प्रायेण हि निमित्तानामीदृशानां समुद्भवे।राजा हि मृत्युमाप्नोति घोरां वाऽऽपदमृच्छति।।2.4.19।।
explanation: When such ominous signs appear, usually the king either meets with  death or faces a grave calamity.

content: तद्यावदेव मे चेतो न विमुह्यति राघव।तावदेवाभिषिञ्चस्व चला हि प्राणिनां मतिः।।2.4.20।।
explanation: Therefore,  before my mind is deluded I wish to see you installed as heirapparent for a man's mind is unstable indeed, O Rama.

content: अद्य चन्द्रोऽभ्युपगतः पुष्यात्पूर्वं पुनर्वसू।श्वः पुष्ययोगं नियतं वक्ष्यन्ते दैवचिन्तकाः।।2.4.21।।
explanation: Today the Moon is in conjunction with the Punarvasu constellation. Tomorrow the  Moon's conjunction with the Pushya constellation is certain and the astrologers say this auspicious time is highly suitable for the purpose of coronation.

content: ततः पुष्येऽभिषिञ्चस्व मनस्त्वरयतीव माम्।श्वस्त्वाऽहमभिषेक्ष्यामि यौवराज्ये परन्तप।।2.4.22।।
explanation: My mind is hastening me saying,'Coronate  Rama in the Pushya constellation itself'. O Slayer of enemies, I shall install you heirapparent tomorrow.

content: तस्मात्त्वयाऽद्य प्रभृति निशेयं नियतात्मना।सह वध्वोपवस्तव्या दर्भप्रस्तरशायिना।।2.4.23।।
explanation: Therefore, you and my daughterinlaw (Sita) should fast tonight and sleep on a bed of darbha or kusha grass with selfrestraint.

content: सुहृदश्चाप्रमत्तास्त्वां रक्षन्त्वद्य समन्ततः।भवन्ति बहु विघ्नानि कार्याण्येवंविधानि हि।।2.4.24।।
explanation: Many impediments befall  acts of this sort indeed. Alert your friends to protect you  from all sides today onwards.

content: विप्रोषितश्च भरतो यावदेव पुरादितः।तावदेवाभिषेकस्ते प्राप्तकालो मतो मम।।2.4.25।।
explanation: While Bharata is away from the city, the time is favourable for your installation. This is my opinion.

content: कामं खलु सतां वृत्ते भ्राता ते भरतस्स्थितः।ज्येष्ठानुवर्ती धर्मात्मा सानुक्रोशो जितेन्द्रियः।।2.4.26।।
explanation: It is true, your brother Bharata has adhered to the path of the virtuous and has followed his elder brother. No doubt, he is righteous, compassionate and self controlled.

content: किन्तु चित्तं मनुष्याणामनित्यमिति मे मतिः।सतां च धर्मनित्यानां कृतशोभि च राघव।।2.4.27।।
explanation: Yet I think even the propitious minds of those who are virtuous and whose thoughts are fixed in righteousness can also become fickle.

content: इत्युक्त स्सोऽभ्यनुज्ञात श्श्वोभाविन्यभिषेचने।व्रजेति रामः पितरमभिवाद्याभ्ययाद्गृहम्।।2.4.28।।
explanation: Having spoken to Rama about the installation ceremony fixed for the next day, he (Dasaratha) permitted him to leave saying, 'You may go'. Rama paid obeisance to his father and returned to his abode.

content: प्रविश्य चात्मनो वेश्मराज्ञोद्दिष्टेऽभिषेचने।तत्क्षणेन विनिर्गम्य मातुरन्तपुरं ययौ।।2.4.29।।
explanation: With the installation fixed by the king, Rama went into his residence but left immediately to see his mother in her inner apartment.

content: तत्र तां प्रवणामेव मातरं क्षौमवासिनीम्।वाग्यतां देवतागारे ददर्शाऽऽयाचतीं श्रियम्।।2.4.30।।
explanation: There he beheld his mother in silk apparel engrossed in silent prayer (to the gods) for his royal fortune in the room meant for the worship of the gods.

content: प्रागेव चागता तत्र सुमित्रा लक्ष्मण स्तथा।सीता चानायिता श्रुत्वा प्रियं रामाभिषेचनम्।।2.4.31।।
explanation: Hearing the welcome tidings of the installation of her beloved Rama, Sita too, had been brought in. Sumitra and Lakshmana had already arrived there.

content: तस्मिन् काले हि कौशल्या तस्थावामीलितेक्षणा।सुमित्रयाऽन्वास्यमाना सीतया लक्ष्मणेन च।।2.4.32।।
explanation: At that moment Kausalya was meditating with her eyes halfclosed. Sumitra, Lakshmana and Sita were attending on her.

content: श्रुत्वा पुष्येण पुत्रस्य यौवराज्याऽभिषेचनम्।प्राणायामेन पुरुषं ध्यायमाना जनार्दनम्।।2.4.33।।
explanation: Having heard that installation of her son as heirapparent was planned in Pushya constellation, Kausalya was meditating upon the Supreme Person, Lord Visnu by controlling her breath (Pranayama).

content: तथा सनियमामेव सोऽभिगम्याभिवाद्य च।उवाच वचनं रामो हर्षयंस्तामनिन्दिताम्।।2.4.34।।
explanation: While she (Kausalya) was in that state of meditation, Rama approached her, offered reverential salutation and said these words of praise enhancing her joy:

content: अम्ब पित्रा नियुक्तोऽस्मि प्रजापालनकर्मणि।भविता श्वोऽभिषेको मे यथा मे शासनं पितुः।।2.4.35।।
explanation: O mother father has assigned me the duties of governing the subjects. My installation takes place tomorrow on my father's command.

content: सीतयाप्युपवस्तव्या रजनीयं मया सह।एवमृत्विगुपाध्यायै स्सह मामुक्तवान्पिता।।2.4.36।।
explanation: Tonight, Sita, the officiating priests and preceptors will take to fasting along with me. This is what father told me.

content: यानि यान्यत्र योग्यानि श्वोभाविन्यभिषेचने।तानि मे मङ्गलान्यद्य वैदेह्याश्चैव कारय।।2.4.37।।
explanation: The installation takes place tomorrow. Perform today whatever auspicious rituals are appropriate (to the occasion) for me and Vaidehi (Sita).

content: एतच्छ्रुत्वा तु कौशल्या चिरकालाभिकाङ्क्षितम्।हर्षबाष्पकलं वाक्यमिदं राममभाषत।।2.4.38।।
explanation: Hearing this long cherished tiding (relating to installation) Kausalya spoke to Rama in sweet but indistinct words due to tears of joy.

content: वत्स राम चिरं जीव हतास्ते परिपन्थिनः।ज्ञातीन्मे त्वं श्रिया युक्त स्सुमित्रायाश्च नन्दय।।2.4.39।।
explanation: O my dear child, O Rama, may you live long Let your enemies be destroyed. Endowed with prosperity, bring delight to my relatives and those of Sumitra.

content: कल्याणे बत नक्षत्रे मयि जातोऽसि पुत्रक।येन त्वया दशरथो गुणैराराधितः पिता।।2.4.40।।
explanation: O Rama, my little child you were born to me under a lucky star. On this account you have delighted your father Dasaratha with your virtues. What a joy

content: अमोघं बत मे क्षान्तं पुरुषे पुष्करेक्षणे।येयमिक्ष्वाकुराज्यश्रीः पुत्र त्वां संश्रयिष्यति।।2.4.41।।
explanation: O my son my devotion to the lotuseyed Visnu, enduring the pain (of observance of vows and fasting) have not gone in vain.The royal fortune of the Ikshvakus will pass on to  you. What a joy

content: इत्येवमुक्तो मात्रेदं रामो भ्रातरमब्रवीत्।प्राञ्जलिं प्रह्वमासीनमभिवीक्ष्य स्मयन्निव।।2.4.42।।
explanation: Thus spoken to by his mother, Rama looked at his brother Lakshmana sitting humbly with folded palms and with a smile said to him:

content: लक्ष्मणेमां मया सार्धं प्रशाधि त्वं वसुन्धराम्।द्वितीयं मेऽन्तरात्मानं त्वामियं श्रीरुपस्थिता।।2.4.43।।
explanation: O Lakshmana rule this earth together with me. This royal fortune also accrues to you, for you are my second innermost self.

content: सौमित्रे भुङ्क्ष्व भोगांत्स्वमिष्टान्राज्यफलानि च।जीवितं च हि राज्यं च त्वदर्थमभिकामये।।2.4.44।।
explanation: O, son of Sumitra, enjoy all pleasures you wish and the fruits of royalty. I desire  this life and kingdom for your sake only.

content: इत्युक्त्वा लक्ष्मणं रामो मातरावभिवाद्य च।अभ्यनुज्ञाप्य सीतां च जगाम स्वं निवेशनम्।।2.4.45।।
explanation: After speaking to Lakshmana, Rama made reverential salutation to the two mothers and on obtaining their consent to leave with Sita, returned to his abode.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे चतुर्थस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fourth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Vasistha advises Rama and Sita to undertake fast preparatory to coronation.]सन्दिश्य रामं नृपति श्श्वोभाविन्यभिषेचने।पुरोहितं समाहूय वशिष्ठमिदमब्रवीत्।।2.5.1।।
explanation: The king having instructed Rama summoned Vasistha, the priest and spoke to him about the coronation that was to take place on the following day

content: गच्छोपवासं काकुत्स्थं कारयाद्य तपोधन।श्रीयशोराज्यलाभाय वध्वा सह यतव्रतम्।।2.5.2।।
explanation: Could you, O sage, whose wealth is asceticism go to Rama engaged in strict observance of vows and advise him along with Sita, my daughterinlaw to undertake fast for securing prosperity, fame and kingdom.

content: तथेति च स राजानमुक्त्वा वेदविदां वरः।स्वयं वसिष्ठो भगवान्ययौ रामनिवेशनम्।।2.5.3।।उपवासयितुं रामं मन्त्रवन्मन्त्रकोविदः।ब्राह्मं रथवरं युक्तमास्थाय सुदृढव्रतः।।2.5.4।।
explanation: Venerabel Vasistha, the best amongst the knowers of the Vedas, skilled in mantras and firm in his vows said to the king, 'Be it so.' Thereafter,  mounted on the best of the chariots befitting a brahmin, with horses harnesed he proceeded personally to the abode of Rama to ask him to undertake a fast in accompaniment with mantras preceding the installation ceremony.

content: स रामभवनं प्राप्य पाण्डुराभ्रघनप्रभम्।तिस्रः कक्ष्या रथेनैव विवेशमुनिसत्तमः।।2.5.5।।
explanation: Having crossed the three courtyards in the chariot, that foremost of ascetics (Vasistha) entered Rams's abode, shining like a mass of white clouds.

content: तमागतमृषिं रामस्त्वरन्निव ससम्भ्रमः।मानयिष्यन्समानार्हं निश्चक्राम निवेशनात्।।2.5.6।।
explanation: Seeing the venerable sage(Vasitha) arrive, Rama quickly came out of his abode in great excitement to receive him with honour.

content: अभ्येत्य त्वरमाणश्च रथाभ्याशं मनीषिणः।ततोऽवतारयामास परिगृह्य रथात्स्वयम्।।2.5.7।।
explanation: Hastening with rapid strides, Rama approached the chariot of the sagacious Vasistha and personally helped him alight from the chariot.

content: स चैनं प्रश्रितं दृष्ट्वा सम्भाष्याभिप्रसाद्य च।प्रियार्हं हर्षयन्राममित्युवाच पुरोहितः।।2.5.8।।
explanation: The family priest Vasistha also, having gratified him by enquiring about his welfare, said thus to Rama, who was humble and lovable:

content: प्रसन्नस्ते पिता राम यौवराज्यमवाप्स्यसि।उपवासं भवानद्य करोतु सह सीतया।।2.5.9।।
explanation: O Rama, welldisposed towards you, your father will declare you heirapparent. Do undertake fast today, along with Sita.

content: प्रातस्त्वामभिषेक्ता हि यौवराज्ये नराधिपः।पिता दशरथः प्रीत्या ययातिं नहुषो यथा।।2.5.10।।
explanation: Your father, king Dasaratha, will be pleased to coronate you as heirapparent early tomorrow morning as Nahusa did (to his son) Yayati.

content: इत्युक्त्वा स तदा राममुपवासं यतव्रतम्।मन्त्रवत्कारयामास वैदेह्या सहितं मुनिः।।2.5.11।।
explanation: The ascetic (Vasistha) having thus spoken to Rama made him undertake fast along with Sita in accompaniment with sacred hymns.

content: ततो यथावद्रामेण स राज्ञो गुरुरर्चितः।अभ्यनुज्ञाप्य काकुत्स्थं ययौ रामनिवेशनात्।।2.5.12।।
explanation: Thereafter, Vasistha, preceptor of the king duly honoured by the descendant of Kakutstha (Rama) left his abode.

content: सुहृद्भिस्तत्र रामोऽपि सहासीनः प्रियंवदैः।सभाजितो विवेशाऽथ ताननुज्ञाप्य सर्वशः।।2.5.13।।
explanation: Rama also sat for a while in the company of his sweettongued friends and duly  honoured by them in every way took  leave  of them and entered his apartment.

content: हृष्टनारीनरयुतं रामवेश्म तदा बभौ।यथा मत्तद्विजगणं प्रफुल्लनलिनं सरः।।2.5.14।।
explanation: The residence of Rama, full of cheerful men and women, looked  splendid like a lake with fullblown  lotuses flocked by multitudes of intoxicated birds.

content: स राजभवनप्रख्यात्तस्माद्रामनिवेशानात्।निर्गत्य ददृशे मार्गं वसिष्ठो जनसंवृतम्।।2.5.15।।
explanation: Vasistha thereafter emerged from the abode of Rama resembling a royal palace and beheld the highways filled with people.

content: बृन्दबृन्दैरयोध्यायां राजमार्गास्समन्ततः।बभूवुरभिसम्बाधाः कुतूहलजनैर्वृताः।।2.5.16।।
explanation: The royal highways in the city of Ayodhya were jammed on all sides with groups of curious people.

content: जनबृन्दोर्मिसंघर्षहर्षस्वनवतस्तदा।बभूव राजमार्गस्य सागरस्येव निस्वनः।।2.5.17।।
explanation: The highways resembled the sea and the exultation of the multitudes, the roar that emanated from the clashing of waves.

content: सिक्तसम्मृष्टरथ्या हि तदहर्वनमालिनी।आसीदयोध्यानगरी समुच्छ्रितगृहध्वजा।।2.5.18।।
explanation: On that day, the thoroughfares of the city of Ayodhya, surrounded with (pleasure) gardens, were sprinkled with water and swept. The flags (on the top) of the houses were raised high.

content: तदा ह्ययोध्यानिलय स्सस्त्रीबालाबलो जनः।रामाभिषेकमाकाङ्क्षन्नाकाङ्क्षदुदयं रवेः।।2.5.19।।
explanation: Then all the people living in Ayodhya including women, children and aged alike  wishing to see the coronation  of Rama eagerly waited for the  sunrise.

content: प्रजालङ्कारभूतं च जनस्यानन्दवर्धनम्।उत्सुकोऽभूज्जनो द्रष्टुं तमयोध्यामहोत्सवम्।।2.5.20।।
explanation: People were anxious to witness that great festival of Ayodhya which was to them (precious) like an ornament and a source of immense joy.

content: एवं तज्जनसम्बाधं राजमार्गं पुरोहितः।व्यूहन्निव जनौघं तं शनै राजकुलं ययौ।।2.5.21।।
explanation: The priest (Vasistha), beholding the overcrowded highway forced his passage through the crowds of men dividing them into two tracts and slowly entered the royal palace.

content: सिताभ्रशिखरप्रख्यं प्रासादमधिरुह्य सः।समीयाय नरेन्द्रेण शक्रेणेव बृहस्पतिः।।2.5.22।।
explanation: Having ascended the royal palace resembling the peak of a mountain covered with white clouds, Vasistha approached the king like  Brihaspati meeting Indra.

content: तमागतमभिप्रेक्ष्य हित्वा राजासनं नृपः।पप्रच्छ स च तस्मै तत्कृतमित्यभ्यवेदयत्।।2.5.23।।
explanation: On seeing Vasistha the king descended from the throne and enquired whether he had performed the mission to which the ascetic replied affirmatively.

content: चैव तदा तुल्यं सहासीनास्सभासदः।आसनेभ्यस्समुत्तस्थुः पूजयन्तः पुरोहितम्।।2.5.24।।
explanation: All those present in the assembly with him (the king) also got up from their seats as he (Dasaratha) did and paid their obeisance to Vasistha.

content: गुरुणा त्वभ्यनुज्ञातो मनुजौघं विसृज्य तम्।विवेशान्तः पुरं राजा सिंहो गिरिगुहामिव।।2.5.25।।
explanation: The king then, dully permitted by the preceptor, disposed the assembly of men and stepped into his inner apartment, like a lion entering the cave of a mountain.

content: तदग्य्रवेषप्रमदाजनाकुलं महेन्द्रवेश्मप्रतिमं निवेशनम्।विदीपयंश्चारु विवेश पार्थिवश्शशीव तारागणसङ्कुलं नभः।।2.5.26।।
explanation: The king entered the inner apartment thronged with excellently attired women which looked like the palace of Mahendra. He resembled the beautiful Moon that illuminates the sky crowded with stars.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे पञ्चमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fifth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama and Sita observe the prescribed rites--rejoiced citizens of Ayodhya express their gratitude to the king--people from villages arrive in multitudes.]गते पुरोहिते रामः स्नातो नियतमानसः।सह पत्न्या विशालाक्ष्या नारायणमुपागमत्।।2.6.1।।
explanation: With the family priest (Vasistha) gone, Rama had his bath, and with his mind under control came to Lord Narayana along with his largeeyed consort, Sita. (with an intention to worship him)

content: प्रगृह्य शिरसा पात्रीं हविषो विधिवत्तदा।महते दैवतायाज्यं जुहाव ज्वलितेऽनले।।2.6.2।।
explanation: Then holding the vessel containing havis on his head, he offered the oblations of  clarified butter into the sacred fire for Visnu in accordance with ritual practices.

content: शेषं च हविषस्तस्य प्राश्याशास्यात्मनः प्रियम्।ध्यायन्नारायणं देवं स्वास्तीर्णे कुशसंस्तरे।।2.6.3।।वाग्यत स्सह वैदेह्या भूत्वा नियतमानसः।श्रीमत्यायतने विष्णो श्शिश्ये नरवरात्मजः।।2.6.4।।
explanation: The son of the king (Rama) partook the remainder of the havis seeking his own welfare. With a restrained mind and a vow of silence, he meditated upon Lord Narayana and slept along with Vaidehi on a wellspread bed of kusha grass in the auspicious temple of lord Visnu.

content: एकयामावशिष्टायां रात्र्यां प्रतिविबुद्ध्य सः।अलङ्कारविधिं कृत्स्नं कारयामास वेश्मनः।।2.6.5।।
explanation: He got up (Rama) with one yama (three hours) of the night still left, and had his entire  residence decorated.

content: तत्र श्रृण्वन्सुखा वाच स्सूतमागधवन्दिनाम्।पूर्वां सध्यामुपासीनो जजाप यतमानसः।।2.6.6।।
explanation: Then (in the last watch of the night) hearing the pleasant words of bards and panegyrists he attended to early morning rites and intoned Gayatri with a concentrated mind.

content: तुष्टाव प्रणतश्चैव शिरसा मधुसूदनम्।विमलक्षौमसंवीतो वाचयामास स द्विजान्।।2.6.7।।
explanation: Clad in spotless silk garments, he extoled Lord Madhusudana (Visnu) with his head bowed low. He listened to the purificatory mantras recited by brahmins.

content: तेषां पुण्याहघोषोऽथ गम्भीरमधुरस्तदा।अयोध्यां पूरयामास तूर्यघोषानुनादितः।।2.6.8।।
explanation: And then the deep and sweet proclamations of 'This is an auspicious day' mingled with the sounds of trumpets reverberated (the city of) Ayodhya.

content: कृतोपवासं तु तदा वैदेह्या सह राघवम्।अयोध्यानिलयश्श्रुत्वा सर्वः प्रमुदितो जनः।।2.6.9।।
explanation: The residents of Ayodhya were happy to hear that the scion of the Raghus (Rama) along with princess of Videha (Sita) had undertaken the fast.

content: ततः पौरजनस्सर्वश्श्रुत्वा रामाभिषेचनम्।प्रभातां रजनीं दृष्ट्वा चक्रे शोभयितुं पुरीम्।।2.6.10।।
explanation: Having heard about the coronation of Rama, all the citizens began to decorate the city soon after daybreak.

content: सिताभ्रशिखराभेषु देवतायतनेषु च।चतुष्पथेषु रथ्यासु चैत्येष्वट्टालकेषु च।।2.6.11।।नानापण्यसमृद्धेषु वणिजामापणेषु च।कुटुम्बिनां समृद्धेषु श्रीमत्सु भवनेषु च।।2.6.12।।सभासु चैव सर्वासु वृक्षेष्वालक्षितेषु च।ध्वजा स्समुच्छ्रिताश्चित्राः पताकाश्चाभवंस्तदा।।2.6.13।।
explanation: Banners of varying colours and flags were raised on the temples looking resplendent like peaks wreathed by a mass of white clouds, at the crossroads, on the thoroughfares, on the trees standing on avenues, on the towers and stalls of the merchants abounding in various kinds of merchandise, on prosperous and graceful houses of householders, in all public halls and on trees looking tall from a distance.

content: नटनर्तकसङ्घानां गायकानां च गायताम्।मनः कर्णसुखा वाच श्शुशृवुश्च ततस्ततः।।2.6.14।।
explanation: Troupes of actors and dancers entertained the people with songs pleasing to the mind and ears and their utterances were heard here and there.

content: रामाभिषेकयुक्ताश्च कथाश्चक्रुर्मिथो जनाः।रामाभिषेके सम्प्राप्ते चत्वरेषु गृहेषु च।।2.6.15।।
explanation: As the time for Rama's coronation was approaching, men in public squares and in private houses talked with one another about the consecration of Rama.

content: बाला अपि क्रीडमाना गृहद्वारेषु सङ्घशः।रामाभिषवसंयुक्ताश्चक्रुरेवं मिथः कथाः।।2.6.16।।
explanation: Similarly children playing in groups in front of the houses also related to each other  stories regarding the coronation of Rama.

content: कृतपुष्पोपहारश्च धूपगन्धाधिवासितः।राजमार्गः कृतः श्रीमान्पौरै रामाभिषेचने।।2.6.17।।
explanation: On the occasion of Rama's coronation the highway, strewn with flowers and rendered fragrant with the burning of incense by the citizens looked glorious.

content: प्रकाशकरणार्थं च निशागमनशङ्कया।दीपवृक्षां स्तथा चक्रुरनु रथ्यासु सर्वशः।।2.6.18।।
explanation: In the same way lest night should fall (by the time the installation ceremony was completed), the streets were provided with lamps in the shape of trees to light them up.

content: अलङ्कारं पुरस्यैवं कृत्वा तत्पुरवासिनः।आकाङ्क्षमाणा रामस्य यौवराज्याभिषेचनम्।।2.6.19।।समेत्य सङ्घशस्सर्वे चत्वरेषु सभासु च।कथयन्तो मिथस्तत्र प्रशशंसुर्जनाधिपम्।।2.6.20।।
explanation: Thus the residents of Ayodhya decorated the city and eagerly waited for Rama's cornonation as heirapparent. Gathered in groups at public squares and in the assembly halls they conversed among themselves about the event, praising Dasaratha, the lord among men.

content: अहो महात्मा राजाऽयमिक्ष्वाकुकुलनन्दनः।ज्ञात्वा यो वृद्धमात्मानं रामं राज्येऽभिषेक्ष्यति।।2.6.21।।
explanation: Oh having realised that he himself has grown old the highsouled king Dasaratha the veritable delight to the Ikshvaku race,  is going to coronate Rama in the kingdom.

content: सर्वेप्यनुगृहीता स्मो यन्नो रामो महीपतिः।चिराय भविता गोप्ता दृष्टलोकपरावरः।।2.6.22।।
explanation: All of us are fortunate indeed that Rama who knows the world's high and low shall be our king, protector for a long time.

content: अनुद्धतमनाः विद्वान्धर्मात्मा भ्रातृवत्सलः।यथा च भ्रातृषु स्निग्धस्तथाऽस्मास्वपि राघवः।।2.6.23।।
explanation: This scion of the Raghus (Rama) is free from arrogance, is learned, righteous and affectionate towards his brothers as much as towards us.

content: चिरं जीवतु धर्मात्मा राजा दशरथोऽनघः।यत्प्रसादोनभिषिक्तं तु रामं द्रक्ष्यामहे वयम्।।2.6.24।।
explanation: May the virtuous and sinless king Dasaratha live long by whose grace we are beholding (going to behold) Rama's coronation.

content: एवंविधं कथयतां पौराणां शुश्रुवु स्तदा।दिग्भ्योपि श्रुतवृत्तान्ता: प्राप्ता जानपदा जनाः।।2.6.25।।
explanation: Having heard about the coronation of Rama, villagers arrived from all directions and listened to the citizens conversing in this manner.

content: ते तु दिग्भ्यः पुरीं प्राप्ता द्रष्टुं रामाभिषेचनम्।रामस्य पूरयामासुः पुरीं जानपदा जनाः।।2.6.26।।
explanation: The city was filled with villagers coming from different directions to behold Rama's coronation.

content: जनौघैस्तैर्विसर्पद्भिः शुश्रुवे तत्र निस्वनः।पर्वसूदीर्णवेगस्य सागरस्येव निस्वनः।।2.6.27।।
explanation: The multitudes of men moving to and fro gave rise to a noise like the roar of the ocean enhanced by the violent speed (of the wind) on the full and new moon days.

content: ततस्तदिन्द्रक्षयसन्निभं पुरंदिदृक्षुभिर्जानपदैरुपागतैः।समन्तत स्सस्वनमाकुलं बभौसमुद्रयादोभिरिवार्णवोदकम्।।2.6.28।।
explanation: The city (of Ayodhya), resembling the abode of Indra, (Amaravati) crowded with villagers from all over wishing to witness it (the coronation of Rama), grew noisy and sparkled like the water of the ocean teeming with aquatic animals.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे षष्ठस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Manthara informs Kaikeyi about the installation of Rama--happy over the news Kaikeyi gifts away her ornaments.]ज्ञातिदासी यतो जाता कैकेय्यास्तु सहोषिता।प्रासादं चन्द्रसङ्काशमारुरोह यदृच्छया।।2.7.1।।
explanation: The family maid (Manthara) of Kaikeyi who had been living with her since her (Kaikeyi's) birth casually ascended the palace gleaming white like the Moon.

content: सिक्तराजपथां कृत्स्नां प्रकीर्णकुसुमोत्कराम्।अयोध्यां मन्थरा तस्मात्प्रासादादन्ववैक्षत।।2.7.2।।
explanation: Manthara beheld from that palace the whole of Ayodhya with its highways sprinkled with water and strewn with a lot of flowers.

content: पताकाभिर्वरार्हाभिर्ध्वजैश्च समलङ्कृताम्।वृतां छन्दपथैश्चापि शिरस्स्नातजनैर्वृताम्।।2.7.3।।माल्यमोदकहस्तैश्च द्विजेन्द्रैरभिनादिताम्।शुक्लदेवगृहद्वारां सर्ववादित्रनिस्वनाम्।।2.7.4।।सम्प्रहृष्टजनाकीर्णां ब्रह्मघोषाभिनादिताम्।प्रहृष्टवरहस्त्यश्वां सम्प्रणर्दितगोवृषाम्।।2.7.5।।प्रहृष्टमुदितैः पौरैरुच्छ्रितध्वजमालिनीम्।अयोध्यां मन्थरा दृष्ट्वा परं विस्मयमागता।।2.7.6।।
explanation: The city of Ayodhya was decorated with costly banners and pennants. The labyrinthine roads were crowded with people who had (finished) their headbath and were wandering at will. The temples with their doors painted white were reverberating with the chanting from the Vedas by the best of brahmins holding garlands and sweetmeats in their hands and with sounds of   all kinds of musical instruments. The city was filled with spirited horses and elephants. The bulls were bellowing and the cows were lowing. The citizens with great joy raised the penants encircling the city of Ayodhya. All this left Manthara astonished.

content: प्रहर्षोत्फुल्लनयनां पाण्डुरक्षौमवासिनीम्।अविदूरे स्थितां दृष्ट्वा धात्रीं पप्रच्छ मन्थरा।।2.7.7।।
explanation: Seeing a royal  maid clad in white silk garment and standing not very far with her eyes expanded in delight Manthara enquired:

content: उत्तमेनाभिसंयुक्ता हर्षेणार्थपरा सती।राममाता धनं किन्नु जनेभ्यस्सम्प्रयच्छति।।2.7.8।।
explanation: Why is Rama's mother, forever interested in the accumulation of money gifting away her wealth to men with great joy?

content: अतिमात्रप्रहर्षोऽयं किं जनस्य च शंस मे।कारयिष्यति किं वापि सम्प्रहृष्टो महीपतिः।।2.7.9।।
explanation: Why do the people look exceedingly happy? Tell me, what the king with great delight is proposing to do?

content: विदीर्यमाणा हर्षेण धात्री तु परया मुदा।आचचक्षेऽथ कुब्जायै भूयसीं राघव श्रियम्।।2.7.10।।
explanation: Bursting with great joy, the royal maid related to the hunchback the great fortune awaiting the son of the Raghus (Rama).

content: श्वः पुष्येण जितक्रोधं यौवराज्येन राघवम्।राजा दशरथो राममभिषेचयिताऽनघम्।।2.7.11।।
explanation: Tomorrow under the spell of the Pushya star, king Dasaratha will consecrate blameless Rama born in the race of Raghu as heirapparent (the maid said).

content: धात्र्यास्तु वचनं शृत्वा कुब्जा क्षिप्रममर्षिता।कैलासशिखराकारा त्प्रासादादवरोहत।।2.7.12।।
explanation: Having heard these words of the royal maid, the hunchback became furious and speedily descended from that palace resembling the peak of mount Kailasa.

content: सा दह्यमाना कोपेन मन्थरा पापदर्शिनी।शयानामेत्य कैकेयीमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.7.13।।
explanation: The malevolent Manthara on fire with fury reached Kaikeyi lying upon her couch  and said:

content: उत्तिष्ठ मूढे किं शेषे भयं त्वामभिवर्तते।उपप्लुतामौघेन किमात्मानं न बुध्यसे।।2.7.14।।
explanation: O senseless one, why are you lying down? Get up A great fear is gripping you. Why don't you realise that you are floating in a sea of perils.

content: अनिष्टे सुभगाकारे सौभाग्येन विकत्थसे। चलं हि तव सौभाग्यं नद्यास्स्रोत इवोष्णगे।।2.7.15।।
explanation: Though you appear to be your husband's darling, in reality he dislikes you. The good fortune you boast of indeed is unstable like the stream of a river in summer.

content: एवमुक्ता तु कैकेयी रुष्टया परुषं वचः।कुब्जया पापदर्शिन्या विषादमगमत्परम्।।2.7.16।।
explanation: At these harsh words of the furious, evileyed hunchback Kaikeyi   fell into great despondency.

content: कैकेयी त्वब्रवीत्कुब्जां कच्चित्क्षेमं नु मन्थरे।विषण्णवदनां हि त्वां लक्षये भृशदुःखिताम्।।2.7.17।।
explanation: Kaikeyi said to the hunchback, O Manthara isn't all well with you? I can mark it from your dejected face how greatly distressed you feel, indeed.

content: मन्थरा तु वच श्श्रुत्वा कैकेय्या मधुराक्षरम्।उवाच क्रोधसंयुक्ता वाक्यं वाक्यविशारदा।।2.7.18।।
explanation: Hearing the words of Kaikeyi uttered in a gentle voice, wrathful Manthara skilled in speech, said:

content: सा विषण्णतरा भूत्वा कुब्जा तस्या हितैषिणी।विषादयन्ती प्रोवाच भेदयन्ती च राघवम्।।2.7.19।।
explanation: That hunchback feeling still more depressed in her (Kaikeyi's) interest and intending to cause in her despondency and distance Rama from her spoke out:

content: अक्षय्यं सुमहद्देवि प्रवृत्तं त्वद्विनाशनम्।रामं दशरथो राजा यौवराज्येऽभिषेक्ष्यति।।2.7.20।।
explanation: O queen, your end is approaching, and it has no end and it is overwhelming. King Dasaratha is crowning Rama as heirapparent.

content: साऽस्म्यगाधे भये मग्ना दुःखशोकसमन्विता।दह्यमानाऽनलेनेव त्वद्धितार्थमिहागता।।2.7.21।।
explanation: Plunged in unfathomable fear and stricken with grief and tears I am here seeking your wellbeing and yet consumed as though by fire.

content: तव दुःखेन कैकेयि मम दुःखं महद्भवेत्।त्वद्वृद्धौ मम वृद्धिश्च भवेदत्र न संशयः।।2.7.22।।
explanation: O Kaikeyi, your sorrow will augment my sorrow. Your prosperity would mean my prosperity. There is no doubt about this.

content: नराधिपकुले जाता महिषी त्वं महीपतेः।उग्रत्वं राजधर्माणां कथं देवि न बुध्यसे।।2.7.23।।
explanation: O queen, born in the royal family and being a king's consort why don't you realise the ruthless ways of statecraft?

content: धर्मावादी शठो भर्ता श्लक्ष्णवादी च दारुणः।शुद्धभावे न जानीषे तेनैव मतिसन्धिता।।2.7.24।।
explanation: Your husband speaks morals publicly but in private he is deceitful. He speaks gently  but acts cruelly. Because of your innocent nature you are  beguiled by him. You do not understand this.

content: उपस्थितः प्रयुञ्जानस्त्वयि सान्त्वमनर्थकम्।अर्थेनैवाद्य ते भर्ता कौसल्यां योजयिष्यति।।2.7.25।।
explanation: When your husband approaches you he swears in meaningless, appeasing words. But today he is going to bestow benefit on Kausalya only.

content: उपवाह्य स दुष्टात्मा भरतं तव बन्धुषु।काल्ये स्थापयिता रामं राज्ये निहतकण्टके।।2.7.26।।
explanation: That evilminded one, having sent Bharata away to your relations house, is going to install Rama unhindered in the kingdom at dawn tomorrow.

content: शत्रुः पतिप्रवादेन मात्रेव हितकाम्यया।आशीविष इवाङ्केन बाले परिधृतस्त्वया।।2.7.27।।
explanation: O innocent lady with the intention of doing good like a mother to your husband who is your enemy, you are holding on your lap a venomous serpent.

content: यथा हि कुर्यात्सर्पो वा शत्रुर्वा प्रत्युपेक्षितः।राज्ञा दशरथेनाद्य सपुत्रा त्वं तथा कृता।।2.7.28।।
explanation: King Dasaratha has done to you and to your son the same thing as a  snake or an enemy would do when ignored.

content: पापेनानृतसान्त्वेन बाले नित्यसुखोचिते।रामं स्थापयता राज्ये सानुबन्धा हता ह्यसि।।2.7.29।।
explanation: O senseless lady, you are always accustomed to comfort. With deceitful words of appeasement that vicious one (King Dasaratha) is going to install Rama in the kingdom. You along with your son have been surely ruined.

content: सा प्राप्तकालं कैकेयि क्षिप्रं कुरु हितं तव।त्रायस्व पुत्रमात्मानं मां च विस्मयदर्शने।।2.7.30।।
explanation: O enchantingeyed Kaikeyi, that appropriate time has come. Act quickly for your own wellbeing. Save yourself, your son and me too.

content: मन्थाराया वचश्श्रुत्वा शयाना सा शुभानना।उत्तस्थौ हर्षसम्पूर्णा चन्द्रलेखेव शारदी।।2.7.31।।
explanation: Hearing the words of Manthara, Kaikeyi of charming countenance lying in her couch rose, full of joy, like the autumnal streak of the Moon's crescent.

content: अतीव सा तु संहृष्टा कैकेयी विस्मयान्विता।एकमाभरणं तस्यै कुब्जायै प्रददौ शुभम्।।2.7.32।।
explanation: Filled with immense joy and wonder (at the news), Kaikeyi gifted a beauthful ornament to that hunchback.

content: दत्वा त्वाभरणं तस्यै कुब्जायै प्रमदोत्तमा।कैकेयी मन्थरां दृष्ट्वा पुनरेवाब्रवीदिदम्।।2.7.33।।
explanation: Kaikeyi, the best among the beauties, having given the ornament to Manthara, the hunchback, looked at her and said these words again:

content: इदं तु मन्थरे मह्यमाख्यासि परमं प्रियम्।एतन्मे प्रियमाख्यातुः किं वा भूयः करोमि ते।।2.7.34।।
explanation: O Manthara, the news you have brought me is exceedingly pleasant. What more can I do for you? Here is the gift for one who brings good tidings.

content: रामे वा भरते वाऽहं विशेषं नोपलक्षये। तस्मात्तुष्टाऽस्मि यद्राजा रामं राज्येऽभिषेक्ष्यति।।2.7.35।।
explanation: I do not see any distinction between Rama and Bharata as such. I am contented with Rama's consecration in the kingdom.

content: न मे परं किञ्चिदितस्त्वया पुनःप्रियं प्रियार्हे सुवचं वचःपरम्।तथा ह्यवोचस्त्वमतः प्रियोत्तरं वरं परं ते प्रददामि तं वृणु।।2.7.36।।
explanation: O woman worthy of affection for me there is nothing greater and dearer than this news. I will grant you another reward better than this. Just ask for it.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे सप्तमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventh sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the  holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Manthara incites Kaikeyi --Kaikeyi narrates the virtues of Rama--Manthara insinuates that installation of Rama would harm Bharata--hence Rama should be banished and Bharata coronated.]मन्थरा त्वभ्यसूयैनामुत्सृज्याभरणं च तत्।उवाचेदं ततो वाक्यं कोपदुःखसमन्विता।।2.8.1।।
explanation: Annoyed with Kaikeyi and filled with rage and sorrow, Manthara discarded the ornament (gifted to her) and said these words:

content: हर्षं किमिदमस्थाने कृतवत्यसि बालिशे।शोकसागरमध्यस्थमात्मानं नावबुध्यसे।।2.8.2।।
explanation: O foolish woman why do you display this misplaced happiness, little realising that you are in the midst of an ocean of sorrow?

content: मनसा प्रहसामि त्वां देवि दुःखार्दिता सती।यच्छोचितव्ये हृष्टाऽसि प्राप्येदं व्यसनं महत्।।2.8.3।।
explanation: O queen at a time when this great misfortune has befallen you, you are rejoicing instead of feeling miserable. I am indeed laughing at you at heart.

content: शोचामि दुर्मतित्वं ते का हि प्राज्ञा प्रहर्षयेत्।अरेस्सपत्नीपुत्रस्य वृद्धिं मृत्योरिवागताम्।।2.8.4।।
explanation: I pity your false notion. Will any wise woman rejoice at the prosperity of the son of a cowife who is like an enemy? This is like (courting) death.

content: भरतादेव रामस्य राज्यसाधारणाद्भयम्।तद्विचिन्त्य विषण्णाऽस्मि भयं भीताऽद्धि जायते।।2.8.5।।
explanation: Since Bharata and Rama have equal claim to the kingdom, Bharata is a  source of fear for Rama. Having thought over this matter, I am dejected. Danger springs from one who is in fear.

content: लक्ष्मणो हि महेष्वासो रामं सर्वात्मना गतः।शत्रुघ्नश्चापि भरतं काकुत्स्थं लक्ष्मणो यथा।।2.8.6।।
explanation: Lakshmana who wields a great bow has taken refuge with all his heart in Rama a descendant of Kakutstha dynasty. So does Satrughna in Bharata.

content: प्रत्यासन्नक्रमेणापि भरतस्यैव भामिनि।राज्यक्रमो विप्रकृष्टस्तयोस्तावत्कनीयसोः।।2.8.7।।
explanation: O beautiful lady in order of birth, too, Bharata's right to the throne is just next (to  Rama's). While being younger, the chances of the other two (Lakshmana and Satrughna) are remote.

content: विदुषः क्षत्रचारित्रे प्राज्ञस्य प्राप्तकारिणः।भयात्प्रवेपे रामस्य चिन्तयन्ती तवात्मजम्।।2.8.8।।
explanation: Rama is learned in the duties of a kshatriya. He is wise enough to do what he should at the appropriate time. While reflecting the fate of your son, I am trembling with fear.

content: सुभगा खलु कौशल्या यस्याः पुत्रोऽभिषेक्ष्यते।यौवराज्येन महता श्वः पुष्येण द्विजोत्तमैः।।2.8.9।।
