explanation: Kausalya whose son is going to be coronated as heirapparent by eminent   brahmins under Pushya  star tomorrow is fortunate, indeed.

content: प्राप्तां सुमहतीं प्रीतिं प्रतीतां तां हतद्विषम्।उपस्थास्यसि कौसल्यां दासीव त्त्वं कृताञ्जलिः।।2.8.10।।
explanation: With folded palms like an attendant, you will have to serve that renowned Kausalya who is greatlly delighted by getting rid of her enemies.

content: एवं चेत्त्वं सहास्माभिस्तस्याः प्रेष्या भविष्यसि।पुत्रश्च तव रामस्य प्रेष्यभावं गमिष्यति।।2.8.11।।
explanation: If you thus become her attendant along with us, your son will also develop slavishness towards Rama.

content: हृष्टाः खलु भविष्यन्ति रामस्य परमास्स्त्रियः।अप्रहृष्टा भविष्यन्ति स्नुषास्ते भरतक्षये।।2.8.12।।
explanation: All the women of Rama's (palace) will be delighted indeed. With the decline of Bharata, your daughtersinlaw will be deprived of all happiness.

content: तां दृष्ट्वा परमप्रीतां ब्रुवन्तीं मन्थरां ततः।रामस्यैव गुणान्देवी कैकेयी प्रशशंस ह।।2.8.13।।
explanation: Having seen that morose Manthara speaking thus, Kaikeyi commended the virtues of Rama.

content: धर्मज्ञो गुरुभिर्दान्तः कृतज्ञस्सत्यवाक्छुचिः।रामो राज्ञ स्सुतो ज्येष्ठो यौवराज्यमतोऽर्हति।।2.8.14।।
explanation: Rama knows righteouness. He has been taught selfrestraint by elders. He is grateful and truthful. He is undefiled. He is the eldest son of the king. Therefore, he deserves to be the heirapparent (of the kingdom).

content: भ्रातृ़न्भृत्यांश्च दीर्घायुः पितृवत्पालयिष्यति।सन्तप्स्यसे कथं कुब्जे श्रुत्वा रामाभिषेचनम्।।2.8.15।।
explanation: Blessed with a long life, Rama will protect his brothers and the servants like a father. O hunchback, hearing Rama's coronation why are you aggrieved?

content: भरतश्चापि रामस्य ध्रुवं वर्षशतात्परम्।पितृपैतामहं राज्यमवाप्ता पुरुषर्षभः।।2.8.16।।
explanation: After a hundred years of Rama's rule, Bharata, the best of men, will get the kingdom of his ancestors.

content: सा त्वमभ्युदये प्राप्ते वर्तमाने च मन्थरे।भविष्यति च कल्याणे किमर्थं परितप्यसे।।2.8.17।।
explanation: Manthara, we have enjoyed prosperity in the past, we are enjoying it now and we will enjoy it in future. Then why are you aggrieved?

content: यथा मे भरतो मान्यस्तथा भूयोऽपि राघवः।कौशल्यातोऽतिरिक्तं च सोऽनुशुश्रूषते हि माम्।।2.8.18।।
explanation: For me, if Bharata is worthy of consideration Rama is worthier. He serves me even more (scrupulously) than he does Kausalya.

content: राज्यं यदि हि रामस्य भरतस्यापि तत्तदा।मन्यते हि यथात्मानं तथा भ्रातृ़ंश्च राघवः।।2.8.19।।
explanation: If the kingdom is Rama's, it is also Bharata's, since Rama regards his brothers as his own self

content: कैकेयीवचनं श्रुत्वा मन्थरा भृशदुःखिता।दीर्घमुष्णं च विनिश्वस्य कैकेयीमिदमब्रवीत्।।2.8.20।।
explanation: Having heard Kaikeyi's words Manthara was extremely unhappy. Heaving deep, hot sighs she said to Kaikeyi.

content: अनर्थदर्शिनी मौर्ख्यान्नात्मानमवबुध्यसे। शोकव्यसनविस्तीर्णे मज्जन्ती दुःखसागरे।।2.8.21।।
explanation: You are sinking in the sea of sorrow widened with tears and troubles. But you are stupid enough not to perceive your own wellbeing.

content: भविता राघवो राजा राघवस्यानु यस्सुतः।राजवंशात्तु कैकेयि भरतःपरिहास्यते।।2.8.22।।
explanation: Rama, the scion of the Raghus, will become king. After Rama, his son will suceed him. O Kaikeyi, as for  Bharata, he will be debarred from royal succession (altogether).

content: न हि राज्ञस्सुता स्सर्वे राज्ये तिष्ठन्ति भामिनि।स्थाप्यमानेषु सर्वेषु सुमहाननयो भवेत्।।2.8.23।।
explanation: O lovely lady, not all the sons of the king will inherit the kingdom. If all of them are installed as kings, there will be great disorder.

content: तस्माज्ज्येष्ठे हि कैकेयि राज्यतन्त्राणि पार्थिवाः।स्थापयन्त्यनवद्याङ्गि गुणवत्स्वितरेष्वपि।।2.8.24।।
explanation: O Kaikeyi of beautiful limbs, for that reason kings bestow the governance of the kingdom either on the eldest or on other virtuous sons.

content: असावत्यन्तनिर्भग्नस्तव पुत्रो भविष्यति।अनाथवत्सुखेभ्यश्च राजवंशाच्च वत्सले।।2.8.25।।
explanation: O (Kaikeyi) dear cut off from royal succession as well as from its comforts, your son will become totally forlorn and brokenhearted.

content: साऽहं त्वदर्थे सम्प्राप्ता त्वं तु मां नावबुद्ध्यसे।सपत्नि वृद्धौ या मे त्वं प्रदेयं दातुमिच्छसि।।2.8.26।।
explanation: I am here to serve your interest. Nevertheless you do not understand me and you wish to confer gifts on me on the occasion of the prosperity of your cowife.

content: ध्रुवं तु भरतं रामः प्राप्य राज्यमकण्टकम्।देशान्तरं वा नयिता लोकान्तरमथाऽपि वा।।2.8.27।।
explanation: Rama, having secured the thornless kingdom, will banish Bharata from the country or else send him to the other world. This is certain.

content: बाल एव हि मातुल्यं भरतो नायितस्त्वया।सन्निकर्षाच्च सौहार्दं जायते स्थावरेष्वपि।।2.8.28।।
explanation: Bharata has been sent by you right from his childhood to his maternal uncle's house.  Proximity creates friendship even amongst the inanimate objects.

content: भरतस्याप्यनुवशश्शत्रुघ्नोऽपि समं गतः।लक्ष्मणो हि यथा रामं तथाऽसौ भरतं गतः।।2.8.29।।
explanation: Satrughna who is obedient to Bharata has followed him. Like Lakshmana who has taken refuge in Rama, he has also resorted to Bharata.

content: श्रूयते हि द्रुमः कश्चिच्छेत्तव्यो वनजीविभिः।सन्निकर्षादिषीकाभिर्मोचितः परमाद्भयात्।।2.8.30।।
explanation: It is said that a tree intended to be cut down by those living on the forest is let off   due to entanglement of a kind of grass known as Ishika (thorny bushes) growing in its vicinity. (If Bharata had been at Ayodhya now, Dasaratha himself would have helped him.

content: गोप्ता हि रामं सौमित्रिर्लक्ष्मणं चापि राघवः।अश्विनोरिव सौभ्रात्रं तयोर्लोकेषु विश्रुतम्।।2.8.31।।
explanation: Just as Lakshmana protects Rama, Rama protects Lakshmana. Their brotherhood is renowned in the world like that of the Ashwins.

content: तस्मान्न लक्ष्मणे रामः पापं किञ्चित्करिष्यति।रामस्तु भरते पापं कुर्यादिति न संशयः।।2.8.32।।
explanation: Rama will do no harm to Lakshmana. As for Bharata, Rama will doubtless do him harm.

content: तस्माद्राजगृहादेव वनं गच्छतु ते सुतः।एतद्धि रोचते मह्यं भृशं चापि हितं तव।।2.8.33।।
explanation: Therefore let your son go to the forest straight from his uncle's palace only. That alone will please me. For you also this is highly beneficial.

content: एवं ते ज्ञातिपक्षस्य श्रेयश्चैव भविष्यति।यदि चेद्भरतो धर्मात्पित्र्यं राज्यमवाप्स्यसि।।2.8.34।।
explanation: If Bharata secures the ancestral kingdom righteously, it will bring welfare to you and to your relations also.

content: स ते सुखोचितो बालो रामस्य सहजो रिपुः।समृद्धार्थस्य नष्टार्थो जीविष्यति कथं वशे।।2.8.35।।
explanation: Your son, that young Bharata, is accustomed to comforts. He is a born enemy of Rama. How will he, deprived of all wealth, live under the control of Rama?

content: अभिद्रुतमिवारण्ये सिंहेन गजयूथपम्।प्रच्छाद्यमानं रामेण भरतं त्रातुमर्हसि।।2.8.36।।
explanation: Like the leader of an elephantherd attacked by a lion in the forest, Bharata is going to be oppressed by Rama. You should save him.

content: दर्पान्निराकृता पूर्वं त्वया सौभाग्यवत्तया।राममाता सपत्नी ते कथं वैरं न शातयेत्।।2.8.37।।
explanation: Being fortunate (being the favourite wife of your husband) you slighted your cowife  earlier with pride. How will she, Rama's mother (Kausalya) remain without retaliating?

content: यदा हि रामः पृथिवीमवाप्स्यतिप्रभूतरत्नाकरशैलपत्तनाम्।तदा गमिष्यस्यशुभं पराभवंसहैव दीना भरतेन भामिनि।।2.8.38।।
explanation: O lovely lady when Rama becomes the lord of this earth with its oceans, mountains and cities, then along with Bharata you will become miserable and fall into disgrace.

content: यदा हि रामः पृथिवीमवाप्स्यतिध्रुवं प्रणष्टो भरतो भविष्यति।अतो हि सञ्चिन्तय राज्यमात्मजे परस्य चैवाद्य विवासकारणम्।।2.8.39।।
explanation: When Rama obtains this earth, Bharata will be certainly ruined. Therefore, right now think of the kingdom for your son and the means of banishment for your enemy, Rama.  इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे अष्टमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eighth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Instigated by Manthara, Kaikeyi enters the chamber of wrath.]एवमुक्ता तु कैकेयी क्रोधेन ज्वलितानना।दीर्घमुष्णं विनिश्वस्य मन्थरामिदमब्रवीत्।।2.9.1।।
explanation: Thus spoken to, Kaikeyi, her face burning with anger, breathed a deep, hot sigh and said these words to Manthara:

content: अद्य राममितः क्षिप्रं वनं प्रस्थापयाम्यहम्।यौवराज्ये च भरतं क्षिप्रमेवाभिषेचये।।2.9.2।।
explanation: Today I shall at once banish Rama from here into the forest and get Bharata coronated as heirapparent without delay.

content: इदं त्विदानीं सम्पश्य केनोपायेन मन्थरे।भरतः प्राप्नुयाद्राज्यं न तु रामः कथञ्चन।।2.9.3।।
explanation: O Manthara now see, for sure, Bharata and not Rama will get the kingdom by any means.

content: एवमुक्ता तया देव्या मन्थरा पापदर्शिनी।रामार्थमुपहिंसन्ती कैकेयीमिदमब्रवीत्।।2.9.4।।
explanation: Thus addressed by queen Kaikeyi, that evil minded Manthara said this to Kaikeyi  in order to spoil the interest of Rama:

content: हन्तेदानीं प्रवक्ष्यामि कैकेयि श्रूयतां च मे।यथा ते भरतो राज्यं पुत्रः प्राप्स्यति केवलम्।।2.9.5।।
explanation: O Kaikeyi, what a joy I shall now tell you how your son Bharata alone will secure the kingdom. Listen to me:

content: किं न स्मरसि कैकेयि स्मरन्ती वा निगूहसे।यदुच्यमानमात्मार्थं मत्तस्त्वं श्रोतुमिच्छसि।।2.9.6।।
explanation: O Kaikeyi, don't you remember in your own interest what I'm going to tell you or are you hiding it, wishing to hear from me?

content: मयोच्यमानं यदि ते श्रोतुं छन्दो विलासिनि।श्रूयतामभिधास्यामि श्रुत्वा चापि विमृश्यताम्।।2.9.7।।
explanation: O lovely Kaikeyi if it pleases you to hear from me, I shall tell you. Listen and think over it, too.

content: श्रुत्वैवं वचनं तस्या मन्थरायास्तु कैकेयी।किञ्चिदुत्थाय शयनात्स्वास्तीर्णादिदमब्रवीत्।।2.9.8।।
explanation: After hearing Manthara's words, Kaikeyi got up a little from her wellspread bed and said this:

content: कथय त्वं ममोपायं केनोपायेन मन्थरे।भरतः प्राप्नुयाद्राज्यं न तु रामः कथञ्चन।।2.9.9।।
explanation: O Manthara, tell me the means by which Bharata and not Rama will secure the kingdom in any circumstances.

content: एवमुक्ता तया देव्या मन्थरा पापदर्शिनी।रामार्थमुपहिंसन्ती कुब्जा वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.9.10।।
explanation: Thus addressed by the queen (Kaikeyi), the evileyed hunchback, Manthara, said with the intention to damage Rama's interest.

content: तव दैवासुरे युद्धे सह राजर्षिभिः पतिः।अगच्छत्त्वामुपादाय देवराजस्य साह्यकृत्।।2.9.11।।दिशमास्थाय वै देवि दक्षिणां दण्डकान्प्रति।वैजयन्तमिति ख्यातं पुरं यत्र तिमिध्वजः।।2.9.12।।
explanation: O queen during the war between gods and asuras, your husband went with royal saints intending to render assistance to Indra, king of the gods, taking you along with him. He set off in the southern direction of Dandaka forest to a renowned city called Vaijayanta where asura Timidhvaja lived.

content: स शम्बर इति ख्यातश्शतमायो महासुरः।ददौ शक्रस्य सङ्ग्रामं देवसङ्घैरनिर्जितः।।2.9.13।।
explanation: That mighty asura wellknown as Sambara, capable of a hundred deceitful forms, challenged Indra to a battle which could not be conquered by hosts of gods.

content: तस्मिन्महति सङ्ग्रामे पुरुषान्क्षतविक्षतान्।रात्रौ प्रसुप्तान्घ्नन्ति स्म तरसाऽऽसाद्य राक्षसाः।।2.9.14।।
explanation: In that great battle, the rakshasas used to kill by force the warriors wounded by the weapons and those fast asleep during the night.

content: तत्राकरोन्महद्युद्धं राजा दशरथस्तदा।असुरैश्च महाबाहुश्शस्त्रैश्च शकलीकृतः।।2.9.15।।
explanation: There in that great battle the mightyarmed king Dasaratha lay wounded with weapons (used) by the asuras.

content: अपवाह्य त्वया देवि सङ्ग्रामान्नष्टचेतनः।तत्रापि विक्षतश्शस्त्रैः पतिस्ते रक्षितस्त्वया।।2.9.16।।
explanation: O queen you had protected your husband by carrying him away from the battlefield when he lost his consciousness. He was saved by you. Once again you saved him when he lay wounded with weapons (hurled) by the asuras.

content: तुष्टेन तेन दत्तौ ते द्वौ वरौ शुभदर्शने।स त्वयोक्तः पतिर्देवि  यदेच्छेयं तदा वरौ।।2.9.17।।गृह्णीयामिति तत्तेन तथेत्युक्तं महात्मना।
explanation: O auspiciouslooking one out of gratitude he had granted two boons to you (for saving him on two occasions). O queen then you told your husband that whenever you desire, you will ask for those boons. The magnanimous king said, 'So be it'.

content: अनभिज्ञाम्ह्यहं देवि त्वयैव कथिता पुरा।।2.9.18।।कथैषा तव तु स्नेहान्मनसा धार्यते मया।रामाभिषेकसम्भारान्निगृह्य विनिवर्तय।।2.9.19।।
explanation: O queen I did not know this indeed. Only you had related it to me earlier. Because of my affection towards you, I have retained it in my memory. (Now) prevent preparations for Rama's consecration by force.

content: तौ वरौ याच भर्तारं भरतस्याभिषेचनम्।प्रव्राजनं च रामस्य त्वं वर्षाणि चतुर्दश।।2.9.20।।
explanation: Ask your husband for those two boons namely consecration of Bharata and banishment  of Rama for fourteen years.

content: चतुर्दश हि वर्षाणि रामे प्रव्राजिते वनम्।प्रजाभावगतस्नेहस्स्थिरः पुत्रो भविष्यति।।2.9.21।।
explanation: If Rama is banished into the forest for fourteen years your son will be firmly established in the kingdom by  affectionately winning the hearts of  the people.

content: क्रोधागारं प्रविश्याऽद्य क्रुद्धेवाश्वपतेस्सुते।शेष्वाऽनन्तर्हितायां त्वं भूमौ मलिनवासिनी।।2.9.22।।
explanation: O Kaikeyi ,daughter of Ashwapati enter now the chamber of wrath like one in angry mood, wearing soiled garments and lie down on the bare ground.

content: मास्मैनं प्रत्युदीक्षेथा मा चैनमभिभाषथाः।रुदन्ती चापि तं दृष्ट्वा जगत्यां शोकलालसा।।2.9.23।।
explanation: Immersed in grief and in tears, neither look at him (Dasaratha) nor even talk to him when you see him.

content: दयिता त्वं सदा भर्तुरत्र मे नास्ति संशयः।त्वत्कृते स महाराजो विशेदपि हुताशनम्।।2.9.24।।
explanation: No doubt, you have always been a beloved wife to your husband. For your sake the great king will even enter into the burning fire.

content: न त्वां क्रोधयितुं शक्तो न क्रृद्धां प्रत्युदीक्षितुम्।तव प्रियार्थं राजा हि प्राणानपि परित्यजेत्।।2.9.25।।
explanation: The king is afraid of inciting your ire. When you are angry, he dare not look at your indignant countenance. Indeed he will forsake even his life for your pleasure.

content: न ह्यतिक्रमितुं शक्तस्तव वाक्यं महीपतिः।मन्दस्वभावे बुध्यस्व सौभाग्यबलमात्मनः।।2.9.26।।
explanation: The king would not dare transgress your words. O wicked woman, recognise the power of your beauty.

content: मणिमुक्तं सुवर्णानि रत्नानि विविधानि च।दद्याद्दशरथो राजा मास्म तेषु मनः कृथाः।।2.9.27।।
explanation: King Dasaratha may give you gems, pearls, gold and different kinds of precious stones. Do not pay them any attention.

content: यौ तौ दैवासुरे युद्धे वरौ दशरथोऽददात्।तौ स्मारय महाभागे सोऽर्थो न त्वामतिक्रमेत्।।2.9.28।।
explanation: O fortunate Kaikeyi, make him recollect the two boons he had granted you in the war between gods and demons. You should not ignore your objective.

content: यदातु ते वरं दद्यात्स्वयमुत्थाप्य राघवः।व्यवस्थाप्य महाराजं त्वमिमं वृणुया वरम्।।2.9.29।।
explanation: When Dasaratha personally lifts you from the floor and  asks  you what you want  you may make him settle down and ask him for these boons:

content: रामं प्रव्राजयारण्ये नव वर्षाणि पञ्च च।भरतः क्रियतां राजा पृथिव्याः पार्थिवर्षभः।।2.9.30।।
explanation: 'O best of kings exile Rama into the forest for fourteen years and make Bharata king of the land'.

content: चतुर्दश हि वर्षाणि रामे प्रव्राजिते वनम्।रूढश्च कृतमूलश्च शेषं स्थास्यति ते सुतः।।2.9.31।।
explanation: After Rama has been exiled into the forest for fourteen years your son grown strong and deeprooted will remain (king) for the rest of his life.

content: रामप्रव्राजनं चैव देवि याचस्व तं वरम्।एवं सिद्ध्यन्ति पुत्रस्य सर्वार्थास्तव भामिनि।।2.9.32।।
explanation: O Devi demand Rama's exile as a boon. O lovely queen this way all the interests of your son will be fulfilled (protected).

content: एवं प्रव्राजितश्चैव रामोऽरामो भविष्यति।भरतश्च हतामित्रस्तव राजा भविष्यति।।2.9.33।।
explanation: Thus, if Rama is exiled he will no longer be Rama (be able to cause delight to the people). Bharata will become king  with his enemy subdued.

content: येन कालेन रामश्च वनात्प्रत्यागमिष्यति।तेन कालेन पुत्रस्ते कृतमूलो भविष्यति।।2.9.34।।सुगृहीतमनुष्यश्च सुहृद्भिस्सार्धमात्मवान्।
explanation: By the time Rama returns from the forest, your son (now) confident, would have become deep rooted by gaining the company of friends and the acceptability of the people.

content: प्राप्तकालं नु मन्येऽहं राजानं वीतसाध्वसा।।2.9.35।।रामाभिषेकसङ्कल्पान्निगृह्य विनिवर्तय।
explanation: I think the proper time has come (to ask for the boons). Without fear refrain the king forcibly from his intention of installing Rama.

content: अनर्थमर्थरूपेण ग्राहिता सा ततस्तया।।2.9.36।।हृष्टा प्रतीता कैकेयी मन्थरामिदमब्रवीत्।
explanation: Thus, having been made to accept the evil design as a beneficial objective, Kaikeyi  understood (the entire matter) and in delight spoke to Manthara.

content: सा हि वाक्येन कुब्जायाः किशोरीवोत्पथं गता।।2.9.37।।कैकेयी विस्मयं प्राप्ता परं परमदर्शना।
explanation: That Kaikeyi, even though endowed with sound foresight, expressed her sense of wonder at the words of the hunchback and chose a wrong path like a young (immature) girl.

content: कुब्जे त्वां नाभिजानामि श्रेष्ठां श्रेष्ठाभिथायिनीम्।।2.9.38।।पृथिव्यामसि कुब्जानामुत्तमा बुद्धिनिश्चये।
explanation: (She said) O hunchback, I never knew that you can speak such excellent words or decide  things intelligently. You are the best among the hunchbacks of this world.

content: त्वमेव तु ममाऽर्थेषु नित्ययुक्ता हितैषिणी।।2.9.39।।नाहं समवबुध्येयं कुब्जे राज्ञश्चिकीर्षितम्।
explanation: O hunchback you alone always show interest in my affairs and seek my welfare. I might not have known the intended (deceptive) action of the king (without you).

content: सन्ति दुस्संस्थिताः कुब्जा वक्राः परमदारुणाः।।2.9.40।।त्वं पद्ममिव वातेन सन्नता प्रियदर्शना।त्वं पद्ममिव वातेन सन्नता प्रियदर्शना।
explanation: There are many hunchbacks in this world, terribly ugly with their bodies misshaped and crooked. But you look beautiful like a lotus bent by the breeze.

content: उरस्तेऽभिनिविष्टं वै यावत्स्कन्धात् समुन्नतं।।2.9.41।।अधस्ताच्चोदरं शातं सुनाभमिव लज्जितम्।
explanation: Your breasts are thick and are as high as your shoulders. Beneath them lies your belly with its beautiful navel (waist) looking slender as if out of bashfulness.

content: परिपूर्णं तु जघनं सुपीनौ च पयोधरौ।।2.9.42।।विमलेन्दुसमं वक्त्रमहोराजसि मन्थरे।
explanation: You have full hips, round and plump breasts. Your countenance equals the bright moon. How passionate you look, Manthara

content: जघनं तव निर्घुष्टं रशनादामशोभितम्।।2.9.43।।जङ्घे भृशमुपन्यस्ते पादौ चाप्यायतावुभौ।
explanation: Your hips, glitter with the jingling girdle. Strong are the  calfs of your legs and long are your feet.

content: त्वमायताभ्यां सक्थिभ्यां मन्थरे क्षौमवासिनी।।2.9.44।।अग्रतो मम गच्छन्ती राजहंसीव राजसे।
explanation: O Manthara when clad in silk garment you walk in front of me with your heavy thighs, you look like a female royal swan.

content: आसन्याश्शम्बरे मायास्सहस्रमसुराधिपे।।2.9.45।।सर्वास्त्वयि निविष्टास्ता भूयश्चान्यास्सहस्रशः।
explanation: In you reside a thousand deceitful means more than all the thousand mayas (tricks) of Sambara, king of the asuras, was capable of.

content: तवेदं स्थगु यद्दीर्घं रथघोणमिवायतम्।।2.9.46।।मतयः क्षत्रविद्याश्च मायाश्चात्र वसन्ति ते।
explanation: Your clever thoughts, magic powers and also the skills of kshatriyas are stored in your huge hump which is as wide as the hub of a chariot wheel.

content: अत्र ते प्रतिमोक्ष्यामि मालां कुब्जे हिरण्मयीम्।।2.9.47।।अभिषिक्ते च भरते राघवे च वनं गते।
explanation: O hunchback, with Rama gone to the forest and Bharata consecrated, I shall drape this hump with a golden garland.

content: जात्येन च सुवर्णेन सुनिष्टप्तेन मन्थरे।।2.9.48।।लब्धार्था च प्रतीता च लेपयिष्यामि ते स्थगु।
explanation: O Manthara, when my objective is accomplished and I am fully satisfied, I will smear your hump with the best of refined liquid gold.

content: मुखे च तिलकं चित्रं जातरूपमयं शुभम्।।2.9.49।।कारयिष्यामि ते कुब्जे शुभान्याभरणानि च।
explanation: O Manthara, I shall get a tilaka made of gold for your auspicious, lovely face and shall also order exquisite ornaments (for you).

content: परिधाय शुभे वस्त्रे देवतेव चरिष्यसि।।2.9.50।।चन्द्रमाह्वयमानेन मुखेनाप्रतिमानना।गमिष्यसि गतिं मुख्यां गर्वयन्ती द्विषज्जनम्।।2.9.51।।
explanation: You shall move about wearing lovely garments like a goddess. With a peerless countenance, as if challenging the Moon and feeling proud, you will attain a state of eminence amidst your enemies.

content: तवापि कुब्जाः कुब्जायास्सर्वाभरणभूषिताः।पादौ परिचरिष्यन्ति यथैव त्वं सदा मम।।2.9.52।।
explanation: Other hunchbacks adorned with all sorts of ornament shall also serve you in the same manner as you are serving me.

content: इति प्रशस्यमाना सा कैकेयीमिदमब्रवीत्।शयानां शयने शुभ्रे वेद्यामग्निशिखामिव।।2.9.53।।
explanation: Flattered in this manner, Manthara addressed Kaikeyi who was lying on a white couch and looking like a flaming fire on the sacrificial altar:

content: गतोदके सेतुबन्धो न कल्याणि विधीयते।उत्तिष्ठ कुरु कल्याणि राजानमनुदर्शय।।2.9.54।।
explanation: O fortunate one construction of a dike is not undertaken after the water has flowed down. Act before the king to the best of your interest.

content: तथा प्रोत्साहिता देवी गत्वा मन्थरया सह।क्रोधागारं विशालाक्षी सौभाग्यमदगर्विता।।2.9.55।।अनेकशतसाहस्रं मुक्ताहारं वराङ्गना।अवमुच्य वरार्हाणि शुभान्याभरणानि च।।2.9.56।।ततो हेमोपमा तत्र कुब्जावाक्यवशं गता।संविश्य भूमौ कैकेयी मन्थरामिदमब्रवीत्।।2.9.57।।
explanation: That beautiful, largeeyed Kaikeyi, puffed with the pride of her intoxicating beauty, encourged and influenced by the words of that hunchback, entered the chamber of wrath. She cast off her highly precious pearl necklace worth many hundreds of thousands (of rupees) and other costly, beautiful ornaments. Thereafter that goldenhued Kaikeyi lay down on the floor and said to Manthara:

content: इह वा मां मृतां कुब्जे नृपायावेदयिष्यसि।वनं तु राघवे प्राप्ते भरतः प्राप्स्यति क्षितिम्।।2.9.58।।
explanation: O hunchback, tell the king, either Bharata shall secure the kingdom on Rama's departure to the forest or else I will die here.

content: न सुवर्णेन मे ह्यर्थो न रत्नैर्न च भूषणैः।एष मे जीवितस्यान्तो रामो यद्यभिषिच्यते।।2.9.59।।
explanation: I do not aspire for gold, nor gems nor ornaments. If Rama is installed, that will be the end of my life.

content: अथो पुनस्तां महिषीं महीक्षितो वचोभिरत्यर्थमहापराक्रमैः।उवाच कुब्जा भरतस्य मातरं हितं वचो राममुपेत्य चाहितम्।।2.9.60।।
explanation: Addressing queen Kaikeyi, the mother of Bharata, with extremely powerful words, that hunchback again made these utterances beneficial to Bharata and detrimental to Rama:

content: प्रपत्स्यते राज्यमिदं हि राघवोयदि ध्रुवं त्वं ससुता च तप्स्यसे।अतो हि कल्याणि यतस्व तत्तथा यथा सुतस्ते भरतोऽभिषेक्ष्यते।।2.9.61।।
explanation: It is true that if Rama secures this kingdom, you along with your son are bound to suffer. O auspicious one, hence act in a way your son Bharata will be installed.

content: तथाऽतिविद्धा महिषी तु कुब्जया समाहता वागिषुभिर्मुहुर्मुहुः।निधायहस्तौ हृदयेऽतिविस्मिताशशंस कुब्जां कुपिता पुनः पुनः।।2.9.62।।
explanation: Repeatedly struck down by that hunchback's arrowsharp words greatly grieved queen Kaikeyi was inflamed against the king. Laying her hands on the chest again and again and expressing her amazement, she praised that hunchback.

content: यमस्य वा मां विषयं गतामितोनिशाम्य कुब्जे प्रतिवेदयिष्यसि।वनं गते वा सुचिराय राघवेसमृद्धकामो भरतो भविष्यति।।2.9.63।।
explanation: Tell the king that he will see either the fulfilment of Bharata's desire after Rama is banished into the forest for a long period or me gone to Yama's abode.

content: अहं हि नैवास्तरणानि न स्रजोन चन्दनं नाञ्जनपानभोजनम्।न किञ्चिदिच्छामि न चेह जीवितंन चेदितो गच्छति राघवो वनम्।।2.9.64।।
explanation: If Rama does not go from here to the forest, I want neither a bed nor garlands nor sandalpaste nor unguents nor food nor water nor even life.

content: अथैतदुक्त्वा वचनं सुदारुणंनिधाय सर्वाभरणानि भामिनी।असंवृतामास्तरणेन मेदिनींतदाऽधिशिश्ये पतितेव किन्नरी।।2.9.65।।
explanation: Saying these ruthless words, that lovely Kaikeyi cast off all her ornaments like a fallen  'kinnara' woman, and lay down on the floor with the carpet removed.

content: उदीर्णसंरम्भतमोवृताननातथाऽवमुक्तोत्तममाल्यभूषणा।नरेन्द्रपत्नी विमना बभूव सा तमोवृता द्यौरिव मग्नतारका।।2.9.66।।
explanation: Thus queen Kaikeyi's face enveloped by the darkness of violent anger and her body stripped of all valuable ornaments, she lay restless, looking like the dark sky without stars. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे नवमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends of the ninth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [King Dasaratha enters the palace of Kaikeyi who is in the chamber of wrath--tries to pacify her in different ways.]विदर्शिता यदा देवी कुब्जया पापया भृशम्।तदा शेते स्म सा भूमौ दिग्धविद्धेव किन्नरी।।2.10.1।।
explanation: Perversely advised by the extremely sinful hunchback the queen (Kaikeyi) lay down on the ground like a kinnari struck as though by a poisonous arrow.

content: निश्चित्य मनसा कृत्यं सा सम्यगिति भामिनी।मन्थरायै शनैस्सर्वमाचचक्षे विचक्षणा।।2.10.2।।
explanation: The intelligent, beautiful lady (Kaikeyi), having correctly decided the strategy in her mind, slowly unfolded everything to Manthara.

content: सा दीना निश्चयं कृत्वा मन्थरावाक्यमोहिता।नागकन्येव निश्वस्य दीर्घमुष्णं च भामिनी।।2.10.3।।मुहूर्तं चिन्तयामास मार्गमात्मसुखावहम्।
explanation: That beautiful wretch (Kaikeyi) impressed by the words of Manthara heaved deep, hot sighs like a female serpent and  thought for a while about the means of bringing happiness to herself.

content: सा सुहृच्चार्थकामा च तं निशम्य सुनिश्चयम्।।2.10.4।।बभूव परमप्रीता सिध्दिं प्राप्येव मन्थरा।
explanation: Manthara, Kaikeyi's friend, too, driven by a strong desire to fulfil her resolve was highly pleased and on hearing the firm determination of Kaikeyi, felt as if the accomplishment of the objective was at hand.

content: अथ सा रुषिता देवी सम्यक्कृत्वा विनिश्चयम्।।2.10.5।।संविवेशाबला भूमौ निवेश्य भृकुटीं मुखे।
explanation: Then Kaikeyi finally took a firm decision. With a soiled body and a frowning face she lay down on the floor.

content: ततश्चित्राणि माल्यानि दिव्यान्याभरणानि च।।2.10.6।।अपविद्धानि कैकेय्या तानि भूमिं प्रपेदिरे।
explanation: Thereafter Kaikeyi flung away her multicoloured garlands along with her costly ornaments on to the ground.

content: तया तान्यपविद्धानि माल्यान्याभरणानि च।।2.10.7।।अशोभयन्त वसुधां नक्षत्राणि यथा नभः।
explanation: All the garlands and ornaments she scattered adorned the floor like the stars (illumining) the sky.

content: क्रोधागारे निपतिता सा बभौ मलिनाम्बरा।।2.10.8।।एकवेणीं दृढं बद्वा गतसत्त्वेव किन्नरी।
explanation: Tightly fastening her hair into a single braid and wearing soiled clothes, she lay down in the chamber of wrath in a lifeless state like a kinnari.

content: आज्ञाप्य च महाराजो राघवस्याभिषेचनम्।।2.10.9।।उपस्थानमनुज्ञाप्य प्रविवेश निवेशनम्।
explanation: The king issued orders for Rama's installation ceremony, and taking leave of his close associates entered the palace.                        .

content: अद्य रामाभिषेको वै प्रसिद्ध इति जज्ञिवान्।।2.10.10।।प्रियार्हां प्रियमाख्यातुं विवेशान्तःपुरं वशी।
explanation: Aware of the fact that Rama's installation ceremony was known to everybody by then he who had subdued his senses entered the inner apartment to convey it to one worthy of such pleasant news.

content: स कैकेय्या गृहं श्रेष्ठं प्रविवेश महायशाः।।2.10.11।।पाण्डुराभ्रमिवाकाशं राहुयुक्तं निशाकरः।
explanation: The illustrious king entered the excellent abode of Kaikeyi like the Moon entering the mouth of Rahu in a sky overcast with pale clouds.

content: शुकबर्हिणसङ्घुष्टं क्रौञ्चहंसरुतायुतम्।।2.10.12।।वादित्ररवसङ्घुष्टं कुब्जा वामनिकायुतम्।लतागृहैश्चित्रगृहैश्चम्पकाशोकशोभितैः।।2.10.13।।दान्तराजतसौवर्णवेदिकाभि स्समायुतम्।नित्यपुष्पफलैर्वृक्षैर्वापीभिश्चोपशोभितम्।।2.10.14।।दान्तरजतसौवर्णैस्संवृतं परमासनैः।विविधैरन्नपानैश्च भक्ष्यैश्च विविधैरपि।।2.10.15।।उपपन्नं महार्हैश्च भूषितैस्त्रिदिवोपमम्।तत्प्रविश्य महाराजस्स्वमन्तः पुरमृद्धिमत्।।2.10.16।।न ददर्श प्रियां राजा कैकेयीं शयनोत्तमे।
explanation: The maharaja entered the inner apartment of Kaikeyi's prosperous abode filled with parrots and peacocks, reverberating with cries of kraunchas and swans and sounds of musical instruments attended with hunchbacks and dwarfs decorated with champak and ashoka trees, bowers surrounded with creepers, picturegalleries, altars and sofas embellished with ivory, gold and silver. It was shining with pools and trees bearing flowers and fruits in all seasons. Various kinds of food, drinks and eatables were kept ready. With excellent decorations that abode of Kaikeyi resembled heaven. (But) the king did not see his beloved Kaikeyi in her best bed.

content: कामबलसंयुक्तो रत्यर्थं मनुजाधिपः।।2.10.17।।अपश्यन्दयितां भार्यां पप्रच्छ विषसाद च।
explanation: Charged with passion and seeking carnal pleasure, the king became dejected when he did not see his beloved wife. He enquired about her.

content: न हि तस्य पुरा देवी तां वेलामत्यवर्तत।।2.10.18।।न च राजा गृहं शून्यं प्रविवेश कदाचन।
explanation: Never before had queen Kaikeyi missed his time of arrival. Nor had the king ever entered her empty apartment.

content: ततो गृहगतो राजा कैकेयीं पर्यपृच्छत।।2.10.19।।यथा पूर्वमविज्ञाय स्वार्थलिप्सुमपण्डिताम्।
explanation: Having entered her apartment, the king, unaware of that foolish Kaikeyi's selfish design enquired her whereabouts as usual.

content: प्रतीहारी त्वथोवाच सन्त्रस्ता सुकृताञ्जलिः।।2.10.20।।देव देवी भृशं कृद्धा क्रोधागारमभिदृता।
explanation: Thereafter, the frightened doorkeeper with folded palms said O monarch the queen in a hot mood has rushed into the chamber of wrath.

content: प्रतीहार्या वचश्शृत्वा राजा परमदुर्मनाः।।2.10.21।।विषसाद पुनर्भूयो लुलितव्याकुलेन्द्रियः।।
explanation: Hearing the words of the doorkeeper, the melancholic king grieved all the more with his senses agitated and unstable.

content: तत्र तां पतितां भूमौ शयानामतथोचिताम्।।2.10.22।।प्रतप्त इव दुःखेन सोऽपश्यज्जगतीपतिः।
explanation: The lord of the earth (Dasaratha) saw her (Kaikeyi) lying down on the floor of the chamber of wrath in an unbecoming manner and felt as if consumed by grief.

content: स वृद्धस्तरुणीं भार्यां प्राणेभ्योपि गरीयसीम्।।2.10.23।।अपापः पापसङ्कल्पां ददर्श धरणीतले।लतामिव विनिष्कृत्तां पतितां देवतामिव।।2.10.24।।किन्नरीमिव निर्धूतां च्युतामप्सरसं यथा।मायामिव परिभ्रष्टां हरिणीमिव संयताम्।।2.10.25।।
explanation: The guileless, old king beheld his youthful wife who was dearer to him than his own life, filled with deceitful  intentions. She looked like a severed creeper, like a goddess fallen down, like a 'Kinnari' thrown down on earth, like an 'apsarasa' slipped from heaven, like an illusion torn, like a female deer tied down.

content: करेणुमिव दिग्धेन विद्धां मृगयुना वने।महागज इवारण्ये स्नेहात्परिममर्श ताम्।।2.10.26।।
explanation: Like a mighty sheelephant caressing her cow wounded with a poisoned arrow in the forest, he caressed her lovingly.

content: परिमृश्य च पाणिभ्यामभिसन्त्रस्तचेतनः।कामी कमलपत्राक्षीमुवाच वनितामिदम्।।2.10.27।।
explanation: With a mind extremely terrified yet passionate, he caressed his lotuseyed wife with his hands, and said:

content: न तेऽहमभिजानामि क्रोधमात्मनि संश्रितम्।देवि केनाभिशप्ताऽसि केन वाऽसि विमानिता।।2.10.28।।यदिदं मम दुःखाय शेषे कल्याणि पांसुषु।
explanation: O auspicious queen, I do not know whether your anger is directed at me. I do not know the cause of your anger. By whom have you been offended or disrespected? Why are you lying in the dust? This is causing me great sorrow.

content: भूमौ शेषे किमर्थं त्वं मयि कल्याणचेतसि।।2.10.29।।भूतोपहतचित्तेव मम चित्तप्रमाथिनी।
explanation: While I am here favourably disposed towards you, why are you lying down on the floor like one possessed by an evil spirit? Why are you afflicting my mind?

content: सन्ति मे कुशला वैद्यास्त्वभितुष्टाश्च सर्वशः।।2.10.30।।सुखितां त्वां करिष्यन्ति व्याधिमाचक्ष्व भामिनी।
explanation: O lovely one there are, to my best satisfaction, expert physicians in all branches (of medical science). They will restore your health. Tell me your ailment.

content: कस्य वा ते प्रियं कार्यं केन वा विप्रियं कृतम्।।2.10.31।।कः प्रियं लभतामद्य को वा सुमहदप्रियम्।
explanation: On whom do you wish to bestow favour? Who has caused you displeasure? To whom should I grant favour now? To whom should I cause great displeasure?

content: मा रोदीर्मा च कार्षीस्त्वं देवि संपरिशोषणम्।।2.10.32।।अवध्यो वध्यतां को वा को वा वध्यो विमुच्यताम्।दरिद्रः को भवत्वाढ्यो द्रव्यवान्वाऽप्यकिञ्चनः।।2.10.33।।
explanation: O queen shed no tears. Drain not your health. Ask me, and I shall slay one who should not be slain or release one who should be slain. I shall make a poor man rich and a wealthy man poor. (Tell me who are such people).

content: अहं चैव मदीयाश्च सर्वे तव वशानुगाः।न ते किञ्चिदभिप्रायं व्याहन्तुमहमुत्सहे।।2.10.34।।
explanation: My kins and I are under your control. I will make no effort to go even a little  against your wishes.

content: आत्मनो जीवितेनापि ब्रूहि यन्मनसेच्छसि।बलमात्मनि जानन्ती न मां शङ्कितुमर्हसि।।2.10.35।।करिष्यामि तव प्रीतिं सुकृतेनापि ते शपे।
explanation: If you want to do anything even if it means sacrificing my life, I shall do it. Since you know my strength, it does not behove you to doubt me. I swear on my  merits. I will do whatever pleases you.

content: यावदावर्तते चक्रं तावती मे वसुन्धरा।।2.10.36।।प्राचीनास्सिन्धुसौवीरा स्सौराष्ट्रा दक्षिणापथाः।वङ्गाङ्गमगधाः मत्स्याः समृद्धा काशिकोसलाः।।2.10.37।।
explanation: My authority on the land is extended till such places the wheel of any chariot rotates such as the regions in the east, SindhuSauvira areas, Saurashtra, Southern regions, Banga, Anga, Magadha states, Matsya kingdom and KasiKosala countries which are prosperous places.

content: तत्र जातं बहु द्रव्यं धनधान्यमजाविकम्।ततो वृणीष्व कैकेयि यद्यत्त्वं मनसेच्छसि।।2.10.38।।
explanation: There wealth and foodgrains, sheep and goats and many things are produced. O Kaikeyi, ask whichever of these you wish.

content: किमायासेन ते भीरु उत्तिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ शोभने।तत्त्वं मे ब्रूहि कैकेयि यतस्ते भयमागतम्।।2.10.39।।तत्ते व्यपनयिष्यामि नीहारमिव रश्मिवान्।
explanation: O lady why do you exert yourself? Arise, arise. O charming Kaikeyi, tell me the cause of your fear. I will dispel it just as the Sun dispels morning mists.

content: तथोक्ता सा समाश्वस्ता वक्तुकामा तदप्रियम्।।2.10.40।।परिपीडयितुं भूयो भर्तारमुपचक्रमे।
explanation: Thus spoken to, she (Kaikeyi) breathed a sigh of relief. Intending to tell him the unpleasant thing (which was in her mind), she began tormenting her husband all the more.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे दशमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends  the tenth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Kaikeyi reminds king Dasaratha about the boons--seeks consecration of Bharata as princeregent and exile of Rama to the forest.]तं मन्मथशरैर्विद्धमं कामवेगवशानुगम्।उवाच पृथिवीपालं कैकेयी दारुणं वचः।।2.11.1।।
explanation: To the ruler of the earth (the king), struck by the darts of Kamadeva and overtaken by passion Kaikeyi spoke (these) dreadful words.

content: नास्मि विप्रकृतादेव केनचिन्नावमानिता।अभिप्रायस्तु मे कश्चित्तमिच्छामि त्वया कृतम्।।2.11.2।।
explanation: O king I have neither been offended nor disregarded by any one, but I have a purpose which you should fulfil.

content: प्रतिज्ञां प्रतिजानीष्व यदि त्वं कर्तुमिच्छसि।अथ तद्व्याहरिष्यामि यदभिप्रार्थितं मया।।2.11.3।।
explanation: If you are inclined to accomplish my desire, then promise me that you will fulfil them. Thereafter I shall reveal it to you.

content: तामुवाच महातेजाः कैकेयीमीषदुत्स्मितः। कामी हस्तेन संगृह्य मूर्धजेषु शुचिस्मिताम्।।2.11.4।।
explanation: The mighty king steeped in passion gently held Kaikeyi's hair in his hands  and with a clear, bright smile said:

content: आवलिप्ते न जानासि त्वत्तः प्रियतरो मम।मनुजो मनुजव्याघ्राद्रामादन्यो न विद्यते।।2.11.5।।
explanation: O proud lady, don't you know there exists for me no woman dearer than you and      no man other than Rama who is the best among men.

content: तेनाजय्येन मुख्येन राघवेण महात्मना।शपे ते जीवनार्हेण ब्रूहि यन्मनसेच्छासि।।2.11.6।।
explanation: I swear in the name of the scion of the Raghu dynasty, the invincible, broadminded Rama, the best among men worthy of long life. Tell me what you have in mind.

content: यं मुहूर्तमपश्यंस्तु न जीवेयमहं ध्रुवम्।तेन रामेण कैकेयि शपे ते वचनक्रियाम्।।2.11.7।।
explanation: O Kaikeyi, in the name of Rama without seeing whom I, for sure, cannot live a momment, I swear I will fulfil your desire.

content: आत्मना वात्मजैश्चान्यैर्वृणेयं मनुजर्षभम्।तेन रामेण कैकेयि शपे ते वचनक्रियाम्।।2.11.8।।
explanation: O Kaikeyi I wish the best among men Rama well.Even at the expense of my life or the lives of the rest of my sons I swear in his name I shall fulfil your wish.

content: भद्रे हृदयमप्येतदनुमृशोद्धरस्व मे।एतत्समीक्ष्य कैकेयि ब्रूहि यत्साधु मन्यसे।।2.11.9।।
explanation: O gentle lady my heart is sinking. Touch my heart and deliver me from distress. O Kaikeyi considering all this, tell me what you think is good.

content: बलमात्मनि जानन्ती न मां शङ्कितुमर्हसि।करिष्यामि तव प्रीतिं सुकृतेनापि ते शपे।।2.11.10।।
explanation: You know fully the authority you wield over me. Therefore, it does not behove you to doubt me. I swear on my acquired merits that I shall do whatever pleases you.

content: सा तदर्थमना देवी तमभिप्रायमागतम्।निर्माध्यस्थ्याच्च हर्षाच्च बभाषे दुर्वचं वचः।।2.11.11।।
explanation: Bent upon her interests, the queen cheered and expressed in unutterable words her premeditated  wish which had no alternative.

content: तेन वाक्येन संहृष्टा तमभिप्रायमागतम्।व्याजहार महाघोरमभ्यागतमिवान्तकम्।।2.11.12।।
explanation: Delighted by the words (of the king), Kaikeyi disclosed him her highly dreadful wish which entered her mind like a sudden visitation of death:

content: यथा क्रमे शपसि वरं मम ददासि च।तच्छृण्वन्तु त्रयस्त्रिंशद्देवास्साग्निपुरोगमाः।।2.11.13।।
explanation: You are repeatedly swearing to grant me boons. Let the thirtythree crore gods headed by  the firegod, listen.

content: चन्द्रादित्यौ नभश्चैव ग्रहा रात्र्यहनी दिशः।जगच्च पृथिवी चेयं सगन्धर्वा सराक्षसा।।2.11.14।।निशाचराणि भूतानि गृहेषु गृहदेवता।यानि चान्यानि भूतानि जानीयुर्भाषितं तव।।2.11.15।।
explanation: Let the Moon and the Sun, the sky, the planets, night and day, the (ten) quarters the world, gandharvas, rakshasas, this earth, the nocturnal spirits all beings, family deities of every house and all other beings listen to your words of promise.

content: सत्यसन्धो महातेजाः धर्मज्ञः सुसमाहितः।वरं मम ददात्येष तन्मे श्रृण्वन्तु दैवताः।।2.11.16।।
explanation: King Dasaratha who is true to his vows, heroic and knows the ways of righteousness is granting me boons with a wellcomposed mind. Let all the gods  stand witness to this (declared Kaikeyi).

content: इति देवी महेष्वासं परिगृह्याभिशस्य च।ततः परमुवाचेदं वरदं काममोहितम्।।2.11.17।।
explanation: Clasping the great archer, the infatuated king, conferer of boons and flattering him (to the top of her bent), the queen said:

content: स्मर राजन् पुरावृत्तं तस्मिन् दैवासुरे रणे।तत्र चाच्यावयच्छत्रुस्तव जीवितमन्तरा।।2.11.18।।
explanation: O king, recall the event that happened long ago in the war between gods and asuras where the enemy destroyed all your forces except your life.

content: तत्र चापि मया देव यत्त्वं समभिरक्षितः।जाग्रत्या यतमानायास्ततो मे प्राददा वरौ।।2.11.19।।
explanation: O king, I rescued you there. Since I was alert to protect you, you granted me two boons.

content: तौ तु दत्तौ वरौ देव निक्षेपौ मृगयाम्यहम्।तथैव पृथिवीपाल सकाशे सत्यसङ्गर।।2.11.20।।
explanation: O protector of the earth, O king, honest in keeping promises, I (now) seek those two boons which were reserved as deposits.

content: तत् प्रतिश्रुत्य धर्मेण न चेद्दास्यसि मे वरम्।अद्यैव हि प्रहास्यामि जीवितं त्वद्विमानिता।।2.11.21।।
explanation: The boons you have vowed to give shall rightfully be given to me. If not, disgraced by you I shall give up my life right away.

content: वाङ्मात्रेण तदा राजा कैकेय्या स्ववशे कृतः।प्रचस्कन्द विनाशाय पाशं मृग इवात्मनः।।2.11.22।।
explanation: The king now came under the control of Kaikeyi by his own words like a deer that jumps into the trap for its own destruction.

content: ततः परमुवाचेदं वरदं काममोहितम्।वरौ यौ मे त्वया देव तदा दत्तौ महीपते।।2.11.23।।तौ तावदहमद्यैव वक्ष्यामि शृणु मे वचः।
explanation: Thereafter, she said to the infatuated king who had promised to confer her boons, O lord of the earth, O king, right now I shall speak to you about the two boons granted by you. Listen to my words.

content: अभिषेकसमारम्भो राघवस्योपकल्पितः।।2.11.24।।अनेनैवाभिषेकेण भरतो मेऽभिषिच्यताम्।
explanation: Preparations for Rama's consecration have been made. With these very materials for installation, my son Bharata should be consecrated.

content: यो द्वितीयो वरो देव दत्तः प्रीतेन मे त्वया।।2.11.25।।तदा दैवासुरे युद्धे तस्य कालोऽयमागत।
explanation: Then in the war between gods and asuras, O lord, pleased with me you have promised a second boon and the time has come to grant it.

content: नव प़ञ्च च वर्षाणि दण्डकारण्यमाश्रितः।।2.11.26।।चीराजिनजटाधारी रामो भवतु तापसः।
explanation: Consigned to the Dandaka forest for fourteen years, clad in bark and deer skin and wearing matted hair, Rama shall live like an ascetic.

content: भरतो भजतामद्य यौवराज्यमकण्टकम्।।2.11.27।।एष मे परमः कामो दत्तमेव वरं वृणे।अद्य चैव हि पश्येयं प्रयान्तं राघवं वनम्।।2.11.28।।
explanation: Let Bharata be princeregent without any rivals. This is my great desire. I am asking for an already granted boon. Let me see Rama's departure to the forest today itself.

content: स राजराजः भव सत्यसङ्गरः कुलं च शीलं च हि रक्ष जन्म च।परत्रवासे हि वदन्त्यनुत्तमं तपोधनास्सत्यवचो हितं नृणाम्।।2.11.29।।
explanation: O king of kings, by being true to your vow, protect your race, character and lineage. Those sages whose ascetism is their wealth maintain that there is no merit superior to truthfulness which can confer man a place in the other world.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकादशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eleventh sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Lamentations of king Dasaratha.]ततश्शृत्वा महाराजः कैकेय्या दारुणं वचः। चिन्तामभिसमापेदे मुहूर्तं प्रतताप च।।2.12.1।।
explanation: After hearing the dreadful words of Kaikeyi, the maharaja (Dasaratha), engulfed in grief, was extremely distressed for a moment.

content: किन्नु मे यदि वा स्वप्नश्चित्तमोहोऽपि वा मम। अनुभूतोपसर्गो वा मनसो वाप्युपद्रवः।।2.12.2।।
explanation: ' Is this a dream? Or a hallucination of the mind? Or some foreboding evil I am going to experience or a malady of my mind'? (wondered Dasaratha)

content: इति सञ्चिन्त्य तद्राजा नाध्यगच्छत्तदासुखम्।प्रतिलभ्य चिरात्संज्ञां कैकेयीवाक्यताडितः।।2.12.3।।व्यथितो विक्लबश्चैव व्याघ्रीं दृष्ट्वा यथा मृगः।असंवृतायामासीनो जगत्यां दीर्घमुच्छवसन्।।2.12.4।।मण्डले पन्नगो रुद्धो मन्त्रैरिव महाविषः।अहो धिगिति सामर्षो वाचमुक्त्वा नराधिपः।।2.12.5।।मोहमापेदिवान्भूय श्शोकोपहतचेतनः।
explanation: The King absorbed in such thoughts did not get solace. He was startled  and distressed like a deer beholding a tigress. He had long lost the senses struck by the (ruthless) words of Kaikeyi. He sank down upon the bare floor heaving deep sighs like  a venomous serpent lying confined in a circle. 'What a pity' said the king with indignation and with his senses overwhelmed  by sorrow  fell into a stupor again.

content: चिरेण तु नृप स्संज्ञां प्रतिलभ्य सुदुःखितः।।2.12.6।।कैकेयीमब्रवीत्क्रुद्धःप्रदहन्निव चक्षुषा।
explanation: Regaining his consciousness after a long time, the king in deep grief and with eyes as though burning in anger looked at  Kaikeyi  and said:

content: नृशंसे दुष्टचारित्रे कुलस्यास्य विनाशिनि।।2.12.7।।किं कृतं तव रामेण पापं पापे मयापि वा।
explanation: O woman of cruel and sinful nature, you are bent on destroying this family. What harm has been done to you  by Rama or by me?

content: यदा ते जननीतुल्यां वृत्तिं वहति राघव: ।।2.12.8।।	तस्यैव त्वमनर्थाय किंनिमित्तमिहोद्यता ।
explanation: Then Rama was conducting himself in relation to you as his own mother, for what purpose are you seeking injustice to such a person?

content: त्वं मयाऽऽत्मविनाशार्थं भवनं स्वं प्रवेशिता।।2.12.9।।अविज्ञानान्नृपसुता व्याली तीक्ष्णविषा यथा।
explanation: In my ignorance I brought home for my selfdestruction a king's daughter who was like a venomous female serpent.

content: जीवलोको यदा सर्वो रामस्याह गुणस्तवम्।।2.12.10।।अपराधं किमुद्दिश्य त्यक्ष्यामीष्टमहं सुतम्।
explanation: When all living beings of this world are extoling the virtues of Rama, for what crime should I abandon my beloved son?

content: कौसल्यां वा सुमित्रां वा त्यजेयमपि वा श्रियम्।।2.12.11।।जीवितं वाऽत्मनो रामं न त्वेव पितृवत्सलम्।
explanation: I shall give up Kausalya or Sumitra or all my wealth or even my own life but I cannot leave Rama who is devoted to his father.

content: परा भवति मे प्रीतिर्दृष्ट्वा तनयमग्रजम्।।2.12.12।।अपश्यतस्तु मे रामं नष्टा भवति चेतना।
explanation: When I see my firstborn , I experience supreme delight. But if I do not see him, my life loses its meaning.

content: तिष्ठेल्लोको विना सूर्यं शस्यं वा सलिलं विना।।2.12.13।।न तु रामं विना देहे तिष्ठेत्तु मम जीवितम्।
explanation: This world can exist without the Sun or crops (can be grown) without water but without Rama, life would not exist in my body.

content: तदलं त्यज्यतामेष निश्चयः पापनिश्चये।।2.12.14।।अपि ते चरणै मूर्ध्ना स्पृशाम्येष प्रसीद मे।
explanation: O lady of evil intentions, enough of this. Give up your resolve. Here I touch your feet with my head. Be pleased with me.

content: किमिदं चिन्तितं पापे त्वया परमदारुणम्।।2.12.15।।अथ जिज्ञाससे मां त्वं भरतस्य प्रियाप्रिये। 	अस्तु यत्तत्त्वया पूर्वं व्याहृतं राघवं प्रति।।2.12.16।।स मे ज्येष्ठस्सुत श्रीमान्धर्मज्येष्ठ इतीव मे।तत्त्वया प्रियवादिन्या सेवार्थं कथितं भवेत्।।2.12.17।।
explanation: O sinful one why have you got this most dreadful thought? Do you want to know  my likes or dislikes about Bharata? Let them be so.But speaking of Rama earlier, you used to say, 'Rama is my eldest son. He is noble and foremost in discharging his  duties.' Such sweet words could not have been said only to please me.

content: तच्छ्रुत्वा शोकसन्तप्ता सन्तापयसि मां भृशम्।आविष्टाऽसि गृहं शून्यं सा त्वं परवशं गता।।2.12.18।।
explanation: Further you are tormented with sorrow under the influence of others' insinuations. You are causing me great pain by entering the empty chamber of wrath.

content: इक्ष्वाकूणां कुले देवि सम्प्राप्तस्सुमहानयम्। अनयो नयसम्पन्ने यत्र ते विकृता मतिः।।2.12.19।।
explanation: O queen, till now you had a moral sense. With your mind debased (now), a very great immorality has infected the  Ikshvaku race.

content: नहि किञ्चिदयुक्तं वा विप्रियं वा पुरा मम।अकरोस्त्वं विशालाक्षि तेन न श्रद्दधाम्यहम्।।2.12.20।।
explanation: O largeeyed lady, you have never done anything improper or unpalatable towards me in the past. Therefore I do not  believe your words.

content: ननु ते राघवस्तुल्यो भरतेन महात्मना।बहुशो हि सुबाले त्वं कथाः कथयसे मम।।2.12.21।।
explanation: O childish one, you used to tell me several times that Rama is as dear to you as the highsouled Bharata.

content: तस्य धर्मात्मनो देवि वनवासं यशस्विनः।कथं रोचयसे भीरु नव वर्षाणि पञ्च च।।2.12.22।।
explanation: O lady how do you wish this righteous and illustrious Rama to dwell in the forest for fourteen years?

content: अत्यन्तसुकुमारस्य तस्य धर्मे धृतात्मनः।कथं रोचयसे वासमरण्ये भृशदारुणे।।2.12.23।।
explanation: Why do you want Rama who is so tender and a firm follower of dharma to dwell in the highly dreadful forest?

content: रोचयस्यभिरामस्य रामस्य शुभलोचने।तव शुश्रूषमाणस्य किमर्थं विप्रवासनम्।।2.12.24।।
explanation: O woman with attractive eyes, why do you want Rama who is so charming and serving you to be exiled to a distant place?

content: रामो हि भरताद्भूयस्तव शुश्रूषते सदा।विशेषं त्वयि तस्मात्तु भरतस्य न लक्षये।।2.12.25।।
explanation: Rama is doing greater service to you than Bharata. Therefore, I do not find any reason for you to have a special love for Bharata.

content: शुश्रूषां गौरवं चैव प्रमाणं वचनक्रियाम्।कस्ते भूयस्तरं कुर्यादन्यत्र मनुजर्षभात्।।2.12.26।।	बहूनां स्त्रीसहस्राणां बहूनां चोपजीविनाम्।
explanation: There are many thousands of women and attendants (in the inner apartment), but who will do greater service and honour you more than Rama, the best among men in the execution of your orders.

content: परिवादोऽपवादो वा राघवे नोपपद्यते।।2.12.27।।सान्त्वयन्सर्वभूतानि राम श्शुद्धेन चेतसा।गृह्णाति मनुजव्याघ्र प्रियैर्विषयवासिनः।।2.12.28।।
explanation: The best among men, Rama has won the trust of the inhabitants of the country by securing their affection with a pure heart and by doing acts dear to them. Therefore, neither a word of blame nor reproach applies to this scion of the Raghu dynasty (Rama).

content: सत्येन लोकान् जयति दीनान् दानेन राघवः।गुरूञ्छुश्रूषया वीरो धनुषा युधि शात्रवान्।।2.12.29।।
explanation: Rama is a hero who wins over the people by his truthfulness, the poor by charity, the preceptors by his service and the enemies in the battle by the power of  his bow.

content: सत्यं दानं तपस्त्यागो मित्रता शौचमार्जवम्।विद्या च गुरुशुश्रूषा ध्रुवाण्येतानि राघवे।।2.12.30।।
explanation: Truth, munificence, asceticism, renunciation, purity, uprightness, learning and service to his superiors all those (virtues) are firmly planted in this descendant of the Raghus.

content: तस्मिन्नार्जवसम्पन्ने देवि देवोपमे कथम्।पापमाशंससे रामे महर्षिसमतेजसि।।2.12.31।।
explanation: How do you, O Devi, wish to harm Rama who is endowed with uprightness, who resembles the gods and in lustre to great ascetics?

content: न स्मराम्यप्रियं वाक्यं लोकस्य प्रियवादिनः।स कथं त्वत्कृते रामं वक्ष्यामि प्रियमप्रियम्।।2.12.32।।
explanation: How can I, for your sake, speak harsh to my beloved Rama who uses pleasing words to the people of the world, and never an unpleasant word which I can recall?

content: क्षमा यस्मिन्दमस्त्याग सत्यं धर्मः कृतज्ञता।अप्यहिंसा च भूतानां तमृते का गतिर्मम।।2.12.33।।
explanation: Where is the refuge for me without him in whom dwell forgiveness, forbearance, renunciation, truthfulness, righteousness, gratefulness and also nonviolence towards all living beings?

content: मम वृद्धस्य कैकेयि गतान्तस्य तपस्विनः।दीनं लालप्यमानस्य कारुण्यं कर्तुमर्हसि।।2.12.34।।
explanation: O Kaikeyi, you should show mercy to this wretched, old man on the verge of death, wailing pitifully.

content: पृथिव्यां सागरान्तायां यत्किञ्चिदधिगम्यते।तत्सर्वं तव दास्यामि मा च त्वां मन्युराविशेत्।।2.12.35।।
explanation: I shall give you all that can be secured on this earth bounded by the ocean. Show no anger.

content: अञ्जलिं करोमि कैकेयि पादौ चापि स्पृशामि ते।शरणं भव रामस्य माऽधर्मो मामिह स्पृशेत्।।2.12.36।।
explanation: O Kaikeyi I bow to you with folded palms. I touch your feet, too. Be the saviour of Rama. Let no sin taint me here (in this life).

content: इति दुःखाभिसन्तप्तं विलपन्तमचेतनम्।घूर्णमानं महाराजं शोकेन समभिप्लुतम्।।2.12.37।।पारं शोकार्णवस्याशु प्रार्थयन्तं पुनः पुनः। 	प्रत्युवाचाथ कैकेयी रौद्रा रौद्रतरं वचः।।2.12.38।।
explanation: Then the fierce Kaikeyi used fiercer words in reply to the king who was tormented with grief and filled with tears, senses switched off, head reeling, overwhelmed with pain, beseeching again and again to ferry him across the ocean of sorrow as quickly as possible:

content: यदि दत्त्वा वरौ राजन्पुनः प्रत्यनुतप्यसे। धार्मिकत्वं कथं वीर पृथिव्यां कथयिष्यसि।।2.12.39।।
explanation: O valiant king, if you repent like this after having given two boons, how will you talk about your righteousness on this earth?

content: यदा समेता बहवस्त्वया राजर्षय स्सह। कथयिष्यन्ति धर्मज्ञ तत्र किं प्रतिवक्ष्यसि।।2.12.40।।
explanation: O knower of righteousness when innumerable rajarshis assemble and ask you on this what answer will you give?

content: यस्याः प्रसादे जीवामि या च मामभ्यपालयत्।तस्याः कृतम् मया मिथ्या कैकेय्या इति वक्षयसि।।2.12.41।।
explanation: Will you say, 'To such a Kaikeyi by whose mercy I am alive and by whom I was protected, I have broken the promise given'?

content: किल्बिषत्वं नरेन्द्राणां करिष्यसि नराधिप।यो दत्वा वरमद्यैव पुनरन्यानि भाषसे।।2.12.42।।
explanation: O king, right now having given two boons, you are speaking otherwise. You are bringing blemish to kings (of the Ikshwaku race)

content: शैब्यश्श्येनकपोतीये स्वमांसं पक्षिणे ददौ।अलर्कश्चक्षुषी दत्वा जगाम गतिमुत्तमाम्।।2.12.43।।
explanation: (King) Saibya gave his own flesh to the hawk in the conflict between the hawk and the pigeon. (King) Alarka gave his eyes (to a blind man) and attained the highest state.

content: सागरस्समयं कृत्वा न वेलामतिवर्तते।समयं माऽनृतं कार्षीः पूर्ववृत्तमनुस्मरन्।।2.12.44।।
explanation: Having made the vow (to the gods), the ocean does not advance beyond the shore. Recollect the history of the earlier kings and do not make the vow false.

content: स त्वं धर्मं परित्यज्य रामं राज्येऽभिषिच्य च।सह कौसल्यया नित्यं रन्तुमिच्छसि दुर्मते।।2.12.45।।
explanation: O wickedminded one, deserting righteousness and installing Rama in the kingdom, you want to enjoy life with Kausalya everafter?

content: भवत्वधर्मो धर्मो वा सत्यं वा यदि वाऽनृतम्।यत्त्वया संश्रुतं मह्यं तस्य नास्ति व्यतिक्रमः।।2.12.46।।
explanation: Whether righteous or unrighteous, true or false, there is no deviation from what you have promised to me.

content: अहं हि विषमद्यैव पीत्वा बहु तवाग्रतः।पश्यतस्ते मरिष्यामि रामो यद्यभिषिच्यते।।2.12.47।।
explanation: If Rama is coronated I will die while as you are watching right in your presence today itself by drinking excessive poison.

content: एकाहमपि पश्येयं यद्यहं राममातरम्।अञ्जलिं प्रतिगृह्णन्तीं श्रेयो ननु मृतिर्मम।।2.12.48।।
explanation: If I were to see Rama's mother receiving homage from everybody even for a day, I shall prefer my death.

content: भरतेनात्मना चाहं शपे ते मनुजाधिप। यथा नान्येन तुष्येयमृते रामविवासनात्।।2.12.49।।
explanation: O king, I swear on Bharata and on my own life that nothing less than Rama's banishment will satisfy me.

content: एतावदुक्त्वा वचनं कैकेयी विरराम ह।विलपन्तं च राजानं न प्रतिव्याजहार सा।।2.12.50।।
explanation: Kaikeyi, having spoken to this extent remained silent. She heeded not the lament of the king.

content: श्रुत्वा तु राजा कैकेय्या वृतं परमशोभनम्।रामस्य च वने वासमैश्वर्यं भरतस्य च।।2.12.51।।	नाभ्यभाषत कैकेयीं मुहूर्तं व्याकुलेन्द्रियः।
explanation: Having heard of the highly unfair demands by Kaikeyi for Rama's exile to the forest and Bharata's prosperity (enthronement), the king was dumbstruck for a while with his senses agitated. He did not speak to Kaikeyi.

content: प्रैक्षतानिमिषो देवीं प्रियामप्रियवादिनीम्।।2.12.52।।तां हि वज्रसमां वाचमाकर्ण्य हृदयाप्रियाम्।दुःखशोकमयीं घोरां राजा न सुखितोऽभवत्।।2.12.53।।
explanation: The unhappy king intently fixed his gaze at his beloved queen speaking unpleasant words charged with grief and anguish, unpleasant to the heart like the dreadful thunderbolt.

content: स देव्या व्यवसायं च घोरं च शपथं कृतम्।ध्यात्वा रामेति निश्श्वस्य छिन्न स्तरुरिवापतत्।।2.12.54।।
explanation: Reflecting on the determination of the queen and her dreadful vow, the king sighed and cried, 'O Rama' and then fell down like a tree severed.

content: नष्टचित्तो यथोन्मत्तो विपरीतो यथाऽतुरः।हृततेजा यथा सर्पो बभूव जगतीपतिः।।2.12.55।।
explanation: The lord of the earth (Dasaratha) became like a man with the mind deranged, like a sick man behaving to the contrary, like a serpent with its energy drained (through mantra).

content: दीनया तु गिरा राजा इति होवाच कैकयीम्।अनर्थमिममर्थाभं केन त्वमुपदर्शिता।।2.12.56।।भूतोपहतचित्तेव ब्रुवन्ती मां न लज्जसे।
explanation: The king addressed Kaikeyi in humble words saying, Why did you exhibit this unfortunate act apparently beneficial to you? You are not ashamed of saying this like one whose faculties are possessed by an evil spirit.

content: शीलव्यसनमेतत्ते नाभिजानाम्यहं पुरा।।2.12.57।।	बालायास्तत्त्वितिदानीं ते लक्षये विपरीतवत्।
explanation: I never knew earlier when you were young that you possessed such perverse behaviour. But now I perceive the reverse (of what I knew).

content: कुतो वा ते भयं जातं या त्वमेवंविधं वरम्।।2.12.58।।राष्ट्रे भरतमासीनं वृणीषे राघवं वने।
explanation: You are asking for a boon that Bharata should be enthroned in the kingdom while Rama should live in the forest. From where did you get this apprehension?

content: विरमैतेन भावेन त्वमेतेनानृतेन वा।।2.12.59।।यदि भर्तुः प्रियं कार्यं लोकस्य भरतस्य च।
explanation: If you wish to do good to your husband, to the world and also to Bharata, refrain from this illusory thought.

content: नृशंसे पापसङ्कल्पे क्षुद्रे दुष्कृतकारिणि।।2.12.60।।किन्नु दुखमलीकं वा मयि रामे च पश्यसि।
explanation: O cruel one, O woman of sinful resolve, O vile (creature), O woman of evil deeds, what  wrong or sin do you really see in Rama or in me.

content: न कथञ्चिदृते रामाद्भरतो राज्यमावसेत्।।2.12.61।।रामादपि हि तं मन्ये धर्मतो बलवत्तरम्।
explanation: Depriving Rama, Bharata in no way will occupy the kingdom because in the matter of righteousness I think he is superior even to Rama.

content: कथं द्रक्ष्यामि रामस्य वनं गच्छेति भाषिते।।2.12.62।।मुखवर्णं विवर्णं तु तं यथैवेन्दुमुपप्लुतम्।
explanation: While instructing Rama to go to the forest, how can I look at his face, pale like the eclipsed moon?

content: तां हि मे सुकृतां बुद्धिं सुहृद्भिस्सह निश्चिताम्।।2.12.63।।कथं द्रक्ष्याम्यपावृत्तां परैरिव हतां चमूम्। किं मां वक्ष्यन्ति राजानो नानादिग्भ्य स्समागताः।।2.12.64।।बालो बताऽयमैक्ष्वाकश्चिरं राज्यमकारयत्।
explanation: I have taken this decision in consultation with friends to install Rama. How can I see such a decision being reversed like a retreating army defeated by enemies? Kings from different quarters have already arrived and they will say, How did this ignorant descendant of the Ikshakus (Dasaratha) rule this kingdom for such a long time?

content: यदा तु बहवो वृद्धा गुणवन्तो बहुश्रुताः।।2.12.65।।परिप्रक्ष्यन्ति काकुत्स्थं वक्ष्यामि किमहं तदा।
explanation: When several virtuous and learned elders ask me about Rama, what shall I tell them?

content: कैकेय्या क्लिश्यमानेन रामः प्रव्राजितो मया।।2.12.66।।यदि सत्यं ब्रवीम्येतत्तदसत्यं भविष्यति।
explanation: If I tell the truth 'Tortured by Kaikeyi, I have sent Rama to the forest', none will believe it  and they will consider it untruth.

content: किं मां वक्ष्यति कौशल्या राघवे वनमास्थिते।।2.12.67।।किं चैनां प्रतिवक्ष्यामि कृत्वा विप्रियमीदृशम्।
explanation: If Rama takes refuge in the forest, what will Kausalya say to me? Having committed such an unpleasant act, what reply can I give her?

content: यदा यदा हि कौशल्या दासीवच्च सखीव च।।2.12.68।।भार्यावद्भगिनीवच्च मातृवच्चोपतिष्ठति। सततं प्रियकामा मे प्रियपुत्रा प्रियंवदा।।2.12.69।।न मया सत्कृता देवी सत्कारार्हा कृते तव।
explanation: Sweetspoken Kausalya who always cherishes my welfare. who has given me my beloved son, who has served me like an attendant, a friend, a wife, a sister and a mother deserved courteous treatment from me, but  because of you, she never received due attention from me.

content: इदानीं तत्तपति मां यन्मया सुकृतं त्वयि।।2.12.70।।अपथ्यव्यञ्जनोपेतं भुक्तमन्नमिवातुरम्।
explanation: I have done many favours to you. Like a sick person afflicted by eating rice mixed with unwholesome curry, those acts of kindness are burning me now.

content: विप्रकारं च रामस्य सम्प्रयाणं वनस्य च।।2.12.71।।सुमित्रा प्रेक्ष्य वै भीता कथं मे विश्वसिष्यति।
explanation: In seeing the insult meted out to Rama and his journey to the forest, how will frightened  Sumitra  have confidence in me?

content: कृपणं बत वैदेही श्रोष्यति द्वयमप्रियम्।।2.12.72।।मां च पञ्चत्वमापन्नं रामं च वनमाश्रितम्।
explanation: Alas Sita will listen in a pitiable state the two unpleasant events namely my death and  Rama's exile to the foest.

content: वैदेही बत मे प्राणान्शोचन्ती क्षपयिष्यति।।2.12.73।।हीना हिमवतः पार्श्वे किन्नरेणेव किन्नरी।
explanation: What a pity Vaidehi, lamenting like a Kinnari forsaken by a Kinnara on the Himalayan slopes, will cause death to me.

content: न हि राममहं दृष्ट्वा प्रवसन्तं महावने।।2.12.74।।चिरं जीवितुमाशंसे रुदन्तीं चापि मैथिलीम्।
explanation: With Rama living in the wilderness and Sita crying, I do not hope to survive for long, indeed.

content: सा नूनं विधवा राज्यं सपुत्रा कारयिष्यसि।।2.12.75।।न हि प्रव्राजिते रामे देवि जीवितुमुत्सहे।
explanation: O Devi you will certainly rule the kingdom as a widow along with your son. (But) I do not wish to live after Rama is exiled.

content: सतीं त्वामहमत्यन्तं व्यवस्याम्यसतीं सतीम्। रूपिणीं विषसंयुक्तां पीत्वेव मदिरां नरः।।2.12.76।।
explanation: Like people regarding wine mixed with poison as fine before drinking it, I had a firm belief that you were a chaste woman, but while you who look extremely beautiful you are actually not so.

content: अनृतैर्बहु मां सान्त्वै स्सान्त्वयन्ती स्म भाषसे। गीतशब्देन संरुध्य लुब्धो मृगमिवावधीः।।2.12.77।।
explanation: You used to console me with so many words pleasing but untrue and you killed me like a hunter getting the deer trapped and slaughtered through the melody of music.

content: अनार्य इति मामार्याः पुत्रविक्रायकं ध्रुवम्। धिक्करिष्यन्ति रथ्यासु सुरापं ब्राह्मणं यथा।।2.12.78।।
explanation: Respectable people on the highway will certainly say 'He sold away his son' and censure me as a mean person like a brahmin consuming liquor.

content: अहो दुःखमहो कृच्छ्रं यत्र वाचः क्षमे तव। दुःखमेवंविधं प्राप्तं पुराकृतमिवाशुभम्।।2.12.79।।
explanation: What suffering What a calamity that I am made to put up with your words. I am subject to this suffering may be as expiation for the sin formerly committed.

content: चिरं खलु मया पापे त्वं पापेनाभिरक्षिता। अज्ञानादुपसम्पन्ना रज्जुरुद्बन्धिनी यथा।।2.12.80।।
explanation: O wretch I protected you in my folly for a long time through ignorance, like a rope preserved which turned out to be a noose to hang me with.

content: रममाणस्त्वया सार्धं मृत्युं त्वां नाभिलक्षये। बालो रहसि हस्तेन कृष्णसर्पमिवास्पृशम्।।2.12.81।।
explanation: While sporting with you, I did not realize you were death incarnate. Like a child handling a black cobra I caressed you.

content: मया ह्यपितृकः पुत्र स्समहात्मा दुरात्मना। तं तु मां जीवलोकोऽयं नूनमाक्रोष्टुमर्हति।।2.12.82।।
explanation: Wicked I am, I have made that magnanimous Rama fatherless. This world of living beings is certainly entitled to condemn me.

content: बालिशो बत कामात्मा राजा दशरथो भृशम्।यः स्त्रीकृते प्रियं पुत्रं वनं प्रस्थापयिष्यति।।2.12.83।।
explanation: (They will say), 'Alas how utterly foolish and lustful is king Dasaratha who is sending his beloved son to the forest for the sake of a woman'.

content: व्रतैश्च ब्रह्मचर्यैश्च गुरुभिश्चोपकर्शितः।भोगकाले महत्कृच्छ्रं पुनरेव प्रपत्स्यते।।2.12.84।।
explanation: '(Rama) already emaciated by observing vows related to ritual and celibacy in compliance with the orders of the preceptors has to undergo hardships again at a time when he should enjoy pleasures (of life)'.

content: नालं द्वितीयं वचनं पुत्रो मां प्रतिभाषितुम्।स वनं प्रव्रजेत्युक्तो बाढमित्येव वक्ष्यति।।2.12.85।।
explanation: My son Rama will not say a second word to me, if I tell him 'Go to the forest'.He will say, 'Certainly so'.

content: यदि मे राघवः कुर्याद्वनं गच्छेति चोदितः।प्रतिकूलं प्रियं मे स्यान्न तु वत्सः करिष्यति।।2.12.86।।
explanation: If this scion of the Raghu race (Rama) urged to go to the forest acts against my order, it will be welcome but my son will not do it.

content: शुद्धभावो हि भावं मे न तु ज्ञास्यति राघवः।।2.12.87।।	स वनं प्रब्रजे त्युक्तो बाढ मित्येव वक्षयति।
explanation: The descendant of the Raghus (Rama) who is pure in thought will not come to know my intention. Therefore if I tell him 'Go to the forest,' he will say, 'Certainly so'.

content: राघवे हि वनं प्राप्ते सर्वलोकस्य धिक्कृतम्।।2.12.88।।मृत्युरक्षमणीयं मां नयिष्यति यमक्षयम्।
explanation: If Rama goes to the forest, the god of death will conduct me to his abode, for condemned by the entire world, I shall not be forgiven (even by Yama).

content: मृते मयि गते रामे वनं मनुजपुङ्गवे।।2.12.89।।इष्टे मम जने शेषे किं पापं प्रतिपत्स्यसे।
explanation: With me dead and Rama, the best among men, banished, what harmful acts are you contemplating against my wellwishers?

content: कौशल्या मां च रामं च पुत्रौ च यदि हास्यति।।2.12.90।।दुःखान्यसहती देवी मामेवानुमरिष्यति।
explanation: If queen Kausalya loses me, Rama, Lakshmana and Satrughna will follow me into death, unable to bear the grief.

content: कौसल्यां च सुमित्रां च मां च पुत्रैस्त्रिभिस्सह।।2.12.91।।	प्रक्षिप्य नरके सा त्वं कैकेयि सुखिता भव।
explanation: O Kaikeyi consign Kausalya, Sumitra, me and my three sons into hell and be happy.

content: मया रामेण च त्यक्तं शाश्वतं सत्कृतं गुणैः।।2.12.92।।इक्ष्वाकुकुलमक्षोभ्यमाकुलं पालयिष्यसि।
explanation: You will rule undisturbed the Ikshvaku race honoured for its divine virtues. Now abandoned by me and Rama it will be afflicted with grief.

content: प्रियं चेद्भरतस्यैतद्रामप्रव्राजनं भवेत्।।2.12.93।।मा स्म मे भरतः कार्षीत्प्रेतकृत्यं गतायुषः।
explanation: If Rama's exile is approved by Bharata, then let him not perform my funeral rites after my death.

content: हन्तानार्ये ममामित्रे सकामा भव कैकयि।।2.12.94।।मृते मयि गते रामे वनं पुरुषपुङ्गवे।सेदानीं विधवा राज्यं सपुत्रा कारयिष्यसि।।2.12.95।।
explanation: O my enemy, O wicked Kaikeyi, after Rama, the foremost of men, has left for the forest your desires will be fulfilled. And after my death, you as a widow along with your son will rule the kingdom.

content: त्वं राजपुत्रीवादेन न्यवसो मम वेश्मनि। 	अकीर्तिश्चातुला लोके ध्रुवः परिभवश्च मे।।2.12.96।।सर्वभूतेषु चावज्ञा यथा पापकृतस्तथा।
explanation: You lived in my palace under the name of a princess. You have brought me, for sure, unparalleled dishonour and disgrace. Everybody will look upon me with contempt as if I have committed a sinful act.

content: कथं रथैर्विभुर्यात्वा गजाश्वैश्च मुहुर्मुहुः।।2.12.97।।पद्भ्यां रामो महारण्ये वत्सो मे विचरिष्यति।
explanation: How will my son, Rama, who used to ride on chariots, elephants and horses roam the wilderness barefoot?

content: यस्य त्वाहारसमये सूदाः कुण्डलधारिणः।।2.12.98।।अहंपूर्वाः पचन्ति स्म प्रशस्तं पानभोजनम्।स कथन्नु कषायाणि तिक्तानि कटुकानि च।।2.12.99।।भक्षयन्वन्यमाहारं सुतो मे वर्तयिष्यति।
explanation: How will my son for whom the cooks with kundalas in their ears used to proudly prepare enough food and beverages subsist on astringent, pungent, bitter wild fruits and roots?

content: महार्हवस्त्रसंवीतो भूत्वा चिरसुखोषितः।।2.12.100।।काषायपरिधानस्तु कथं भूमौनिवत्स्यति।
explanation: How will he who was habituated to wearing expensive apparels and to (royal) comforts over a long period of time live (sleep) on the ground, putting on saffron robes?

content: कस्यैतद्धारुणं वाक्यमेवंविधमचिन्तितम्।।2.12.101।।रामस्यारण्यगमनं भरतस्याभिषेचनम्।
explanation: Whose are these dreadful words, this inconceivable plan of Rama's exilement and Bharata's enthronement?

content: धिगस्तु योषितो नाम शठा स्स्वार्थपरास्सदा।न ब्रवीमि स्त्रिय स्सर्वा भरतस्यैव मातरम्।।2.12.102।।
explanation: A woman means one who secretly harms others. This is shameful indeed. They always seek selfish interests. I do not say this of all women, only of Bharata's mother.

content: अनर्थभावेऽर्थपरे नृशंसे ममानुतापाय निविष्टभावे।किमप्रियं पश्यसि मन्निमित्तं हितानुकारिण्यथवाऽपि रामे।।2.12.103।।
explanation: O malicious one, O covetous one, O cruel one, O woman determined to torment me, what fault have you seen in Rama who is always devoted to the welfare of others?

content: परित्यजेयुः पितरो हि पुत्रान्भार्याः पतींश्चापि कृतानुरागाः।कृत्स्नं हि सर्वं कुपितं जगत्स्याद्दृष्ट्वैव रामं व्यसने निमग्नम्।।2.12.104।।
explanation: This entire world will be inflamed to see Rama plunged in adversity. Fathers will abandon their sons. Wives, attached to their husbands, will forsake them.

content: अहं पुनर्देवकुमाररूपमलङ्कृतं तं सुतमाव्रजन्तम्।नन्दामि पश्यन्नपि दर्शनेन भवामि दृष्ट्वैव च पुनर्युवेव।।2.12.105।।
explanation: When I see my son, handsome and welladorned like the son of a celestial deity, coming towards me, I rejoice. Even his very sight makes me grow young again.

content: विनाऽपि सूर्येण भवेत्प्रवृत्तिरवर्षता वज्रधरेण वाऽपि।रामं तु गच्छन्तमित स्समीक्ष्य जीवेन्न कश्चित्त्विति चेतना मे।।2.12.106।।
explanation: Nature's activity will continue even without the Sun or even if  Indra, wielder of the thunderbolt, sends no rain but none will live to see Rama departing to the forest. This is my conviction.

content: विनाशकामामहिताममित्रामावासयं मृत्युमिवात्मनस्त्वाम्।चिरं बताङ्केन धृतासि सर्पी महाविषा तेन हतोऽस्मि मोहात्।।2.12.107।।
explanation: Alas I carried all along on my lap a highly poisonous female snake I gave you shelter while you were like death .This delusion is the cause of my ruin.You were my enemy. You wished me harm. You wished my destruction.

content: मया च रामेण च लक्ष्मणेन प्रशास्तु हीनो भरतस्त्वया सह।पुरं च राष्ट्रं च निहत्य बान्धवान् ममाहितानां च भवाभिहर्षिणी।।2.12.108।।
explanation: With Rama and Lakshmana withdrawn from me, my kinsmen killed, let Bharata along with you rule the city and the kingdom causing delight to my enemies.

content: नृशंसवृत्ते व्यसनप्रहारिणि प्रसह्य वाक्यं यदिहाद्य भाषसे।न नाम ते केन मुखात्पतन्त्यधो विशीर्यमाणा दशना स्सहस्रधा।।2.12.109।।
explanation: O cruelhearted woman, you strike one in adversity. Why are your teeth with which you are now speaking (such harsh words) do not fall to the ground, broken into a thousand fragments?

content: न किञ्चिदाहाहितमप्रियं वचो न वेत्ति रामः परुषाणि भाषितुम्।कथन्नु रामे ह्यभिरामवादिनि ब्रवीषि दोषान्गुणनित्यसम्मते।।2.12.110।।
explanation: How do you find fault with Rama who does not utter even one harmful or unpalatable word, who does not know how to use harsh words, and who speaks pleasingly and who is always honoured for his virtues?

content: प्रताम्य वा प्रज्वल वा प्रणश्य वा सहस्रशो वा स्फुटिता महीं व्रज। न ते करिष्यामि वच स्सुदारुणं ममाहितं केकयराजपांसनि।।2.12.111।।
explanation: O obloquy on the house of Kekaya, you may grieve or burn yourself in the fire, or get  destroyed. Even if you fall down on earth broken into a thousand pieces I will not act on your terrible, harmful words.

content: क्षुरोपमां नित्यमसत्प्रियंवदां प्रदुष्टभावां स्वकुलोपघातिनीम्।न जीवितुं त्वां विषहेऽमनोरमां दिधक्षमाणां हृदयं सबन्धनम्।।2.12.112।।
explanation: You are like a knife. You always speak palatable lies. You are  malevolent. You are a destroyer of your own race. You displease the mind. You are intent on burning down all the links of my heart. I cannot bear to see you alive in this world.

content: न जीवितं मेऽस्ति पुनःकुत स्सुखं विनाऽऽत्मजेनाऽत्मवतः कुतो रतिः।ममाहितं देवि न कर्तुमर्हसि स्पृशामि पादावपि ते प्रसीद मे।।2.12.113।।
explanation: There is no life for me without my son (Rama). What to speak of happiness again? Where is pleasure for a selfrespecting man like me? O queen, it does not behove you to do this harmful act. I will touch your feet. Show pity on me.

content: स भूमिपालो विलपन्ननाथवत्स्त्रिया गृहीतो हृदयेऽतिमात्रया।पपात देव्याश्चरणौ प्रसारितावुभावसम्स्पृश्य यथाऽतुरस्तथा।।2.12.114।।
explanation: The king, with his heart in the grip of a woman, wailing like an orphan tried to reach her feet, exceeding the limit of selfrespect but, unable to touch them as she pulled them apart, he collapsed like a sick man.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे द्वादशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twelfth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Dasaratha tries to appease queen Kaikeyi.]अतदर्हं महाराजं शयानमतथोचितम्।ययातिमिव पुण्यान्ते देवलोकात्परिच्युतम्।।2.13.1।।अनर्थरूपा सिद्धार्था ह्यभीता भयदर्शिनी।पुनराकारयामास तमेव वरमङ्गना।।2.13.2।।
explanation: The maharaja lying on the floor resembled (king) Yayati fallen from heaven after his merits (earned earlier) were exhausted. He neither deserved nor was accustomed to such (humiliating) treatment. Fearless Kaikeyi ,the incarnate of misfortune having accomplished her purpose, displyaing feigned fear, urged the king again (without inhibition), about the boons:

content: अतदर्हं महाराजं शयानमतथोचितम्।ययातिमिव पुण्यान्ते देवलोकात्परिच्युतम्।।2.13.1।।अनर्थरूपा सिद्धार्था ह्यभीता भयदर्शिनी।पुनराकारयामास तमेव वरमङ्गना।।2.13.2।।
explanation: The maharaja lying on the floor resembled (king) Yayati fallen from heaven after his merits (earned earlier) were exhausted. He neither deserved nor was accustomed to such (humiliating) treatment. Fearless Kaikeyi ,the incarnate of misfortune having accomplished her purpose, displyaing feigned fear, urged the king again (without inhibition), about the boons:

content: त्वं कत्थसे महाराज सत्यवादी दृढव्रतः।मम चेमं वरं कस्माद्विधारयितुमिच्छसि।।2.13.3।।
explanation: O great king you used to boast that you always speak the truth and are steadfast in your vows. Why are you now seeking to avoid granting me this boon?

content: एवमुक्तस्तु कैकेय्या राजा दशरथस्तदा।प्रत्युवाच ततः क्रुद्धो मुहूर्तं विह्वलन्निव।।2.13.4।।
explanation: Thus addressed by Kaikeyi, king Dasaratha flew into a temper for a while, and then as if in a state of delirium, replied:

content: मृते मयि गते रामे वनं मनुजपुङ्गवे।हन्तानार्ये ममामित्रे सकामा सुखिनी भव।।2.13.5।।
explanation: Alas O ignoble woman, my enemy, your desire would be fulfilled after Rama, the foremost among men is exiled and I am dead. You will be happy thereafter

content: स्वर्गेऽपि खलु रामस्य कुशलं दैवतैरहम्।प्रत्यादेशादभिहितं धारयिष्ये कथं बत।।2.13.6।।
explanation: Even in heaven when the gods enquire about the welfare of Rama how will I convince them about his banishment repudiating the fact? What a catastrophe

content: कैकेय्याः प्रियकामेन रामः प्रव्राजितो मया।यदि सत्यं ब्रवीम्येतत्तदसत्यं भविष्यति।।2.13.7।।
explanation: If I tell the truth, 'To please Kaikeyi I have sent Rama to the forest', none will believe it  and will consider it untruth.

content: अपुत्रेण मया पुत्रश्श्रमेण महता महान्।रामो लब्धो महाबाहु स्सकथं त्यज्यते मया।।2.13.8।।
explanation: When I was issueless, I obtained mighty and valiant Rama with great effort as a son. How can I banish him?

content: शूरश्च कृतविद्यश्च जितक्रोधो क्षमापरः।कथं कमलपत्राक्षो मया रामो विवास्यते।।2.13.9।।
explanation: How can I exile Rama, whose eyes resemble lotus petals, who is learned, who has subdued his anger and who is always full of forgiveness?

content: कथमिन्दीवरश्यामं दीर्घबाहुं महाबलम्।अभिराममहं रामं प्रेषयिष्यामि दण्डकान्।।2.13.10।।
explanation: Rama with a charming personality has a complexion like the blue lotus. He has long arms (with immense strength). How can I banish him to Dandaka forest?

content: सुखानामुचितस्यैव दुःखैरनुचितस्य च।दुखं नामानुपश्येयं कथं रामस्य धीमतः।।2.13.11।।
explanation: Rama deserves happiness not suffering. How can I  bear to see such a sagacious Rama undergoing distress?

content: यदि दुःखमकृत्वाऽद्य मम संक्रमणं भवेत्।अदुःखार्हस्य रामस्य तत स्सुखमवाप्नुयाम्।।2.13.12।।
explanation: If death comes to me right now I shall be very happy because I will not have to inflict suffering on Rama who does not deserve it.

content: नृशंसे पापसङ्कल्पे रामं सत्यपराक्रमम्।किं विप्रियेण कैकेयि प्रियं योजयसे मम।।2.13.13।।अकीर्तिरतुला लोके ध्रुवं परिभवश्च मे।
explanation: O cruel, malevolent Kaikeyi, why do you propose such a harmful act against Rama who has truth as his prowess and who is so dear to me? Certainly, you will get unparalleled infamy and disgrace in this world.

content: तथा विलपतस्तस्य परिभ्रमितचेतसः।।2.13.14।।अस्तमभ्यगमत्सूर्यो रजनी चाभ्यवर्तत।
explanation: While Dasaratha was thus lamenting with a distracted mind, the Sun set and night fell.

content: सा त्रियामा तथार्त्तस्य चन्द्रमण्डलमण्डिता।।2.13.15।।राज्ञो विलपमानस्य न व्यभासत शर्वरी।
explanation: For the king who was in deep anguish and in tears the night appeared dark even though it was adorned with the lunar orb.

content: तथैवोष्णं विनिश्वस्य वृद्धो दशरथो नृपः।।2.13.16।।विललापार्तवद्युखं गगनासक्तलोचनः।
explanation: The old king Dasaratha, heaving hot sighs, started lamenting pitiably fixing his gaze at the sky like the sick:

content: न प्रभातं त्वयेच्छामि निशे नक्षत्रभूषणे।।2.13.17।।क्रियतां मे दया भद्रे मयाऽयं रचितोऽञ्जलिः।
explanation: 'O auspiciouslooking Night adorned with stars, I do not wish to see the dawn. O gentle night, be kind to me I pray with folded hands'.

content: अथवा गम्यतां शीघ्रं नाहमिच्छामि निर्घृणाम्।।2.13.18।।नृशंसां कैकयीं द्रष्टुं यत्कृते व्यसनं महत्।
explanation: 'Or, pass off quickly. I do not want to see this merciless, malicious Kaikeyi who is the cause of this great misfortune'.

content: एवमुक्त्वा ततो राजा कैकेयीं संयताञ्जलिः।।2.13.19।।प्रसादयामास पुनः कैकेयीं चेदमब्रवीत्।
explanation: Having said this, the king spoke again with folded hands to Kaikeyi in order to appease her:

content: साधु वृत्तस्य दीनस्य त्वद्गतस्य गतायुषः।।2.1.20।।प्रसादः क्रियतां देवि भद्रे राज्ञो विशेषतः।
explanation: O gentle queen, I am an old man and my life is almost over. I am a wretch devoted to you. I am a man of good conduct. Do me this favour especially as I am  king.

content: शून्ये न खलु सुश्रोणि मयेदं समुदाहृतम्।।2.13.21।।कुरु साधु प्रसादं मे बाले सहृदया ह्यसि।
explanation: O lady with fair hips, I hope whatever I have said has not been a cry in the (empty) sky. O young lady show me this favour. Surely you are kindhearted.

content: प्रसीद देवि रामोमेत्वद्दत्तं राज्यमव्यम्।।2.13.22।।लभतामसितापाङ्गे यशः परमवाप्नु हि।
explanation: O queen with beautiful, dark eyelashes, show pity on me. Let Rama receive this unbounded kingdom through you and you acquire fame.

content: मम रामस्य लोकस्य गुरूणां भरतस्य च।।2.13.23।।प्रियमेतद्गुरुश्रोणि कुरु चारुमुखेक्षणे
explanation: O lady with heavy hips, charming eyes and a beautiful face, do this favour to me, to Rama, to the world, to all the preceptors and to Bharata too.

content: विशुद्धभावस्य सुदुष्टभावा ताम्रेक्षणस्याश्रुकलस्य राज्ञः।श्रुत्वा विचित्रं करुणं विलापं भर्तुर्नृशंसा न चकार वाक्यम्।।2.13.24।।
explanation: The king with a clean heart, whose eyes had been rendered red with weeping wailed  piteously. Even after hearing it, that malicious woman full of wicked thoughts did not act upon his word.

content: ततस्स राजा पुनरेव मूर्छितःप्रियामतुष्टां प्रतिकूलभाषिणीम्।समीक्ष्य पुत्रस्य विवासनं प्रति क्षितौ विसंज्ञो निपपात दुखितः।।2.13.25।।
explanation: Seeing his dear wife not pleased (despite his pleadings) and urging him, to the contrary, for the banishment of his son, the king overcome with grief fell down unconscious on the floor.

content: इतीव राज्ञो व्यथितस्य सा निशा जगाम घोरं श्वसतो मनस्विनःविबोध्यमानः प्रतिबोधनं तदा  निवारयामास स राजसत्तमः।।2.13.26।।
explanation: The night passed off with the highminded king lamenting this way and heaving deep sighs. When he got up, the eminent king stopped (the panegyrists) awakening him.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे त्रयोदशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirteenth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Kaikeyi insists on the boons -- Ayodhya is decorated all over--People wait eagerly for the event -- Vasistha arrives at the inner apartment of the king-- Dasaratha sends Sumantra to fetch Rama.]  पुत्रशोकार्दितं पापा विसंज्ञं पतितं भुवि।विवेष्टमानमुद्वीक्ष्य सैक्ष्वाकमिदमब्रवीत्।।2.14.1।।
explanation: The evil woman (Kaikeyi) said to the king of the Ikshvaku race who lay unconscious on the floor writhing and tormented with grief on account of his son.

content: पापं कृत्वैव किमिदं मम संश्रुत्य संश्रवम्। शेषे क्षितितले सन्नः स्थित्यां स्थातुं त्वमर्हसि।।2.14.2।।
explanation: (Kaikeyi said) What is this? After hearing my response to the promised boon, why are you lying down on the floor dejected as if you had committed a sin? It behoves you to maintain your status.

content: आहु स्सत्यं हि परमं धर्मं धर्मविदो जनाः। सत्यमाश्रित्य हि मया त्वं च धर्मं प्रबोधितः।।2.14.3।।
explanation: Those conversant with righteousness say that truth is a great virtue. By following the truth, I have enlightened you about your duty.
