content: संश्रुत्य शैब्यश्श्येनाय स्वां तनुं जगतीपतिः।प्रदाय पक्षिणे राज न्जगाम गतिमुत्तमाम्।।2.14.4।।
explanation: O King O lord of the earth (king) Saibya attained the highest state by offering his own body to a hawk in accordance with his promise.

content: तथा ह्यलर्कस्तेजस्वी ब्राह्मणे वेदपारगे। याचमाने स्वके नेत्रे उद्धृत्याविमना ददौ।।2.14.5।।
explanation: In the same way the lustrous king Alarka, on being solicited by a brahmin who was an adept in the Vedas, plucked his own eyes and gave them to him without hesitation.

content: सरितां तु पतिस्स्वल्पां मर्यादां सत्यमन्वितः। सत्यानुरोधात्समये स्वां वेलां नातिवर्तते।।2.14.6।।
explanation: The ocean, lord of rivers, even when (tidal) time comes does not cross the shore in obedience to truth.

content: सत्यमेकपदं ब्रह्म सत्ये धर्मः प्रतिष्टितः।सत्यमेवाक्षया वेदा सत्येनैवाप्यते स्परम्।।2.14.7।।
explanation: Truth is Brahman in one word. Righteousness is firmly established in truth. Truth is the imperishable Vedas. The supreme state can be attained by means of truth.

content: सत्यं समनुवर्तस्व यदि धर्मे धृता मतिः।सफलस्स वरो मेऽस्तु वरदो ह्यसि सत्तम।।2.14.8।।
explanation: O excellent one, if your mind is firmly fixed in righteousness, then by following it fulfil the boon granted to me.You are the bestower of boons indeed

content: धर्मस्यैहाभिकामार्थं मम चैवाभिचोदनात्। प्रव्राजय सुतं रामं त्रिःखलु त्वां ब्रवीम्यहम्।।2.14.9।।
explanation: You must uphold righteousness. I also urge you to do that. Send your son Rama to the forest. I am repeating this statememt thrice.

content: समयं च ममार्येमं यदि त्वं न करिष्यसि। अग्रतस्ते परित्यक्ता परित्यक्ष्यामि जीवितम्।।2.14.10।।
explanation: O noble one, if you do not fulfil the agreement, it will mean I have been abandoned by you. (Therefore) I will give up my life in your presence.

content: एवं प्रचोदितो राजा कैकेय्या निर्विशङ्कया। नाशकत्पाशमुन्मोक्तुं बलिरिन्द्रकृतं यथा।।2.14.11।।
explanation: In this way urged by Kaikeyi without fear or hesitation, he (Dasaratha), like Bali unable to release himself from the noose cast by Indra (through Vamana), could not get out of the noose of promise.

content: उद्भ्रान्तहृदयश्चापि विवर्णवदनोऽभवत्। स धुर्योवैपरिस्पन्दन्युगचक्रान्तरं यथा।।2.14.12।।
explanation: Like a bullock, restlessly moving between the wheels and the yoke, Dasaratha's heart started beating wildly and his face turned pale.

content: विह्वलाभ्यां च नेत्राभ्यामपश्यन्निव भूपतिः। कृच्छ्राद्धैर्येण संस्तभ्य कैकेयीमिदमब्रवीत्।।2.14.13।।
explanation: The king was unable to see with his eyes overwhelmed (with tears). Gaining with great difficulty a firm footing and courage he addressed Kaikeyi:

content: यस्ते मन्त्रकृतः पाणिरग्नौ पापे मया धृतः।तं त्यजामि स्वजं चैव तव पुत्रं त्वया सह।।2.14.14।।
explanation: O wicked woman, I held your hand amid chantings of mantras with the sacred fire (as witness). I now disown that hand, you and your son begotten by me.

content: प्रयाता रजनी देवि सूर्यस्योदयनंप्रति। अभिषेकं गुरुजनस्त्वरयिष्यति मां ध्रुवम्।।2.14.15।।
explanation: O queen the night has departed and the Sun is about to rise. The preceptors now will definitely ask me to hasten for the consecration.

content: रामाभिषेकसंभारैस्तदर्थमुपकल्पितैः।रामः कारयितव्यो मे मृतस्य सलिलक्रियाम्।।2.14.16।।
explanation: With the materials already collected for the consecration of Rama he will perform my funeral rite of offering water to the dead.

content: त्वया सपुत्रया नैव कर्तव्या सलिलक्रिया। व्याहन्ताऽस्यशुभाचारे यदि रामाभिषेचनम्।।2.14.17।।
explanation: O woman of inauspicious practices, since you are obstructing Rama's coronation, you and your son shall not perform my funeral rite of offering water to the dead.

content: न च शक्तोऽस्म्यहं द्रष्टुं दृष्ट्वा पूर्वं तथासुखम्। हतहर्षं निरानन्दं पुनर्जनमवाङ्मुखम्।।2.14.18।।
explanation: Having seen people formerly enjoying happiness, I cannot see them again with their downcast, cheerless faces devoid of all happiness.

content: तां तथा ब्रुवतस्तस्य भूमिपस्य महात्मनः। प्रभाता शर्वरी पुण्या चन्द्रनक्षत्रशालिनी।।2.14.19।।
explanation: While the king was thus speaking to her (Kaikeyi) that holy night resplendent with the Moon and the stars, the day dawned.

content: ततः पापसमाचारा कैकेयी पार्थिवं पुनः। उवाच परुषं वाक्यं वाक्यज्ञा रोषमूर्छिता।।2.14.20।।
explanation: Thereafter, Kaikeyi of sinful conduct and skilful in the use of words, rendered senseless by wrath, again addressing the king in harsh words said:

content: किमिदं भाषसे राजन्वाक्यं गररुजोपमम्। आनाययितुमक्लिष्टं पुत्रं राममिहार्हसि।।2.14.21।।
explanation: O king, why are you speaking these painful, poisonous words? What is this? It behoves you to summon your son Rama who does not expearience this pain.

content: स्थाप्य राज्ये मम सुतं कृत्वा रामं वनेचरम्। निस्सपत्नां च मां कृत्वा कृतकृत्यो भविष्यसि।।2.14.22।।
explanation: Only after you have  installed my son in the kingdom and sent Rama to the forest and  made me free from rivals, you shall have your duty fulfiled.

content: स नुन्न इव तीक्ष्णेन प्रतोदेन हयोत्तमः।राजा प्रचोदितोऽभीक्ष्णं कैकेयीमिदमब्रवीत्।।2.14.23।।
explanation: The king who was very much incited by her words, like a horse of the best breed whipped by the lash, replied to Kaikeyi:

content: धर्मबन्धेन बध्दोऽस्मि नष्टा च मम चेतना। ज्येष्ठं पुत्रं प्रियं रामं द्रष्टुमिच्छामि धार्मिकम्।।2.14.24।।
explanation: I am bound by bond of righteousness. My intellect is destroyed. I wish to see my beloved, virtuous firstborn, Rama.

content: ततः प्रभातां रजनीमुदिते च दिवाकरे।पुण्ये नक्षत्रयोगे च मुहूर्ते च समाहिते।।2.14.25।।वसिष्ठो गुणसम्पन्न श्शिष्यै परिवृतस्तदा। उपगृह्याशु सम्भारान्प्रविवेश पुरोत्तमम्।।2.14.26।।
explanation: The night dawned. Ths Sun rose. The auspicious time with the sacred star in (favourable) conjunction arrived. The virtuous Vasistha, surrounded by his disciples, soon entered the best of abodes with the articles collected (for the ceremony).

content: सिक्तसम्मार्जितपथां पताकोत्तम भूषिताम्।विचित्रकुसुमाकीर्णां नानास्रग्भिर्विराजिताम्।।2.14.27।।संहृष्टमनुजोपेतां समृद्धविपणापणाम्। महोत्सवसमाकीर्णां राघवार्थे समुत्सुकाम्।।2.14.28।।चन्दनागरुधूपैश्च सर्वतः प्रतिधूपिताम्। तां पुरीं समतिक्रम्य पुरन्दरपुरोपमाम्।।।2.14.29।।ददर्शान्तःपुरश्रेष्ठं नानाद्विजगणायुतम्।पौरजानपदाकीर्णं ब्राह्मणैरुपशोभितम्।।2.14.30।।	यज्ञविद्भि स्सुसम्पूर्णं सदस्यैः परमद्विजैः।
explanation: The streets in Ayodhya were swept and sprinkled with water, decorated with excellent flags, strewn with flowers of variegated colours and bedecked with various flower garlands. The streets were crowded with curious people rejoicing at the event. The stalls and markets were abundantly filled with merchandise.The city was full of great festivities. The people were curious to see Rama. Sandalwood and incense were burnt and fragrance pervaded in all the directions. The city resembled Amaravati, the abode of Indra.Vasistha entered the city, covered some distance and beheld the best inner apartment. There he saw host of brahmins, citizens and villagers. The best of inner apartments was graced with brahmins who were experts in sacrificial rituals priests and eminent  brahmins.

content: तदन्तःपुरमासाद्य व्यतिचक्राम तं जनम्।।2.14.31।।वसिष्ठः परमप्रीतः परमर्षिर्विवेश च।
explanation: Having reached the inner apartment, the eminent ascetic, Vasistha felt very happy. He passed by the people and entered the inner apartment.

content: सत्वपश्यद्विनिष्क्रान्तं सुमन्त्रं नाम सारथिम्।।2.14.32।।द्वारे मनुजसिंहस्य सचिवं प्रियदर्शनम्।
explanation: Sage Vasistha saw handsome Sumantra, minister to Dasaratha, a lion among the charioteers coming out of the gate.

content: तमुवाच महातेजा स्सूतपुत्रं विशारदम्।।2.14.33 वसिष्ठः क्षिप्रमाचक्ष्व नृपतेर्मामिहागतम्।
explanation: Effulgent Vasistha said to the expert chariotieer Sumantra to inform the king immediately of his arrival.

content: इमे गङ्गोदकघटा स्सागरेभ्यश्च काञ्चनाः।।2.14.34।।औदुम्बरं भद्रपीठमभिषेकार्थमागतम्।सर्वबीजानि गन्धाश्च रत्नानि विविधानि च।।2.14.35।।क्षौद्रं दधि घृतं लाजा दर्भास्सुमनसः पयः। अष्टौ च कन्या रुचिरा मत्तश्च वरवारणः।।2.14.36।।चतुरश्वो रथश्श्रीमान्निस्त्रिंशो धनुरुत्तमम्। वाहनं नरसंयुक्तं छत्रं च शशिसन्निभम्।।2.14.37।।श्वेते च वालव्यजने भृङ्गारुश्च हिरण्मयः। हेमदामपिनध्दश्च ककुद्मान्पाण्डुरो वृषः।।2.14.38।।केसरी च चतुर्दंष्ट्रो हरिश्रेष्ठो महाबलः। सिंहासनं व्याघ्रतनु स्समिद्धश्च हुताशनः।।2.14.39।।सर्ववादित्रसङ्घाश्च वेश्याश्चालङ्कृता स्स्त्रयः। आचार्या ब्राह्मणा गावः पुण्याश्च मृगपक्षिणः।।2.14.40।।पौरजानपदश्रेष्ठा नैगमाश्च गणै स्सह। एते चान्ये च बहवो नीयमानाः प्रियंवदाः।।2.14.41।।अभिषेकाय रामस्य सह तिष्ठन्ति पार्थिवैः।
explanation: Here are the pots filled with water from river Ganga and golden vessels with water from the seas. And throne made of udumbara wood for the installation ceremony. All kinds of seeds, perfumes, different kinds of precious stones, honey, curd, ghee, puffed grains, kusha grass (special grass used in rituals), flowers, milk, eight beautiful girls, an intoxicated elephant, a dignified chariot drawn by four horses, a sword, an elegant bow, a palanquin accompanied by bearers, an umbrella resembling the full Moon, two white fans made of Yak's tails, a golden vessel, a palecoloured humped bull, wearing golden gerland, a lion having four strong and large teeth, a mighty horse of the best breed, a throne, tiger skin, fire kindled with faggots, all kinds of musical instruments, courtesans, welldecorated women, preceptors, brahmins, cows, sacred animals and birds, eminent citizens and villagers, groups of merchants all speaking pleasant words and kings -- all are here for Rama's coronation.

content: त्वरयस्व महाराजं यथा समुदितेऽहनि।।2.14.42।।पुष्ये नक्षत्रयोगे च रामो राज्यमवाप्नुयात्।
explanation: Hasten the maharaja as Rama has to be installed in the kingdom as soon as the day breaks under the conjunction of the sacred Pushya star.

content: इति तस्य वच श्श्रुत्वा सूतपुत्रो महात्मनः।।2.14.43।।स्तुवन्नृपतिशार्दूलं प्रविवेश निवेशनम्।
explanation: Having heard the words of the great Vasistha, charioteer Sumantra entered the  inner apartment, singing the praise of this tiger among kings (Dasaratha).

content: तं तु पूर्वोदितं वृध्दं द्वारस्था राज सम्मतम्।।2.14.44।।न शेकुरभिसंरोध्दुं राज्ञः प्रियचिकीर्षवः।
explanation: The doorkeepers, beloved wellwishers of the king, did not detain aged Sumantra  who was liked by the king and who had arrived early.

content: स समीपस्थितो राज्ञस्तामवस्थामजज्ञिवान्।।2.14.45।।वाग्भिः परमतुष्टाभिरभिष्टोतुं प्रचक्रमे।
explanation: Sumantra approached the king unaware of the state of his mind and commenced praising him in highly pleasing words (as usual).

content: तत स्सूतो यथाकालं पार्थिवस्य निवेशने।।2.14.46।।सुमन्त्रः प्राञ्जलिर्भूत्वा तुष्टाव जगतीपतिम्।
explanation: Thereafter the charioteer Sumantra entered the inner apartment of the king, and with folded hands began singing the praise of the lord of the earth appropriate to the hour.

content: यथा नन्दति तेजस्वी सागरो भास्करोदये।।2.14.47।।प्रीतः प्रीतेन मनसा तथाऽनन्दघन स्स्वतः।
explanation: Just as the mighty ocean rejoices at sunrise, the inherently cheerful Sumantra became delighted to see the king.

content: इन्द्रमस्यां तु वेलायामभितुष्टाव मातलिः।।2.14.48।।सोऽजयद्दानवान्सर्वांस्तथा त्वां बोधयाम्यहम्।
explanation: Just as Indra's charioteer at this time (at dawn) extols him, the conquerer of demons, so do I rouse you (with a song).

content: वेदास्सहाङ्गविद्याश्च यथाह्यात्मभुवं विभुम्।।2.14.49। ब्रह्माणं बोधयन्त्यद्य तथा त्वां बोधयाम्यहम्।
explanation: Just as the Vedas and Vedangas awaken the selfborn lord Brahma, so do I  awaken you.

content: आदित्यस्सह चन्द्रेण यथा भूतधरां शुभाम्।।2.14.50।।बोधयत्यद्य पृथिवीं तथा त्वां बोधयाम्यहम्।
explanation: As the Sun along with the Moon awakens the auspicious earth which supports all  beings, in the same way I am awakening you today.

content: उत्तिष्ठाशु महाराज कृतकौतुकमङ्गलः।।2.14.51।।विराजमानो वपुषा मेरोरिव दिवाकरः।
explanation: O mighty king get up at once like the Sun rising up mount Meru. Put on your beautiful body auspicious robes befitting the festivity.

content: सोमसूर्यौ च काकुत्स्थ शिववैश्रवणावपि।।2.14.52।।वरुणश्चाग्निरिन्द्रश्च विजयं प्रदिशन्तु ते।
explanation: O descendent of Kakutstha, may Moon and Sun, Siva and Kubera, Varuna, Agni and Indra bestow victory on you.

content: गता भगवती रात्रिः कृतं कृत्यमिदं तव।।2.14.53।।बुद्ध्यस्व नृपशार्दूल कुरु कार्यमनन्तरम्। उदतिष्ठत रामस्य समग्रमभिषेचनम्।।2.14.54।।
explanation: O best among kings the holy night has passed. Having been acquainted with the acts accomplished so far, perform whatever is further necessary for the installation    ceremony. All preparations for Rama's coronation ceremony have since been complete.

content: पौरजानापदैश्चापि नैगमैश्च कृताञ्जलिः। स्वयं वशिष्ठो भगवान्ब्राह्मणै स्सह तिष्ठति।।2.14.55।।
explanation: Venerable Vasistha along with inhabitants of the city and countryside including merchants and brahmins with folded hands awaits you.

content: क्षिप्रमाज्ञाप्यतां राजन्राघवस्याभिषेचनम्। यथा ह्यपालाः पशवो यथा सेना ह्यनायका।।2.14.56।।यथा चन्द्रं विना रात्रिर्यथा गावो विना वृषम्। एवं हि भविता राष्ट्रं यत्र राजा न दृश्यते।।2.14.57।।
explanation: O king Rama's installation may be promptly ordered. As herds without herdsman, army without commander, night without the Moon, and cows without a bull, so is a kingdom without a king.

content: इति तस्य वच श्शृत्वा सान्त्वपूर्वमिवार्थवत्। अभ्यकीर्यत शोकेन भूय एव महीपतिः।।2.14.58।।
explanation: Hearing these  meaningful words of Sumantra uttered in an appealing tone, the lord of the earth relapsed into grief.

content: तत स्सराजा तं सूतं सन्नहर्ष स्सुतं प्रति। शोकरक्तेक्षण श्श्रीमानुद्वीक्ष्योवाच धार्मिकः।।2.14.59।।वाक्यैस्तु खलु मर्माणि मम भूयो निकृन्तसि।
explanation: The virtuous and glorious king thinking of his son without cheer looked upward with eyes red with tears and said to the charioteer, You are causing my heart excruciating pain with your words.

content: सुमन्त्रः करुणं श्रुत्वा दृष्ट्वा दीनं च पार्थिवम्। प्रगृहीताञ्जलिः किञ्चित्तस्माद्देशादपाक्रमत्।।2.14.60।।
explanation: Having heard the sorrowful words of the king and having seen his wretched state  Sumantra with palms folded moved away a little from the place.

content: यदा वक्तुं स्वयं दैन्यान्न शशाक महीपतिः।।2.14.61।।तदा सुमन्त्रं मन्त्रज्ञा कैकेयी प्रत्युवाच ह।
explanation: When the king himself in that wretched state was not able to speak to Sumantra, crafty Kaikeyi said to him in reply:

content: सुमन्त्र राजा रजनीं रामहर्षसमुत्सुकः।।2.14.62।।प्रजागरपरिश्रान्तो निद्राया वशमुपेयिवान्।
explanation: O Sumantra, excited with joy on account of the (proposed) installation of Rama, the king did not have a wink of sleep all night. He is weary and overpowered with sleep.

content: तद्गच्छ त्वरितं सूत राजपुत्रं यशस्विनम्।।2.14.63।।राममानय भद्रं ते नात्र कार्या विचारणा।
explanation: So, O Sumantra quickly fetch the gentle, illustrious prince Rama. Let there be no hesitation in this matter.

content: स मन्यमानः कल्याणं हृदयेन ननन्द च।।2.14.64।।निर्जगाम च सम्प्रीत्या त्वरितो राजशासनात्।
explanation: Thinking that an auspicious event will take place, he rejoiced at heart and in obedience to royal order, left at once.

content: सुमन्त्रश्चिन्तयामास त्वरितं चोदितस्तया।।2.14.65।।व्यक्तं रामोऽभिषेकार्थमिहायास्यति धर्मवित्।
explanation: Urged by Kaikeyi, Sumantra thought 'Righteous Rama will definitely come here for the purpose of  installation'.

content: इति सूतो मतिं कृत्वा हर्षेण महताऽऽवृतः।।2.14.66।।निर्जगाम महाबाहो राघवस्य दिदृक्षया।
explanation: So thought the charioteer and filled with great delight left (the inner apartment), eager to see the mightyarmed Rama.

content: सागरह्रदसङ्काशात्सुमन्त्रोऽन्तःपुराच्छुभात्।।2.14.67।।निष्क्रम्य जनसम्बाधं ददर्श द्वारमग्रतः।
explanation: Sumantra, departed from the auspcious inner apartment which looked like the deep waters of the sea and saw people thronging the gate.

content: ततः पुरस्तात्सहसा विनिर्गतो महीपतीन्द्वारगतो विलोकयन्। ददर्श पौरान्विविधान्महाधना नुपस्थितान्द्वारमुपेत्य विष्ठितान्।।2.14.68।।
explanation: Then Sumantra hastened towards the gate where he saw kings, wealthy people and citizens who had already arrived and waiting there.   इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे चतुर्दशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fourteenth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Dasaratha commands Sumantra to bring Rama] ते तु तां रजनीमुष्य ब्राह्मणा वेदपारगाः।उपतस्थुरुपस्थानं सह राजपुरोहिताः।।2.15.1।।
explanation: The brahmins wellversed in the Vedas stayed waiting all night and assembled at the pavilion (for the consecration ceremony) along with royal priests.

content: अमात्या बलमुख्याश्च मुख्या ये निगमस्य च।राघवस्याभिषेकार्थे प्रियमाणास्तु संगताः।।2.15.2।।
explanation: For the consecration of the scion of the Raghu race (Rama), ministers, army chiefs and chiefs of merchants' associations assembled, brimming with joy.

content: उदिते विमले सूर्ये पुष्ये चाभ्यागतेऽहनि।लग्ने कर्कटके प्राप्ते जन्म रामस्य च स्थिते।।2.15.3।।अभिषेकाय रामस्य द्विजेन्द्रैरुपकल्पितम्।
explanation: The best of brahmins had decided to perform the consecration ceremony after the  bright Sun appeared in the sky when the Pushya star approached the karkataka lagna, which was the constellation at the time of Rama's birth.

content: काञ्चना जलकुम्भाश्च भद्रपीठं स्वलंकृतम्।।2.15.4।।रथः च सम्यगास्तीर्णो भास्वता व्याघ्रचर्मणा।
explanation: Golden jars filled with water, the welldecorated throne and a chariot  spread well with  bright tigerskin (were kept ready).

content: गङ्गायमुनयोःपुण्यात्सङ्गमादाहृतं जलम्।।2.15.5।।याश्चान्या स्सरितः पुण्या ह्रदाः कूपा स्सरांसि च।प्राग्वाहाश्चोर्ध्ववाहाश्च तिर्यग्वाहा स्समाहिताः।।2.15.6।।ताभ्यश्चैवाहृतं तोयं समुद्रेभ्यश्च सर्वशः।
explanation: Water had been fetched from the sacred confluence of Ganga and Yamuna, from other  holy streams, wells, ponds and lakes, from rivers flowing eastward, westward, and  zigzag, from rivers from all directions joined together. And from all the seas.

content: सलाजाः क्षीरिभिश्छन्ना घटाः काञ्चनराजताः।।2.15.7।।पद्मोत्पलयुता भान्ति पूर्णाः परमवारिणा।
explanation: Gold and silver vessels filled with holy water and puffed corn, adorned with lotuses, water lilies and leaves from trees rich in sap shone.

content: क्षौद्रं दधि घृतं लाजा दर्भा स्सुमनसः पयः।।2.15.8।।वेश्याश्चैव शुभाचारा स्सर्वाभरणभूषिताः।
explanation: Honey, curd, ghee, puffed grain, darbha grass, flowers and milk were arranged. Wellmannered courtesans adorned with all kinds of ornaments (stood in position).

content: चन्द्रांशुविकचप्रख्यं काञ्चनं रत्नभूषितम्।।2.15.9।।सज्जं तिष्ठति रामस्य वालव्यजनमुत्तमम्।
explanation: An excellent fan of yak's tail with a staff of gold  studded with gems looking like diffused moonbeams was kept ready.

content: चन्द्रमण्डलसङ्काशमातपत्रं च पाण्डुरम्।।2.15.10।।सज्जं द्युतिकरं श्रीमदभिषेकपुरस्कृतम्।
explanation: A lustrous pale white umbrella resembling the Moon's orb or the pole star was kept in front of the coronation pavilion.

content: पाण्डुरश्च वृषस्सज्जः पाण्डुरोऽश्वश्च सुस्थितः।।2.15.11।।प्रसृतश्च गजःश्रीमानौपवाह्यः प्रतीक्षते।
explanation: A bull and a horse both pale white and a majestic elephant in rut worthy of royal ride stood waiting.

content: अष्टौ च कन्या माङ्गल्या स्सर्वाभरणभूषिताः।।2.15.12।।वादित्राणि च सर्वाणि वन्दिनश्च तथाऽपरे।
explanation: Eight auspicious maidens adorned with all types of ornaments, all sorts of musical instruments, panegyrists and others (were in waiting).

content: इक्ष्वाकूणां यथा राज्ये संभ्रियेताभिषेचनम्।।2.15.13।।तथाजातीयमादाय राजपुत्राभिषेचनम्।ते राजवचनात्तत्र समवेतामहीपतिम्।।2.15.14।।अपश्यन्तोऽब्रुवन् को नु राज्ञो नः प्रतिवेदयेत्।न पश्यामश्च राजानमुदितश्च दिवाकरः।।2.15.15।।यौवराज्याभिषेकश्च सज्जो रामस्य धीमतः।
explanation: Just as articles necessary for the consecration of the descendants of the Ikshvakus, are customarily arranged in the kingdom, in the same way things were arranged for the coronation of the prince belonging to that race. All those who had assembled there in response to the order of the king could not see him and so they said to themselves 'Who will inform the king of our arrival. Everything is kept ready for consecration of the sagacious Rama as prince regent. The Sun has risen. But we do not find the king'.

content: इति तेषु ब्रुवाणेषु सार्वभौमान् महीपतीन्।।2.15.16।।अब्रवीत्तानिदं सर्वान्सुमन्त्रो राजसत्कृतः।
explanation: While the sovereign monarchs who hailed from different parts of the earth were thus talking Sumantra the king's confidant said:

content: रामं राज्ञो नियोगेन त्वरया प्रस्थितोऽस्म्यहम्।।2.15.17।।पूज्या राज्ञो भवन्तस्तु रामस्य च विशेषतः।
explanation: In obedience to the king's command I am hurrying for Rama. All of you are honourable to king Dasaratha, especially to Rama.

content: अयं पृच्छामि वचनात्सुखमायुष्मतामहम्।।2.15.18।।राज्ञः संप्रति बुद्धस्य यच्चागमनकारणम्।
explanation: On your behalf I shall enquire from the king who is awake now about his welfare and the reason for calling me here.

content: इत्युक्त्वाऽन्तः पुरद्वारमाजगाम पुराणवित्।।2.15.19।।सदाऽसक्तं च तद्वेश्म सुमन्त्रः प्रविवेश ह।
explanation: Having said so, Sumantra who was versed in history and tradition  approached the inner apartment which always remains closed.

content: तुष्टावास्य तदा वंशं प्रविश्य स विशांपतेः।।2.15.20।।शयनीयं नरेन्द्रस्य तदाऽऽसाद्य व्यतिष्ठत।
explanation: Entering the king's inner apartment, he began extoling the virtues of the royal dynasty, and stood there as he approached the king's bedchamber.

content: सोऽत्यासाद्य तु तद्वेश्म तिरस्करणिमन्तरा।।2.15.21।।आशीर्भिर्गुणयुक्ताभि रभितुष्टाव राघवम्।
explanation: Having approached the king's bedchamber Sumatra stood behind the screen, singing his glory and seeking the blessings (of God) on this son of Raghus dynasty.

content: सोमसूर्यौ च काकुत्स्थ शिववैश्रवणावपि।।2.15.22।।वरुणश्चाग्निरिन्द्रश्च विजयं प्रदिशन्तु ते।
explanation: O scion of the kakutsthas (Dasaratha), may Moon and Sun, Siva and Kubera, Varuna, Agni and Indra grant you victory

content: गता भगवती रात्रिरहः शिवमुपस्थितम्।।2.15.23।।बुद्ध्यस्व नृपशार्दूल कुरु कार्यमनन्तरम्।
explanation: The holy night has passed and the auspicious day has arrived. O tiger among kings,  awaken and attend to your duties.

content: ब्राह्मणा बलमुख्याश्च नैगमाश्चागता नृप।।2.15.24।।दर्शनं तेऽभिकांक्षन्ते प्रतिबुध्यस्व राघव।
explanation: O scion of the Raghu dynasty brahmins, army commanders and merchants have arrived and they beseech your audience. Please awake.

content: स्तुवन्तं तं तदा सूतं सुमन्त्रं मन्त्रकोविदम्।।2.15.25।।प्रतिबुध्य ततो राजा इदं वचनमब्रवीत्।
explanation: Dasaratha waking up saw the charioteer and expert counsellor Sumantra extoling him, and said:

content: राममानय सूतेति यदस्यभिहितोऽनया।।2.15.26।।किमिदं कारणं येन ममाज्ञा प्रतिहन्यते।
explanation: You had been asked by her (Kaikeyi) to bring Rama here. What is the reason the command is disregarded?

content: न चैव संप्रसुप्तोऽहमानयेहाशु राघवम्।।2.15.27।।इति राजा दशरथ स्सूतं तत्रान्वशात्पुनः।
explanation: I did not sleep (last night). Bring Rama here at once, said king Dasaratha to the charioteer again.

content: स राजवचनं श्रुत्वा शिरसा प्रतिपूज्य तम्।।2.15.28।।निर्जगाम नृपावासान्मन्यमानः प्रियं महत्।
explanation: At these words of the king, he offered his salutations by bowing his head and left the king's apartment, reflecting on the great happy event.

content: प्रसन्नो राजमार्गं च पताकाध्वजशोभितम्।।2.15.29।।हृष्टः प्रमुदित स्सूतो जगामाशु विलोकयन्।
explanation: The charioteer left cheerfully, happily looking at the highway bedecked with pennants and banners.

content: स सूतस्तत्र शुश्राव रामाधिकरणाः कथाः।।2.15.30।।अभिषेचनसंयुक्तास्सर्वलोकस्य हृष्टवत्।
explanation: The charioteer heard the conversation relating to Rama and his consecration among the happy citizens.

content: ततो ददर्श रुचिरं कैलासशिखरप्रभम्।।2.15.31।।रामवेश्म सुमन्त्रस्तु शक्रवेश्मसमप्रभम्।
explanation: Thereafter, Sumantra beheld the beautiful palace of Rama,  resembling  the abode of Indra or the peak of Kailasa in its splendour.

content: महाकवाटविहितं वितर्दिशतशोभितम्।।2.15.32।।काञ्चनप्रतिमैकाग्रं मणिविद्रुमतोरणम्।				शारदाभ्रघनप्रख्यं दीप्तं मेरुगुहोपमम्।।2.15.33।।मणिभिर्वरमाल्यानां समुहद्भिरलंकृतम्।मुक्तामणिभिराकीर्णं चन्दनागरूधूपितम्।।2.15.34।।गन्धान्मनोज्ञान् विसृजद्दार्दुरं शिखरं यथा।सारसैश्च मयूरैश्च विनदद्भिर्विराजितम्।।2.15.35।।सुकृतेहामृगाकीर्णं सुकीर्णं भक्तिभिस्तथा।मनश्चक्षुश्च भूतानामाददत्तिग्मतेजसा।।2.15.36।।चन्द्रभास्करसङ्काशं कुबेरभवनोपमम्।महेन्द्रधामप्रतिमं नानापक्षिसमाकुलम्।।2.15.37।।मेरुशृङ्गसमं सूतो रामवेश्म ददर्श ह।उपस्थितैःसमाकीर्णं जनैरञ्जलिकारिभिः।।2.15.38।।उपादाय समाक्रान्तैस्तथा जानपदैर्जनैः।रामाभिषेकसुमुखैरुन्मुखैस्समलंकृतम्।।2.15.39।।महामेघसमप्रख्यमुदग्रं सुविभूषितम्।नानारत्नसमाकीर्णं कुब्जकैरातकावृतम्।।2.15.40।।
explanation: The charioteer (Sumantra) beheld Rama's palace closed with two heavypanelled doors. Adorned with hundreds of galleries, it had a peak mounted with golden idols. The arches were studded with different gems and corals. Bright like dense autumnal cloud, it shone like the cave of mount Meru. It was ornamented with excellent garlands and precious diamonds. Pearls were strewn around. Decorated with sandal and aloe wood, it emitted, like the peak of mount Dardura, captivating fragrance৷৷ Sarasas and peacocks were singing sweetly. The palace was full of skilfully carved images of deer and other embellishments. It attracted the minds and the eyes of all living beings with brilliant splendour. Resplendent like the Sun and the Moon, it looked like the abode of Kubera and a reflected image of the abode of Mahendra. It was crowded with birds of various kinds. In height it was equal to the peak of mount Meru. Villagers thronged the palace with gifts, eagerly waiting with folded hands to see the spectacle of Rama's coronation. Lofty, it looked like a vast cloud. Welldecked and filled with various gems, it was crowded with hunchbacks and kiratas (hunters) too.

content: स वाजियुक्तेन रथेन सारथिःनराकुलं राजकुलं विराजयन्।वरूथिना रामगृहाभिपातिना   पुरस्य सर्वस्य मनांसि हर्षयन्।।2.15.41।।
explanation: Mounted on a chariot, attached with a fender and driven by horses, the charioteer advanced towards the royal palace of Rama delighting the minds of the people of the city.

content: ततस्समासाद्य महाधनं महत्प्रहृष्टरोमा स बभूब सारथिः।  मृर्गैर्मयूरैश्च समाकुलोल्बणं                  गृहं वरार्हस्य शचीपतेरिव।।2.15.42।।
explanation: Having reached the palace abounding in deer and peacocks which resembled the magnificent and opulent abode of Indra, the charioteer was thrilled at the allpervading beauty of the place befitting Rama.

content: स तत्र कैलासनिभास्स्वलंकृताःप्रविश्य कक्ष्यास्त्रिदशालयोपमाः।प्रियान्वरान् राममते स्थितान् बहून्व्यपोह्य शुद्धान्तमुपस्थितो रथी।।2.15.43।।
explanation: Having entered the welldecorated palace which was (lofty) like Kailasa, he crossed the courtyards comparable to the abode of the celestials, passed through the many bosom friends of Rama and entered the private apartment.

content: स तत्र शुश्राव च हर्षयुक्ताःरामाभिषेकार्थकृता जनानाम्।नरेन्द्रसूनोरभिमङ्गलार्थाःसर्वस्य लोकस्य गिरः प्रहृष्टः।।2.15.44।।
explanation: There he heard the happy words spoken by people about the enthronement of prince Rama and his future wellbeing.

content: महेन्द्रसद्मप्रतिमं तु वेश्मरामस्य रम्यं मृगपक्षि जुष्टम्।ददर्श मेरोरिव श्रुङ्गमुच्चंविभ्राजमानं प्रभया सुमन्त्रः।।2.15.45।।
explanation: Sumantra beheld Rama's palace which resembled the high summit of mount Meru shining with splendour. Filled with animals and birds, if looked like the abode of Indra.

content: उपस्थितैरञ्जलिकारकैश्चसोपायनैर्जानपदैर्जनैश्च।कोट्या परार्धैश्च विमुक्तयानैःसमाकुलं द्वारपथं ददर्श।।2.15.46।।
explanation: He saw villagers and others in crores and parardhas, leaving their chariots and thronging the gateway, (some) paying obeisance with folded palms and (some) carrying gifts in their hands.

content: ततो महामेघमहीधराभं प्रभिन्नमत्यङ्कुशमत्यसह्यम्।रामौपवाह्यं रुचिरं ददर्शशत्रुञ्जयं नागमुदग्रकायम्।।2.15.47।।
explanation: He beheld a beautiful elephant named Satrunjaya with a huge body on which Rama was to mount. It looked like a vast mountain or a huge cloud. With ichor flowing from his temples and without caring for the goad, the elephant was intolerant.

content: स्वलङ्कृतान् साश्वरथान् सकुञ्जरानमात्य मुख्यांश्च ददर्श वल्लभान्।व्यपोह्य सूतस्सहितान् समन्ततःसमृद्धमन्तःपुरमाविवेश ह।।2.15.48।।
explanation: Important ministers who were dear to the king and welladorned arrived there on their  horses, chariots and elephants. Sumantra finding his way through the crowd of the people who assembled on all sides, entered the glorious private apartment of Rama.

content: तदन्द्रिकूटाचलमेघसन्निभं महाविमानोपमवेश्मसंयुतम्।अवार्यमाणः प्रविवेश सारथिःप्रभूतरत्नं मकरो यथार्णवम्।।2.15.49।।
explanation: The palace looked like a mountain peak covered by a cloud and a great vimana surrounded by splendid apartments. The charioteer entered the palace unobstructed like a crocodile entering the ocean bristling with many gems.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे पञ्चदशःसर्गः।।Thus ends the fifteenth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the  holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Sumantra reaches Rama's palace and conveys to him  Dasaratha's messageRama accompanied by Lakshmana proceeds to his father's palace-- comments of men and women on his way to the king.]तदन्तःपुरद्वारं समतीत्य जनाकुलम्।प्रविविक्तां ततः कक्ष्यामाससाद पुराणवित्।।2.16.1।।प्रासकार्मुकबिभ्रद्भिर्युवभिर्मृष्टकुण्डलैः।अप्रमादिभिरेकाग्रै स्स्वनुरक्तैरधिष्ठिताम्।।2.16.2।।
explanation: Sumantra, who was conversant with ancient traditions, passed through the entrance of the inner apartment full of people and reached the sparsely crowded courtyard. There alert, loyal young men were attentively guarding the frontyard, armed with spears and bows and wearing shining earrings.

content: तदन्तःपुरद्वारं समतीत्य जनाकुलम्।प्रविविक्तां ततः कक्ष्यामाससाद पुराणवित्।।2.16.1।।प्रासकार्मुकबिभ्रद्भिर्युवभिर्मृष्टकुण्डलैः।अप्रमादिभिरेकाग्रै स्स्वनुरक्तैरधिष्ठिताम्।।2.16.2।।
explanation: Sumantra, who was conversant with ancient traditions, passed through the entrance of the inner apartment full of people and reached the sparsely crowded courtyard. There alert, loyal young men were attentively guarding the frontyard, armed with spears and bows and wearing shining earrings.

content: तत्र काषायिणो वृद्धान् वेत्रपाणीन् स्वलङ्कृतान्।ददर्श विष्ठितान् द्वारि स्त्र्यध्यक्षान्सुसमाहितान्।।2.16.3।।
explanation: He saw aged people appointed as security staff for women's apartments. They were welladorned, dressed in orange robes and with rapt attention stood holding staff in their hands.

content: ते समीक्ष्य समायान्तं रामप्रियचिकीर्षवः।सहसोत्पतितास्सर्वे स्वासनेभ्यस्ससम्भ्रमाः।।2.16.4।।
explanation: On seeing (Sumantra) arriving, all of them, wellwishers to Rama, quickly rose from their seats.

content: तानुवाच विनीतात्मा सूतपुत्रः प्रदक्षिणः। क्षिप्रमाख्यात रामाय सुमंन्त्रो द्वारि तिष्ठति।।2.16.5।।
explanation: .Humble and extremely courteous charioteer (to the guards) said, Inform Rama at once that Sumantra is waiting at the entrance.

content: ते राममुपसङ्गम्य भर्तुः प्रियचिकीर्षवः। सहभार्याय रामाय क्षिप्रमेवाभिचक्षिरे।।2.16.6।।
explanation: Always dedicated to the wellbeing of their master, they approached Rama who was in the company of Sita. And informed him:

content: प्रतिवेदितमाज्ञाय सूतमभ्यन्तरं पितुः।तत्रैवानाययामास राघवप्रियकाम्यया।।2.16.7।।
explanation: Coming to know that Sumantra who is intimate to his father had arrived, Rama, in order to please him, commanded that he be escorted to that very place.

content: तं वैश्रवणसङ्काशमुपविष्टं स्वलङ्कृतम्।ददर्श सूतः पर्य्यङ्के सौवर्णे सोत्तरच्छदे।।2.16.8।।वराहरुधिराभेण शुचिना च सुगन्धिना।अनुलिप्तं परार्ध्येन चन्दनेन परन्तपम्।।2.16.9।।स्थितया पार्श्वतश्चापि वालव्यजनहस्तया।उपेतं सीतयाभूयश्चित्रया शशिनं यथा।।2.16.10।।
explanation: Sumantra beheld Rama, who resembled Kubera. Rama was sitting on a richlycovered golden couch, welladorned and anointed with precious, pure, fragrant red sandalpaste the colour of which appeared like the blood of a hog. With Sita standing by his side with a fan of yak's tail in her hand Rama, the tormentor of foes, looked like the Moon united with (the star) Chitra.

content: तं तपन्तमिवादित्यमुपपन्नं स्वतेजसा।ववन्दे वरदं वन्दी विनयज्ञो विनीतवत्।।2.16.11।।
explanation: Sumantra who knew the art of modesty, made humble, reverential salutation to Rama  the granter of boons, shining like the Sun with his own effulgence.

content: प्राञ्जलिस्सुमुखं दृष्ट्वा विहारशयनासने।राजपुत्रमुवाचेदं सुमन्त्रो राजसत्कृतः।।2.16.12।।
explanation: On seeing Rama of charming countenance relaxing on a couch, Sumantra, honourable to the king (Dasaratha) said these words with folded palms.

content: कौशल्यासुप्रजा राम पिता त्वां द्रष्टुमिच्छति।महिष्या सह कैकेय्या गम्यतां तत्र मा चिरम्।।2.16.13।।
explanation: O Rama, worthy son of Kausalya, your father along with queen Kaikeyi desires to see you.You may go there. Please do not delay.

content: एवमुक्तस्तु संहृष्टो नरसिंहो महाद्युतिः।ततस्सम्मानयामास सीतामिदमुवाच ह।।2.16.14।।
explanation: Highly lustrous Rama ,the lion among men, when thus spoken to, was immensely pleased and extending due honour to him said to Sita:

content: देवि देवश्च देवी च समागम्य मदन्तरे।मन्त्रयेते धृवं किञ्चिदभिषेचनसंहितम्।।2.16.15।।
explanation: O Sita, I am sure the king and queen are discussing something relating to my consecration.

content: लक्षयित्वा ह्यभिप्रायं प्रियकामा सुदक्षिणा।सञ्चोदयति राजानं मदर्थमसितेक्षणा।।2.16.16।।
explanation: Darkeyed and highly favoured wellwisher of the king (Kaikeyi) is urging him for my sake in view of his intention.

content: सा प्रहृष्टा महाराजं हितकामानुवर्तिनी।जननी चार्थकामा मे केकयाधिपतेस्सुता।।2.16.17।।
explanation: My mother, daughter of the king of Kekaya, knows the king's intention and, heppy to do me good, seeks my wellbeing.

content: दिष्ट्या खलु महाराजो महिष्या प्रियया सह।सुमन्त्रं प्राहिणोद्दूतमर्थकामकरं मम।।2.16.18।।
explanation: It is our fortune that the king and his dear queen have sent Sumantra as messenger who is interested in my prosperity and pleasure.

content: यादृशी परिषत्तत्र तादृशो दूत आगतः।ध्रुवमद्यैव मां राजा यौवराज्येऽभिषेक्ष्यति।।2.16.19।।
explanation: There worthy of the council of the king and the queen, a befitting messenger has come. Assuredly the king will consecrate me as heirapparent this very day.

content: हन्त शीघ्रमितो गत्वा द्रक्ष्यामि च महीपतिम्।सह त्वं परिवारेण सुखमास्व रमस्व च।।2.16.20।।
explanation: I shall go from here immediately and see the king. Remain here happily and rejoice with your maids.

content: पतिसम्मानिता सीता भर्तारमसितेक्षणा।आद्वारमनुवव्राज मङ्गलान्यभिदध्युषी।।2.16.21।।
explanation: Reflecting over the auspicious event, the darkeyed Sita who is highly esteemed by her husband, followed him up to the entrance, (saying):

content: राज्यं द्विजातिभिर्जुष्टं राजसूयाभिषेचनम्।कर्तुमर्हति ते राजा वासवस्येव लोककृत्।।2.16.22।।
explanation: The king will bestow upon you, like the creator of the world (Brahma) bestowing on Indra, the kingdom served by brahmins who are fit to perform 'Rajasuya' sacrifice at the time of consecration.

content: दीक्षितं व्रतसम्पन्नं वराजिनधरं शुचिम्।कुरङ्गशृङ्गपाणिं च पश्यन्ती त्वां भजाम्यहम्।।2.16.23।।
explanation: I shall be delighted to see you initiated and engaged in the observance of the vow made pure, wearing excellent deerskin and carrying the horns of an antelope in your hand.

content: पूर्वां दिशं वज्रधरो दक्षिणां पातु ते यमः।वरुणः पश्चिमामाशां धनेशस्तूत्तरां दिशम्।।2.16.24।।
explanation: May Indra protect you on the east, Yama in the south, Varuna in the west and Kubera in the north.

content: अथ सीतामनुज्ञाप्य कृतकौतुकमङ्गलः।निश्चक्राम सुमन्त्रेण सह रामो निवेशनात्।।2.16.25।।
explanation: Adorned in auspicious ornaments, Rama took leave of Sita and departed from his palace accompanied by Sumantra.

content: पर्वतादिव निष्क्रम्य सिंहो गिरिगुहाशयः।लक्ष्मणं द्वारिसोऽपश्यत्प्रह्वाञ्जलिपुटं स्थितम्।।2.16.26।।
explanation: Like a lion living in a mountain cave and coming out of it, Rama while exiting, saw Lakshmana at the entrance bowing with folded hands.

content: अथ मध्यमकक्ष्यायां समागच्छत्सुहृज्जनैः।स सर्वानर्थिनो दृष्ट्वा समेत्य प्रतिनन्द्य च।।2.16.27।।ततः पावकसङ्काशमारुरोह रथोत्तमम्।वैयाघ्रं पुरुषव्याघ्रो राजतं राजनन्दनः।।2.16.28।।
explanation: Rama, the best among men, met all his friends in the middle courtyard. Having seen them all eager to see him, he approached and greeted them. Thereafter, he mounted the best silver chariot covered with tigerskin and glowing like fire.

content: मेघनादमसम्बाधं मणिहेमविभूषितम्।मुष्णन्तमिव चक्षूंषि प्रभया सूर्यवर्चसम्।।2.16.29।।करेणुशिशुकल्पैश्च युक्तं परमवाजिभिः।हरियुक्तं सहस्राक्षो रथमिन्द्र इवाशुगम्।।2.16.30।।प्रययौ तूर्णमास्थाय राघवो ज्वलितश्श्रिया।
explanation: The sound emanating from the chariot resembled the thunder. The spacious chariot was decorated with gold and gems which dazzled the eyes as though they shed the lustre of the Sun. The swiftmoving chariot was harnessed by excellent horses as if they were young elephants. Like the thousandeyed Indra, Rama, ablaze with royal splendour, mounted this chariot and sped away.

content: स पर्जन्य इवाकाशे स्वनवानभिनादयन्।।2.16.31।।निकेतान्निर्ययौ श्रीमान्महाभ्रादिव चन्द्रमाः।
explanation: The magnificent chariot, rumbling like a stormcloud in the sky, emerged from (Rama's) residence like the Moon peeping through a huge cloud.

content: छत्रचामरपाणिस्तु लक्ष्मणो राघवानुजः।।2.16.32।।जुगोप भ्रातरं भ्राता रथमास्थाय पृष्ठतः।
explanation: Holding an umbrella and a fan made of yak's tail in his hand Lakshmana boarded the chariot at the rear, guarding his brother.

content: ततो हलहलाशब्दस्तुमुलस्समजायत।।2.16.33।।तस्य निष्क्रममाणस्य जनौघस्य समन्ततः।
explanation: As it (the chariot) was passing out, a tumultuoas roar emanated from the multitude of people all around.

content: ततो हयवरा मुख्या नागाश्च गिरिसन्निभाः।।2.16.34।।अनुजग्मुस्तदा रामं शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः।
explanation: Then the chief commanders riding the best of the horses and elephants, resembling hills in size, followed Rama in their hundreds and thousands.

content: अग्रतश्चास्य सन्नद्धाश्चन्दनागरुभूषिताः।।2.16.35।।खड्गचापधराश्शूरा जग्मुराशंसवो जनाः।
explanation: Soldiers, anointing their bodies with pastes of sandal and aloe wood, equipped with armour and holding swords and bows, went ahead heralding his (Rama's) arrival.

content: ततो वादित्रशब्दाश्च स्तुतिशब्दाश्च वन्दिनाम्।।2.16.36।।सिंहनादाश्च शूराणां तदा शुश्रुविरे पथि।
explanation: At that time, sounds of musical instruments and songs of eulogy by panegyrists, roarings of warriors were heard on the way.

content: हर्म्यवातायनस्थाभिर्भूषिताभिस्समन्ततः।।2.16.37।।कीर्यमाण स्सुपुष्पौघैर्ययौ स्त्रीभिररिन्दमः।
explanation: Rama, the subduer of enemies, proceeded while the wellattired women standing at the windows of their mansions showered heaps of flowers on him from every side.

content: रामं सर्वानवद्याङ्ग्यो रामपिप्रीषया ततः।।2.16.38।।वचोभिरग्य्रैर्हर्म्यस्था क्षितिस्थाश्च ववन्दिरे।
explanation: Women with faultless limbs standing on their housetops as well as on the ground paid their homage with charming words in order to propitiate Rama.

content: नूनं नन्दति ते माता कौशल्यामातृनन्दन।।2.16.39।।पश्यन्ती सिद्धयात्रं त्वां पित्र्यं राज्यमवस्थितम्।
explanation: O Joy of your mother (Rama) on seeing you having successfully acomplished the purpose of your journey (life) by securing your father's kingdom, your mother Kausalya will surely be delighted.

content: सर्वसीमन्तिनीभ्यश्च सीतां सीमन्तिनी वराम्।।2.16.40।।अमन्यन्त हि ता नार्यो रामस्य हृदयप्रियाम्।
explanation: Those women considered Sita who was dear to the heart of Rama the best among all women.

content: तया सुचरितं देव्या पुरा नूनं महत्तपः।।2.16.41।।रोहिणीव शशाङ्केन रामसंयोगमाप या।
explanation: Sita was united with Rama like Rohini with the Moon surely because of her great austerities performed in the past. (They observed).

content: इति प्रासादशृङ्गेषु प्रमदाभिर्नरोत्तमः।।2.16.42।।शुश्राव राजमार्गस्थः प्रिया वाच उदाहृताः।आत्मसंपूजनै शृण्वन् ययौ रामौ महापथम्।।2.16.43।।
explanation: Rama, the best among men, while riding along the highway overheard the pleasing words uttered by women standing on the elevation of their buildings. Thus hearing his own praise Rama proceeded along the highway.

content: स राघवस्तत्र कथाप्रपञ्चान् शुश्राव लोकस्य समागतस्य।आत्माधिकारा विविधाश्च वाचःप्रहृष्टरूपस्य पुरो जनस्य।।2.16.44।।
explanation: Rama heard these various words of admiration by people who had assembled there, and (witnessed) the rejoicings of the citizens.

content: एष श्रियं गच्छति राघवोऽद्य राजप्रसादाद्विपुलां गमिष्यन्।एते वयं सर्व समृद्धकामायेषामयं नो भविता प्रशास्ता।।2.16.45।।
explanation: This scion of the Raghus (Rama) is going to acquire the earth and the wealth today by the king's grace. He will be our protector and fulfil all our desires.

content: लाभो जनस्यास्य यदेष सर्वं प्रपत्स्यते राष्ट्रमिदं चिराय।न ह्यप्रियं किञ्चन जातु कश्चित्पश्येन्न दुःखं मनुजाधिपेऽस्मिन्।।2.16.46।।
explanation: If this Rama obtains the entire kingdom for a long time, it will be in the interest of the people. If he becomes king none will ever witness anything unpleasant or sad. (They observed).

content: स घोषवद्भिश्च मतङ्गाजैर्ययैःपुरस्सरै स्स्वस्तिकसूतमागधैः।महीयमानः प्रवरैश्च वादकै रभिष्टुतो वैश्रवणो यथा ययौ।।2.16.47।।
explanation: With bards, panegyrists and great musical performers invoking blessings and walking ahead, he (Rama) proceeded, like Kubera amid intoxicated elephants  and horses.

content: करेणुमातंङ्गरथाश्वसंकुलं महाजनौघ परिपूर्णचत्वरम्।प्रभूतरत्नं बहुपण्यसञ्चयं ददर्श रामो रुचिरं महापथम्।।2.16.48।।
explanation: Rama beheld the beautiful highway filled with precious stones and merchandise (for sale), thronged with elephants, horses and chariots, the crossroads crowded with multitude of people.  इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे षोडशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixteenth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama watches the splendour of the highway, listens to the words of his friends -- and enters his father's  palace.]स रामो रथमास्थाय सम्प्रहृष्टसुहृज्जनः।पताकाध्वजसम्पन्नं महार्हागरुधूपितम्।।2.17.1।।अपश्यन्नगरं श्रीमान्नानाजनसमाकुलम्।
explanation: Surrounded by friends overwhelmed with great joy, that glorious Rama aboard the chariot beheld the city decorated with banners and pennants and made fragrant with expensive incense and agaru and crowded with multitudes of people.

content: स गृहैरभ्रसङ्काशैः पाण्डुरैरुपशोभितम्।।2.17.2।।राजमार्गं ययौ रामो मध्येनागरुधूपितम्।
explanation: That Rama, proceeded down the middle of the highway made fragrant with agaru and incense, lined with houses gleaming pale white like clouds.

content: चन्दनानां च मुख्यानामगरूणां च सञ्चयैः।।2.17.3।।उत्तमानां च गन्धानां क्षौमकोशाम्बरस्य च। अविद्धाभिश्च मुक्ताभिरुत्तमैस्स्फाटिकैरपि।।2.17.4।।शोभमानमसंबाधैस्तं राजपथमुत्तमम्। संवृतं विविधैःपुष्पैर्भक्ष्यैरुच्चावचैरपि।।2.17.5।।
explanation: The highway (Rama entered) was splendid and spacious with heaps of sandal and agaru of the highest quality, excellent fragrant substances and bundles of white silken cloth. It gleamed with unholed (pristine) pearls, articles made of crystals, flowers of every kind and articles of food of every variety.

content: ददर्श तं राजपथं दिवि देवपथं यथा। दध्यक्षतहविर्लाजैर्धूपैरगरुचन्दनैः।।2.17.6।।नानामाल्योपगंधैश्च सदाऽभ्यर्चितचत्वरम्।
explanation: Rama beheld the highway resembling the pathway of gods in heaven. Here the crossroads were always worshipped with curd, grains of rice, sacrificial libations, laja or puffed rice, fragrant substances like sandal wood, agaru and garlands of every kind.

content: अशीर्वादान्बहून् शृण्वन्सुहृद्भिस्समुदीरितान्।।2.17.7।।यथार्हं चापि सम्पूज्य सर्वानेव नरान्ययौ।
explanation: Hearing many words of blessings uttered by his friends and honouring each person   according to his rank, he passed on.

content: पितामहैराचरितं तथैव प्रपितामहैः।।2.17.8।।अद्योपादाय तं मार्गमभिषिक्तोऽनुपालय।
explanation: (They said) Consecrated today, rule the kingdom by adopting the same path followed by your grandfathers and greatgrandfathers.

content: यथास्म पोषिताः पित्रा यथा सर्वैः पितामहैः।।2.17.9।।ततस्सुखतरं रामे वत्स्यामस्सति राजनि।
explanation: Once Rama assumes kingship, we shall all live in happiness greater than when we were ruled by his father and grandfather.

content: अलमद्य हि भुक्तेन परमार्थैरलं च नः।।2.17.10।।यदि पश्याम निर्यान्तं रामं राज्ये प्रतिष्ठितम्।
explanation: If only we can see Rama enthroned today and going in a procession, there will be no need for food and no greater object of life to be accomplished.

content: अतो हि नः प्रियतरं नान्यत्किञ्चिद्भविष्यति।।2.17.11।।यथाऽभिषेको रामस्य राज्येनामिततेजसः।
explanation: For us, there is nothing dearer in the kingdom than the consecration of Rama of undimmed brilliance.

content: एताश्चान्याश्च सुहृदामुदासीनः कथाश्शुभाः।।2.17.12।।आत्मसम्पूजनीश्शृण्वन्ययौ रामो महापथम्।
explanation: Indifferent to such warm words by his friends in his favour Rama passed along the highway.

content: न हि तस्मान्मनः कश्चिच्चक्षुषी वा नरोत्तमात्।।2.17.13।।नर श्शक्नोत्यपाक्रष्टुमतिक्रान्तेऽपि राघवे।
explanation: Even though Rama, the best among men had driven past them none was able to withdraw his mind or eyes from him. (They continued).

content: यश्च रामं न पश्येत्तु यं च रामो न पश्यति।।2.17.14।।निन्दित स्सर्वल्लोकेषु स्वात्माऽप्येनं विगर्हते।
explanation: 'Whoever does not see Rama or Rama does not see him, will be blamed by all men in the (three) worlds. Even his self will blame him.

content: सर्वेषु हि स धर्मात्मा वर्णानां कुरुते दयाम्।।2.17.15।।चतुर्णां हि वयः स्थानां तेन ते तमनुव्रताः।
explanation: That righteous Rama shows compassion to all, to the four castes, to the young and the old. So they were devoted to him.

content: चतुष्पथान्देवपथांश्चैत्यान्यायतनानि च।।2.17.16।।प्रदक्षिणं परिहरन् जगाम नृपते स्सुतः।
explanation: The son of the king proceeded, leaving on his right, squares (intersections of four roads), and roads leading to temples, monuments and shrines too.

content: स राजकुलमासाद्य मेघसङ्घोपमै श्शुभैः।।2.17.17।।प्रासादशृङ्गैर्विविधैःकैलास शिखरोपमैः। आवारयद्भिर्गगनं विमानैरिव पाण्डुरैः।।2.17.18।।वर्धमानगृहैश्चापि रत्नजालपरिष्कृतैः। तत्पृथिव्यां गृहवरं महेन्द्रसदनोपमम्।।2.17.19।।राजपुत्रः पितुर्वेश्म प्रविवेश श्रिया ज्वलन्।
explanation: That prince (Rama) arrived at the excellent palace of the king, which looked like the abode of Indra on earth, blazing with splendour. The various towers of the palace touching the sky resembled clusters of white clouds, like auspicious peaks of Kailasa, and like white aerial chariots decorated with gems.

content: स कक्ष्या धन्विभिर्गुप्तास्तिस्रोऽतिक्रम्य वाजिभिः।।2.17.20।।पदातिरपरे कक्ष्ये द्वे जगाम नरोत्तमः।
explanation: Rama, the best among men, crossed the first three courtyards which were protected by bowmen on horses and crossed the remaining two on foot.

content: स सर्वा स्समतिक्रम्य कक्ष्या दशरथात्मजः। सन्निवर्त्य जनं सर्वं शुद्धान्तः पुरमभ्यगात्।।2.17.21।।
explanation: Crossing the courtyards on his way Rama sent back his followers and entered the private apartment of the king.

content: तस्मिन् प्रविष्टे पितुरन्तिकं तदा जन स्स सर्वो मुदितो नृपात्मजे। प्रतीक्षते तस्य पुनः स्म निर्गमं यथोदयं चन्द्रमसस्सरित्पतिः।।2.17.22।।
explanation: When the prince approached his father all the people were delighted and  awaited his return like the ocean waiting for the rise of the Moon.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे सप्तदशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventeenth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama enquires Kaikeyi the reasons for his father's grief-- she informs him about the two boons bestowed by the king -- urges him to uphold the promise given by his father and live in the forest for fourteen years.]स ददर्शासने रामो निषण्णं पितरं शुभे।कैकेयीसहितं दीनं मुखेन परिशुष्यता।।2.18.1।।
explanation: Rama beheld his father reclined on an auspicious couch and by his side was seated Kaikeyi. He looked wretched with a pale face.

content: स पितुश्चरणौ पूर्वमभिवाद्य विनीतवत्।ततो ववन्दे चरणौ कैकेय्या स्सुसमाहितः।।2.18.2।।
explanation: With all humility and wellcomposed mind, he made reverential salutation first at his father's feet and thereafter at Kaikeyi's.

content: रामेत्युक्त्वा तु वचनं बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणः।शशाक नृपतिर्दीनो नेक्षितुं नाभिभाषितुम्।।2.18.3।।
explanation: Dasaratha uttered the word 'Rama', but thereafter could neither say any more in  distress nor look at him becuase his eyes were brimming with tears.

content: तदपूर्वं नरपतेर्दृष्ट्वा रूपं भयावहम्।रामोऽपि भयमापन्नः पदा स्पृष्ट्वेव पन्नगम्।।2.18.4।।
explanation: Never before did Rama see such frightful appearance of his father. He was seized with fear as if  he trampled a serpent.

content: इन्द्रियैरप्रहृष्टैस्तं शोकसन्तापकर्शितम्।निश्श्वसन्तं महाराजं व्यथिताकुलचेतसम्।।2.18.5।।ऊर्मिमालिनमक्षोभ्यं क्षुभ्यन्तमिव सागरम्।उपप्लुतमिवादित्यमुक्तानृतमृषिं यथा।।2.18.6।।
explanation: Maharaja (Dasaratha) with his senses dulled had become emaciated due to sorrow and suffering. With an agitated and troubled mind, he was breathing heavily. Although unshakable, he looked agitated like an ocean with successive rows of waves, like  the  Sun in eclipse, like an ascetic who has uttered falsehood.

content: अचिन्त्यकल्पं हि पितुस्तं शोकमुपधारयन्।बभूव संरब्धतर स्समुद्र इव पर्वणि।।2.18.7।।
explanation: The more Rama reflected on the incomprehensible sorrow of the king, the more he became perturbed like an ocean on the new Moon day.

content: चिन्तयामास च तदा रामः पितृहिते रतः।किं स्विदद्यैव नृपतिर्न मां प्रत्यभिनन्दति।।2.18.8।।
explanation: Devoted to his father's wellbeing, Rama reflected, Why does not father reciprocate my greeting (like on other days)?

content: अन्यदा मां पिता दृष्ट्वा कुपितोऽपि प्रसीदति।तस्य मामद्य संप्रेक्ष्य किमायासः प्रवर्तते।।2.18.9।।
explanation: On other occasions even though angry he would feel pleased. But today  why does he feel sad even after seeing me?

content: स दीन इव शोकार्तो विषण्णवदनद्युतिः।कैकेयीमभिवाद्यैव रामो वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.18.10।।
explanation: With a sorrowful countenance Rama made salutation to Kaikeyi and said like a wretch tormented with grief:

content: कच्चिन्मया नापराद्धमज्ञानाद्येन मे पिता।कुपितस्तन्ममाचक्ष्व त्वं चैवैनं प्रसादय।।2.18.11।।
explanation: Have I committed any offence unknowingly? Please tell me why my father is angry with me. You alone can pacify him.

content: अप्रसन्नमनाः किन्नु सदा मां प्रति वत्सलः।विवर्णवदनो दीनो न हि मामभिभाषते।।2.18.12।।
explanation: Father has always been affectionate to me but today why is he in a dejected mood?  Why does his countenance look pale and wretched? Why does he not speak to me?

content: शरीरो मानसो वापि कच्चिदेनं न बाधते।सन्तापोवाऽभितापो वा दुर्लभं हि सदा सुखम्।।2.18.13।।
explanation: Is he suffering from any physical ailment or mental agony? It is affliction of either the body or the mind. (For) perpetual happiness is indeed rare.

content: कच्चिन्न किञ्चिद्भरते कुमारे प्रियदर्शने।शत्रुघ्ने वा महासत्त्वे मात्रूणां वा ममाशुभम्।।2.18.14।।
explanation: Has any misfortune befallen the handsome Bharata or the mighty Satrughna or any of my mothers?

content: अतोषयन्महाराजमकुर्वन्वा पितुर्वचः।मुहूर्तमपि नेच्छेयं जीवितुं कुपिते नृपे।।2.18.15।।
explanation: If I have (ever) displeased the maharaja, my father or disobeyed his command which has angered him, I do not wish to live for a moment৷৷

content: यतोमूलं नरः पश्येत्प्रादुर्भावमिहात्मनः।कथं तस्मिन्नवर्तेत प्रत्यक्षे सति दैवते।।2.18.16।।
explanation: How can a man who owes his origin (birth) in this world to him (father) who still exists as a visible god not conduct himself (as per his wish)?

content: कच्चित्ते परुषं किञ्चिदभिमानात्पतिता मम।उक्तो भवत्या कोपेन यत्रास्य लुलितं मनः।।2.18.17।।
explanation: Have you said anything harsh to my father out of anger or (injured) selfrespect for which his mind has been shaken?

content: एतदाचक्ष्व मे देवि तत्त्वेन परिपृच्छतः।किं निमित्तमपूर्वोयं विकारो मनुजाधिपे।।2.18.18।।
explanation: O Devi I am repeatedly asking you the cause of this unprecedented change in the king please tell me the truth.

content: एवमुक्ता तु कैकेयी राघवेण महात्मना।उवाचेदं सुनिर्लज्जा धृष्टमात्महितं वचः।।2.18.19।।
explanation: When Kaikeyi was thus asked by the magnanimous scion of the Raghus (Rama) she uttered unashamed these impudent words in her own interest.

content: न राजा कुपितो राम व्यसनं नास्य किञ्चन। किञ्चिन्मनोगतंत्वस्य त्वद्भयान्नाभिभाषते।।2.18.20।।
explanation: O Rama, the king is neither angry, nor has any misforturne befallen him. But out of fear for you he is not able to speak out what he has in mind.

content: प्रियं त्वामप्रियं वक्तुं वाणी नास्योपवर्तते।तदवश्यं त्वया कार्यं यदनेनाश्रुतं मम।।2.18.21।।
explanation: The goddess of speech does not permit him to say an unpleasant thing to you for you are his beloved son. So you must fulfil the promise he has made to me.

content: एष मह्यं वरं दत्त्वा पुरा मामभिपूज्य च।स पश्चात्तप्यते राजा यथाऽन्यः प्राकृतस्तथा।।2.18.22।।
explanation: In the past the king had honoured me with (two) boons. Now like any other common man he is repenting (for the same).

content: अतिसृज्य ददानीति वरं मम विशांपतिः।स निरर्थं गतजले सेतुं बन्धितुमिच्छति।।2.18.23।।
explanation: The king bestowed on me boons saying, 'I shall grant you two boons'. But now he wishes in vain to build a dam when the water has run down.

content: धर्ममूलमिदं राम विदितं च सतामपि।तत्सत्यं न त्यजेद्राजा कुपितस्त्वत्कृते यथा।।2.18.24।।
explanation: O Rama, this (truth) is the basis of righteousness. The virtuous also know this. The king being angry (with me), should not abandon the truth for your sake.

content: यदि तद्वक्ष्यते राजा शुभं वा यदि वाऽशुभम्।करिष्यसि ततस्सर्वमाख्यास्यामि पुनस्त्वहम्।।2.18.25।।
explanation: If you fulfil whatever the king says, pleasant or unpleasant, I shall relate to you everything.

content: यदि त्वभिहितं राज्ञा त्वयि तन्न विपत्स्यते।ततोऽहमभिधास्यामि न ह्येष त्वयि वक्ष्यति।।2.18.26।।
explanation: If you do not transgress the word given by the king I shall tell you everything. The king on his own will not tell you.

content: एतत्तु वचनं श्रुत्वा कैकेय्या समुदाहृतम्।उवाच व्यथितो रामस्तां देवीं नृपसन्निधौ।।2.18.27।।
explanation: Very much depressed on hearing the words of Kaikeyi, Rama thus said to her in the presence of the king:

content: अहो धिङ्नार्हसे देवि वक्तुं मामीदृशं वचः।अहं हि वचनाद्राज्ञः पतेयमपि पावके।।2.18.28।।भक्षयेयं विषं तीक्ष्णं मज्जेयमपि चार्णवे।नियुक्तो गुरुणा पित्रा नृपेण च हितेन च।।2.18.29।।
explanation: Alas, what a pity, O queen, it does not behove you to speak to me such words. I can jump into fire. Since he is my father, preceptor and wellwisher, I shall consume deadly poison or even get drowned in the sea if he so commands.

content: तद्ब्रूहि वचनं देवि राज्ञो यदभिकाङ्क्षितम्।करिष्ये प्रतिजाने च रामो द्विर्नाभिभाषते।।2.18.30।।
explanation: Hence tell me, O Devi Whatever be the desire of the king: I promise I shall carry out, Rama does not say two things (does not go back on his word).

content: तमार्जवसमायुक्तमनार्या सत्यवादिनम्।उवाच रामं कैकेयी वचनं भृशदारुणम्।।2.18.31।।
explanation: To Rama who was devoted to truth and to rectitude of conduct the ignobale Kaikeyi said:

content: पुरा दैवासुरे युद्धे पित्रा ते मम राघव।रक्षितेन वरौ दत्तौ सशल्येन महारणे।।2.18.32।।
explanation: O descendant of Raghu in the great war between gods and demons in the past your father had granted me two boons for protecting him when he was wounded by a shaft.

content: तत्र मे याचितो राजा भरतस्याभिषेचनम्।गमनं दण्डकारण्ये तव चाद्यैव राघव।।2.18.33।।
explanation: O scion of the Raghus, hence I have asked the king for consecration of Bharata and your departure to Dandaka forest today itself.

content: यदि सत्यप्रतिज्ञं त्वं पितरं कर्तुमिच्छसि।आत्मानं च नरश्रेष्ठ मम वाक्यमिदं शृणु।।2.18.34।।
explanation: O the best of men if you want to be true to the word given by you and your father, listen to what I say.

content: सन्निदेशे पितुस्तिष्ठ यथा तेन प्रतिश्रुतम्।त्वयाऽरण्यं प्रवेष्टव्यं नव वर्षाणि पञ्च च।।2.18.35।।
explanation: Abide by your father's command. As promised by him go to the forest for fourteen years.

content: भरतस्त्वभिषिच्येत यदेतदभिषेचनम्।त्वदर्थे विहितं राज्ञा तेन सर्वेण राघव।।2.18.36।।
explanation: Bharata shall be consecrated, O descendant of the Raghu dynasty with all these preparations made by the king to install you.

content: सप्त सप्त च वर्षाणि दण्डकारण्यमाश्रितः।अभिषेकमिमं त्यक्त्वा जटाजिनधरो वस।।2.18.37।।
explanation: Forsake this consecration, wear matted locks and deerskin and take refuge in Dandaka forest for fourteen years.

content: भरतः कोसलपुरे प्रशास्तु वसुधामिमाम्।नानारत्न समाकीर्णां सवाजिरथकुञ्जराम्।।2.18.38।।
explanation: Let Bharata live in Ayodhya, the capital of Kosala and rule this kingdom rich in gems of different kinds in horses, chariots and elephants.

content: एतेन त्वां नरेन्द्रोऽयं कारुण्येन समाप्लुतः।शोकसंक्लिष्ट वदनो न शक्नोति निरीक्षितुम्।।2.18.39।।
explanation: This is why the king with his face tortured by tears and (his heart) overwhelmed with compassion for you, is unable to look at you.

content: एतत्कुरु नरेन्द्रस्य वचनं रघुनन्दन।सत्येन महता राम तारयस्व नरेश्वरम्।।2.18.40।।
explanation: O Joy of the Raghus, O son of the Raghu race, carry out the word of promise given by the king and save him by helping him keep the truth which is great.

content: इतीव तस्यां परुषं वदन्त्यां न चैव रामः प्रविवेश शोकम्।प्रविव्यथे चापि महानुभावो राजा तु पुत्रव्यसनाभितप्तः।।2.18.41।।
explanation: Even though she was speaking harsh words, Rama did not come to grief. But the magnanimous king was greatly afflicted to see the calamity on his son.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे अष्टादशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eighteenth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the oly Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama hears from Kaikeyi about the boons promised by Dasarathaconsents to leave for the forest goes to meet Kausalya.] तदप्रियममित्रघ्नो वचनं मरणोपमम्।श्रुत्वा न विव्यथे रामः कैकेयीं चेदमब्रवीत्।।2.19.1।।
explanation: The destroyer of enemies (Rama) did not feel distressed to hear these words painful like death. To Kaikeyi he said:

content: एवमस्तु गमिष्यामि वनं वस्तुमहं त्वितः। जटाजिनधरो राज्ञः प्रतिज्ञामनुपालयन्।।2.19.2।।
explanation: Be it so I shall go from here to the forest and live there with matted hair and deerskin to keep the promise of the king.

content: इदं तु ज्ञातुमिच्छामि किमर्थं मां महीपतिः।नाभिनन्दति दुर्धर्षो यथापूर्वमरिन्दमः।।2.19.3।।
explanation: Nevertheless I would like to know why king Dasaratha, an unassailable subduer of enemies does not greet me as usual.

content: मन्युर्न च त्वया कार्यो देवि ब्रूमि तवाग्रतः।यास्यामि भव सुप्रीता वनं चीरजटाधरः।।2.19.4।।
explanation: O Devi you should not grieve. I declare in your presence that I shall go to the forest wearing tattered clothes (bark) and matted locks. Rejoice (to hear this).

content: हितेन गुरुणा पित्रा कृतज्ञेन नृपेण च।नियुज्यमानो विस्रब्धः किं न कुर्यामहं प्रियम्।।2.19.5।।
explanation: Ordered by my father who is my wellwisher, my guru, one with a sense of gratidude and, above all a king, shall I not, without hesitation do what pleases him?

content: अलीकं मानसं त्वेकं हृदयं दहतीव मे।स्वयं यन्नाह मां राजा भरतस्याभिषेचनम्।।2.19.6।।
explanation: One thing which hurts me is that the king himself did not tell me about Bharata's  consecration. That alone is burning my heart.

content: अहं हि सीतां राज्यं च प्राणानिष्टान्धनानि च।हृष्टो भ्रात्रे स्वयं दद्यां भरतायाप्रचोदितः।।2.19.7।।
explanation: Unurged, I would have gladly given to Bharata the kingdom, wealth, my most coveted life, and even Sita.

content: किं पुनर्मनुजेन्द्रेण स्वयं पित्रा प्रचोदितः।तव च प्रियकामार्थं प्रतिज्ञामनुपालयन्।।2.19.8।।
explanation: In order to keep the promise I shall do everything to fulfil your desire. Needless to say that my father has ordered this.

content: तदाश्वासय हीमं त्वं किन्विदं यन्महीपतिः।वसुधासक्तनयनो मन्दमश्रूणि मुञ्चति।।2.19.9।।
explanation: Please console him. Why is it that the king with his eyes fixed upon the ground is shedding tears drop by drop?

content: गच्छन्तु चैवानयितुं दूताश्श्रीघ्रजवैर्हयैः।भरतं मातुलकुलादद्यैव नृपशासनात्।।2.19.10।।
explanation: With the king's orders let messengers go right away on swift horses to fetch Bharata from his maternal uncle's house.

content: दण्डकारण्यमेषोऽहमितो गच्छामि सत्वरः।अविचार्य पितुर्वाक्यं समा वस्तुं चतुर्दश।।2.19.11।।
explanation: As for me, without deliberating on the propriety of my father's orders, I shall go from here at once to Dandaka forest to live (there) for fourteen years.

content: सा हृष्टा तस्य तद्वाक्यं श्रुत्वा रामस्य कैकयी।प्रस्थानं श्रद्धधाना हि त्वरयामास राघवम्।।2.19.12।।
explanation: Kaikeyi, happy to hear the words of the son of the Raghus as she was convinced that his departure (to the forest) was certain, hastened him (to set out).

content: एवं भवतु यास्यन्ति दूता श्शीघ्रजवैर्हयैः।भरतं मातुलकुलादुपावर्तयितुं नराः।।2.19.13।।
explanation: Let it be so. Messengers shall go at once on swift horses to bring Bharata from his maternal uncle's house.

content: तव त्वहं क्षमं मन्ये नोत्सुकस्य विलम्बनम्।राम तस्मादित श्शीघ्रं वनं त्वं गन्तुमर्हसि।।2.19.14।।
explanation: Since you are eager (to go to the forest), I do not think it is proper to delay. O Rama therefore it behoves you to proceed immediately from here to the forest.

content: व्रीडान्वित स्स्वयं यच्च नृपस्त्वां नाभिभाषते।नैतत्किञ्चिन्नरश्रेष्ठ मन्युरेषोऽपनीयताम्।।2.19.15।।
explanation: Out of shame the king is unable to speak to you. There is nothing other than this. O Rama, the best of men, dispel this distress (of mind).

content: यावत्त्वं न वनं यातः पुरादस्मादभित्वरन्।पिता तावन्न ते राम स्नास्यते भोक्ष्यतेऽपि वा।।2.19.16।।
explanation: O Rama, as long as you do not hasten to leave this city for the forest, your father will neither bathe nor eat.

content: धिक्कष्टमिति निःश्वस्य राजा शोकपरिप्लुतः।मूर्छितो न्यपतत्तस्मिन्पर्यङ्के हेमभूषिते।।2.19.17।।
explanation: 'Fie, what a calamity' sighing thus, the king, overwhelmed with sorrow, fainted and fell back on the golden couch.

content: रामोऽप्युत्थाप्य राजानं कैकेय्याभिप्रचोदितः।कशयेवाहतो वाजी वनं गन्तुं कृतत्वरः।।2.19.18।।
explanation: Rama lifted up the king and, urged by Kaikeyi, hastened to depart for the forest like a horse flogged by a whip.

content: तदप्रियमनार्याया वचनं दारुणोदयम्।श्रुत्वा गतव्यथो रामः कैकेयीं वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।2.19.19।।
explanation: Rama listened to the dreadful, cruel words of the ignoble woman but, without feeling any sorrow, said to Kaikeyi, these words:

content: नाहमर्थपरो देवि लोकमावस्तुमुत्सहे।विद्धिमामृषिभिस्तुल्यं केवलं धर्ममास्थितम्।।2.19.20।।
explanation: O Devi, I have no desire to live in this world for the sake of wealth. Know me as one with the sages who are devoted only to righteousness.

content: यदत्र भवतः किञ्चिच्छक्यं कर्तुं प्रियं मया।प्राणानपि परित्यज्य सर्वथा कृतमेव तत्।।2.19.21।।
explanation: If I am able to do anything which pleases my venerable father, it shall be done in every possible manner, may be even at the cost of my life.

content: न ह्यतो धर्मचरणं किञ्चिदस्ति महत्तरम्।यथा पितरिशुश्रूषा तस्य वा वचनक्रिया।।2.19.22।।
explanation: There is no greater observance of righteousness than doing service to one's father or carrying out his orders.

content: अनुक्तोऽप्यत्रभवता भवत्या वचनादहम्।वने वत्स्यामि विजने वर्षाणीह चतुर्दश।।2.19.23।।
explanation: Though this has not been said by my respectable father himself, I shall live in the forlorn forest for fourteen years in accordance with your word.

content: न नूनं मयि कैकयि किञ्चिदाशंससे गुणम्।यद्राजानमवोचस्त्वं ममेश्वरतरा सती।।2.19.24।।
explanation: Since in my case you have exercised more authority (than my father) and pleaded with the king, it follows, you, for sure, do not see any virtue in me, O Kaikeyi (Or else, you should not have asked for Bharata's kingship).

content: यावन्मातरमाप्नच्छे सीतां चानुनयाम्यहम्।ततोऽद्यैव गमिष्यामि दण्डकानां महद्वनम्।।2.19.25।।
explanation: After taking leave of my mother and consoling Sita, today itself I shall go to that wild  Dandaka forest.

content: भरतः पालयेद्राज्यं शुश्रूषेच्च पितुर्यथा।तथा भवत्या कर्तव्यं स हि धर्म स्सनातनः।।2.19.26।।
explanation: It is your bounden duty to see that Bharata rules the kingdom and serves father.

content: स रामस्य वचश्श्रृत्वा भृशं दुःखहतः पिता।शोकादशक्नुवन्वकतुं प्ररुरोद महास्वनम्।।2.19.27।।
explanation: Father (Dasaratha), too tormented with grief to speak cried out loudly on hearing the words of Rama.

content: वन्दित्वा चरणौ रामो विसंज्ञस्य पितुस्तथा।कैकेय्याश्चाप्यनार्यायाः निष्पपात महाद्युतिः।।2.19.28।।
explanation: Effulgent Rama  bowed at the feet of his father who had fallen into a swoon. He bowed at the feet of the ignoble Kaikeyi and set out.

content: स रामः पितरं कृत्वा कैकेयीं च प्रदक्षिणम्।निष्क्रम्यान्तःपुरात्तस्मात्स्वं ददर्श सुहृज्जनम्।।2.19.29।।
explanation: Hardly had Rama withdrawn from the harem after circumambulating his father and Kaikeyi when he saw his friends .

content: तं बाष्पपरिपूर्णाक्षः पृष्ठतोऽनुजगाम ह।लक्ष्मणः परमक्कृध्दः स्सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनः।।2.19.30।।
explanation: Lakshmana, the enhancer of Sumitra's delight, with his eyes brimming with tears, followed him in a rage.

content: अभिषेचनिकं भाण्डं कृत्वा रामः प्रदक्षिणम्।शनैर्जगाम सापेक्षो दृष्टिं तत्राविचालयन्।।2.19.31।।
explanation: Rama circumambulated the vessels meant for the consecration ceremony and steadily glancing at them with attention slowly moved away.

content: न चास्य महतीं लक्ष्मीं राज्यनाशोऽपकर्षति।लोककान्तस्य कान्तत्वाच्छीतरश्मेरिव क्षपा।।2.19.32।।
explanation: Rama was the beloved of the people. Loss of kingdom did not diminish his splendour just like night cannot diminish the splendour of the coolrayed Moon.

content: न वनं गन्तुकामस्य त्यजतश्च वसुन्धराम्।सर्वलोकातिगस्येव लक्ष्यते चित्तविक्रिया।।2.19.33।।
explanation: Rama was determined to renounce the kingdom and go to the forest. So none could see any change in his mind. (For) he was one beyond all worldly affairs.

content: प्रतिषिध्य शुभं छत्रं व्यजने च स्वलङ्कृते।                                                                     विसर्जयित्वा स्वजनं रथं पौरांस्तथा जनान्।।2.19.34।।                                                                                 धारयन् मनसा दुःखमिन्द्रियाणि निगृह्य च।प्रविवेशात्मवान्वेश्म मातुरप्रियशंसिवान्।2.19.35।।
explanation: Selfpossessed Rama held back his sorrow within his mind, abandoned the auspicious umbrella, welldecorated fans and chariot, sent away kinsmen, citydwellers and others and entered his mother's residence to break the unpleasant news.

content: सर्वोह्यभिजनश्श्रीमान् श्रीमतस्सत्यवादिनः।नालक्षयत रामस्य किञ्चिदाकारमानने।।2.19.36।।
explanation: All the glorious people around him did not observe any change in the countenance of that dignified and truthful Rama.

content: उचितं च महाबाहुर्नजहौहर्षमात्मनः।शारद स्समुदीर्णांशुश्चन्द्रस्तेज इवात्मजम्।।2.19.37।।
explanation: The mightyarmed (Rama) did not leave his habitual cheerfulness like the autumnal Moon his own brightness.

content: वाचा मधुरया रामस्सर्वं सम्मानयञ्जनम्।मातुस्समीपं धीरात्मा प्रविवेश महायशाः।।2.19.38।।
explanation: Firmminded and illustrious Rama treated all people with sweet words and approached his mother.

content: तं गुणैस्समतां प्राप्तो भ्राता विपुलविक्रमः।सौमित्रिरनुवव्राज धारयन्दुःखमात्मजम्।।2.19.39।।
explanation: Mighty Lakshmana as virtuous as his brother held the sorrow in his mind and followed him.

content: प्रविश्य वेश्मातिभृशं मुदाऽन्वितं समीक्ष्य तां चार्थविपत्तिमागताम्।न चैव रामोऽत्रजगामविक्रियां सुहृज्जनस्यात्मविपत्तिशङ्कया।।2.19.40।।
explanation: Rama entered  the palace which was full of great rejoicing. He did not disclose the obstruction that had come on the way of achieving his objective for fear of causing distress to his friends. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकोनविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the nineteenth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama enters to the inner apartment of his mother Kausalya--informs her of his exile to the forest--lamentations of Kausalya.] तस्मिंस्तु पुरुषव्याघ्रे निष्क्रामति कृताञ्जलौ।आर्तशब्दो महान् जज्ञे स्त्रीणामन्तःपुरे तदा।।2.20.1।।
explanation: When the tiger among men (Rama) was coming out with folded palms, there arose a huge cry of distress among the ladies of the harem:

content: कृत्येष्वचोदितः पित्रा सर्वस्यान्तःपुरस्य च।गतिर्यश्शरणं चापि स रामोऽद्य प्रवत्स्यति।।2.20.2।।
explanation: Rama was the refuge and protector of all the inmates lot of the inner apartment although it was not his duty nor was he forced by his father to safeguard them. That Rama is now going on exile.

content: कौशल्यायां यथा युक्तो जनन्यां वर्तते सदा।तथैव वर्ततेऽस्मासु जन्मप्रभृति राघवः।।2.20.3।।
explanation: Rama conducted himself towards us in the same way as he did towards his mother Kausalya right from the begining.

content: न क्रुध्यत्यभिशप्तोऽपि क्रोधनीयानि वर्जयन्।क्रुद्धान्प्रसादयन्सर्वान् स इतोऽद्य प्रवत्स्यति।।2.20.4।।
explanation: Rama who used to avoid deeds that caused anger, pacified those who were angry with him, and never lost his cool even when cursed, that Rama is going on exile today.

content: अबुद्धिर्बत नो राजा जीवलोकं चरत्ययम्।यो गतिं सर्वभूतानां परित्यजति राघवम्।।.2.20.5।।
explanation: Alas our king who has lost his brain, who has ordered the banishment of Rama, the refuge of all living beings, (on the other hand) is moving about in the world.

content: इति सर्वा महिष्यस्ता विवत्सा इव धेनवः।पतिमाचुक्रुशुश्चैव सस्वरं चापि चुक्रुशुः।।2.20.6।।
explanation: Thus all the queens like calfless cows cried loudly blaming their husband.

content: स हि चान्तःपुरे घोरमार्तशब्दं महीपतिः।पुत्रशोकाभिसन्तप्तः श्रुत्वा व्यालीयताऽसने।।2.20.7।।
explanation: Tormented with grief on account of his son, the king sank in his seat on hearing the cries of distress from the inner apartment

content: रामस्तु भृशमायस्तो निश्श्वसन्निव कुञ्जरः।जगाम सहितो भ्रात्रा मातुरन्तःपुरं वशी।।2.20.8।।
explanation: Deeply pained yet selfpossessed Rama, heaving sighs like an elephant went towards the inner apartment of his mother along with his brother.

content: सोऽपश्यत्पुरुषं तत्र वृद्धं परमपूजितम्।उपविष्टं गृहद्वारि तिष्ठतश्चापरान्बहून्।।2.20.9।।
explanation: Rama beheld a highly venerable elderly man seated at the entrance of the residence and many others standing (nearby).

content: दृष्ट्वैव तु तदा रामं ते सर्वे सहसोत्थिताः।जयेन जयतां श्रेष्ठं वर्धयन्ति स्म राघवम्।।2.20.10।।
explanation: On seeing Rama, all the eminent among the victors got up immediately and greeted him, saying, 'Victory to you'.

content: प्रविश्य प्रथमां कक्ष्यां द्वितीयायां ददर्श सः।ब्राह्मणान्वेदसम्पन्नान्वृद्धान्राज्ञाऽभिसत्कृतान्।।2.20.11।।
explanation: With the first courtyard crossed, Rama saw in the second aged brahmins versed in the Vedas, and duly honoured by the king.

content: प्रणम्य रामस्तान्विप्रांस्तृतीयायां ददर्श सः।स्त्रियो वृद्धास्तथा बाला द्वाररक्षणतत्पराः।।2.20.12।।
explanation: Rama wished the brahmins and saw old men, women and children vigilantly guarding the door in the third courtyard.

content: वर्धयित्वा प्रहृष्टास्ताः प्रविश्य च गृहं स्त्रियः।न्यवेदयन्त त्वरिता राममातुः प्रियं तदा।।2.20.13।।
explanation: Wellpleased, the women then greeted him wishing prosperity. They hurried into the abode of Kausalya and gave her the happy news (of Rama's arrival).

content: कौशल्यापि तदा देवी रात्रिं स्थित्वा समाहिता।प्रभाते त्वकरोत्पूजां विष्णोः पुत्रहितैषिणी।।2.20.14।।
explanation: Having spent the night with a composed mind (abosorbed in meditation), Kausalya was worshipping lord Visnu in the early morning to secure her son's welfare.

content: सा क्षौमवसना हृष्टा नित्यं व्रतपरायणा। अग्निं जुहोति स्म तदा मन्त्रवत्कृतमङ्गला।।2.20.15।।
explanation: Always engaged in the observance of vows, Kausalya (then) clad in silk cloth was performing rituals of auspiciousness, offering oblations to the firegod in accordance with mantras (Vedic hymns).

content: प्रविश्य च तदा रामो मातुरन्त:पुरं शुभम्।ददर्श मातरं तत्र हावयन्तीं हुताशनम्।।2.20.16।।
explanation: Rama entered the auspicious inner apartment of his mother and saw her exhorting the priests to offer sacrificial oblations to Agni (firegod).

content: देवकार्यनिमित्तं च तत्रापश्यत्समुद्यतम्।दध्यक्षतं घृतं चैव मोदकान्हविषस्तथा।।2.20.17।।लाजान्माल्यानि शुक्लानि पायसं कृसरं तथा।समिध: पूर्णकुम्भांश्च ददर्श रघुनन्दनः।।2.20.18।।
explanation: There Rama saw  curd, grains of rice, clarified butter, sweetmeats, oblations, parched grain, white garlands, porridge of cooked rice mixed with sesame seeds, sacrirficial faggots, vessels filled with water, etc. kept ready for religious rites.

content: तां शुक्लक्षौमसंवीतां व्रतयोगेन कर्शिताम्।तर्पयन्तीं ददर्शाद्भिर्देवतां देववर्णिनीम्।।2.20.19।।
explanation: Kausalya, emaciated due to observance of vows and clad in white silk looked like a celestial being. She was engaged in offering libations to the deities.

content: सा चिरस्यात्मजं दृष्ट्वा मातृनन्दनमागतम्।अभिचक्राम संहृष्टा किशोरं बडबा यथा।।2.20.20।।
explanation: Seeing her son who had come after a long time and who is a source of joy to his mother, Kausalya approached him with great delight like a mare to her young calf.

content: स मातरमभिक्रान्तामुपसंगृह्य राघवः।परिष्वक्तश्च बाहुभ्यामुपाघ्रातश्च मूर्धनि।।2.20.21।।
explanation: The scion of the Raghus saw his mother coming and bowed her. She held him in both her arms and kissed his forehead.

content: तमुवाच दुराधर्षं राघवं सुतमात्मनः।कौशल्या पुत्रवात्सल्यादिदं प्रियहितं वचः।।2.20.22।।
explanation: Out of love for her son, the invincible scion of the Raghu dynasty, Kausalya spoke with gentle and pleasant words:

content: वृद्धानां धर्मशीलानां राजर्षीणां महात्मनाम्।प्राप्नुह्यायुश्च कीर्तिं च धर्मं चोपहितं कुले।।2.20.23।।
explanation: May you attain long life and fame like those of the aged, virtuous and great rajarsis  who upheld the righteousness in the race.

content: सत्यप्रतिज्ञं पितरं राजानं पश्य राघव।अद्यैव हि त्वां धर्मात्मा यौवराज्येऽभिषेक्ष्यति।।2.20.24।।
explanation: O scion of the Raghu race see the king, your righteous and truthful father, who will consecrate you as princeregent today itself.

content: दत्तमासनमालभ्य भोजनेन निमन्त्रितः।मातरं राघवः किञ्चिद्व्रीडात्प्रसार्याञ्जलिमब्रवीत्।।2.20.25।।
explanation: Invited (by Kausalya) to partake the food, Rama out of abashment only touched the seat provided to him and having stretched his folded palms spoke to his mother.

content: स स्वभावविनीतश्च गौरवाच्च तदा नतः।प्रस्थितो दण्डकारण्यमाप्रष्टुमुपचक्रमे।।2.20.26।।
explanation: Modest by nature, Rama with respectful humility began seeking her permission for his departure to Dandaka forest:

content: देवि नूनं न जानीषे महद्भयमुपस्थितम्।इदं तव च दुःखाय वैदेह्या लक्ष्मणस्य च।।2.20.27।।
explanation: O mother surely you do not know that a great misfortune has befallen, causing distress to you, Sita and Lakshmana, too.

content: गमिष्ये दण्डकारण्यं किमनेनासनेन मे।विष्टरासनयोग्यो हि कालोऽयं मामुपस्थितः।।2.20.28।।
explanation: I am setting forth to Dandaka forest.  What is this seat for? A time has come for me when I am fit for a seat of kusa grass.

content: चतुर्दश हि वर्षाणि वत्स्यामि विजने वने।मधुमूलफलैर्जीवन्हित्वा मुनिवदामिषम्।।2.20.29।।
explanation: Abstaining from eating meat like hermits and living on honey, fruits and roots, I am to live in the solitary forest for fourteen years.

content: भरताय महाराजो यौवराज्यं प्रयच्छति।मां पुनर्दण्डकारण्ये विवासयति तापसम्।।2.20.30।।
explanation: The great king is conferring the status of heirapparent on Bharata while he is banishing me to Dandaka forest to live like an ascetic.

content: स षट्चाष्टौ च वर्षाणि वत्स्यामि विजने वने।आसेवमानो वन्यानि फलमूलैश्च वर्तयन्।।2.20.31।।
explanation: Living on things available in the forest, on fruits and roots, I am to dwell in the uninhabited jungle for fourteen years.

content: सा निकृत्तेव सालस्य यष्टिः परशुना वने।पपात सहसा देवी देवतेव दिवश्च्युता।।2.20.32।।
explanation: All on a sidden Kausalya fell down on the ground like the branch of a sal tree in the forest severed by an axe, like a goddess dropped from heaven.

content: तामदुःखोचितां दृष्ट्वा पतितां कदलीमिव।रामस्तूत्थापयामास मातरं गतचेतसम्।।2.20.33।।
explanation: Seeing his mother who had done nothing to deserve (this) suffering and who had fallen down like a plantain tree, deprived of her senses, Rama raised her up (from the ground).

content: उपावृत्त्योत्थितां दीनां बडबामिव वाहिताम्।पांसुकुण्ठितसर्वाङ्गीं विममर्श च पाणिना।।2.20.34।।
explanation: Rama gently wiped away the dust that had covered her body as Kausalya stood miserable, like a mare who stands up after having rolled on the ground while pulling the load.

content: सा राघवमुपासीनमसुखार्ता सुखोचिता।उवाच पुरुषव्याघ्रमुपशृण्वति लक्ष्मणे।।2.20.35।।
explanation: Kausalya who deserved happiness yet was struck down by (this) distress spoke to Rama, the tiger among men who was sitting nearby, while Lakshmana was listening.

content: यदि पुत्र न जायेथा मम शोकाय राघव।न स्म दुःखमतो भूयः पश्येयमहमप्रजाः।।2.20.36।।
explanation: O my son, if you were not born to me, I, even as a woman without  progeny, would not have experienced grief, more intense than this.

content: एक एव हि वन्ध्याया श्शोको भवति मानसः।अप्रजाऽस्मीति सन्तापो न ह्यन्यः पुत्र विद्यते।।2.20.37।।
explanation: O my son a barren woman has only one mental agony that she has no progeny.  Except that she does not have any other sorrow.

content: न दृष्टपूर्वं कल्याणं सुखं वा पतिपौरुषे।अपि पुत्रे ऽपि पश्येयमिति रामाऽस्थितं मया।।2.20.38।।
explanation: I did not have the fortune, O Rama, to enjoy any auspicious moment or pleasure earlier when my husband was in authority. I exist with the hope that I will have it when my son assumes authority.

content: सा बहून्यमनोज्ञानि वाक्यानि हृदयच्छिदाम्।अहं श्रोष्ये सपत्नीनामवराणां वरा सती।।2.20.39।।
explanation: I, being the eldest (of the queens) will have to listen to many heartbreaking and unpleasant words from my fellowwives who are younger to me.

content: अतो दुःखतरं किं नु प्रमदानां भविष्यति।मम शोको विलापश्च यादृशोऽयमनन्तकः।।2.20.40।।
explanation: There cannnot be greater distress for any woman than such unending grief and lamentation (which I am now experiencing).

content: त्वयि सन्निहितेऽप्येवमहमासं निराकृता।किं पुनः प्रोषिते तात ध्रुवं मरणमेव मे।।2.20.41।।
explanation: O child even when you are nearby I am neglected like this. What to say when you are banished. Death is certain to me.

content: अत्यन्तनिगृहीतास्मि भर्तुर्नित्यमतन्त्रिता।परिवारेण कैकेय्या स्समा वाप्यथवाऽवरा।।2.20.42।।
explanation: Treating me as an equal or inferior to the attendants of Kaikeyi and making me always dependent, my husband has greatly suppressed me.

content: योऽहि मां सेवते कश्चिदथवाप्यनुवर्तते।कैकेय्याः पुत्रमन्वीक्ष्य स्वश्चि जनो नाभिभाषते।।2.20.43।।
explanation: Any one who serves me or follows me will not talk to me after seeing Bharata (installed as heirapparent).

content: नित्यक्रोधतया तस्याः कथं नु खरवादितत्।कैकेय्या वदनं द्रष्टुं पुत्र शक्ष्यामि दुर्गता।।2.20.44।।
explanation: Fallen into an unfortunate state how can I look at Kaikeyi's face who is always harsh and in temper?

content: दश सप्त च वर्षाणि जातस्य तव राघवअतितानि प्रकाङ्क्षन्त्या मया दुःखपरिक्षयम्।।2.20.45।।
explanation: O Rama, I have spent the last seventeen years after your birth with the expectaion that my sorrows would come to an end.

content: तदक्षयं महद्दुःखं नोत्सहे सहितुं चिरम्।विप्रकारं सपत्नीनामेवं जीर्णाऽपि राघव।।2.20.46।।
explanation: Therefore, O Rama, I cannot at this old age endure this great, endless sorrow and the insults from cowives for long.

content: अपश्यन्ती तव मुखं परिपूर्णशशिप्रभम्।कृपणा वर्तयिष्यामि कथं कृपणजीविकाम्।।2.20.47।।
explanation: Without beholding your face that is as bright as the full Moon, how can this wretched woman live this pitiable life?

content: उपवासैश्च योगैश्च बहुभिश्च परिश्रमैः।दुःखं संवर्धितो मोघं त्वं हि दुर्गतया मया।।2.20.48।।
explanation: Through meditation, through fasts and with a great deal of efforts you have been brought up by this luckless (mother). But alas this is all in vain.

content: स्थिरं तु हृदयं मन्ये ममेदं यन्न दीर्यते।प्रावृषीव महानद्या स्पृष्टं कूलं नवाम्भसा।।2.20.49।।
