content: सग्राहा स्सरितश्चैव पङ्कवत्यस्सु दुस्तराः। मत्तैरपि गजैर्नित्यमतो दुःखतरं वनम्।।2.28.9।।
explanation: The rivers, infested with crocodiles and filled with mud are difficult to cross even for elephants in rut. Hence forest life is always extremely dangerous.

content: लताकण्टकसङ्कीर्णाः कृकवाकूपनादिताः।निरपाश्च सुदुर्गाश्च मार्गा दुःखमतो वनम्।।2.28.10।।
explanation: .The paths full of thorny creepers, echoing with the noise of wild fowls, and with no water (to drink) are difficult to tread. So forest is a source of suffering.

content: सुप्यते पर्णशय्यासु स्वयं भग्नासु भूतले।रात्रिषु श्रमखिन्नेन तस्माद्दुःखतरं वनम्।।2.28.11।।
explanation: Exhausted with struggles one has to sleep at night on a bed of leaves fallen on their own on the ground. Therefore, forest life is extremely painful.

content: अहोरात्रं च सन्तोषः कर्तव्यो नियतात्मना।फलैर्वृक्षावपतितै स्सीते दुःखमतो वनम्।।2.28.12।।
explanation: With the senses under control night and day, O Sita, one must be satisfied with the fruits fallen from trees. Therefore, forest life is full of suffering.

content: उपवासश्च कर्तव्यो यथा प्राणेन मैथिलि।जटाभारश्च कर्तव्यो वल्कलाम्बरधारिणा।।2.28.13।।
explanation: One has to wear robes of bark and matted hair and take to fasting as long as one can, O daughter of Mithila

content: देवतानां पित्रूणां कर्तव्यं विधिपूर्वकम्।प्राप्तानामतिथीनां च नित्यशः प्रतिपूजनम्।।2.28.14।।
explanation: One has to worship gods and ancestors according to tradition and extend hospitality to guests, (who arrive unexpectedly).

content: कार्यस्त्रिरभिषेकश्च काले काले च नित्यशः।चरता नियमेनैव तस्माद्धुःखतरं वनम्।।2.28.15।।
explanation: One has to wander about all the while (like an ascetic) as per the customs and take ablutions three times a day at prescribed hours. Hence life in the forest is extremely hard.

content: उपहारश्च कर्तव्यः कुसुमै स्स्वयमाहृतैः।आर्षेण विधिना वेद्यां बाले दुःखमतो वनम्।।2.28.16।।
explanation: Flowers collected with one's own hands, O innocent one, should be offered on the altar as per injunction of the Vedas. Therefore (life in the) forest is difficult.

content: यथालब्धेन कर्तव्यः सन्तोषस्तेन मैथिलि।यताहारैर्वनचरै र्नित्यं दुःखमतो वनम्।।2.28.17।।
explanation: The wanderers in the jungle, O daughter of Mithila, have to be satisfied daily with whatever little food is available. So forest (life) is a hard life.

content: अतीव वातास्तिमिरं बुभुक्षा चात्र नित्यशः।भयानि च महान्त्यत्र ततो दुःखतरं वनम्।।2.28.18।।
explanation: There is extreme wind and darkness, hunger and fear. Therefore forest (life) is difficult.

content: सरीसृपाश्च बहवो बहुरूपाश्च भामिनि।चरन्ति पृथिवीं दर्पात्ततो दुःखतरं वनम्।।2.28.19।।
explanation: There are various forms of fierce reptiles fearlessly crawling on the ground. So (living in the) forest is extremely dangerous.

content: नदी निलयना स्सर्पा नदीकुटिलगामिनः।तिषठ्न्त्यावृत्य पन्थानं ततो दुःखतरं वनम्।।.2.28.20।।
explanation: The serpents that live in and move like meandering rivers always obstruct  the paths. Therefore, living in the forest is tremendously difficult.

content: पतङ्गा वृश्चिकाः कीटा दंशाश्च मशकै स्सह।बाधन्ते नित्यमबले सर्वं दुःखमतो वनम्।।2.28.21।।
explanation: Birds, scorpions, insects, gnats and mosquitoes always create trouble. Therefore, life in the forest is all suffering.

content: द्रुमाः कण्टकिनश्चैव कुशा: काशाश्च भामिनि।वने व्याकुलशाखाग्रास्तेन दुःखतरं वनम्।।2.28.22।।
explanation: O lovely Sita there are thorny trees with branches on the top interlaced with one another. There are kusa grass and reeds. So forest life is very hard.

content: कायक्लेशाश्च बहवो भयानि विविधानि च।अरण्यवासे वसतो दुःखमेव ततो वनम्।।2.28.23।।
explanation: There are various physical afflictions and fears for one who lives in the forest. Therefore, forest brings suffering.

content: क्रोधलोभौ विमोक्तव्यौ कर्तव्या तपसे मतिः।न भेतव्यं च भेतव्ये नित्यं दुःखमतो वनम्।।2.28.24।।
explanation: Anger and greed have to be given up, with the mind preoccupied with ascetic practices. One should not be afraid of fearful situations. Hence forest (life) always very hard.

content: तदलं ते वनं गत्वा क्षमं न हि वनं तव।विमृशन्निह पश्यामि बहुदोषतरं वनम्।।2.28.25।।
explanation: Thus forest life is not suitable for you. On reconsideration, I see that there are many dangers in forest life.

content: वनन्तु नेतुं न कृता मतिस्तदाबभूव रामेण यदा महात्मना।न तस्य सीता वचनं चकार तत्ततोऽब्रवीद्राममिदं सुदुःखिता।।2.28.26।।
explanation: When the great Rama decided not to take her along with him to the forest, Sita, deeply grieved said these words.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे अष्टाविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyeighth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of  the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Sita insists on going with Rama] एतत्तु वचनं श्रुत्वा सीता रामस्य दुःखिता। प्रसक्ताश्रुमुखी मन्दमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.29.1।।
explanation: Having heard the words of Rama, thus spoke Sita in a faint voice in sadness, with tears flowing incessantly from her eyes:

content: ये त्वया कीर्तिता दोषा वने वस्तव्यतां प्रति। गुणानित्येव तान्विद्धि तव स्नेहपुरस्कृतान्।।2.29.2।।
explanation: Understand that the difficulties of forest life described by you will be turned into advantages if they are accompanied by your affection.

content: मृगा स्सिंहा गजाश्चैव शार्दूला श्शरभास्तथा। पक्षिण स्सृमराश्चैव ये चान्ये वनचारिणः।।2.29.3।।अदृष्टपूर्वरूपत्वात्सर्वे ते तव राघव। रूपं दृष्ट्वाऽपसर्पेयुर्भये सर्वे हि बिभ्यति।।2.29.4।।
explanation: O scion of the Raghu race antelopes, lions, elephants, tigers, sarabhas, birds, srimaras and other wild beasts wandering in the forest have not seen your beauty before. Now on seeing you, they will flee away. In fact, who will not be afraid of seeing an object of fear?.

content: त्वया च सह गन्तव्यं मया गुरुजनाज्ञया।त्वद्वियोगेन मे राम त्यक्तव्यमिह जीवितम्।।2.29.5।।
explanation: In accordance with the command of the elders, I must accompany you to the forest. If I am separated from you, I will give up my life here itself.

content: न हि मां त्वत्समीपस्थामपि शक्नोतिराघव। सुराणामीश्वर श्शक्रः प्रधर्षयितुमोजसा।।2.29.6।।
explanation: If I am  in your company, O Rama even the lord of the gods, Indra with all his might will not be able to hurt me.

content: पतिहीना तु या नारी न सा शक्ष्यति जीवितुम्। काममेवं विधं राम त्वया मम निदर्शितम्।।2.29.7।।
explanation: Your salutary instruction to me, O Rama, is 'A woman cannot live without her husband'. This truth is greatly applicable to me.

content: अथ चापि महाप्राज्ञ ब्राह्मणानां मया श्रुतम्। पुरा पितृगृहे सत्यं वस्तव्यं किल मे वने।।2.29.8।।
explanation: O highly sagacious Rama  I had also heard in my father's house long ago, from brahmins prophesing that some day I shall have certainly to dwell in the forest.

content: लक्षणिभ्यो द्विजातिभ्य श्शृत्वाऽहं वचनं पुरा। वनवासकृतोत्साहा नित्यमेव महाबल।।2.29.9।।
explanation: O mighty hero ever since I heard the prophesies from the brahmin palmists I am yearning to dwell in the forest.

content: आदेशो वनवासस्य प्राप्तव्य स्स मया किल। सा त्वया सह तत्राहं यास्यामि प्रिय नान्यथा।।2.29.10।।
explanation: Therefore, O my beloved I must certainly obtain such a command to dwell in the forest. I must accompany you to the forest and it cannot be otherwise.

content: कृतादेशा भविष्यामि गमिष्यामि सह त्वया। कालश्चायं समुत्पन्न स्सत्यवाग्भवतु द्विजः।।2.29.11।।
explanation: I will go with you, true to the prediction of the brahmin. That time has come and let his prediction come to pass.

content: वनवासेऽभिजानामि दुःखानि बहुथा किल। प्राप्यन्ते नियतं वीर पुरुषैरकृतात्मभिः।।2.29.12।।
explanation: I am aware, O valiant one, that there are hardships of every  kind in forest life. But they befall those whose senses are not under their  control.

content: कन्यया च पितुर्गेहे वनवास श्शृतो मया। भिक्षिण्या स्साधुवृत्ताया मम मातुरिहाग्रतः।।2.29.13।।
explanation: When I was young in my father's house, a holy female mendicant foretold in the presence of my mother that I would dwell in the forest (in this life).

content: प्रसादितश्च वै पूर्वं त्वं मे बहुतिथं प्रभो। गमनं वनवासस्य काङ्क्षितं हि सह त्वया।।2.29.14।।
explanation: Pleased with my long entreaties in the past  to dwell with you in the forest, O lord, you had granted my desire.

content: कृतक्षणाऽहं भद्रं ते गमनं प्रति राघव। वनवासस्य शूरस्य चर्या हि मम रोचते।।2.29.15।।
explanation: Since then I have been counting time for this forest life. It pleases me to follow my valiant hero as he lives in the forest. Rama, prosperity to you

content: शुद्धात्मन्प्रेमभावाध्दि भविष्यामि विकल्मषा। भर्तारमनुगच्छन्ती भर्ता हि मम दैवतम्।।2.29.16।।
explanation: O my purehearted one by following my husband with love I shall become sinless, because my husband is my god.

content: प्रेत्यभावे हि कल्याण स्सङ्गमो मे सह त्वया। श्रुतिर्हि श्रूयते पुण्या ब्राह्मणानां यशस्विनाम्।।2.29.17।।इहलोके च पितृभिर्या स्त्री यस्य महामते। अद्भिर्दत्ता स्वधर्मेण प्रेत्यभावेऽपि तस्य सा।।2.29.18।।
explanation: My union with you, O highminded one, is auspicious even beyond death. A woman, given away by her parents in accordance with traditional offerings of water belongs to him even after death and lives with him. This is a statement from the Vedas quoted by famous brahmins.

content: एवमस्मात्स्वकां नारीं सुवृत्तां हि पतिव्रताम्। नाभिरोचयसे नेतुं त्वं मां केनेह हेतुना।।2.29.19।।
explanation: Why don't you want to take to the forest your own wife who is loyal and devoted, and is of good conduct.

content: भक्तां पतिव्रतां दीनां मां समां सुखदुःखयोः। नेतुमर्हसि काकुत्स्थ समान सुखदुःखिनीम्।।2.29.20।।
explanation: O Rama, I am faithful and devoted to you. I have equal disposition to happiness and sorrow. I equally share your prosperity and adversity. Therefore, you should  take your wife (to the forest). In this time of distress.

content: ययदि मां दुःखितामेवं वनं नेतुं न चेच्छसि। विषमग्निं जलं वाऽहमास्थास्ये मृत्युकारणात्।।2.29.21।।
explanation: If you do not wish to take your wife in this time of distress to the forest I shall die by consuming poison or throwing myself into fire or drowning in water.

content: एवं बहुविधं तं सा याचते गमनं प्रति। नानुमेने महाबाहुस्तां नेतुं विजनं वनम्।।2.29.22।।
explanation: Despite Sita's  pleadings with him in various ways the mightyarmed Rama would not consent to take her to the desolate forest.

content: एवमुक्ता तु सा चिन्तां मैथिली समुपागता। स्नापयन्तीव गामुष्णैरश्रुभिर्नयनच्युतैः।।2.29.23।।
explanation: Thus spoken to (prevented), Sita was filled with grief and cried, drenching the ground with warm tears that fell from her eyes.

content: चिन्तयन्तीं तथा तां तु निवर्तयितुमात्मवान्। ताम्रोष्ठीं स तदा सीतां काकुत्स्थो बह्वसान्त्वयत्।।2.29.24।।
explanation: That selfpossessed scion of the Kakutstha dynasty consoled the copperredlipped Sita in several ways to dissuade her (from going to the forest).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकोनत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyninth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama consents to take Sita to the forest--instructs her to distribute their precious possessions on the eve of their departure]  सान्त्व्यमाना तु रामेण मैथिली जनकात्मजा।वनवासनिमित्ताय भर्तारमिदमब्रवीत्।।2.30.1।।
explanation: In response to Rama's consolation with regard to her stay in the forest, the daughter of Janaka, Maithili (Sita) said:

content: सा तमुत्तमसंविग्ना सीता विपुलवक्षसम्।प्रणयाच्चाभिमानाच्च परिचिक्षेप राघवम्।।2.30.2।।
explanation: Sita agitated over a supreme cause upbraided the broadchested scion of the Raghu race out of love and injured selfrespect.

content: किं त्वाऽमन्यत वैदेहः पिता मे मिथिलाधिपः।राम जामातरं प्राप्य स्त्रियं पुरुषविग्रहम्।।2.30.3।।
explanation: O Rama while accepting you as soninlaw did my father, king of Mithila and lord of Videha ever think that you are a woman in the guise of a man?

content: अनृतं बत लोकोऽयमज्ञानाद्यदि वक्ष्यति।तेजो नास्ति परं रामे तपतीव दिवाकरे।।2.30.4।।
explanation: Alas that will be a falschood if people out of ignorance say that there is no supreme splendour in Rama like the shining Sun.

content: किं हि कृत्वा विषण्णस्त्वं कुतो वा भयमस्ति ते।यत्परित्यक्तुकामस्त्वं मामनन्यपरायणाम्।।2.30.5।।
explanation: What may be the cause for your fear and depression behind your desire to desert one who is so exclusively devoted to you?

content: द्युमत्सेनसुतं वीर सत्यवन्तमनुव्रताम्।सावित्रीमिव मां विद्धि त्वमात्मवशवर्तिनीम्।।2.30.6।।
explanation: Know, O valiant one, that by remaining subordinate to you, I am as faithful to you as Savitri was to her husband, Satyavanta, son of Dyumatsena.

content: न त्वहं मनसाऽप्यन्यं द्रष्टाऽस्मि त्वदृतेऽनघ।त्वया राघव गच्छेयं यथाऽन्या कुलपांसिनी।।2.30.7।।
explanation: O sinless son of the Raghus I am not like other women who bring disgreace to the family. I have not looked at any one except you, even with my mind's eye. I will go (to the forest) along with you.

content: स्वयं तु भार्यां कौमारीं चिरमध्युषितां सतीम्।शैलूष इव मां राम परेभ्यो दातुमिच्छसि।।2.30.8।।
explanation: I have been living with you for a long time, O Rama I am young and chaste. Why do you, like an actor, wish to hand me over to others.

content: यस्य पथ्यं च रामाऽत्थ यस्य चार्थेऽवरुध्यसे।त्वं तस्य भव वश्यश्च विधेयश्च सदाऽनघ।।2.30.9।।
explanation: You, O sinless Rama, may become subservient and obedient to them about whose wellfare you are speaking of and on account of whom you are preventing me to go (along with you).

content: स मामनादाय वनं न त्वं प्रस्थातुमर्हसि।तपो वा यदि वाऽरण्यं स्वर्गो वा स्यात्सह मे त्वया।।2.30.10।।
explanation: You should not depart for the forest without taking me. Be it for penance or for the forest or for heaven, I wish to be with you.

content: न च मे भविता तत्र कश्चित्पथि परिश्रमः।पृष्ठतस्तव गच्छन्त्या विहारशयनेष्विव।।2.30.11।।
explanation: While following you, I will feel no fatigue there on the way as if I am going on a pleasurestroll or in a comfortable couch.

content: कुशकाशशरेषीका ये च कण्टकिनो द्रुमाः।तूलाजिनसमस्पर्शा मार्गे मम सह त्वया।।2.30.12।।
explanation: The white reeds, the kusha, the sara and the ishika grasses and thorny trees on the way will feel as soft as cotton or as the skin of a black antelope.

content: महावातसमुद्धूतं यन्मामपकरिष्यति।रजो रमण तन्मन्ये परार्थ्यमिव चन्दनम्।।2.30.13।।
explanation: I shall regard, O charming Rama, the harmful dust raised by the stormy wind and settled on me as the most excellent sandal powder.

content: शाद्वलेषु यथा शिश्ये वनान्ते वनगोचर।कुथास्तरणतल्पेषु किं स्यात्सुखतरं ततः।।2.30.14।।
explanation: O rover of the forest I will feel happier when I sleep on the meadows (of tender green grass) on the outskirts of the forest than when I sleep on the couch spread with carpets.

content: पत्रं मूलं फलं यत्त्वमल्पं वा यदि वा बहु।दास्यसि स्वयमाहृत्य तन्मेऽमृतरसोपमम्।।2.30.15।।
explanation: Whatever leaves or roots or fruits you collect with your own hands for me little or much, they will be nectar to me.

content: न मातुर्न पितुस्तत्र स्मरिष्यामि न वेश्मनः।आर्तवान्युपभुञ्जाना पुष्पाणि च फलानि च।।2.30.16।।
explanation: Enjoying the seasonal flowers and fruits in the forest, I will not remember my mother or father or home.

content: न च तत्र ततः किञ्चिद्द्रष्टुमर्हसि विप्रियम्।मत्कृते न च ते शोको न भविष्यामि दुर्भरा।।2.30.17।।
explanation: Therefore, you should not anticipate any problem from me in the forest. Neither shall I be burdensome to you nor shall I make you experience any sorrow on my account.

content: य स्त्वया सह स स्वर्गो निरयो यस्त्वया विना।इति जानन्परां प्रीतिं गच्छ राम मया सह।।2.30.18।।
explanation: Wherever I be with you is heaven and without, hell. O Rama, recognise this truth, and derive great pleasure in my company.

content: अथ मामेवमव्यग्रां वनं नैव नयिष्यति।विषमद्यैव पास्यामि मा विशं द्विषतां गमम्।।2.30.19।।
explanation: If you do not take me to the forest without the least hesitation I shall consume poison right now, but not live under the control of enemies (at Ayodhya).

content: पश्चादपि हि दुःखेन मम नैवास्ति जीवितम्।उज्झितायास्त्वया नाथ तदैव मरणं वरम्।।2.30.20।।
explanation: If forsaken, O Lord I shall not live a life of sorrow. Instant death is better (than abandoned existence).

content: इमं हि सहितुं शोकं मुहूर्तमपि नोत्सहे।किं पुनर्दशवर्षाणि त्रीणि चैकं च दुःखिता।।2.30.21।।
explanation: I cannot bear this grief even for a moment, what to speak of fourteen (ten and three and one) years of grieving.

content: इति सा शोकसन्तप्ता विलप्य करुणं बहु।चुक्रोश पतिमायस्ता भृशमालिङ्ग्य सस्वरम्।।2.30.22।।
explanation: Tormented with grief, Sita piteously and profusely lamented, and then exhausted,  embraced her husband  tightly and cried bitterly.

content: सा विद्धा बहुभिर्वाक्यैर्दिग्धैरिव गजाङ्गना।चिरसन्नियतं बाष्पं मुमोचाग्निमिवारणिः।।2.30.23।।
explanation: Pierced by so many words (of objection from  Rama), Sita felt like a cowelephant penetrated by poisonsmeared arrrows. And shed her longsuppressed tears like arani (a firekindling stick) kindling fire.

content: तस्या स्फटिकसङ्काशं वारि सन्तापसम्भवम्।नेत्राभ्यां परिसुस्राव पङ्कजाभ्यामिवोदकम्।।2.30.24।।
explanation: Crystallike tears arising out of distress flowed from her eyes like water trickling from two lotuses.

content: तच्चैवामलचन्द्राभं मुखमायतलोचनम्।पर्यशुष्यत बाष्पेण जलोद्धृतमिवाम्बुजम्।।2.30.25।।
explanation: Her face with large eyes assumed the brightness of an immaculate Moon and withered with tears like a lotus plucked out of water.

content: तां परिष्वज्य बाहुभ्यां विसंज्ञामिव दुःखिताम्।उवाच वचनं रामः परिविश्वासयंस्तदा।।2.30.26।।
explanation: With his arms Rama embraced Sita who had almost fainted in grief. And in order to create confidence in her he said these words:

content: न देवि तव दुःखेन स्वर्गमप्यभिरोचये।न हि मेऽस्ति भयं किञ्चित्स्वयम्भोरिव सर्वतः।।2.30.27।।
explanation: When you are in grief O Devi I do not desire even heaven. Like the selfcreated Brahma, I have no fear for any one.

content: तव सर्वमभिप्रायमविज्ञाय शुभानने।वासं न रोचयेऽरण्ये शक्तिमानपि रक्षणे।।2.30.28।।
explanation: O Sita of auspicious countenance even though I am capable of protecting you I did not like your stay in the forest as I did not know your intentions.

content: यत्सृष्टाऽसि मया सार्धं वनवासाय मैथिलि।न विहातुं मया शक्या कीर्तिरात्मवता यथा।।2.30.29।।
explanation: Since you, O daughter of Mithila, were born to go along with me to the forest, I cannot abandon you just as a selfrespecting man cannot forsake his reputation.

content: धर्मस्तु गजनासोरु सद्भिराचरितः पुरा।तं चाहमनुवर्तेऽद्य यथा सूर्यं सुवर्चला।।2.30.30।।
explanation: O one  with (shapely) thighs like the trunk of an elephant follow only the path of righteousness practised earlier by the virtuous as Suvarchala follows the Sun.

content: न खल्वहं न गच्छेयं वनं जनकनन्दिनि।वचनं तन्नयति मां पितु स्सत्योपबृंहितम्।।2.30.31।।
explanation: Not that I shall not go to the forest (go I must). My father's word nourished by truth is leading me there, O daughter of Janaka

content: एष धर्मस्तु सुश्रोणि पितुर्मातुश्च वश्यता।अतश्च तं व्यतिक्रम्य नाहं जीवितुमुत्सहे।।2.30.32।।
explanation: Obedience to parents is a righteous act. Therefore, O one with fair hips I cannot live and disobey the word of truth.

content: अस्वाधीनं कथं दैवं प्रकारैरभिराध्यते।स्वाधीनं समतिक्रम्य मातरं पितरं गुरुम्।।2.30.33।।
explanation: Mother, father and preceptor are present before us. By overstepping them, how can we, in various ways, worship God who is beyond reach (not visible)?

content: यत्त्रयं तत्त्रयो लोकाः पवित्रं तत्समं भुवि।नान्यदस्ति शुभापाङ्गे तेनेदमभिराध्यते।।2.30.34।।
explanation: Where these three(mother,father and preceptor) equal to the three worlds are, O one with loverly sideglances, there is none in this world as holy. Therefore, they are to be worshipped.

content: न सत्यं दानमानौ वा न यज्ञाश्चाप्तदक्षिणाः।तथा बलकरा स्सीते यथा सेवा पितुर्हिता।।2.30.35।।
explanation: Truth or munificence or homage or distribution of gifts to the revered ones or sacrifices, O Sita, are  not considered as efficacious as service to father.

content: स्वर्गो धनं वा धान्यं वा विद्याः पुत्रास्सुखानि च।गुरुवृत्त्यनुरोधेन न किञ्चिदपि दुर्लभम्।।2.30.36।।
explanation: By fulfilling father's wish, nothing is difficult to achieve, whether it is heaven, or wealth, or foodgrains, or learning, or sons or other comforts.

content: देवगन्धर्वगोलोकान्ब्रह्मलोकां स्तथाऽपरान्।प्राप्नुवन्ति महात्मानो मातापितृपरायणाः।।2.30.37।।
explanation: Great men who are devoted to the service of their parents attain the world of the gods, of gandharvas, of cows, of Visnu, of Brahma and other worlds.

content: स मां पिता यथा शास्ति सत्यधर्मपथे स्थितः।तथा वर्तितुमिच्छामि स हि धर्मस्सनातनः।।2.30.38।।
explanation: My father who follows the path of truth and dharma whatever be his commands, I wish to obey. He is, indeed, dharma eternal.

content: मम सन्ना मतिस्सीते त्वां नेतुं दण्डकावनम्।वसिष्यामीति सा त्वं मामनुयातुं सुनिश्चिता।।2.30.39।।
explanation: O Sita, my discretion fails me in deciding whether to take you to Dandaka forest or not. You are, however, firmly determined to follow me, saying, you can live in the forest.

content: सा हि सृष्टाऽनवद्याङ्गि वनाय मदिरेक्षणे।अनुगच्छस्व मां भीरु सहधर्मचरी भव।।2.30.40।।
explanation: O one with fascinating eyes and exquisite beauty you were born to live in the forest. O gentle lady, assist me in carrying out my duties.

content: सर्वथा सदृशं सीते मम स्वस्य कुलस्य च।व्यवसायमनुक्रान्ता कान्ते त्वमतिशोभनम्।।2.30.41।।
explanation: You, O my lovely beloved Sita, have taken in the right time a highly dignified decision befitting in all ways your family, myself and yourself.

content: आरभस्व शुभश्रोणि वनवासक्षमाः क्रियाः।नेदानीं त्वदृते सीते स्वर्गोऽपि मम रोचते।।2.30.42।।
explanation: O Sita, begin right now all preparations necessary for residing in the forest. O one, with beautiful buttocks, without you even the very heaven does not please me.

content: ब्राह्मणेभ्यश्च रत्नानि भिक्षुकेभ्यश्च भोजनम्।देहि चाशंसमानेभ्य स्सन्त्वरस्व च मा चिरम्।।2.30.43।।
explanation: Give away your jewels to brahmins who need them and food to religious mendicants. Hurry up Do not delay.

content: भूषणानि महार्हाणि वरवस्त्राणि यानि च।रमणीयाश्च ये केचित्क्रीडार्थाश्चाप्युपस्कराः।।2.30.44।।शयनीयानि यानानि मम चान्यानि यानि च।देहि स्वभृत्यवर्गस्य ब्राह्मणानामनन्तरम्।।2.30.45।।
explanation: Distribute among your attendants highly valuable ornaments and excellent clothing, charming articles meant for (court) sport, my couches, chariots and all other things. Offer the rest to brahmins.

content: अनुकूलं तु सा भर्तुर्ज्ञात्वा गमनमात्मनः।क्षिप्रं प्रमुदिता देवी दातुमेवोपचक्रमे।।2.30.46।।
explanation: Having come to know that her departure to the forest is acceptable to her husband, Sita, highly delighted, quickly got ready to give away (things).

content: ततः प्रहृष्टा प्रतिपूर्णमानसायशश्विनी भर्तुरवेक्ष्य भाषितम्।धनानि रत्नानि च दातुमङ्गनाप्रचक्रमे धर्मभृतां मनस्स्विनी।।2.30.47।।
explanation: Having heard her husband, the glorious and broadminded Sita was delighted with her desires fulfiled. She made preparations to gift away her wealth including jewels to the virtuous.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtieth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic  composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Lakshmana gets ready to accompany Rama takes leave of his friends and collects divine weapons from preceptor Vasistha--Rama asks Lakshmana to  distribute his wealth among brahmins.]एवं शृत्वा तु संवादं लक्ष्मणः पूर्वमागतः।बाष्पपर्याकुलमुखः शोकं सोढुमशक्नुवन्।।2.31.1।।स भ्रातुश्चरणौ गाढं निपीड्य रघुनन्दनः।सीतामुवाचातियशां राघवं च महाव्रतम्।।2.31.2।।
explanation: Lakshmana who had already reached there heard the conversation (between Sita and Rama). His eyes brimming with tears, he was unable to bear the grief. He held the feet of his brother tightly and said to the illustrious Sita and Rama of great resolve:

content: एवं शृत्वा तु संवादं लक्ष्मणः पूर्वमागतः।बाष्पपर्याकुलमुखः शोकं सोढुमशक्नुवन्।।2.31.1।।स भ्रातुश्चरणौ गाढं निपीड्य रघुनन्दनः।सीतामुवाचातियशां राघवं च महाव्रतम्।।2.31.2।।
explanation: Lakshmana who had already reached there heard the conversation (between Sita and Rama). His eyes brimming with tears, he was unable to bear the grief. He held the feet of his brother tightly and said to the illustrious Sita and Rama of great resolve:

content: यदि गन्तुं कृताबुद्धिर्वनं मृगगजायुतम्।अहं त्वानुगमिष्यामि वनमग्रे धनुर्धरः।।2.31.3।।
explanation: If you have decided to go to the forest where deer and elephants abound, I shall also accompany you by walking before you, holding the bow.

content: मया समेतोऽरण्यानि बहूनि विचरिष्यसि।पक्षिभिर्मृगयूथैश्च संघुष्टानि समन्ततः।।2.31.4।।
explanation: Accompanied by me, you will roam the forests echoing with the cries of birds and sounds of herds of animals.

content: न देवलोकाक्रमणं नामरत्वमहं वृणे।ऐश्वर्यं वापि लोकानां कामये न त्वया विना।।2.31.5।।
explanation: Without you, I do not want victory over the gods or sovereignty over the worlds or even immortality.

content: एवं ब्रुवाणस्सौमित्रिर्वनवासाय निश्चितः।रामेण बहुभिस्सान्त्वैर्निषिध्दः पुनरब्रवीत्।।2.31.6।।
explanation: When Rama tried to dissuade Lakshmana with many words of consolation Lakshmana who was determined to go to the forest said again:

content: अनुज्ञातश्च भवता पूर्वमेव यदस्म्यहम्।किमिदानीं पुनरिदं क्रियते मन्निवारणम्।।2.31.7।।
explanation: You have granted permission to me earlier.Why are you now preventing me?

content: यदर्थं प्रतिषेधो मे क्रियते गन्तुमिच्छतः।एतदिच्छामि विज्ञातुं संशयो हि ममानघ।।2.31.8।।
explanation: I wish to know, O sinless one, the reason why you are dissuading me, when I am willing to go with you. This creates a doubt in my mind.

content: ततोऽब्रवीन्महातेजा रामो लक्ष्मणमग्रतः।स्थितं प्राग्गामिनं वीरं याचमानं कृताञ्जलिम्।।2.31.9।।
explanation: Addressing the heroic Lakshmana in front of him imploring with folded hands to take him to the forest so that he may walk ahead (and guard them), the effulgent Rama said:

content: स्निग्धो धर्मरतो वीरस्सततं सत्पथे स्थितः।प्रियः प्राणसमो वश्यो भ्राता चापि सखा च मे।।2.31.10।।
explanation: You are affectionate, you are devoted to dharma. You are valiant. You always walk the path of virtue. You are dear to me like my own life. You are not only an obedient brother but also a friend.

content: मयाऽद्य सह सौमित्रे त्वयि गच्छति तद्वनम्।को भरिष्यति कौसल्यां सुमित्रां वा यशस्विनीम्।।2.31.11।।
explanation: O Lakshmana, if you also accompany me to the forest, who will take care of mother Kausalya and the illustrious Sumitra?

content: अभिवर्षति कामैर्यः पर्जन्यः पृथिवीमिव।स कामपाशपर्यस्तो महातेजा महीपतिः।।2.31.12।।
explanation: Dasaratha, the mighty king like Parjanya (the raingod), lord of the earth used to shower favours on earth. But now he is bound by the noose of passion.

content: सा हि राज्यमिदं प्राप्य नृपस्याश्वपते स्सुता।दुःखितानां सपत्नीनां न करिष्यति शोभनम्।।2.31.13।।
explanation: Once the daughter of king Aswapati (Kaikeyi) gains control over the kingdom, she will do nothing to help her afflicted cowives (Kausalya and Sumitra).

content: न स्मरिष्यति कौसल्यां सुमित्रां च सुदुःखिताम्।भरतो राज्यमासाद्य कैकेय्यां पर्यवस्थितः।।2.31.14।।
explanation: When Bharata secures the kingdom, his confidence reposed in Kaikeyi he will not bother about the miserable Kausalya and Sumitra.

content: तामार्यां स्वयमेवेह राजानुग्रहणेन वा।सौमित्रे भर कौशल्यामुक्तमर्थमिमं चर।।2.31.15।।
explanation: Either by yourself or by seeking the favour of the king, O son of Sumitra, lend support to venerable  Kausalya. This is the objective you must accomplish.

content: एवं मम च ते भक्तिर्भविष्यति सुदर्शिता।धर्मज्ञ गुरुपूजायां धर्मश्चाप्यतुलो महान्।।2.31.16।।
explanation: If you do this, your devotion to me will be amply demonstrated. Service to the elders, O dutiful one, is a virtue, great and unequalled.

content: एवं कुरुष्व सौमित्रे मत्कृते रघुनन्दन।अस्माभिर्विप्रहीणाया मातुर्नो न भवेत्सुखम्।।2.31.17।।
explanation: O delight of the Raghu race, do this for my sake, since deprived of us, there will be no happiness for our mother, O son of Sumitra

content: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण लक्ष्मण श्श्लक्ष्णया गिरा।प्रत्युवाच तदा रामं वाक्यज्ञो वाक्यकोविदम्।।2.31.18।।
explanation: Thus addressed by Rama who was an adept in the use of words, eloquent Lakshmana gently replied:

content: तवैव तेजसा वीर भरतः पूजयिष्यति।कौसल्यां च सुमित्रां च प्रयतो नात्र संशयः।।2.31.19।।
explanation: Aware of your power O valiant one, Bharata will undoubtedly pay respect to Kausalya and Sumitra with all humility.

content: कौशल्या बिभृयादार्या सहस्रमपि मद्विधान्।यस्यास्सहस्रं ग्रामाणां सम्प्राप्त मुपजीवनम्।।2.31.20।।
explanation: Noble Kausalya has under her charge a thousand villages for her sustenance. She can support a thousand men like me.

content: तदात्मभरणे चैव मम मातुस्तथैव च।पर्याप्ता मद्विधानां च भरणाय यशस्विनी।।2.31.21।।
explanation: Illustrious Kausalya is competent enough to support herself, my mother and men  like me.

content: कुरुष्व मामनुचरं वैधर्म्यं नेह विद्यते।कृतार्थोऽहं भविष्यामि तव चार्थः प्रकल्पते।।2.31.22।।
explanation: Make me your follower. There is no breach of virtue in this. I will have my purpose accomplished. Your object also will be fulfilled.

content: धनुरादाय सशरं खनित्रपिटकाधरः।अग्रतस्ते गमिष्यामि पन्थानमनुदर्शयन्।।2.31.23।।
explanation: Holding the bow and arrows and carrying a crowbar and a basket, I shall go in front of you leading the way.

content: आहरिष्यामि ते नित्यं मूलानि च फलानि च।वन्यानि यानि चान्यानि स्वाहाराणि तपस्विनाम्।।2.31.24।।
explanation: I shall daily collect roots, fruits and other forest products fit for ascetics.

content: भवांस्तु सह वैदेह्या गिरिसानुषु रंस्यते।अहं सर्वं करिष्यामि जाग्रत स्स्वपतश्च ते।।2.31.25।।
explanation: When you go about for pleasure on mountain slopes along with Sita, I shall do everything for you, whether you are awake or asleep.

content: रामस्त्वनेन वाक्येन सुप्रीतः प्रत्युवाच तम्।व्रजापृच्छस्व सौमित्रे सर्वमेव सुहृज्जनम्।।2.31.26।।
explanation: Pleased with his words Rama said, O Lakshmana go and take leave of all your friends.

content: ये च राज्ञो ददौ दिव्ये महात्मा वरुण स्स्वयम्।जनकस्य महायज्ञे धनुषी रौद्रदर्शने।।2.31.27।।अभेद्यकवचे दिव्ये तूणी चाक्षयसायकौ।आदित्यविमलौ चोभौ खड्गौ हेमपरिष्कृतौ।।2.31.28।।सत्कृत्य निहितं सर्वमेतदाचार्यसद्मनि।सर्वमायुधमादाय क्षिप्रमाव्रज लक्ष्मण।।2.31.29।।
explanation: O Lakshmana in the great sacrifice performed by the highsouled Janaka, Varuna himself gave him two aweinspiring celestial bows, two impenetrable divine armours, two quivers with inexhaustible arrows, two swords plated with gold and as bright as the sun. All these weapons are deposited in the house of our preceptor (sage Vasistha) where they are being worshipped. Go and bring them swiftly.

content: स सुहृज्जनमामन्त्र्यवनवासाय निश्चितः।इक्ष्वाकुगुरुमागम्य जग्राहायुधमुत्तमम्।।2.31.30।।
explanation: Lakshmana, who was resolved to go to the forest, took leave of his friends, and collected from the house of Vasistha, preceptor of the Ikshvaku race, the powerful weapons deposited with him.

content: तद्धिव्यं राजशार्दूल सत्कृतं माल्यभूषितम्।रामाय दर्शयामास सौमित्रिस्सर्वमायुधम्।।2.31.31।।
explanation: Lakshmana, tiger among princes, brought all those divine weapons sanctified and  decorated with garlands and showed them to Rama.

content: तमुवाचात्मवान् रामः प्रीत्या लक्ष्मणमागतम्।काले त्वमागत सौम्य काङ्क्षिते मम लक्ष्मण।।2.31.32।।
explanation: O handsome Lakshmana, you have come at the expected time, said the selfpossessed Rama affectionately when he saw him arrive.

content: अहं प्रदातुमिच्छामि यदिदं मामकं धनम्।ब्राह्मणेभ्यस्तपस्विभ्यस्त्वया सह परन्तप।।2.31.33।।
explanation: Let us give away, O tormentor of enemies (Lakshmana) my belogings to the ascetic brahmins.

content: वसन्तीह दृढं भक्त्या गुरुषु द्विजसत्तमाः।तेषामपि च मे भूयस्सर्वेषाञ्चोपजीविनाम्।।2.31.34।।
explanation: Here live the best of brahmins who are deeply devoted to their teachers along with those who are dependent on me for their livelihood.

content: वशिष्ठपुत्रं तु सुयज्ञमार्यंत्वमानयाशु प्रवरं द्विजानाम्।अभिप्रयास्यामि वनं समस्तानभ्यर्च्य शिष्टानपरान् द्विजातीन्।।2.31.35।।
explanation: Fetch Suyajna, son of Vasistha, best among the brahmins along with all other distinguished brahmins to whom I will pay my homage and leave for the forest.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyfirst sarga of Ayodhyakanda of  the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama honours Suyajna with valuable gifts--distributes his wealth to dependents, brahmins and to sageTrijata.]ततश्शासन माज्ञाय भ्रातु श्शुभतरं प्रियम्।गत्वा स प्रविवेशाशु सुयज्ञस्य निवेशनम्।।2.32.1।।
explanation: Lakshmana having understood the very auspicious and welcome order (of Rama)  immediately  proceeded to the house of Suyajna.

content: तं विप्रमग्न्यगारस्थं वन्दित्वा लक्ष्मणोऽब्रवीत्।सखेऽभ्यागच्छ पश्य त्वं वेश्म दुष्करकारिणः।।2.32.2।।
explanation: Lakshmana paid homage to him who was in the firesanctuary, and said O friend, come and see the palace of Rama who is the accomplisher of all difficult tasks.

content: ततस्सन्ध्यामुपास्याशु गत्वा सौमित्रिणा सह।जुष्टं तत्प्राविशल्लक्ष्म्या रम्यं रामनिवेशनम्।।2.32.3।।
explanation: After performing the twilight prayers, Suyajna along with Lakshmana went straight away and entered the beautiful and prosperous palace of Rama.

content: तमागतं वेदविदं प्राञ्जलिस्सीतया सह।सुयज्ञमभिचक्राम राघवोऽग्निमिवार्चितम्।।2.32.4।।
explanation: On the arrival of sage Suyajna wellversed in the Vedas, both Rama and Sita offered obeisance to him as to firegod and circumambulated him.

content: जातरूपमयैर्मुख्यैरङ्गदैः कुण्डलैः शुभैः।सहेमसूत्रैर्मणिभिः केयूरैर्वलयैरपि।।2.32.5।।अन्यैश्च रत्नैर्बहुभिः काकुत्स्थः प्रत्यपूजयत्।सुयज्ञं स तदोवाच रामस्सीता प्रचोदितः।।2.32.6।।
explanation: Rama, scion of the Kakutstha dynasty, worshipped Suyajna with a collection of golden ornaments such as earrings, anklets, armlets, bracelets and many other ornaments of precious stones. Then urged by Sita, Rama said to him:

content: हारं च हेमसूत्रं च भार्यायै सौम्य हारय।रशनां चाधुना सीता दातुमिच्छति ते सखे।।2.32.7।।
explanation: O handsome friend now Sita intends to give away to your wife her necklace, her golden chain and girdle. Could you accept them?

content: अङ्गदानि विचित्राणि केयूराणि शुभानि च।प्रयच्छति सखे तुभ्यं भार्यायै गच्छती वनम्।।2.32.8।।
explanation: Sita is departing for the forest and offers your wife her armlets, wonderful and elegant  bracelets.

content: पर्यङ्कमग्य्रास्तरणं नानारत्नविभूषितम्।तमपीच्छति वैदेही प्रतिष्ठापयितुं त्वयि।।2.32.9।।
explanation: Sita also wishes to give away a couch with an exquisite cover, encrusted with a variety of precious stones.

content: नाग श्शत्रुञ्जयो नाम मातुलोऽयं ददौ मम।तं ते गजसहस्रेण ददामि द्विजसत्तम।।2.32.10।।
explanation: I am gifting you, O best among brahmins a thousand elephants including Satrunjaya an elephant my maternal uncle had given me.

content: इत्युक्तस्स हि रामेण सुयज्ञः प्रतिगृहृयतत्।रामलक्ष्मणसीतानां प्रयुयोजाशिष श्शुभाः।।2.32.11।।
explanation: Thus addressed by Rama, Suyajna accepted the gifts and conferred auspicious blessings on Rama, Lakshmana and Sita.

content: अथ भ्रातरमव्यग्रं प्रियं रामः प्रियंवदः।सौमित्रिं तमुवाचेदं ब्रह्मेव त्रिदशेश्वरम्।।2.32.12।।
explanation: Sweettongued Rama calmly said to his brother (Lakshmana) like Brahma addressing Indra:

content: अगस्त्यं कौशिकं चैव तावुभौ ब्राह्मणोत्तमौ। अर्चयाहूय सौमित्रे रत्नैस्सस्यमिवाम्बुभिः।।2.32.13।।
explanation: O Lakshmana invite Agastya and Kausika, the two celebrated brahmins, and bestow on them with reverence plenty of precious gems like showers of rain on standing crops.

content: तर्पयस्व महाबाहो गोसहस्रैश्च मानद।सुवर्णै रजतैश्चैव मणिभिश्च महाधनैः।।2.32.14।।
explanation: Satisfy them, O highlyarmed Lakshmana, O bestower of honour with a thousand cows, gold, silver and with the great wealth of gems.

content: कौसल्यां च य आशीर्भिर्भक्तः पर्युपतिष्ठति।आचार्यस्तैत्तिरीयाणामभिरूपश्च वेदवित्।।2.32.15।।तस्य यानं च दासीश्च सौमित्रे सम्प्रदापय।कौशेयानि च वस्त्राणि यावत्तुष्यति स द्विजः।।2.32.16।।
explanation: O Lakshmana, give away chariots, maidservants, silk clothes to learned brahmins of Taittiriya branch and wellversed in the Vedas, to agreeable and faithful brahmins attending on Kausalya with their blessings till they are fully satisfied.

content: सूतश्चित्ररथश्चार्य सचिवस्सुचिरोषितः।तोषयैनं महार्हैश्च रत्नैर्वस्त्रैर्धनैस्तथा।।2.32.17।।पशुकाभिश्च सर्वाभिर्गवां दशशतेन च।
explanation: Noble counsellor (of our father) and charioteer Chitraratha has been in our service for many years. Gratify him with invaluable jewels, clothes, wealth, with young female calves and a thousand cows.

content: ये चेमे कठकालापा बहवो दण्डमाणवाः।।2.32.18।।नित्यस्वाध्यायशीलत्वान्नान्यत्कुर्वन्ति किञ्चन।अलसा स्वादुकामाश्च महतां चापि सम्मताः।।2.32.19।।तेषामशीतियानानि रत्नपूर्णानि दापय।शालिवाहसहस्रं च द्वे शते भद्रकां स्तथा।।2.32.20।।व्यञ्जनार्थं च सौमित्रे गोसहस्रमुपाकुरु।
explanation: O Lakshmana many brahmacharis with a staff (as a mark of religious authority) wellversed in Katha and Kalapa portions of the Vedas engaged daily in the study of the Vedas and nothing else. Not active otherwise, they are fond of delicious food and are respected even by great people. Give them eighty carts filled with gems, a thousand bulls capable of carrying paddy, and two hundred oxen capable of  ploughing land and a thousand cows for preparing food (with milk products).

content: मेखलीनां महासङ्घः कौसल्यां समुपस्थितः।।2.32.21।।तेषां सहस्रं सौमित्रे प्रत्येकं सम्प्रदापय।
explanation: Give each of the large number of brahmacharis wearing girdles and working under Kausalya a thousand (cows or gold coins), O Lakshmana

content: अम्बा यथा च सा नन्देत्कौसल्या मम दक्षिणाम्।।2.32.22।।तथा द्विजातीस्ता न्सर्वान् लक्ष्मणार्चय सर्वशः।
explanation: You should, O Lakshmana treat all those brahmins in such a way that my mother shall be pleased on seeing my respectful offerings.

content: तत स्सपुरुषव्याघ्रस्तद्धनं लक्ष्मणः स्वयम्।।2.32.23।।यथोक्तं ब्राह्मणेन्द्राणांमददाद्धनदो यथा।
explanation: Thereupon Lakshmana, a tiger among men, personally distributed like Kubera, gifts of riches to all those Indras among brahmins (best of brahmins) in accordance with the instructions of Rama.

content: अथाऽब्रवीद्बाष्पकलांस्तिष्ठतश्चोपजीविनः।।2.32.24।।सम्प्रदायबहुद्रव्यमेकैकस्योपजीवनम्।
explanation: Rama then bestowed abundant wealth on each of the dependents as they stood with their throats choked with tears, saying:

content: लक्ष्मणस्य च यद्वेश्म गृहं च यदिदं मम।।2.32.25।।अशून्यं कार्यमेकैकं यावदागमनं मम।
explanation: Till I come back, guard each of the palaces of Lakshmana and mine and ensure that they are not left unattended.

content: इत्युक्त्वा दुःखितं सर्वं जनं तमुपजीविनम्।।2.32.26।।उवाचेदं धनाध्यक्षं धनमानीयतामिति।
explanation: Having spoken thus to all dependents who were overcome with grief, Rama ordered the  treasury officer to bring the entire treasure.

content: ततोऽस्य धनमाजह्रुस्सर्वमेवोपजीविनः।।2.32.27।।स राशिस्सुमहांस्तत्र दर्शनीयो ह्यदृश्यत।
explanation: When all the dependents fetched the entire wealth of Rama, they were pleased to see the great heap of wealth.

content: ततस्सपुरुषव्याघ्र स्तद्धनं सहलक्ष्मणः।।2.32.28।।द्विजेभ्यो बालवृद्धेभ्यः कृपणेभ्योऽह्यदापयत्।
explanation: Rama, best among men, got the entire wealth distributed among indigent brahmins, and young and old alike with the help of Lakshmana.

content: तत्रासीत्पिङ्गलो गार्ग्यस्त्रिजटो नाम वै द्विजः।।2.32.29।।क्षतवृत्तिर्वने नित्यं फालकुद्दाललाङ्गली।
explanation: A brahmin by name, Trijata, a descendant of sage Garga and of reddishbrown colour used to live in that region earning his livelihood in the forest by digging the earth with an ironspade and a plough.

content: तं वृद्धं तरुणी भार्या बालानादाय दारकान्।।2.32.30।।अब्रवीद्बाह्मणं वाक्यं दारिद्र्येणाभिपीडिता।
explanation: His young wife, highly distressed due to poverty, keeping her young sons before her said to the aged brahmin:

content: अपास्य फालं कुद्दालं कुरुष्व वचनं मम।।2.32.31।।रामं दर्शय धर्मज्ञं यदि किञ्चिदवाप्स्यसि।
explanation: Listen to me throw away this ironspade. Go and see the righteous Rama.You may obtain something.

content: स भार्यावचनं श्रुत्वा शाटीमाच्छाद्य दुश्छदाम्।।2.32.32।।स प्रातिष्ठत पन्थानं यत्र रामनिवेशनम्।
explanation: At the words of his wife, Trijata took the path to Rama's palace, having wrapped  himself with a torn upper garment .

content: भृग्वङ्गिरसमं दीप्त्या त्रिजटं जनसंसदि।।2.32.33।।आपञ्चमायाः कक्ष्यायाः नैनं कश्चिदवारयत्।
explanation: No one in the crowd stopped Tirjata until he reached the fifth courtyard as he looked like Bhrigu and Angirasa in brilliance.

content: स राजपुत्रमासाद्य त्रिजटो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।2.32.34।।निर्धनो बहुपुत्रोऽस्मि राजपुत्र महायशः।उञ्छवृत्तिर्वने नित्यं प्रत्यवेक्षस्व मामिति।।2.32.35।।
explanation: Trijata approached Rama and said O illustrious prince I am a destitute and have many children. I am  living in the forest by collecting leftover grains. Look at me.

content: तमुवाच ततो राम: परिहास समन्वितम्।गवां सहस्रमप्येकं न नु विश्राणितं मया।।2.32.36।।परिक्षिपसि दण्डेन यावत्तावदवाप्स्यसि।
explanation: Rama jokingly replied to him, I have not yet gifted one thousand cows. Throw your staff and the cows on the space your staff covers will be yours.

content: स शाटीं त्वरितः कट्यां सम्भ्रान्तः परिवेष्ट्य ताम्।।2.32.37।।आविद्ध्य दण्डं चिक्षेप सर्वप्राणेन वेगितः।
explanation: Bewildered Trijata swiftly tightened up his upper garment around his waist, set the direction for his staff and hurled it with all his might.

content: स तीर्त्वा सरयूपारं दण्डस्तस्य कराच्च्युतः।।2.32.38।।गोव्रजे बहुसाहस्रे पपातोक्षणसन्निधौ।
explanation: The staff he hurled crossed the bank of the river Sarayu and fell near a bull in the midst of a thousands cows.

content: तं परिष्वज्य धर्मात्मा आतस्मात्सरयूतटात्।।2.32.39।।आनयामास ता गोपै स्त्रिजटायाश्रमं प्रति।
explanation: The virtuous Rama embraced Trijata, and despatched all the cattle extending up to the bank of Sarayu to his hermitage.

content: उवाच स ततो रामस्तं गार्ग्यमभिसान्त्वयन्।मन्युर्न खलु कर्तव्यः परिहासो ह्ययं मम।।2.32.40।।
explanation: Afterwards Rama sought to placate Trijata, that descendant of Ganga, saying: This was a joke. Do not be angry.

content: इदं हि तेजस्तव यद्दुरत्ययं तदेव जिज्ञासितुमिच्छता मया।इमं भवानर्थमभि प्रचोदितोवृणीष्व किं चेदपरं व्यवस्यति।।2.32.41।।
explanation: Your power is unsurpassable and to ascertain this, I incited you to do this act. If there is anything else, ask for it.

content: ब्रवीमि सत्येन नतेऽस्ति यन्त्रणा धनं हि यद्यन्मम विप्रकारणात्।भवत्सु सम्यक्प्रतिपादनेन तन्मयार्जितं प्रीतियशस्करं भवेत्।।2.32.42।।
explanation: Truly speaking, there is no limit to seeking wealth. My wealth is specifically meant for brahmins. By distributing all the wealth earned by me, I get pleasure and renown.

content: तत स्सभार्य स्त्रिजटो महामुनिर्गवामनीकं प्रतिगृह्य मोदितः।यशोबलप्रीतिसुखोपबृंहणीस्तदाशिष: प्रत्यवदन्महात्मनः।।2.32.43।।
explanation: Thereafter that great sage Trijata along with his wife, immensely happy to receive multitudes of cows, pronounced blessings on the magnanimous Rama for glory, power, pleasure and prosperity.

content: स चापि रामः प्रतिपूर्णमानसोमहद्धनं धर्मबलैरुपार्जितम्।नियोजयामास सुहृज्जनेऽचिराद्यथार्हसम्मानवचः प्रचोदितः।।2.32.44।।
explanation: Prompted by the deserving words of acclaim from his friends, Rama distributed with joy and without delay the entire wealth earned by him through dharma.

content: द्विज स्सुहृद्भृत्यजनोऽथवा तदा दरिद्रभिक्षाचरणश्च योऽभवत्।न तत्र कश्चिन्न बभूव तर्पितोयथार्हसम्मानन दान सम्भ्रमैः।।2.32.46।।
explanation: Thus there was none among those brahmins, attendants, poor people, and beggars, who was not satisfied with the honour (received) or with the charity.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे द्वात्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtysecond sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama along with Sita and Lakshmana goes to the residence of Kaikeyi--hears comments on the way.]दत्त्वा तु सह वैदेह्या ब्राह्मणेभ्यो धनं बहु।जग्मतुः पितरं द्रष्टुं सीतया सह राघवौ।।2.33.1।।
explanation: After giving away plenty of wealth to brahmins in charity, Rama and Lakshmana along with Sita set out to see their father, king Dasaratha.

content: ततो गृहीते दुष्प्रेक्षे त्वशोभेतां तदायुधे।मालादामभिराबद्धे सीतया समलङ्कृते।।2.33.2।।
explanation: The pair of dazzling weapons held (by Rama and Lakshmana) looked splendid decorated with flower garlands by Sita.

content: ततः प्रासादहर्म्याणि विमानशिखराणि च।अधिरुह्य जनश्श्रीमानुदासीनो व्यलोकयत्।।2.33.3।।
explanation: The rich climbed their palaces and mansions, terraces of sevenstoried buildings and watched them sadly.

content: न हि रथ्याः स्म शक्यन्ते गन्तुं बहुजनाकुलाः।आरुह्य तस्मात्प्रासादान् दीनाः पश्यन्ति राघवम्।।2.33.4।।
explanation: The streets were so thronged with multitudes of citizens that they were impassable. Therefore, people felt miserable and ascended their mansions and gazed at Rama.

content: पदातिं वर्जितच्छत्रं रामं दृष्ट्वा जनास्तदा।ऊचुर्बहुविधा वाच श्शोकोपहतचेतसः।।2.33.5।।
explanation: Seeing Rama walking without the royal umbrella, people were very much shocked. They expressed their reaction in so many words:

content: यं यान्तमनुयाति स्म चतुरङ्गबलं महत्।तमेकं सीतया सार्धमनुयाति स्म लक्ष्मणः।।2.33.6।।
explanation: Whenever Rama went out, powerful army of four divisions used to follow him. Today he is walking alone followed by Lakshmana and Sita.

content: ऐश्वर्यस्य रसज्ञः सन् कामिनां चैव कामदः।नेच्छत्येवानृतं कर्तुं पितरं धर्मगौरवात्।।2.33.7।।
explanation: Rama who enjoyed the comforts of affluence gratifies those who have desires. Out of veneration for righteousness, he does not want to prove his father false (to his promise).

content: या न शक्या पुरा द्रष्टुं भूतैराकाशगैरपि।तामद्य सीतां पश्यन्ति राजमार्गगता जनाः।।2.33.8।।
explanation: It was not possible even for the creatures wandering in the sky (birds) to have a glimpse of Sita before. Now passersby walking the highway can behold her.

content: अङ्गरागोचितां सीतां रक्तचन्दनसेविनीम्।वर्षमुष्णं च शीतं च नेष्यन्त्याशु विवर्णताम्।।2.33.9।।
explanation: Sita who used to apply fragrant unguents and smear the body with redsandal cream will now be exposed to the rain, the heat and the cold which will quickly discolour her body.

content: अद्य नूनं दशरथस्सत्त्वमाविश्य भाषते।न हि राजा प्रियं पुत्रं विवासयितुमर्हति।।2.33.10।।
explanation: Surely king Dasaratha possessed of an evil spirit spoke the way he did today. Otherwise, should a king banish his beloved son?

content: निर्गुणस्यापि पुत्रस्य कथं स्याद्विप्रवासनम्।किं पुनर्यस्य लोकोऽयं जितो वृत्तेन केवलम्।।2.33.11।।
explanation: Even a son who is bereft of virtues cannot be banished, what to say about Rama, who by good conduct alone has conquered the world.

content: अनृशंस्यमनुक्रोशः श्रुतं शीलं दमश्शमः।राघवं शोभयन्त्येते षड्गुणाः पुरुषोत्तमम्।।2.33.12।।
explanation: Harmlessness, compassion, learning, good conduct, restraint of senses and selfcontrol, all these six qualities adorn Rama, the greatest among men.

content: तस्मात्तस्योपघातेन प्रजाः परमपीडिताः।औदकानीव सत्त्वानि ग्रीष्मे सलिलसङ्क्षयात्।।2.33.13।।
explanation: Therefore, people are deeply pained to see Rama afflicted. They look like aquatic creatures in summer when the water dries up.

content: पीडया पीडितं सर्वं जगदस्य जगत्पतेः।मूलस्येवोपघातेन वृक्षः पुष्पफलोपगः।।2.33.14।।
explanation: Just as severed at the root, an entire tree along with its fruits and flowers is destroyed, similarly the whole world gets afflicted when Rama, the ruler of the world, comes to harm.

content: मूलं ह्येष मनुष्याणां धर्मसारो महाद्युतिः।पुष्पं फलं च पत्रं च शाखाश्चास्येतरे जनाः।।2.33.15।।
explanation: Effulgent Rama personifies the essence of dharma. He is the root of  (the tree of) humanity. The other people are connected with this tree like flowers, fruit, leaves and branches.

content: ते लक्ष्मण इव क्षिप्रं सपत्न्य स्सहबान्धवाः।गच्छन्तमनुगच्छामो येन गच्छति राघवः।।2.33.16।।
explanation: Let all of us without delay along with our wives and relations follow Rama, like Lakshmana, wherever he goes.

content: उद्यानानि परित्यज्य क्षेत्राणि च गृहाणि च।एकदुःखसुखा राममनुगच्छाम धार्मिकम्।।2.33.17।।
explanation: Deserting our gardens, fields and houses and experiencing the same joy and sorrow of the virtuous Rama, we shall follow him.

content: समुद्धृतनिधानानि परिध्वस्ताजिराणि च।उपात्त धनधान्यानि हृतसाराणि सर्वशः।।2.33.18।।रजसाभ्यवकीर्णानि परित्यक्तानि दैवतैः।मूषकैःपरिधावद्भिरुद्बिलैरावृतानि च।।2.33.19।।अपेतोदकधूमानि हीनसम्मार्जनानि च।प्रणष्टबलिकर्मेज्यामन्त्रहोमजपानि च।।2.33.20।।दुष्कालेनेव भग्नानि भिन्नभाजनवन्ति च।अस्मात्त्यक्तानि वेश्मानि कैकेयी प्रतिपद्यताम्।।2.33.21।।
explanation: Let Kaikeyi take possession of our deserted and dilapidated homes with ruined courtyards which seem as though struck by calamities. They are drained of wealth and foodgrains, covered with dust and abandoned by the gods. There is no water or smoke (from kitchen). They are infested with rats. They stand unswept. There foodgrains lie around ratholes, and broken earthenwares lie scattered. There are no offerings, no sacrifices, no recitation of sacred hymns, no libations and no invocations.

content: वनं नगरमेवास्तु येन गच्छति राघवः।अस्माभिश्च परित्यक्तं पुरं सम्पद्यतां वनम्।।2.33.22।।
explanation: Since the scion of the Raghu race is going to the forest, let that forest itself be our city and let the city deserted by us become the forest.

content: बिलानि दंष्ट्रिण स्सर्वे सानूनि मृगपक्षिणः।त्यजन्त्वस्मद्भयाद्भीता गजास्सिंहा वनानि च।।2.33.23।।अस्मत्त्यक्तं प्रपद्यन्तां सेव्यमानं त्यजन्तु च।
explanation: Let all the fanged creatures leave their lairs, birds and animals the mountain slopes, lions and elephants, their haunts due to the fear caused by our presence and occupy the city left by us (on seeing us deserting).

content: तृणमांस फलादानां देशं व्यालमृगद्विजम्।।2.33.24।।प्रपद्यतां हि कैकेयी सपुत्रा सह बान्धवैः।राघवेण वने सर्वे वयं वत्स्याम निर्वृताः।।2.33.25।।
explanation: Let Kaikeyi along with her son and her relatives acquire that country which will be inhabited by birds and animals living on grass, fruits, and flesh. Withdrawn, we shall happily live in the forest along with Rama.

content: इत्येवं विविधा वाचो नानाजनसमीरिताः।शुश्राव रामः श्रुत्वा च न विचक्रेऽस्य मानसम्।।2.33.26।।
explanation: Such were the various words uttered by the people. Even after hearing them his (Rama's) mind remained unmoved (from his resolve).

content: स तु वेश्म पितुर्दूरात्कैलासशिखरप्रभम्।अभिचक्राम धर्मात्मा मत्तमातङ्गविक्रमः।।2.33.27।।
explanation: Dutiful Rama, endowed with the prowess of an intoxicated elephant, approached the residence of his father that resembled from a distance the peak of mount Kailasa in splendour.

content: विनीतवीरपुरुषं प्रविश्य तु नृपालयम्।ददर्शावस्थितं दीनं सुमन्त्रमविदूरतः।।2.33.28।।
explanation: Rama entered the royal palace guarded by welltrained warriors and not from very far saw Sumantra who stood a picture of dejection.

content: प्रतीक्षमाणोऽपि जनं तदार्तमनार्तरूपः प्रहसन्निवाथ।जगाम रामः पितरं दिदृक्षुःपितुर्निदेशं विधिवच्चिकीर्षुः।।2.33.29।।
explanation: Even after observing the people in grief, Rama did not reveal his sorrowful feelings. Bound by duty he went in as if with a smile to see his father.

content: तत्पूर्वमैक्ष्वाकसुतो महात्मारामो गमिष्यन्वनमार्तरूपम्।व्यतिष्ठत प्रेक्ष्य तदा सुमन्त्रंपितुर्महात्मा प्रतिहारणार्थम्।।2.33.30।।
explanation: Seeing Sumantra stricken with grief for the first time the magnanimous Rama, scion of the Ikshvaku dynasty, on the way to the forest waited there for his father to be informed of his arrival.

content: पितुर्निदेशेन तु धर्मवत्सलःवनप्रवेशे कृतबुद्धिनिश्चयः।स राघवः प्रेक्ष्य सुमन्त्रमब्रवीन्निवेदयस्वागमनं नृपाय मे।।2.33.31।।
explanation: Rama, lover of righteousness, determined to go to the forest in obedience to his father's command said to Sumantra, Inform the king of my arrival.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे त्रयस्त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtythird sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic  composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama,  Sita and Lakshmana take leave of Dasaratha--Dasaratha falls unconscious.]ततः कमलपत्राक्षः श्यामो निरुपमो महान्।उवाच राम स्तं सूतं पितुराख्याहि मामिति।।2.34.1।।
explanation: Let my father be informed of my arrival, said the lotuseyed, darkcomplexioned, venerable, peerless Rama to the charioteer.

content: स रामप्रेषितः क्षिप्रं सन्तापकलुषेन्द्रियः।प्रविश्य नृपतिं सूतो निश्वसन्तं ददर्श ह ।।2.34.2।।
explanation: At the command of Rama, charioteer Sumantra whose senses were overwhelmed with grief quickly entered the apartment of the king and found him heaving sighs.

content: उपरक्तमिवादित्यं भस्मच्छन्नमिवानलम्।तटाकमिव निस्तोयमपश्यज्जगतीपतिम्।।2.34.3।।
explanation: He saw the lord of the world (Dasaratha) dull like the Sun in eclipse, like the fire covered with ashes, like a tank with its water dried up.

content: आलोक्य तु महाप्राज्ञः परमाकुलचेतसम्।राममेवानुशोचन्तं सूतः प्राञ्जलिरासदत्।।2.34.4।।
explanation: Seeing the king brooding over Rama, in an extremely agitated state, the sagacious charioteer approached him with folded hands.

content: तं वर्धयित्वा राजानं पूर्वं सूतो जयाशिषा।भयविक्लबया वाचा मन्दया श्लक्ष्णमब्रवीत्।।2.34.5।।
explanation: At first greeting the king with the words 'victory be yours', the charioteer, trembling with fear, gently said in a feeble voice.

content: अयं स पुरुषव्याघ्रो द्वारि तिष्ठति ते सुतः।ब्राह्मणेभ्यो धनं दत्वा सर्वञ्चैवोपजीविनाम्।।2.34.6।।
explanation: Your son Rama, the  best of men, having given away his entire wealth in charity to brahmins and to all the dependents is waiting at the entrance.

content: स त्वा पश्यतु भद्रं ते रामस्सत्यपराक्रमः।सर्वान् सुहृद आपृच्छ्य त्वामिदानीं दिदृक्षते।।1.34.7।।
explanation: Be blessed audience may be granted to Rama who possesses proven prowess, and now waits, after taking leave of his friends, to see you.

content: गमिष्यति महारण्यं तं पश्य जगतीपते।वृतं राजगुणै स्सर्वैरादित्यमिव रश्मिभिः।।2.34.8।।
explanation: O Lord of the world behold him embellished with all princely virtues like the Sun encircled with its rays, (now) leaving for the forest.

content: स सत्यवादी धर्मात्मा गाम्भीर्यात्सागरोपमः।आकाश इव निष्पङ्को नरेन्द्रः प्रत्युवाच तम्।।2.34.9।।
explanation: That truthful and virtuous king (Dasaratha) who was deep like the ocean and free from mud (pure) like the  sky replied:

content: सुमंन्त्रानय मे दारान् ये केचिदिह मामकाः।दारैः परिवृतस्सर्वैर्द्रष्टुमिच्छामि धार्मिकम्।।2.34.10।।
explanation: O Sumantra bring all my consorts who are here. In the company of all my wives, I desire to give audience to virtuous Rama.

content: सोऽन्तःपुरमतीत्यैव स्त्रियस्ता वाक्यमब्रवीत्।आर्याह्वयति वो राजा गम्यतां तत्र मा चिरम्।।2.34.11।।
explanation: O venerable ones, king Dasaratha summons you. Go there without delay, said Sumantra to the king's consorts after crossing the inner apartment.

content: एवमुक्ताः स्त्रिय स्सर्वाः सुमन्त्रेण नृपाज्ञया।प्रचक्रमु स्तद्भवनं भर्तुराज्ञाय शासनम्।।2.34.12।।
explanation: Thus addressed by Sumantra in accordance with the king's order, all the women went to their husband's palace.

content: अर्धसप्तशतास्तास्तु प्रमदास्ताम्रलोचनाः।कौसल्यां परिवार्याथ शनैर्जग्मुर्धृतव्रताः।।2.34.13।।
explanation: Thereafter, Kausalya surrounded by three hundred and fifty  ladies who were faithful to their vows, reached there slowly with their eyes turned copperred (in grief).

content: आगतेषु च दारेषु समवेक्ष्य महीपतिः।उवाच राजा तं सूतं सुमन्त्राऽनय मे सुतम्।।2.34.14।।
explanation: Usher in my son (Rama), O Sumantra, said the lord of the world (king Dasaratha) to the charioteer on seeing his wives arrive.

content: स सूतो राममादाय लक्ष्मणं मैथिलीं तदा।जगामाभिमुखस्तूर्णं सकाशं जगतीपतेः।।2.34.15।।
explanation: Then the charioteer fetched Rama, Lakshmana and Sita and advanced towards the king without delay.

content: स राजा पुत्रमायान्तं दृष्ट्वा दूरात्कृताञ्जलिम्।उत्पपातासनात्तूर्णमार्त स्त्रीजनसंवृतः।।2.34.16।।
explanation: When the king saw from a distance his son coming with folded hands, he, surrounded by the ladies and tormented with grief, stood up.

content: सोऽभिदुद्राव वेगेन रामं दृष्ट्वा विशाम्पतिः।तमसंप्राप्य दुःखार्तः पपात भुवि मूर्छितः।।2.34.17।।
explanation: At the sight of Rama, the lord of men (king Dasaratha), tortured with grief, immediately ran towards him but  before he could reach him, fell unconscious on the floor.

content: तं रामोऽभ्यपतत् क्षिप्रं लक्ष्मणश्च महारथः।विसंज्ञमिव दुःखेन सशोकं नृपतिं तदा।।2.34.18।।
explanation: Rama and the mighty warrior Lakshmana, quickly reached the king who lay as though  he had lost his senses due to grief.

content: स्त्रीसहस्रनिनादश्च संजज्ञे राजवेश्मनि।  हा हा रामेति सहसा भूषणध्वनिमूर्छितः।।2.34.19।।
explanation: All on a sudden there arose from (the mouths of) a thousand women of the palace cries of 'alas, alas, Rama' mingled with the tinkling sounds of their ornaments.

content: तं परिष्वज्य बाहुभ्यां तावुभौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।पर्यंङ्के सीतया सार्धं रुदन्तः समवेशयन्।।2.34.20।।
explanation: Thereafter Rama and Lakshmana assisted by Sita, lifted him wailing in their arms and laid him on a couch.

content: अथ रामो मुहूर्तेन लब्धसंज्ञं महीपतिम्। उवाच प्राञ्जलिर्भूत्वा शोकार्णवपरिप्लुतम्।।2.34.21।।
explanation: After the king regained his consciousness in a moment, Rama with folded hands said to him, who was immersed in a sea of sorrow:

content: आपृच्छे त्वां महाराज सर्वेषामीश्वरोऽसि नः।प्रस्थितं दण्डकारण्यं पश्य त्वं कुशलेन माम्।।2.34.22।।
explanation: O great king, I am asking leave of you, for you are lord of  all of us. I am set to depart  for the Dandaka forest. See me (off) in a cheerful mood.

content: लक्ष्मणं चानुजानीहि सीता चान्वेति मां वनम्।कारणैर्बहुभि स्तथ्यैर्वार्यमाणौ न चेच्छतः।।2.34.23।।
explanation: Allow Lakshmana and Sita to follow me into the forest. I tried to dissuade them with a number of reasons but they did not agree.

content: अनुजानीहि सर्वान्नः शोकमुत्सृज्य मानद।लक्ष्मणं मां च सीतां च प्रजापतिरिव प्रजाः।।2.34.24।।
explanation: Discard your grief and, like Brahma, the creator, allow Lakshmana, Sita and me all of us, your subjects, O respector of men

content: प्रतीक्षमाणमव्यग्रमनुज्ञां जगतीपतेः।उवाच राजा सम्प्रेक्ष्य वनवासाय राघवम्।।2.34.25।।
explanation: On seeing Rama, unruffled, waiting for his permission to proceed to the forest, the lord of the earth, king Dasaratha said:

content: अहं राघव कैकेय्या वरदानेन मोहितः।अयोध्यायास्त्वमेवाद्य भव राजा निगृह्य माम्।।2.34.26।।
explanation: I have been deluded by Kaikeyi into bestowing boons. Imprison me and be now king of Ayodhya, O scion of the Raghu dynasty

content: एवमुक्तो नृपतिना रामो धर्मभृतां वरः।प्रत्युवाचाञ्जलिं कृत्वा पितरं वाक्यकोविदः।।2.34.27।।
explanation: Thus spoken to by the king, Rama, skilled in speech and upholder of righteousness, replied to his father with folded palms:

content: भवान्वर्ष सहस्राय पृथिव्या नृपते पतिः।अहं त्वरण्येवत्स्यामि न मे कार्यं त्वयाऽनृतम्।।2.34.28।।
explanation: You will remain the lord of this earth for a thousand years to come, O king As for me, I will dwell in the forest. Do not deviate from truth on my account.

content: नव पञ्च च वर्षाणि वनवासे विहृत्य ते।पुनःपादौ ग्रहीष्यामि प्रतिज्ञान्ते नराधिप।।2.34.29।।
explanation: Having fulfilled the vow on the completion of fourteen years of wandering in the forest I shall come back to touch your feet, O lord of men

content: रुदन्नार्तः प्रियं पुत्रं सत्यपाशेन संयतः।कैकेय्या चोद्यमानस्तु मिथो राजा तमब्रवीत्।।2.34.30।।
explanation: The king who was bound by the cord of truth and instigated by Kaikeyi said, wailing in distress:

content: श्रेयसे वृद्धये तात पुनरागमनाय च।गच्छस्वारिष्टमव्यग्रः पन्थानमकुतोभयम्।।2.34.31।।
explanation: Go, my dear child, wish you wellMay your path be auspicious, free from obstacles and fear (from any quarters). Come back (after fulfilment of the pledge)

content: न हि सत्यात्मनस्तात धर्माभिमनस स्तव।विनिवर्तयितुं बुद्धिः शक्यते रघुनन्दन।।2.34.32।।
explanation: O my beloved son O delight of the Raghus you are devoted to truth and duty. It is difficult to dissuade you from your resolve .

content: अद्य त्विदानीं रजनीं पुत्र मा गच्छ सर्वथा।एकाहदर्शनेनापि साधु तावच्चराम्यहम्।।2.34.33।।
explanation: O son, by all means, do not go now, today, tonight Give me, at least, one day more to see (by with) you to my satisfaction.

content: मातरं मां च सम्पश्यन् वसेमामद्य शर्वरीम्।तर्पित स्सर्वकामैस्त्वं श्वः काले साधयिष्यसि।।।2.34.34।।
explanation: Stay tonight in the company of your mother and me. With all our desire satisfied, you can set out tomorrow at the appropriate time.

content: दुष्करं क्रियते पुत्र सर्वथा राघव त्वया।मत्प्रियार्थं प्रियांस्त्यक्त्वा यद्यासि विजनं वनम्।।2.34.35।।
explanation: O my son, O descendant of the Raghus, you are called upon to accomplish, by all means, a very difficult task. For the sake of my pleasure you are forsaking your dear ones and going to the desolate forest.

content: न चैतन्मे प्रियं पुत्र शपे सत्येन राघव।छन्नया चलितस्त्वस्मि स्त्रिया छन्नाग्निकल्पया।।2.34.36।।
explanation: I swear by truth, O my beloved son, that your departure to the forest is in no way a pleasure to me. With a hidden motive, this woman who is like fire  concealed by ashes has duped me.

content: वञ्चना या तु लब्धा मे तां त्वं निस्तर्तुमिच्छसि।अनया वृत्तसादिन्या कैकेय्याऽभिप्रचोदितः।।.2.34.37।।
explanation: Instigated by this Kaikeyi, the destroyer of traditions (of the race) I have been deceived for which you wish to pay.

content: न चैतदाश्चर्यतमं यत्तज्येष्ठस्सुतो मम।अपानृतकथं पुत्र पितरं कर्तुमिच्छसि।।2.34.38।।
explanation: It is not a great surprise that you, O my son, being the eldest, want to make your father free from a false promise.

content: अथ रामस्तथा श्रुत्वा पितुरार्तस्य भाषितम्।लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा दीनो वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.34.39।।
explanation: Rama and Lakshmana were sad to hear the words of their anguished father. Rama replies:

content: प्राप्स्यामि यानद्य गुणान्को मे श्वस्तान् प्रदास्यति।अपक्रमणमेवातः सर्वकामैरहं वृणे।।2.34.40।।
explanation: Who will give me the merit (of propriety) I earn today? Therefore, I want to depart (today), discarding all my desires.

content: इयं सराष्ट्रा सजना धनधान्यसमाकुला। मया विसृष्टा वसुधा भरताय प्रदीयताम्।।2.34.41।।
explanation: The kingdom abdicated by me with all its people, its wealth and foodgrains may be bestowed on Bharata.

content: वनवासकृता बुद्धिर्न च मेऽद्य चलिष्यति।यस्तुष्टेन वरो दत्तः कैकेय्यै वरद त्वया।।2.34.42।।दीयतां निखिलेनैव सत्यस्त्वं भव पार्थिव।
explanation: My decision to go to the forest remains unchanged. O bestower of boons, O king  honour to the last word the boons you had granted Kaikeyi. And adhere to truth.

content: अहं निदेशं भवतो यथोक्तमनुपालयन्।।2.34.43।।चतुर्दश समा वत्स्ये वने वनचरैस्सह।
explanation: As already said, I shall dwell in the forest for fourteen years with forest rangers, in obedience to your commands.

content: मा विमर्शो वसुमती भरताय प्रदीयताम्।।2.34.44।।न हि मे काङ्क्षितं राज्यं सुखमात्मनि वा प्रियम्।यथानिदेशं कर्तुं वै तवैव रघुनन्दन।।2.34.45।।
explanation: Do not brood. Bestow the kingdom on Bharata. I do not have any desire for the kingdom or pleasure. Nothing is dearer to me than compliance with your order, O Delight of the Raghu race

content: अपगच्छतु ते दु:खं माभूर्बाष्पपरिप्लुतः।न हि क्षुभ्यति दुर्धर्षः समुद्रः सरितां पतिः।।2.34.46।।
explanation: Let your grief go. Do not shed tears. The indomitable ocean, Lord of rivers, is never perturbed.

content: नैवाहं राज्यमिच्छामि न सुखं न च मेदिनीम्।नैव सर्वानिमान् कामा न्नस्वर्गं नैव जीवितम्।।2.34.47।।
explanation: I desire no kingdom, no comfort, not this earth nor any pleasure nor heaven nor even life.

content: त्वामहं सत्यमिच्छामि नानृतं पुरुषर्षभ।प्रत्यक्षं तव सत्येन सुकृतेन च ते शपे।।2.34.48।।
explanation: I wish you, O best of men, to uphold truth and not falsehood. I swear this in your presence in the name of truth and on my merits acquired.

content: न च शक्यं मया तात स्थातुं क्षणमपि प्रभो।   स शोकं धारयस्वेमं न हि मेऽस्ति विपर्ययः।।2.34.49।।
explanation: It is not possible for me, O father to stay here for a moment any longer. Restrain your grief. There can be no change in my resolve, O king

content: अर्थितो ह्यस्मि कैकेय्या वनं गच्छेति राघव।मया चोक्तं व्रजामीति तत्सत्यमनुपालये।।2.34.50।।
explanation: 'O Rama, go to the forest', Kaikeyi had said, and I have given her word I would go. I must fulfil my promise.

content: मा चोत्कण्ठां कृथा देव वने रंस्यामहे वयम्।प्रशान्तहरिणाकीर्णे नानाशकुनिनादिते।।2.34.51।।
explanation: Do not worry, O Lord We will enjoy (our stay in) the peaceful forest full of deer and resounding with the chirpings of various birds.

content: पिता हि दैवतं तात देवतानामपि स्मृतम्।तस्माद्दैवतमित्येव करिष्यामि पितुर्वचः।।2.34.52।।
explanation: Father is divine even for the gods as cited in scriptures, therefore, looking upon father as my god, I will carry out his words, O father

content: चतुर्दशसु वर्षेषु गतेषु नरसत्तम।पुनर्द्रक्ष्यसि मां प्राप्तं सन्तापोऽयं विमुच्यताम्।।2.34.53।।
explanation: I shall return after fourteen years have passed, O best among men you will see me back, Give up this grief.

content: येन संस्तम्भनीयोऽयं सर्वो बाष्पगलो जनः।स त्वं पुरुषशार्दूल किमर्थं विक्रियां गतः।।2.34.54।।
explanation: When you, O tiger among men, are required (as king) to pacify those whose throats are choked with tears, why this change in you?

content: पुरं च राष्ट्रं च मही च केवलामया निसृष्टा भरताय दीयताम्।अहं निदेशं भवतोऽनुपालयन्वनं गमिष्यामि चिराय सेवितुम्।।2.34.55।।
explanation: I am renouncing this city, kingdom and this entire earth, and let all this be conferred on Bharata. In obedience to your order, I shall go and live in the forest for a long time.

content: मया निसृष्टां भरतो महीमिमांसशैलषण्डां सपुरां सकाननाम्। शिवां सुसीमामनुशास्तु केवलंत्वया यदुक्तं नृपते तथास्तु तत्।।2.34.56।।
explanation: I am leaving behind, O king this (auspicious) land with its welllaid boundaries, mountain ranges, cities and forests, which Bharata alone should rule. Let it happen the way you have said.

content: न मे तथा पार्थिव धीयते मनो महत्सु कामेषु न चात्मनःप्रिये।यथा निदेशे तव शिष्टसम्मतेव्यपैतु दुःखं तव मत्कृतेऽनघ।।2.34.57।।
explanation: O king my mind derives no happiness from great enjoyment or personal comfort as it does from carrying out your order. This is corroborated by the wise. Your grief (relating to filfilment of the vow) on mt account will be dispelled, O sinless one

content: तदद्य नैवानघ राज्यमव्ययंन सर्वकामान्न सुखं न मैथिलीम्।न जीवितं त्वामनृतेन योजयन्वृणीय सत्यं व्रतमस्तु ते तथा।।2.34.58।।
explanation: O sinless one by associating you with falsehood I will neither seek this eternal kingdom nor objects of desires nor objects of happiness nor Maithili nor even my life. I only wish that your vow comes true.

content: फलानि मूलानि च भक्षयन्वनेगिरींश्च पश्यन् सरितस्सरांसि च।वनं प्रविश्यैव विचित्रपादपम्सुखी भविष्यामि तवास्तु निर्वृतिः।।2.34.59।।
explanation: Entering the forest full of various kinds of trees I shall be happy to view the mountains, rivers and the lakes and to eat fruits and roots. (Hence) do not grieve.

content: एवं स राजा व्यसनाभिपन्नःशोकेन दुःखेन च ताम्यमानः।आलिङ्ग्य पुत्रं सुविनष्टसंज्ञोमोहं गतो नैव चिचेष्ट किंञ्चित्।।2.34.60।।
explanation: The king, immersed in anguish and distressed with tears of grief embraced his son and then fell down unconscious on the floor and lay motionless.

content: देव्यस्तत स्संरुरुदुस्समेता स्तां वर्जयित्वा नरदेवपत्नीम्।रुदन् सुमन्त्रोऽऽपि जगाम मूर्छांहाहाकृतं तत्र बभूव सर्वम्।।2.34.61।।
explanation: Thereupon all the queens except Kaikeyi, wailed loudly. Sumantra, too, cried and fell unconscious. The entire palace cried 'Alas, Alas'.  इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे चतुस्त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyfourth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the  holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Sumantra pleads with Kaikeyi to change her mind--Kaikeyi refuses.]ततो निर्धूय सहसा शिरो निश्श्वस्य चासकृत्। पाणौ पाणिं विनिष्पिष्य दन्तान् कटकटाप्य च ।।2.35.1।।लोचने कोपसंरक्ते वर्णं पूर्वोचितं जहत्। कोपाभिभूतस्सहसा सन्तापमशुभं गतः।।2.35.2।।मनः समीक्षमाणश्च सूतो दशरथस्य सः। कम्पयन्निव कैकेय्या हृदयं वाक्छरैश्शितैः ।।2.35.3।।वाक्यवज्रैरनुपमैर्निर्भिन्दन्निव चाशुभैः। कैकेय्या स्सर्वमर्माणि सुमन्त्रः प्रत्यभाषत।।2.35.4।।
explanation: Overcome with anger, charioteer Sumantra started shaking his head and sighing off and on, crushing his palms and grinding his teeth. His eyes turned red due to anger. Overcome with a sudden, ominous grief, the complexion of his face turned red.  Sumantra understood the mind of Dasaratha. With sharp arrows of words as if piercing the heart of Kaikeyi, he denounced her in exceptionally harsh words which, like thunderbolt, cut her to the quick:

content: ततो निर्धूय सहसा शिरो निश्श्वस्य चासकृत्। पाणौ पाणिं विनिष्पिष्य दन्तान् कटकटाप्य च ।।2.35.1।।लोचने कोपसंरक्ते वर्णं पूर्वोचितं जहत्। कोपाभिभूतस्सहसा सन्तापमशुभं गतः।।2.35.2।।मनः समीक्षमाणश्च सूतो दशरथस्य सः। कम्पयन्निव कैकेय्या हृदयं वाक्छरैश्शितैः ।।2.35.3।।वाक्यवज्रैरनुपमैर्निर्भिन्दन्निव चाशुभैः। कैकेय्या स्सर्वमर्माणि सुमन्त्रः प्रत्यभाषत।।2.35.4।।
explanation: Overcome with anger, charioteer Sumantra started shaking his head and sighing off and on, crushing his palms and grinding his teeth. His eyes turned red due to anger. Overcome with a sudden, ominous grief, the complexion of his face turned red.  Sumantra understood the mind of Dasaratha. With sharp arrows of words as if piercing the heart of Kaikeyi, he denounced her in exceptionally harsh words which, like thunderbolt, cut her to the quick:

content: यस्यास्तव पतिस्त्यक्तो राजा दशरथः स्वयम्। भर्ता सर्वस्य जगतः स्थावरस्य चरस्य च।।2.35.5।।न ह्यकार्यतमं किञ्चित्तव देवीह विद्यते।
explanation: O Kaikeyi  you have forsaken king Dasaratha, your husband and the lord of this entire world consisting of the movable and the immovable immovable and movable world. There is nothing in this world which you are notcapable of doing.

content: पतिघ्नीं त्वामहं मन्ये कुलघ्नीमपि चान्ततः।।2.35.6।।यन्महेन्द्रमिवाजय्यं दुष्प्रकम्प्यमिवाचलम्।महोदधिमिवाक्षोभ्यं सन्तापयसि कर्मभिः।।2.35.7।।
explanation: King Dasaratha is invincible like Indra, unshakeable like a mountain and unperturbable like the ocean. By causing grief to him through your action I feel you are killing your husband (inch by inch). I think you are ultimately destroying your own race.

content: मावमंस्था दशरथं भर्तारं वरदं पतिम्। भर्तुरिच्छा हि नारीणां पुत्रकोट्या विशिष्यते।।2.35.8।।
explanation: Do not have contempt for Dasaratha who is your husband, nourisher and bestower of boons. For a wife, the desire of her husband is considered worthier than ten million sons.

content: यथावयो हि राज्यानि प्राप्नुवन्ति नृपक्षये। इक्ष्वाकुकुलनाथेऽस्मिं स्तल्लोपयितुमिच्छसि।।2.35.9।।
explanation: After the death of the king, the princes will obtain the kingdom according to   seniority. Why do you want to break this tradition in the case of Rama, the lord of the Ikshvaku dynasty?

content: राजा भवतु ते पुत्रो भरतश्शास्तु मेदिनीम्।वयं तत्र गमिष्यामो रामो यत्र गमिष्यति।।2.35.10।।
explanation: Let your son Bharata be king and rule the earth. All of us will go whereever Rama goes.

content: न हि ते विषये कश्चिद् र्ब्राह्मणो वस्तुमर्हति। तादृशं त्वममर्यादमद्य कर्म चिकीर्षसि।।2.35.11।।
explanation: Now by  your act, you intend to transgress the bounds of tradition(code of conduct). No brahmin shall ever dwell in your country.

content: नूनं सर्वे गमिष्यामो मार्गं रामनिषेवितम्।त्यक्ताया बान्धवैः सर्वैर्ब्राह्मणैः साधुभिः सदा।।2.35.12।।का प्रीती राज्यलाभेन तव देवि भविष्यति। तादृशं त्वममर्यादं कर्म कर्तुं चिकीर्षसि।।2.35.13।।
explanation: All of us certainly will follow the path pursued by Rama. Abandoned by relatives, brahmins and virtuous men for all times, what pleasure will you derive by your lust for this kingdom? O Kaikeyi, why do you intend to trangress the limits of honour?

content: आश्चर्यमिव पश्यामि यस्यास्ते वृत्तमीदृशम्।आचरन्त्या न विवृता सद्यो भवति मेदिनी।।2.35.14।।
explanation: It is a wonder that the earth does not split right away when you are perpetrating such an (abominable) act.

content: महाब्रह्मर्षिसृष्टाः वा ज्वलन्तो भीमदर्शनाः।धिग्वाग्दण्डा न हिंसन्ति रामप्रव्राजने स्थिताम्।।2.35.15।।
explanation: It is a wonder that while bent upon banishing Rama, you are  not destroyed by frightening fire created by great brahmarsis, crying, 'Shame, shame'

content:
आम्रं छित्वा कुठारेण निम्बं परिचरेत्तु यः।

यश्चैनं पयसा सिञ्चेन्नैवास्य मधुरो भवेत्।।2.35.16।।
explanation: By axing a mango tree and growing a nimba in its place and sprinkling it with milk one does not get sweet fruit.

content: अभिजात्यं हि ते मन्ये  यथा मातुस्तथैव च।न हि निम्बात्स्रवेत् क्षैद्रं लोके निगदितं वचः।।2.35.17।।
explanation: Your nature corresponds to your mother's, so I think. 'Honey will not flow from a nimba tree' is a wellknown saying in this world.

content: तव मातुरसद्ग्राहं विद्मः पूर्वं यथाश्रुतम्।पितुस्ते वरदः कश्चिद्ददौ वरमनुत्तमम्।।2.35.18।।सर्वभूतरुतं तस्मात्संजज्ञे वसुधाधिपः। तेन तिर्यग्गतानां च भूतानां विदितं वचः।।2.35.19।।
explanation: We have heard in the past about the evil (stubborn) nature of your mother. Once a bestower of boons conferred an extraordinary boon on your father by virtue of which he could tell the sounds of all living beings. He also understood the language of all crookedly  moving creatures.

content: ततो जृम्भस्य शयने विरुताद्भूरिवर्चसः।पितुस्ते विदितो भाव स्स तत्र बहुधाऽहसत्।।2.35.20।।
explanation: Then one day near his bed your highly brilliant father laughed repeatedly over what an ant or a bird said, for he knew the meaning from its sound.

content: तत्र ते जननी क्रुद्धा मृत्युपाशमभीप्सती।हासं ते नृपते सौम्य जिज्ञासामीति चाब्रवीत्।।2.35.21।।
explanation: This incensed your mother who seeking the noose of death, asked him, 'O handsome king, I intend to know the cause of your laughter'.

content: नृपश्चोवाच तां देवीं देवि शंसामि ते यदि। ततो मे मरणं सद्यो भविष्यति न संशयः।।2.35.22।।
explanation: 'O queen if I disclose it, then I will undoubtedly die that very movement' replied the king to his wife.

content: माता ते पितरं देवि ततः केकयमब्रवीत्। शंस मे जीव वा मा वा न मामपहसिष्यसि।।2.35.23।।
explanation: Then your mother said to your father, 'Whether you live or die, tell me the cause. You are laughing at me'.

content: प्रियया च तथोक्त स्सन् केकयः पृथिवीपतिः।तस्मै तं वरदायार्थं कथयामास तत्त्वतः।।2.35.24।।
explanation: Hearing the words of his beloved, king of Kekaya related the entire matter, as it happened, concerning the conferor of boons.

content: ततः स्स वरदः साधुराजानं प्रत्यभाषत।म्रियतां ध्वंसतां वेयं मा कृथास्त्वं महीपते।।2.35.25।।
explanation: That holy man who had granted the boon (to the king) had said, 'Let her die or destroy herself, but do not disclose (the cause of your laughter).

content: स तच्छ्रुत्वा वचस्तस्य प्रसन्नमनसो नृपः। मातरं ते निरस्याशु विजहार कुबेरवत्।।2.35.26।।
explanation: Happy to hear these words, your father sent away your mother and moved about like Kubera.

content: तथा त्वमपि राजानं दुर्जनाचरिते पथि। असद्ग्राहमिमं मोहात्कुरुषे पापदर्शिनि।।2.35.27।।
explanation: O evilminded one you, too, are following the path of wickedness, forcing the king infatuated (with you) to act unrighteously.

content: सत्यश्चाद्य प्रवादोऽयं लौकिकः प्रतिभाति मा। पितृन् समनुजायन्ते नरा मातरमङ्गनाः।।2.35.28।।
explanation: The generally accepted saying in this world that 'sons resemble the father and, daughters the mother' appears true to me today.

content: नैवं भव गृहाणेदं यदाह वसुधाधिपः।भर्तुरिच्छामुपास्वेह जनस्यास्य गतिर्भव।।2.35.29।।
explanation: Do not be like your mother. Accept what the king says. Abide by his wishes. Be his saviour.

content: मा त्वं प्रोत्साहिता पापैर्देवराजसमप्रभम्। भर्तारं लोकभर्तारमसद्धर्ममुपादधाः।।2.35.30।।
explanation: Instigated by the wicked, do not attribute unrighteousness to your husband who is equal to Indra in brilliance and is the sustainer of this world.

content: न हि मिथ्या प्रतिज्ञातं करिष्यति तवानघः। श्रीमान्दशरथो राजा देवि राजीवलोचनः।।2.35.31।।
explanation: The lotuseyed, sinless and prosperous king Dasaratha, O Devi will not render false the promise given you (he will fulfil it in another form).

content: ज्येष्ठो वदान्यः कर्मण्यः स्वधर्मपरिरक्षिता। रक्षिता जीवलोकस्य बली रामोऽभिषिच्यताम्।।2.35.32।।
explanation: Let his eldest son Rama, valiant, generous, skilful, dutiful and protector of this world, be consecrated.

content: परिवादो हि ते देवि महाल्लोके चरिष्यति। यदि रामो वनं याति विहाय पितरं नृपम्।।2.35.33।।
explanation: O Devi, if Rama goes to the forest leaving his father, the king, you will be squarely blamed by the people of the world.

content: स राज्यं राघवः पातु भव त्वं विगतज्वरा।न हि ते राघवादन्यः क्षमः पुरवरे वसेत्।।2.35.34।।
explanation: Therefore, let Rama potect this kingdom. Be relieved of mental afflictions. There is no other person in this excellent city more competent than Rama to rule this kingdom.

content: रामे हि यौवराज्यस्थे राजा दशरथो वनम्। प्रवेक्ष्यति महेष्वासः पूर्ववृत्तमनुस्मरन्।।2.35.35।।
explanation: If Rama is installed as heirapparent, king Dasaratha, the great archer will retire to the forest for carrying out austerities following ancient customs.

content: इति सान्त्वैश्च तीक्ष्णैश्च कैकेयीं राजसंसदि। सुमन्त्रः क्षोभयामास भूय एव कृताज्जलिः।।2.35.36।।
explanation: Sumantra tried with words both gentle and sharp to make Kaikeyi regret. And then stood with folded palms in the presence of the king.

content: नैव सा क्षुभ्यते देवी न च स्म परिदूयते। न चास्या मुखवर्णस्य विक्रिया लक्ष्यते तदा।।2.35.37।।
explanation: (Despite the exhortations by Sumantra) Kaikeyi remained unperturbed. She did not feel sorry. There was no change in the expression of her face.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे पंचत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyfifth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [King Dasaratha orders four divisions of the army and a lot of wealth to be sent with Rama --Kaikeyi objects --Siddhartha appeases Kaikeyi--the king expresses his desire to accompany Rama to the forest.]ततस्सुमन्त्रमैक्ष्वाकः पीडितोऽत्र प्रतिज्ञया। सबाष्पमतिनिश्श्वश्य जगादेदं पुनः पुनः।।2.36.1।।
explanation: Afflicted on account of the promise he had made, Dasaratha, descendant of the Ikshvakus heaved deep sighs again and again and with his eyes full of tears uttered these words to Sumantra:

content: सूत रत्नसुसम्पूर्णा चतुर्विधबला चमूः। राघवस्यानुयात्रार्थं क्षिप्रं प्रतिविधीयताम्।।2.36.2।।
explanation: O Sumantra arrange immediately four divisions of the army, wellequipped with  precious stones to escort Rama in his journey to (the forest).

content: रूपाजीवाश्च वादिन्यो वणिजश्च महाधनाः।शोभयन्तु कुमारस्य वाहिनीं सुप्रसारिताः।।2.36.3।।
explanation: Let the sweettongued courtesans, opulent merchants with well spreadout merchandise make the army of my son graceful.

content: ये चैनमुपजीवन्ति रमते यैश्च वीर्यतः। तेषां बहुविधं दत्त्वा तानप्यत्र नियोजय ।।2.38.4।।
explanation: Bestow immense wealth on those who depended on Rama for their living and on the gallant youths with whom he used to sport. Send them along with the entourage.

content: आयुधानि च मुख्यानि नागरा श्शकटानि च। अनुगच्छन्तु काकुत्स्थं व्याधाश्चारण्य गोचराः।।2.36.5।।
explanation: Main weapons, citizens (bodyguards), carts, wanderers in the forest and fowlers wellacquainted with the forest shall follow Rama.

content: निघ्नन् मृगान् कुञ्जरांश्च पिबंश्चारण्यकं मधु। नदीश्च विविधाः पश्यन्न राज्यस्य स्मरिष्यति।।2.36.6।।
explanation: Hunting the elephants and antelopes, drinking forest honey, beholding several rivers on the way, Rama will not recollect the kingdom.

content: धान्यकोशश्च यः कश्चिद्धनकोशश्च मामकः। तौ राममनुगच्छेतां वसन्तं निर्जने वने।।2.36.7।।
explanation: Let the entire contents of my granary and treasury follow Rama wherever he lives in the desolate forest.

content: यजन् पुण्येषु देशेषु विसृजं श्चाप्तदक्षिणाः। ऋषिभिश्च समागम्य प्रवत्स्यति सुखं वने।।2.36.8।।
explanation: Performing sacrifices in the holy places and liberally giving appropriate gifts, Rama will live happily in the forest in the company of sages.

content: भरतश्च महाबाहुरयोध्यां पालयिष्यति। सर्वकामैः सह श्रीमान् रामः संसाध्यतामिति ।।2.36.9।।
