explanation: (While) mightyarmed Bharata will rule Ayodhya, Rama be furnished with all objects of enjoyment.

content: एवं ब्रुवति काकुत्स्थे कैकेय्या भय मागतम्। मुखं चाप्यगमच्छोषं स्वरश्चापि न्यरुध्यत।।2.36.10।।
explanation: While Dasaratha was saying these words, Kaikeyi was gripped by fear and her face looked pale. Even her voice got choked.

content: सा विषण्णा च सन्त्रस्ता मुखेन परिशुष्यता। राजानमेवाभिमुखी कैकेयी वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।2.36.11।।
explanation: The dejected and frightened Kaikeyi with a dry countenance, looked at the king and said:

content: राज्यं गतजनं साधो पीतमण्डां सुरामिव। निरास्वाद्यतमं शून्यं भरतो नाभिपत्स्यते।।2.36.12।।
explanation: O virtuous king Bharata will not take charge of the kingdom abandoned by men, drained of wealth and incapable of being enjoyed, like wine with its essence evaporated.

content: कैकेय्यां मुक्तलज्जायां वदन्त्यामतिदारुणाम्। राजा दशरथो वाक्यमुवाचायतलोचनाम्।।2.36.13।।
explanation: King Dasaratha heard the terribly cruel and shameless words of that largeeyed Kaikeyi, and said:

content: वहन्तं किं तुदसि मां नियुज्य धुरि माऽहिते। अनार्ये कृत्यमारब्धं किं न पूर्वमुपारुधः।।2.36.14।।
explanation: O brutal Kaikeyi, you fastened me to the yoke and when I am drawing forward, why do you beat me? O vile woman why did  you not prevent me in the beginning itself?

content: तस्यैतत्क्रोधसंयुक्तमुक्तं श्रुत्वा वराङ्गना। कैकेयी द्विगुणं क्रुद्धा राजानमिदमब्रवीत्।।2.36.15।।
explanation: At these wrathful words of Dasaratha, Kaikeyi with redoubled fury replied to the king:

content: वैव वंशे सगरो ज्येष्ठं पुत्रमुपारुधत्। असमञ्ज इति ख्यातं तथायं गन्तुमर्हति।।2.36.16।।
explanation: In your own dynasty  king Sagara prevented his wellknown eldest son Asamanjasa (from enjoying the kingdom). Rama also should depart in the same manner.

content: एवमुक्तो धिगित्येव राजा दशरथोऽब्रवीत्। व्रीडितश्च जनस्सर्व स्सा च तं नावबुध्यत।।2.36.17।।
explanation: Hearing the words of Kaikeyi, Dasaratha could say only 'shame'. All the people felt ashamed, but Kaikeyi could not understand this.

content: तत्र वृद्धो महामात्रस्सिद्धार्थो नाम नामतः। शुचिर्बहुमतो राज्ञः कैकेयी मिदमब्रवीत्।।2.38.18।।
explanation: An aged minister named Siddhartha who justified his name, highly respected by the king said this to Kaikeyi:

content: असमञ्जो गृहीत्वा तु क्रीडतः पथि बालकान्। सरय्वाः प्रक्षिपन्नप्सु रमते तेन दुर्मतिः।।2.36.19।।
explanation: That wickedminded Asamanjasa used to seize the children playing on the street and amuse himself by hurling them in the waters of river Sarayu.

content: तं दृष्ट्वा नागरा स्सर्वे कृद्धा राजानमब्रुवन्।असमञ्जं वृणीष्वैकमस्मान्वा राष्ट्रवर्धन।।2.36.20।।
explanation: Watching it, all the enraged citizens said to the king, 'O enhancer of the prosperity of the kingdom, either you choose Asamanjasa or us'.

content: तानुवाच ततो राजा किन्निमित्तमिदं भयम्।ताश्चापि राज्ञा सम्पृष्टा वाक्यं प्रकृतयोऽब्रुवन्।।2.36.21।।
explanation: The king  then asked them, 'Why this fear?'. And the citizens responded:

content: डक्रीडतस्त्वेष नः पुत्रान् बालानुद्भ्रान्तचेतनः। सरय्वां प्रक्षिपन्मौर्ख्यादतुलां प्रीतिमश्नुते।।2.36.22।।
explanation: That insane (Asamanjasa) while throwing our children who were playing around into Sarayu river in his insanity derived incomparable pleasure'.

content: स तासां वचनं श्रुत्वा प्रकृतीनां नराधिपः। तं तत्याजाहितं पुत्रं तेषां प्रियचिकीर्षया।।2.36.23।।
explanation: That king (Sagara) heard the words of the citizens and with the intention of doing good to them, banished that malevolent son.

content: तं यानं शीघ्रमारोप्य सभार्यं सपरिच्छदम्।यावज्जीवं विवास्योऽयमिति स्वानन्वशात्पिता।।2.36.24।।
explanation: Then the father made him and his wife climb a carriage with the clothes they had at the time on them and at once ordered his servants to banish him for life.

content: स फालपिटकं गृह्य गिरिदुर्गाण्यलोडयत्। दिश स्सर्वास्त्वनुचरन् स यथा पापकर्मकृत्।।2.36.25।।
explanation: Like an evildoer wandering about in different directions, holding a spade and a basket in his hand, he went about digging the impenetrable mountains.

content: इत्येनमत्यजद्राजा सगरो वै सुधार्मिकः। रामः किमकरोत्पापं येनैवमुपरुध्यते।।2.36.26।।
explanation: Highly righteous king Sagara thus banished his son. What sin has Rama committed to secure a similar banishment?

content: न हि कञ्चन पश्यामो राघवस्यागुणं वयम्।दुर्लभो ह्यस्य निरय श्शशाङ्कस्येव कल्मषम्।।2.36.27।।
explanation: We see no fault in Rama. Unlike the stain in the Moon it is difficult to find any  blemish in him.

content: अथवा देवि दोषं त्वं कञ्चित्पश्यसि राघवे। तमद्य ब्रूहि तत्वेन तदा रामो विवास्यताम्।।2.36.28।।
explanation: O Kaikeyi speak truly if you find any fault in this scion of the Raghu race (Rama). Then he will be exiled.

content: अदुष्टस्य हि संत्यागः सत्पथे निरतस्य च।  निर्दहेदपि शक्रस्य द्युतिं धर्मनिरोधनात्।2.36.29।।
explanation: The act of banishment of an innocent one walking the righteous path is like destroying the brilliance of Indra by restraining his righteousness.

content: तदलं देवि रामस्य श्रिया विहतया त्वया। लोकतोऽपि हि ते रक्ष्यः परिवादः शुभानने।।2.36.30।।
explanation: O Devi, there is no use obstructing Rama's prosperity. O one with an auspicious countenance, save yourself from the censure of the world.

content: श्रुत्वा तु सिद्धार्थवचो राजा श्रान्ततरस्वनः। शोकोपहतया वाचा कैकेयीमिदमब्रवीत्।।2.36.31।।
explanation: Having heard Siddhartha, the king, stricken with grief, said to Kaikeyi in a gradually feeble voice.

content: एतद्वचो नेच्छसि पापवृत्ते हितं न जानासि ममात्मनो वा। आस्थाय मार्गं कृपणं कुचेष्टा चेष्टा हि ते साधुपथादपेता।।2.36.32।।
explanation: O Kaikeyi of vicious behaviour, you do not aceept even the words of Siddhartha. You woman of wicked acts, having adopted vile ways, and abjured the right path cannot know what is good either for you or for me.

content: अनुव्रजिष्याम्यहमद्य रामं राज्यं परित्यज्य सुखं धनं च।सहैव राज्ञा भरतेन च त्वं यथासुखं भुङ्क्ष्व चिराय राज्यम्।।2.36.33।।
explanation: Abandoning this kingdom, these comforts and this wealth, I shall follow Rama. Enjoy the kingdom for a long time happily along with king Bharata.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे षट्त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends  the thirtysixth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama puts on bark--Vasistha blames Kaikeyi--says Sita was not ordained to wear bark.]महामात्रवचः श्रुत्वा रामो दशरथं तदा।अभ्यभाषत वाक्यं तु विनयज्ञो विनीतवत्।।2.37.1।।
explanation: On hearing the minister, Rama who knew how to be polite spoke these words  to Dasaratha humbly:

content: त्यक्तभोगस्य मे राजन् वने वन्येन जीवतः।किं कार्यमनुयात्रेण त्यक्तसङ्गस्य सर्वतः।।2.37.2।।
explanation: O king giving up pleasures and attachments altogether I am going to live on whatever is available in the forest. What is the use of followers?

content: यो हि दत्त्वा द्विपश्रेष्ठं कक्ष्यायां कुरुते मनः।रज्जुस्नेहेन किं तस्य त्यजतः कुञ्जरोत्तमम्।।2.37.3।।
explanation: Having given away the best of elephants, will any one be interested in the rope tied to its girth? Why should one have any attachment for the rope after he has given up the elephant?

content: तथा मम सतां श्रेष्ठ किं ध्वजिन्या जगत्पते।सर्वाण्येवानुजानामि चीराण्येवाऽनयन्तु मे।।2.37.4।।
explanation: O best among the virtuous O lord of the world, I do not have any use for this army. I am giving away everything (to Bharata). Bring the bark only.

content: खनित्रपिटके चोभे समानयत गच्छतः।चतुर्दश वने वासं वर्षाणि वसतो मम।।2.37.5।।
explanation: I am going to the forest to live there for fourteen years. Bring me two things: a basket and a crowbar.

content: अथ चीराणि कैकेयी स्वयमाहृत्य राघवम्।उवाच परिधत्स्वेति जनौघे निरपत्रपा।।2.37.6।।
explanation: Thereupon in the assembly of people, without any sense of shame Kaikeyi herself brought the bark robes and said to the son of the Raghus (Rama), Wear it.

content: स चीरे पुरुषव्याघ्रः कैकेय्या प्रतिगृह्य ते।सूक्ष्मवस्त्रमवक्षिप्य मुनिवस्त्राण्यवस्त ह।।2.37.7।।
explanation: The tiger among men (Rama) received the bark robes from Kaikeyi and putting off the fine apparel wore the robes of an ascetic.

content: लक्ष्मणश्चापि तत्रैव विहाय वसने शुभे।तापसाच्छादने चैव जग्राह पितुरग्रतः।।2.37.8।।
explanation: Lakshmana also  removed his auspicious raiment in front (presence) of his father and accepted (put on) the robes of an ascetic.

content: अथाऽत्मपरिधानार्थं सीता कौशेयवासिनी।समीक्ष्य चीरं सन्त्रस्ता पृषती वागुरामिव।।2.37.9।।
explanation: Then Sita in silk clothes glanced at the bark robes meant for her to wear and was frightened like a doe seeing a (fowler's) snare.

content: सा व्यपत्रपमाणेव प्रगृह्य च सुदुर्मनाः।कैकेयी कुशचीरे ते जानकी शुभलक्षणा।।2.37.10।।अश्रुसम्पूर्ण नेत्रा च धर्मज्ञा धर्मदर्शिनी।गन्धर्वराजप्रतिमं भर्तारमिदमब्रवीत्।।2.37.11।।
explanation: Sita of auspicious nature who knew her duties and understood righteousness, took the garments made of kusa grass from Kaikeyi. With a sense of abashment her eyes suffused with tears, she said to her husband who was the very image of  the king of gandharvas.

content: कथं नु चीरं बध्नन्ति मुनयो वनवासिनः।इति ह्यकुशला सीता सा मुमोह मुहुर्मुहुः।।2.37.12।।
explanation: Sita, unacquainted with wearing bark robes, asked Rama, perplexed 'How do the sages who live in the forest wear bark garment?'.

content: कृत्वा कण्ठे च सा चीरमेकमादाय पाणिना।तस्थौ ह्यकुशला तत्र व्रीडिता जनकात्मजा।।2.37.13।।
explanation: The daughter of Janaka, placed one end of the garment round her neck and held the other in her hand, and stood ashamed as she did not know what to do next.

content: तस्यास्तत्क्षिप्रमागम्य रामो धर्मभृतां वरः।चीरं बबन्ध सीतायाः कौशेयस्योपरि स्वयम्।।2.37.14।।
explanation: Rama, foremost among protectors of righteousness, came forward quickly and fastened the bark himself over her silk garment.

content: रामं प्रेक्ष्य तु सीताया बध्नन्तं चीरमुत्तमम्।अन्तःपुरगता नार्यो मुमुचुर्वारि नेत्रजम्।।2.37.15।।
explanation: Beholding Rama fastening the bark garment on Sita, the women of the inner apartment shed tears from their eyes.

content: ऊचुश्च परमायस्ता रामं ज्वलिततेजसम्।वत्स नैवं नियुक्तेयं वनवासे मनस्विनी।।2.37.16।।
explanation: Profoundly distressed, they said to Rama glowing with burning lustre O dear, no one has ordered this highminded Sita to dwell in the forest.

content: पितुर्वाक्यानुरोधेन गतस्य विजनं वनम्।तावद्दर्शनमस्या नः सफलं भवतु प्रभो।।2.37.17।।
explanation: In obedience to the words of your father, O lord you are going to the forest. Till you return, please allow us to have her (Sita's) audience.

content: लक्ष्मणेन सहायेन वनं गच्छस्व पुत्रक।नेयमर्हति कल्याणी वस्तुं तापसवद्वने।।2.37.18।।
explanation: Go, O son to the forest with Lakshmana as your companion. (But) this auspicious Sita, will not be able to live in the jungle like a hermit.

content: कुरु नो याचनां पुत्र सीता तिष्ठतु भामिनी।धर्मनित्यस्स्वयं स्थातुं न हीदानीं त्वमिच्छसि।।2.37.19।।
explanation: Do accede to our prayer. Let lovely Sita stay with us as you, O son faithful to your duty, will not like to remain here.

content: तासामेवंविधा वाच शृण्वन् दशरथात्मजः।बबन्धैव तदा चीरं सीतया तुल्यशीलया।।2.37.20।।
explanation: While Rama was listening to such words uttered by them, he got the bark robes fastened round Sita who was of similar nature.

content: चीरे गृहीते तु तया समीक्ष्य नृपतेर्गुरुः।निवार्य सीतां कैकेयीं वसिष्ठो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।2.37.21।।
explanation: When Sita wore the bark garments, Vasistha, the king's preceptor who was watching this restrained her (Sita) and said to Kaikeyi:

content: अतिप्रवृत्ते दुर्मेधे कैकेयि कुलपांसनि।वञ्चयित्वा च राजानं न प्रमाणेऽवतिष्ठसे।।2.37.22।।
explanation: .You are exceeding all limits of decency O Kaikeyi your motive is evil. You are a disgrace to the race You have deceived the king and your behaviour does not conform to the standards (of righteousness).

content: न गन्तव्यं वनं देव्या सीतया शीलवर्जिते।अनुष्ठास्यति रामस्य सीता प्रकृतमासनम्।।2.37.23।।
explanation: You are devoid of good conduct, O Kaikeyi Divine Sita need not go to the forest. Remaining here she should occupy the royal throne of Rama.

content: आत्मा हि दारास्सर्वेषां दारसङ्ग्रहवर्तिनाम्।आत्मेयमिति रामस्य पालयिष्यति मेदिनीम्।।2.37.24।।
explanation: For every householder, his wife is the soul. Since Sita is the soul of Rama, she can rule this earth.

content: अथ यास्यति वैदेही वनं रामेण सङ्गता।वयमप्यनुयास्यामः पुरं चेदं गमिष्यति।।2.37.25।।
explanation: Otherwise, if Sita goes with Rama to the forest, all of us along with the entire city will follow.

content: अन्तपालाश्च यास्यन्ति सदारो यत्र राघवः।सहोपजीव्यं राष्ट्रं च पुरं च सपरिच्छदम्।।2.37.26।।
explanation: The guardians of the harem, its patron king Dasaratha with his retinue and, the people of this city will go wherever Rama lives with his wife.

content: भरतश्च सशत्रुघ्नश्चीरवासा वनेचरः।वने वसन्तं काकुत्स्थ मनुवत्स्यति पूर्वजम्।।2.37.27।।
explanation: Wandering in the forest and wearing bark, Satrughna and Bharata will live in the company of their elder brother (Rama) in the jungle.

content: तत श्शून्यां गतजनां वसुधां पादपै स्सह।त्वमेका शाधि दुर्वृत्ता प्रजानामहिते स्थिता।।2.37.28।।
explanation: Intent upon doing harm to the people with your vile behaviour, you alone rule this kingdom full of trees and deserted by men.

content: न हि तद्भविता राष्ट्रं यत्र रामो न भूपतिः।तद्वनं भविता राष्ट्रं यत्र रामो निवत्स्यति।।2.37.29।।
explanation: That is not a kingdom where Rama does not rule. If Rama lives in the forest, that shall be  the kingdom.

content: न ह्यदत्तां महीं पित्रा भरतः शास्तुमर्हति।त्वयि वा पुत्रवद्वस्तुं यदि जातो महीपतेः।।2.37.30।।
explanation: If Bharata is truly born to the king, he will not rule the kingdom which has not been bestowed on him (wholeheartedly) by his father. Nor will he live like a son to you.

content: यद्यपि त्वं क्षितितलाद्गगनं चोत्पतिष्यसि।पितृर्वंशचरित्रज्ञः सोऽन्यथा न करिष्यति।।2.37.31।।
explanation: Even if you were to fly from earth to sky, Bharata who knows the traditions of his  father's dynasty, will not act otherwise.

content: तत्त्वया पुत्रगर्धिन्या पुत्रस्य कृतमप्रियम्।लोके हि स न विद्येत यो न राममनुव्रतः।।2.37.32।।
explanation: Therefore, by greedily guarding your son's interest you are doing him harm. There is  none in this world who will not follow Rama.

content: द्रक्ष्यस्यद्यैव कैकेयी पशुव्यालमृगद्विजान्।गच्छतस्सह रामेण पादपांश्च तदुन्मुखान्।।2.37.33।।
explanation: Today  you shall see, O Kaikeyi, flocks of cattle, elephants, deer and birds following Rama, even the trees bending towards him.

content: अथोत्तमान्याभरणानि देविदेहि स्नुषायै व्यपनीय चीरम्।न चीरमस्याः प्रविधीयतेतिन्यवारयत्तद्वसनं वसिष्टः।।2.37.34।।
explanation: O Kaikeyi remove those bark robes and bestow on your daughterinlaw precious ornaments. She was not ordained to wear the bark. Vaisishta, saying so, prevented Sita from wearing that garment.

content: एकस्य रामस्य वने निवासस्त्वया वृतःकेकयराजपुत्री।विभूषितेयं प्रतिकर्मनित्या वसत्वरण्ये सह राघवेण।।2.37.35।।
explanation: O Kaikeyi, you asked that Rama only should dwell in the forest (wearing bark robes). Therefore let Sita, adorn her body daily, while she  lives in the forest with Rama.

content: यानैश्च मुख्यैः परिचारकैश्चसुसंवृता गच्छतु राजपुत्री।वस्त्रैश्च सर्वैस्सहितैर्विधानैर्नेयं वृता ते वरसम्प्रदाने।।2.37.36।।
explanation: Equipped with excellent chariots, attendants, garments, and all other needs let the princess (Sita) go. While seeking boons, you did not include Sita.

content: तस्मिंस्तथा जल्पति विप्रमुख्येगुरौ नृपस्याप्रतिमप्रभावे।नैव स्म सीता विनिवृत्तभावाप्रियस्य भर्तुः प्रतिकारकामा।।2.37.37।।
explanation: (Though) Vasistha, endowed with matchless power, the preceptor of the king and foremost among the brahmins thus expressed himself, Sita was not willing to swerve from her resolve in order to serve her beloved husband.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे सप्तत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyseventh sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama prays his father to look after his mother with compassion and regard.]तस्यां चीरं वसानायां नाथवत्यामनाथवत्। प्रचुक्रोश जनस्सर्वो धिक्त्वां दशरथं त्विति।।2.38.1।।
explanation: Beholding Sita who was wearing a bark garment, like one without a support, though having a husband, all the people cried bitterly exclaiming O Dasaratha, fie on you.

content: तेन तत्र प्रणादेन दुःखितस्स महीपतिः। चिच्छेद जीविते श्रद्धां धर्मे यशसि चात्मनः।।2.38.2।।
explanation: Hearing that tumult the distressed Dasaratha lost faith in his own life and in his righteousness.

content: स निःश्वस्योष्णमैक्ष्वाक स्तां भार्यामिदमब्रवीत्। कैकेयि कुशचीरेण न सीता गन्तुमर्हति।।2.38.3।।
explanation: The descendant of the Ikshvakus (Dasaratha), heaving hot sighs, said to his wife O Kaikeyi, Sita does not deserve to go (to the forest) in garment of kusa grass.

content: सुकुमारी च बाला च सततं च सुखोचिता। नेयं वनस्य योग्येति सत्यमाह गुरुर्मम।।2.38.4।।
explanation: Sita a delicate, young princess accustomed to comforts is not fit to dwell in the forest. This is what my preceptor has truly spoken.

content: इयं हि कस्यापकरोति किञ्चि त्तपस्विनी राजवरस्य कन्या। या चीरमासाद्य जनस्य मध्ये स्थिता विसंज्ञाश्रमणीव काचित्।।2.38.5।।
explanation: Sita, daughter of Janaka, the greatest among kings, stands amidst people wearing bark garment like an ascetic with her senses switched off. To whom and what harm has she done?

content: चीराण्यपास्याज्जनकस्य कन्या नेयं प्रतिज्ञा मम दत्तपूर्वा। यथासुखं गच्छतु राजपुत्री वनं समग्रा सह सर्वरत्नैः।।2.38.6।।
explanation: Let the daughter of Janaka take off her bark garments. This is not the promise I had made to you earlier. Let the princess happily go to the forest adorned with all jewels and with all other necessities.

content: अजीवनार्हेण मया नृशंसा कृता प्रतिज्ञा नियमेन तावत्। तवया हि बाल्यात् प्रतिपन्नमेतत्  तन्मां दहेद्वेणुमिवात्मपुष्पम्।।2.38.7।।
explanation: By giving this cruel promise through importunity, I have rendered myself unfit to live. This promise was made as a child's play and it (now) destroys me like a bamboo destroyed by its own flowers.

content: रामेण यदि ते पापे किञ्चित्कृतमशोभनम्। अपकारः क इह ते वैदेह्या दर्शितोऽधमे।।2.38.8।।
explanation: O sinful woman O wretch Rama might have done something unbecoming to you, but what offence has Sita committed?

content: मृगीवोत्फुल्लनयना मृदुशीला तपस्वीनी। अपकारं कमिह ते करोति जनकात्मजा।।2.38.9।।
explanation: What wrong has the daughter of Janaka largeeyed like a doe, so gentle and worthy of compassion done to you?

content: ननु पर्याप्त मेतत्ते पापे रामविवासनम्। किमेभिः कृपणैर्भूय: पातकैरपि ते कृतैः।।2.38.10।।
explanation: Rama's exile, O wicked woman, is enough for you. What are you committing further heinous crimes for?

content: प्रतिज्ञातं मया तावत् त्वयोक्तं देवि शृण्वता। रामं यदभिषेकाय त्वमिहागतमब्रवीः।।2.38.11।।
explanation: I have heard you, O Devi speaking to Rama when he came here in connection with the coronation. I promised you to that extent only.

content: तत्त्वेतत्समतिक्रम्य निरयं गन्तुमिच्छसि।मैथिलीमपि या हि त्वमीक्षसे चीरवासिनीम्।।2.38.12।।
explanation: Having exceeded all that, you want to behold Sita in bark garment and thereby, wish for hell.

content: इतीव राजा विलपन्महात्मा शोकस्य नान्तं स ददर्श किञ्चित्।भृशातुरत्वाच्च पपात भूमौ तेनैव पुत्रव्यसनेन मग्नः।।2.38.13।।
explanation: The king could not see any end to his lamentation. Immersed in the grief of separation from his son and deeply tormented, he fell down on the ground.

content: एवं ब्रुवन्तं पितरं रामस्सम्प्रस्थितो वनम्। अवाक्छिरसमासीनमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.38.14।।
explanation: Rama who was about to leave for the forest addressed his father who sat with his head bent once again:

content: यं धार्मिक कौशल्या मम माता यशस्विनी। वृद्धा चाक्षुद्रशीला च न च त्वां देव गर्हते।।2.38.15।।
explanation: O righteous father O king my aged and illustrious mother, Kausalya possesses neither a mean character nor does she blame you.

content: मया विहीनां वरद प्रपन्नां शोकसागरम्। अदृष्टपूर्वव्यसनां भूयस्सम्मन्तुमर्हसि।।2.38.16।।
explanation: O bestower of boons,  separated from me and unaccustomed to suffering, she will be plunged into an unforeseen ocean of sorrow. You should pay her greater attention.

content: पुत्रशोकं यथा नर्च्छेत्त्वया पूज्येन पूजिता। मां हि सञ्चिन्तयन्ती सा त्वयि जीवेत्तपस्विनी।।2.38.17।।
explanation: Let her not grieve on account of her son. O venerable father, if she, who deserves compassion is honoured by you, she will live.

content: इमां महेंन्द्रोपम जातगर्धिनीं तथा विधातुं जननीं ममार्हसि। यथा वनस्थे मयि शोककर्शिता न जीवितं न्यस्य यमक्षयं व्रजेत्।।2.38.18।।
explanation: You are powerful like Indra.You should act accordingly so that my mother who has a possesive feeling towards her son should not, due to emaciation go to the abode of Yama after my departure for the forest. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे अष्टत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyeighth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Lamentations of Dasaratha--Sumantra fetches the chariot at the command of the king treasury officer gives valuable ornaments and garments to Sita--Kausalya instructs Sita on the obligations of a wife towards her husband-- Rama seeks leave of his other mothers.]रामस्य तु वचः शृत्वा मुनिवेशधरं च तम्।समीक्ष्य सह भार्याभी राजा विगतचेतनः।।2.39.1।।नैनं दुःखेन सन्तप्तः प्रत्यवैक्षत राघवम्।न चैनमभिसम्प्रेक्ष्य प्रत्यभाषत दुर्मनाः।।2.39.2।।
explanation: After hearing  Rama and beholding him in the robes of  an ascetic, Dasaratha and his wives fell unconscious. With his body and mind afflicted with grief, Dasaratha could not look Rama in the face nor could he make a reply.

content: रामस्य तु वचः शृत्वा मुनिवेशधरं च तम्।समीक्ष्य सह भार्याभी राजा विगतचेतनः।।2.39.1।।नैनं दुःखेन सन्तप्तः प्रत्यवैक्षत राघवम्।न चैनमभिसम्प्रेक्ष्य प्रत्यभाषत दुर्मनाः।।2.39.2।।
explanation: After hearing  Rama and beholding him in the robes of  an ascetic, Dasaratha and his wives fell unconscious. With his body and mind afflicted with grief, Dasaratha could not look Rama in the face nor could he make a reply.

content: स मुहूर्तमिवासंज्ञो दुःखितश्च महीपतिः।विललाप महाबाहू राममेवानुचिन्तयन्।।2.39.3।।
explanation: The mightyarmed king lost consciousness for a moment and in grief lamented, brooding only over Rama.

content: मन्ये खलु मया पूर्वं विवत्सा बहवःकृताः।प्राणिनो हिंसिता वापि तस्मादिदमुपस्थितम्।।2.39.4।।
explanation: 'In the past I must have separated many from their children or harmed many living beings. That is why I think this calamity has befallen me.

content: न त्वेवानागते काले देहाच्च्यवति जीवितम्।कैकेय्या क्लिश्यमानस्य मृत्युर्मम न विद्यते।।2.39.5।।योऽहं पावकसङ्काशं पश्यामि पुरतः स्थितम्।विहाय वसने सूक्ष्मे तापसाच्छादमात्मजम्।।2.39.6।।
explanation: Unless the destined hour arrives, life does not leave the body. Therefore, even though I am tormented by Kaikeyi and even after seeing my son, standing before me, (bright) like fire, taking off his fine clothes and wearing the robes of an ascetic my end does not come.

content: एकस्याः खलु कैकेय्याः कृतेऽयं क्लिश्यते जनः।स्वार्थे प्रयतमानायाः संश्रित्य निकृतिं त्विमाम्।।2.39.7।।
explanation: Only because of Kaikeyi  who resorted to this deception in pursuit of selfish ends so many people are made to suffer.

content: एवमुक्त्वा तु वचनं बाष्पेण पिहितेन्द्रियः।रामेति सकृदेवोक्त्वा व्याहर्तुं न शशाक ह।।2.39.8।।
explanation: Having uttered these words and muttering, 'O Rama' only once, his vision blurred by tears, he could speak no more.

content: संज्ञां तु प्रतिलभ्यैव मुहूर्तात्स महीपतिः।नेत्राभ्यामश्रुपूर्णाभ्यां सुमन्त्रमिदमब्रवीत्।।2.39.9।।
explanation: Regaining his senses in a moment, the king, with eyes filled with tears, said to Sumantra:

content: औपवाह्यं रथं युक्त्वा त्वमायाहि हयोत्तमैः।प्रापयैनं महाभागमितो जनपदात्परम्।।2.39.10।।
explanation: Harness the finest horses to the chariot suitable for the journey, drive this magnanimous Rama to a place outside the city, and come back.

content: एवं मन्ये गुणवतां गुणानां फलमुच्यते।पित्रा मात्रा च यत्साधुर्वीरो निर्वास्यते वनम्।।2.39.11।।
explanation: That the pious and heroic son is banished by his parents to the forest is, I think, the reward to the virtuous for his virtues.

content: राज्ञो वचनमाज्ञाय सुमन्त्रः शीघ्रविक्रमः।योजयित्वाऽययौ तत्र रथमश्वैरलङ्कृतम्।।2.39.12।।
explanation: In obedience to the words of the king, Sumantra promptly harnessed the horses to a welldecorated chariot and brought it there.

content: तं रथं राजपुत्राय सूत: कनकभूषितम्।आचचक्षेऽञ्जलिं कृत्वा युक्तं परमवाजिभिः।।2.39.13।।
explanation: With folded palms Sumantra informed the prince that a chariot, decked in gold and harnessed with excellent horses, is ready.

content: राजा सत्वरमाहूय व्यापृतं वित्तसंञ्चये।उवाच देशकालज्ञो निश्चितं सर्वत श्शुचिम्।।2.39.14।।
explanation: The king who was aware of the right place and time summoned hurriedly the treaury officer, who was firm and honest and said to him:

content: वासांसि च महार्हाणि भूषणानि वराणि च।वर्षाण्येतानि सङ्ख्याय वैदेह्याः क्षिप्रमानय।।2.39.15।।
explanation: Assess the (needs for) number of years the princess of Videha (Sita) is going to be in the forest, and fetch her quickly highly valuable garments and excellent ornaments.

content: नरेन्द्रेणैवमुक्तस्तु गत्वा कोशगृहं ततः।प्रायच्छत्सर्वमाहृत्य सीतायै सममेव तत्।।2.39.16।।
explanation: Ordered thus by the king, the officer went to the treasury, collected all the things and presented them to Sita.

content: सा सुजाता सुजातानि वैदेही प्रस्थिता वनम्।भूषयामास गात्राणि तैर्विचित्रैर्विभूषणैः।।2.39.17।।
explanation: That princess of noble birth from Videha adorned her beautiful limbs with the sparkling ornaments and got ready to depart for the forest.

content: व्यराजयत वैदेही वेश्म तत्सुविभूषिता।उद्यतोंऽशुमतः काले खं प्रभेव विवस्वतः।।2.39.18।।
explanation: Welladorned Sita illumined the palace like the rising Sun lighting up the sky at dawn.

content: तां भुजाभ्यां परिष्वज्य श्वश्रूर्वचनमब्रवीत्।अनाचरन्ती कृपणं मूर्ध्न्युपाघ्राय मैथिलीम्।।2.39.19।।
explanation: Kausalya, Sita's motherinlaw, took her in her arms, embraced her, kissed her on the forehead, and said to her who conducted herself without evoking any pity.

content: असत्य स्सर्वलोकेऽस्मिन्सततं सत्कृताः प्रियैः।भर्तारं नानुमन्यन्ते विनिपातगतं स्त्रियः।।2.39.20।।
explanation: Those women who, although always gratified, do not follow their husband when they fall into misfortune, are regarded as unfaithful.

content: एष स्वभावो नारीणामनुभूय पुरा सुखम्।अल्पामप्यापदं प्राप्य दुष्यन्ति प्रजहत्यपि।।2.39.21।।
explanation: Though they have enjoyed all pleasures (with their husbands) earlier, they censure them in the wake of the slightest trouble or even abandon them. This is the nature of women.

content: असत्यशीला विकृता दुर्ग्राह्यहृदयास्सदा।युवत्यः पापसंङ्कल्पाः क्षणमात्राद्विरागिणः।।2.39.22।।
explanation: Evilminded young ladies are infidels. They are of perverted nature. They are inscrutable. In an instant they lose their love (for their husbands).

content: न कुलं न कृतं विद्या न दत्तं नापि सङ्ग्रहः।स्त्रीणां गृह्णाति हृदयमनित्यहृदया हि ताः।।2.39.23।।
explanation: Neither family traditions nor benefits received, nor education nor affection nor gifts nor even accumulated wealth attract women's hearts. Their minds are unstable indeed.

content: साध्वीनां हि स्थितानां तु शीले सत्ये श्रुते शमे।स्त्रीणां पवित्रं परमं पतिरेको विशिष्यते।।2.39.24।।
explanation: But for those virtuous women whose minds are fixed in chastity, truth, scriptures and stability, the husband occupies a distinguished place and is considered supremely holy.

content: स त्वया नावमन्तव्यः पुत्रः प्रव्राजितो मम।तव दैवतमस्त्वेष निर्धनः सधनोऽपि वा।।2.39.25।।
explanation: You must not underestimate my son in his exile. You must treat him as your god whether he is wealthy or not.

content: विज्ञाय वचनं सीता तस्या धर्मार्थसंहितम्।कृताञ्जलिरुवाचेदं श्वश्रूमभिमुखे स्थिताम्।।2.39.26।।
explanation: Sita who understood the import of these words which were in conformity with dharma and artha, repiled to her motherinlaw facing her with folded palms:

content: करिष्ये सर्वमेवाहमार्या यदनुशास्ति माम्।अभिज्ञास्मि यथा भर्तुर्वर्तितव्यं श्रुतं च मे।।2.39.27।।
explanation: I shall do exactly all that the venerable motherinlaw instructs me. I have heard it earlier and have fully understood as to how I should conduct myself towards my husband.

content: न मामसज्जनेनार्या समानयितुमर्हति।धर्माद्विचलितुं नाहमलं चन्द्रादिव प्रभा।।2.39.28।।
explanation: My worshipful motherinlaw should not equate me with wicked people (women). I cannot swerve from the path of virtue like radiance which never leaves the Moon.

content: नातन्त्री वाद्यते वीणा नाचक्रो वर्तते रथः।नापतिस्सुखमेधेत या स्यादपि शतात्मजा।।2.39.29।।
explanation: A veena (lute) sans strings cannot be played. A chariot without wheels cannot move. Similarly, a woman without her husband finds no  happiness even though she has one hundred sons.

content: मितं ददाति हि पिता मितं माता मितं सुतः।अमितस्य हि दातारं भर्तारं का न पूजयेत्।।2.39.30।।
explanation: While the happiness that the father, mother and son give is limited, a husband gives unlimited happiness. Which wife will not worship such a husband?

content: साहमेवं गता श्रेष्ठा श्रुतधर्मपरावरा।आर्ये किमवमन्येऽहं स्त्रीणां भर्ता हि दैवतम्।।2.39.31।।
explanation: Instructed about my obligations by an eminent lady (her mother?), imbued with these ideals, how can I, O exalted one, underestimate him (my husband)? For a woman the husband is a god indeed

content: सीताया वचनं श्रुत्वा कौशल्या हृदयङ्गमम्।शुद्धसत्त्वा मुमोचाश्रु सहसा दुःखहर्षजम्।।2.39.32।।
explanation: Listening to the heartstirring words of Sita, Kausalya with her heart so pure burst instantaneously into tears of joy and grief.

content: तां प्राञ्जलिरभिक्रम्य मातृमध्येऽतिसत्कृताम्। रामः परमधर्मात्मा मातरं वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।2.39.33।।
explanation: Most virtuous Rama approached his mother, that highly revered lady among all his mothers, and with folded hands said:

content: अम्ब मा दुःखिता भूस्त्वं पश्य त्वं पितरं मम।।क्षयो हि वनवासस्य क्षिप्रमेव भविष्यति।।2.39.34।।
explanation: O mother, do not grieve. Look after my father. My stay in the forest will soon come to an end.

content: सुप्तायास्ते गमिष्यन्ति नव वर्षाणि पञ्च च।सा समग्रमिह प्राप्तं मां द्रक्ष्यसि सुहृद्वृतम्।।2.39.35।।
explanation: Fourteen years will pass off like a night's sleep. You will see me come home safe and sound, surrounded by my friends.

content: एतावदभिनीतार्थमुक्त्वा स जननीं वचः।त्रयश्शतशतार्धाश्च ददर्शा वेक्ष्य मातरः।।2.39.36।।
explanation: Speaking thus to his mother with highly polished words, he then turned his gaze at his other three hundred and fifty mothers.

content: ता श्चापि स तथैवार्ता मातृ़र्दशरथात्मजः।धर्मयुक्तमिदं वाक्यं निजगाद कृताञ्जलिः।।2.39.37।।
explanation: To all the mothers who stood deeply distressed with grief the son of Dasaratha spoke with folded hands these words suffused with virtue:

content: संवासात्परुषं किञ्चिदज्ञानाद्वापि यत्कृतम्।तन्मे समनुजानीत सर्वाश्चामन्त्रयामि वः।।2.39.38।।
explanation: If I have been harsh towards you, on account of our living together or through ignorance may you forgive me. I (now) seek leave of you all.

content: वचनं राघवस्यैतध्दर्मयुक्तं समाहितम्।शुश्रुवुस्ताः स्त्रियंस्सर्वा श्शोकोपहतचेतसः।।2.39.39।।
explanation: All the women with their senses afflicted by grief heard the virtuous and wellbalanced words of the scion of the Raghu race:

content: जज्ञेऽथ तासां सन्नादः क्रौञ्चीनामिव निस्वनः।मानवेन्द्रस्य भार्याणामेवं वदति राघवे।।2.39.40।।
explanation: While Rama said so, there arose a loud cry of the wives of the king like the cry of the female herons.

content: मुरजपणवमेघघोषवत्दशरथवेश्म बभूव यत्पुरा।विलपितपरिदेवनाकुलंव्यसनगतं तदभूत्सुदुःखितम्।।2.39.41।।
explanation: Dasaratha's palace which reverberated, like the rumblings of the cloud, with the sounds of drums and other musical instruments earlier, now immensely griefsticken and trapped in calamity, is filled with wailings and lamentations. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकोनचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyninth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of  the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama, Lakshmana and Sita set out for the forest--wailing of citizens, queens and the king.]अथ रामश्च सीता च लक्ष्मणश्च कृताञ्जलिः। उपसङ्गृह्य राजानं चक्रुर्दीना: प्रदक्षिणम्।।2.40.1।।
explanation: Thereafter, Sita, Rama and Lakshmana with folded palms in a forlom state touched (the feet of) the king and circumambulated him.

content: तं चापि समनुज्ञाप्य धर्मज्ञस्सीतया सह। राघव श्शोकसम्मूढो जननीमभ्यवादयत्।।2.40.2।।
explanation: Taking leave of Dasaratha, the righteous descendant of the Raghus (Rama) along with Sita paid obeisance to his mother Kausalya who was afflicted with deep grief.

content: अअन्वक्षं लक्ष्मणो भ्रातुः कौशल्यामभ्यवादयत्। अथ मातु स्सुमित्राया जग्राह चरणौ पुनः।।2.40.3।।
explanation: Immediately following Rama, his brother, Lakshmana also paid obeisance to Kausalya and, thereafter, held the feet of his own mother Sumitra.

content: तं वन्दमानं रुदती माता सौमित्रिमब्रवीत्।हितकामा महाबाहुं मूध्नर्युपाघ्राय लक्ष्मणम्।।2.40.4।।
explanation: While the mightyarmed Lakshmana paid her homage, Sumitra wailed, kissed him on his forehead, wished him well and said:

content: सृष्टस्त्वं वनवासाय स्वनुरक्तस्सुहृज्जने। रामे प्रमादं मा कार्षीः पुत्र भ्रातरि गच्छति।।2.40.5।।
explanation: Although deeply attached to your beloved ones, O Son, you are born to dwell in the forest. Never be inattentive towards your brother Rama who is on his way (to the forest).

content: व्यसनी वा समृद्धो वा गतिरेष तवानघ। एष लोके सतां धर्मो यज्ज्येष्ठवशगो भवेत्।।2.40.6।।
explanation: Rama is your refuge in times of adversity or prosperity, O sinless one To be obedient to the eldest (brother) is the duty of virtuous men in this world.

content: इदं हि वृत्तमुचितं कुलस्यास्य सनातनम्।दानं दीक्षा च यज्ञेषु तनुत्यागो मृधेषु च।।2.40.7।।
explanation: Charity, initiation at sacrifices and yielding life in battles are the befitting ancient traditions prevailing in your race.

content: लक्ष्मणं त्वेवमुक्त्वा सा संसिद्धं प्रियराघवम्।सुमित्रा गच्छ गच्छेति पुनः पुनरुवाच तम्।।2.40.8।।
explanation: Having said this to Lakshmana Sumitra again and again said to her beloved Rama, who was fully prepared, 'Go, go'.

content: रामं दशरथं विद्धि मां विद्धि जनकात्मजाम्। अयोध्यामटवीं विध्दि गच्छ तात यथासुखम्।।2.40.9।।
explanation: (To Lakshmana she said) Regard Rama as Dasaratha, Sita as me and the forest as Ayodhya. My child, go in peace.

content: ततः सुमन्त्रः काकुत्स्थं प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यमब्रवीत्। विनीतो विनयज्ञश्च मातलिर्वासवं यथा।।2.40.10।।
explanation: Then Sumantra who knows the ways of politeness and humility spoke to Rama, with folded hands as Matali did to Indra.

content: ररथमारोह भद्रं ते राजपुत्र महायशः। क्षिप्रं त्वां प्रापयिष्यामि यत्र मां राम वक्ष्यसि।।2.40.11।।
explanation: O Illustrious prince, wish you well Mount the chariot. I shall convey you speedily whereever you want.

content: चतुर्दश हि वर्षाणि वस्तव्यानि वने त्वया। तान्युपक्रमितव्यानि यानि देव्यासि चोदितः।।2.40.12।।
explanation: You have been directed by Kaikeyi to live in the forest for fourteen years. Accordingly you must now commence counting those years as directed.

content: तं रथं सूर्यसङ्काशं सीता हृष्टेन चेतसा। आरुरोह वरारोहा कृत्वालङ्कारमात्मनः।।2.40.13।।
explanation: Sita of lovely limbs decorated herself and with a cheerful mind boarded the chariot which was shining like the Sun.

content: अथो ज्वलनसङ्काशं चामीकरविभूषितम्। तमारुरुहतुस्तूर्णं भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।।2.40.14।।
explanation: Thereafter, Rama and Lakshmana also boarded that chariot decorated with gold and  shining like blazing fire.

content: वनवासं हि संख्याय वासांस्याभरणानि च। भर्तारमनुगच्छन्त्यै सीतायै श्वशुरो ददौ।।2.40.15।।
explanation: Fatherinlaw (Dasaratha) gave clothes and ornaments on the assessment of the number of years Sita was going to spend in the forest with her husband.

content: तथैवायुधजालानि भ्रातृभ्यां कवचानि च। रथोपस्थे प्रतिन्यस्य सचर्म कठिनं च तत्।।2.40.16।।सीतातृतीयानारूढान् दृष्ट्वा दृष्टमचोदयत्। सुमन्त्रस्सम्मतानश्वान् वायुवेगसमान्जवे।।2.40.17।।
explanation: So also Dasaratha secured a multitude of weapons, shields and protective leathercoverings for hands and placed them at the centre of the chariot, for use by the brothers. When Sumantra ensured that Sita, Rama and Lakshmana boarded the chariot,  he briskly hastened the horses which were as speedy as the wind.

content: प्रतियाते महारण्यं चिररात्राय राघवे। बभूव नगरे मूर्छा बलमूर्छा जनस्य च।।2.40.18।।
explanation: Having seen Rama set out  for the great forest for a long period, the city was stilled and men were enervated.

content: तत्समाकुलसम्भ्रान्तं मत्तसङ्कुपितद्विपम्। हयशिञ्जितनिर्घोषं पुरमासीन्महास्वनम्।।2.40.19।।
explanation: The city was distressed and flurried by the intoxicated elephants, provoked by the mighty sound of the tinkling of bells and the neighing of the horses.

content: तत स्सबालवृद्धा सा पुरी परमपीडिता। राममेवाभिदुद्राव घर्मार्ता सलिलं यथा।।2.40.20।।
explanation: Thereafter the extremely afflicted people of the city, including young and old alike, ran towards Rama like men oppressed with heat running for water.

content: पार्श्वतः पृष्ठतश्चापि लम्बमानास्तदुन्मुखाः। बाष्पपूर्णमुखास्सर्वे तमूचुर्भृशनिस्वनाः।।2.40.21।।
explanation: All the people hanging from the chariot from behind and by the sides, heaving deeply, their faces covered with tears, thus addressed to Sumantra:

content: संयच्छ वाजिनां रश्मीन् सूत याहि शनैश्शनैः। मुखं द्रक्ष्याम रामस्य दुर्दर्शं नो भविष्यति।।2.40.22।।
explanation: O charioteer, control the reins of the horses and go slow so that we may look at the face of Rama, for soon we will not be able to see him.

content: आयसं हृदयं नूनं राममातुरसंशयम्।यद्देवगर्भप्रतिमे वनं याति न भिद्यते।।2.40.23।।
explanation: Alas, the heart of Kausalya whose son, Rama, resembles the offspring of the gods, does not break even though he is going to the forest Undoubtedly it must be made of iron.

content: कृतकृत्या हि वैदेही छायेवानुगता पतिम्। न जहाति रता धर्मे मेरुमर्कप्रभा यथा।।2.40.24।।
explanation: Sita, deeply attached to her duty, and with her desire fulfilled is following her husband like a shadow just as the sunlight which never leaves mount Meru.

content: अहो लक्ष्मण सिद्धार्थ स्सततं प्रियवादिनम्।भ्रातरं देवसङ्काशं यस्त्वं परिचरिष्यसि।।2.40.25।।
explanation: With your desires fulfilled, O Lakshmana, you will attend to your godlike brother who always speaks pleasant words.

content: महत्येषा हि ते सिध्दिरेष चाभ्युदयो महान्। एष स्वर्गस्य मार्गश्च यदेनमनुगच्छसि।।2.40.26।।
explanation: The very fact that you are  following Rama is a great achievement and a great fortune for you. This, in fact, is the way to heaven.

content: एवं वदन्तस्ते सोढुं न शेकुर्बाष्पमागतम्। नरास्तमनुगच्छन्तः प्रियमिक्ष्वाकुनन्दनम्।।2.40.27।।
explanation: Speaking thus, the people following their beloved Rama, the delight of the Ikshvaku dynasty, were not able to bear (restrain) the tears flowing from their eyes.

content: अथ राजा वृत स्त्रीभिर्दीनाभिर्दीनचेतनः।निर्जगाम प्रियं पुत्रं द्रक्ष्यामीति ब्रुवन् गृहात्।।2.40.28।।
explanation: I wish to see my beloved son said the king with a sense of desolation and emerged, surrounded by forlorn women, from the palace.

content: शुश्रुवे चाग्रतः स्त्रीणां रुदन्तीनां महास्वनः।यथा नादः करेणूनां बद्धे महति कुञ्जरे।।2.40.29।।
explanation: He heard the women crying loudly in front like wailings of cowelephants when their bull elephant is captured.

content: पिता हि राजा काकुत्स्थः श्रीमान् सन्नस्तदाऽभवत्। परिपूर्णः शशी काले ग्रहेणोपप्लुतो यथा।।2.40.30।।
explanation: The king born in the race of Kakutstha, though bright, looked dull then like the full Moon eclipsed (by Rahu).

content: स च श्रीमानचिन्त्यात्मा रामो दशरथात्मजः।सूतं सञ्चोदयामास त्वरितं वाह्यतामिति।।2.40.31।।
explanation: The son of Dasaratha, glorious Rama of inconceivable courage, exhorted the charioteer to drive the chariot fast.

content: रामो याहीति सूतं तं तिष्ठेति स जनस्तदा। उभयं नाशकत्सूतः कर्तुमध्वनि चोदितः।।2.40.32।।
explanation: Urged by Rama to drive fast on the one hand and by the citizens to stay, on the other, the charioteer could do neither on the way.

content: निर्गच्छति महाबाहौ रामे पौरजनाश्रुभिः।पतितैरभ्यवहितं प्रशशाम महीरजः।।2.40.33।।
explanation: As the mightyarmed Rama was going away, the dust raised from the earth subsided with the tears falling from the citizens' (eyes).

content: रुदिताश्रुपरिद्यूनं हाहाकृतमचेतनम्।  प्रयाणे राघवस्यासीत्पुरं परमपीडितम्।।2.40.34।।
explanation: At the time of Rama's departure, the insensate city was drenched with tears of the deeply afflicted people crying, 'Alas, Alas'.

content: सुस्राव नयनैः स्त्रीणामस्रमायाससम्भवम्।मीनसङ्क्षोभचलितै स्सलिलं पङ्कजैरिव।।2.40.35।।
explanation: Tears born of anguish fell from the eyes of women just as waterdrops fall from lotuses shaken by the movements of fishes.

content: दृष्ट्वा तु नृपति श्श्रीमानेकचित्तगतं पुरम्। निपपातैव दुःखेन हतमूल इव द्रुमः।।2.40.36।।
explanation: Having seen the city (people) absorbed in one single thought, the prosperous king, griefstricken, fell down on the ground like a tree severed at its root.

content: ततो हलहलाशब्दो जज्ञे रामस्य पृष्ठतः।नराणां प्रेक्ष्य राजानं सीदन्तं भृशदुःखितम्।।2.40.37।।
explanation: When the people saw the king enfeebled by deep grief, they raised an uproar behind Rama's (chariot).

content: हा रामेति जनाः केचिद्राममातेति चापरे। अन्तःपुरं समृद्धं च क्रोशन्तः पर्यदेवयन्।।2.40.38।।
explanation: Some among them wailed 'Oh Rama', while some others cried 'Oh mother of Rama' By crying loudly, they made the women in the inner apartment cry too.

content: अन्वीक्षमाणो रामस्तु विषण्णं भ्रान्तचेतसम्।राजानं मातरं चैव ददर्शानुगतौ पथि।।2.40.39।।
explanation: When Rama glanced back, he saw his mother and father trailing behind him on the highway, with an agitated and dejected mind.

content: स बद्ध इव पाशेन किशोरो मातरं यथा।धर्मपाशेन सङ्क्षिप्तः प्रकाशं नाभ्युदैक्षत।।2.40.40।।
explanation: Like a fastened foal cannot see its mother, Rama restrained by bonds of duty could not see his parents clearly.

content: पदातिनौ च यानार्हावदुःखार्हौ सुखोचितौ। दृष्ट्वा सञ्चोदयामास शीघ्रं याहीति सारथिम्।।2.40.41।।
explanation: Seeing his parents, who were worthy of riding a chariot now going on foot, who were accustomed to comforts and did not deserve any suffering, Rama urged his charioteer to drive fast.

content: न हि तत्पुरुषव्याघ्रो दुःखदं दर्शनं पितुः। मातुश्च सहितुं शक्तस्तोत्रार्दित इव द्विपः।।2.40.42।।
explanation: Rama the best among men, could not, like an elephant tormented by the goad, endure that pitiful sight of his father and mother.

content: प्रत्यगारमिवायान्ती वत्सला वत्सकारणात्। बद्धवत्सा यथा धेनू राममाताभ्यधावत।।2.40.43।।
explanation: Rama's mother ran after the chariot, like an affectionate cow running towards the shed to join its fastened calf.

content: तथा रुदन्तीं कौसल्यां रथं तमनुधावतीम्। क्रोशन्तीं राम रामेति हा सीते लक्ष्मणेति च।।2.40.44।।रामलक्ष्मणसीतार्थं स्रवन्तीं वारि नेत्रजम्। असकृत्प्रैक्षत तदा नृत्यन्तीमिव मातरम्।।2.40.45।।
explanation: While Kausalya was weeping and running after the chariot, crying O 'Rama, O Sita, O Lakshmana, shedding tears for them, Rama repeatedly glanced at her who was twisting and bending as if in a dancing pose.

content: तिष्ठेति राजा चुक्रोश याहि याहीति राघवः। सुमन्त्रस्य बभूवात्मा चक्रयोरिव चान्तरा।।2.40.46।।
explanation: The king cried, 'Stay, Stay', while Rama said 'Go on, Go on'. Sumantra's mind was caught as if in between two wheels.

content: नाश्रौषमिति राजानमुपालब्धोऽपि वक्ष्यसि। चिरं दुःखस्य पापिष्ठमिति रामस्तमब्रवीत्।।2.40.47।।
explanation: When the king reproaches you for not stopping the chariot, you can say 'I could not hear'.Prolonging agony is sinful, said Rama to Sumantra.

content: रामस्य स वचः कुर्वन्ननुज्ञाप्य च तं जनम्। व्रजतोऽपि हयान् शीघ्रं चोदयामास सारथिः।।2.40.48।।
explanation: Obeying the command of Rama and after taking leave of the people, Sumantra hastened the horses although they were galloping.

content: न्यवर्तत जनो राज्ञो रामं कृत्वा प्रदक्षिणम्। मनसाप्यश्रुवेगैश्च न न्यवर्तत मानुषम्।।2.40.49।।
explanation: The king's men returned, with Rama circumambulated (on the plane of their minds). But from their minds they could not hold back their tears (grief).

content: यमिच्छेत्पुनरायान्तं नैनं दूरमनुव्रजेत्। इत्यमात्या महाराजमूचुर्दशरथं वचः।।2.40.50।।
explanation: We should not follow over a long distance those we wish to return, said the ministers to king Dasaratha.

content: तेषां वचः सर्वगुणोपपन्नं प्रस्विन्नगात्रः प्रविषण्णरूपः। निशम्य राजा कृपणः सभार्यो व्यवस्थितस्तं सुतमीक्षमाणः।।2.40.51।।
explanation: Dasaratha and his wives, overcome with grief, heard their words steeped in virtue (wisdom). The king stood there with his perspiring body and melancholic appearance, fixing his gaze on his son.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortieth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic  composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [On the departure of Rama to the forest, citizens of Ayodhya and women from the inner apartment lament]तस्मिन्स्तु पुरुषव्याघ्रे विनिर्याति कृताञ्जलौ।आर्तशब्दोऽहि सञ्जज्ञे स्त्रीणामन्त:पुरे महान्।।2.41.1।।
explanation: When Rama, the foremost men, was departing with folded palms there arose a huge cry of distress from the inner apartment of ladies.

content: अनाथस्य जनस्यास्य दुर्बलस्य तपस्विनः।यो गतिश्शरणं चासीत्स नाथः क्व नु गच्छति।।2.41.2।।
explanation: Rama was a refuge and a protector to all the people who were defenceless, weak and miserable. Where is such a protector going now? (said the people).

content: न क्रुध्यत्यभिशप्तोऽपि क्रोधनीयानि वर्जयन्।क्रुद्धान्प्रसादयन्सर्वान् समदुःखः क्व गज्छति।।2.41.3।।
explanation: Where is he who, even if reviled, never gets angry, never does acts that provoke anger, pacifies those who are enraged and shares the sorrows of others going now?

content: कौशल्यायां महातेजा यथा मातरि वर्तते।तथा यो वर्ततेऽस्मासु महात्मा क्व नु गच्छति।।2.41.4।।
explanation: Where is he, that effulgent, magnanimous one who treated us (with the same respect) as he treated his mother Kausalya, going now?

content: कैकेय्या क्लिश्यमानेन राज्ञा सञ्चोदितो वनम्।परित्राता जनस्यास्य जगतः क्व नु गच्छति।।2.41.5।।
explanation: Tormented by Kaikeyi, the king ordered him to go to the forest. Where is he, who happened to be the protector of the people of this world, going now?

content: अहो निश्चेतनो राजा जीवलोकस्य सम्प्रियम्।धर्म्यं सत्यव्रतं रामं वनवासे प्रवत्स्यति।।2.41.6।।
explanation: Alas, the king must be devoid of any sense as he is sending away Rama, who is dear to the world, is righteous and truthful, to dwell in the forest.

content: इति सर्वा महिष्यस्ता विवत्सा इव धेनवः।रुरुदुश्चैव दुःखार्ताः सस्वरं च विचुक्रुशुः।।2.41.7।।
explanation: So wept aloud the anguished wives of the king like cows separated from their calves.

content: स तमन्तः पुरे घोरमार्तशब्दं महीपतिः।पुत्रशोकाभिसन्तप्तः श्रुत्वा चासीत्सुदुःखितः।।2.41.8।।
explanation: Upon hearing the dreadful wailing from the inner apartments of the palace, the king already devasted at the separation from his son, grew even more distressed.

content: नाग्निहोत्राण्यहूयन्त नापचन् गृहमेधिनःअकुर्वन्न प्रजाः कार्यं सूर्यश्चान्तरधीयत।।2.41.9।।
explanation: The sacred fire in agnihotra sacrifices was not invoked householders did not cook their food the people did not attend to their daily chores. And the Sun set.

content: व्यसृजन् कबलान्नागा गावो वत्सान्न पाययन्।पुत्रं प्रथमजं लब्ध्वा जननी नाभ्यनन्दत।।2.41.10।।
explanation: Elephants dropped their morsel of food. Cows did not suckle their calves. Even the mothers were not pleased with their firstborn sons.

content: त्रिशङ्कुर्लोहिताङ्गश्च बृहस्पतिबुधावपि।दारुणा स्सोममभ्येत्य ग्रहास्सर्वे व्यवस्थिताः।।2.41.11।।
explanation: The constellation Trishanku, the planets Mars, Jupiter, Mercury and other fierce planets took their position near the Moon.

content: नक्षत्राणि गतार्चींषि ग्रहाश्च गततेजसः।विशाखास्तु सधूमाश्च नभसि प्रचकाशिरे।।2.41.12।।
explanation: The stars were shorn of their radiance. The brilliance of the planets diminished. Shrouded in smoke the Visakha constellation appeared in the sky.

content: कालिकानिलवेगेन महोदधिरिवोत्थितः।रामे वनं प्रव्रजिते नगरं प्रचचाल तत्।।2.41.13।।
explanation: After Rama left for the forest, dark clouds appeared (in the sky) like the (waves of) the great ocean uplifted by the speed of the wind which shook the city.

content: दिशः पर्याकुलास्सर्वा स्तिमिरेणेव संवृताः।न ग्रहो नापि नक्षत्रं प्रचकाशे नकिञ्चन।।2.41.14।।
explanation: As if covered with darkness, all the cardinal points became agitated. No planet, no star nor was anything (any heavenly body) shining (in the sky).

content: अकस्मान्नागरस्सर्वो जनो दैन्यमुपागमत्।आहारे वा विहारे वा न कश्चिदकरोन्मनः।।2.41.15।।
explanation: All of a sudden the people of the city became miserable. No one was interested in eating and enjoying (life).

content: शोकपर्यायसन्तप्त स्सततं दीर्घमुच्छवसन्।अयोध्यायां जनस्सर्व श्शुशोच जगतीपतिम्।।2.41.16।।
explanation: All the citizens of Ayodhya, afflicted with a series of grief and heaving deep sighs  ceaselessly bewailed at the sight of the lord of the world (Dasaratha).

content: बाष्पपर्याकुलमुखो राजमार्गगतो जनः।न हृष्टो लक्ष्यते कश्चित्सर्व श्शोकपरायणः।।2.41.17।।
explanation: The faces of the people on the highway were turbid with tears. None looked happy. All were plunged in sorrow.

content: न वाति पवन श्शीतो न शशी सौम्यदर्शनः।न सूर्यस्तपते लोकं सर्वं पर्याकुलं जगत्।।2.41.18।।
explanation: The breeze did not blow cool. No more did the Moon look pleasant. The Sun did not give warmth to the world. All the world was agitated.

content: अनर्थिनस्सुताः स्त्रीणां भर्तारो भ्रातरस्तथा।सर्वे सर्वं परित्यज्य राममेवान्वचिन्तयन्।।2.41.19।।
explanation: Mothers stopped thinking of their sons and husbands of their wives. Brothers were no longer interested in each other. Every one deserted every one and thought only of Rama.

content: ये तु रामस्य सुहृद स्सर्वे ते मूढचेतसः।शोकभारेण चाक्रान्ता श्शयनं न जहुस्तदा।।2.41.20।।
explanation: All the friends of Rama were stupefied. Afflicted with the burden of sorrow they did not leave their bed.

content: ततस्त्वयोध्या रहिता महात्मनापुरन्दरेणेव मही सपर्वता।चचाल घोरं भयशोकपीडितासनागयोधाश्वगणा ननाद च।।2.41.21।।
explanation: Without magnanimous Rama, Ayodhya thereafter looked like the earth along with its mountains bereft of Indra. Afflicted with fear and sorrow it started shaking dreadfully with the sounds of horses, elephants and warriors. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyfirst sarga of Ayodhyakanda of  the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Grief stricken Dasaratha falls down-- denounces Kaikeyi--reaches the chamber of Kausalya.]यावत्तु निर्यतस्तस्य रजोरूपमदृश्यत।नैवेक्ष्वाकुवरस्तावत्सञ्जहारात्मचक्षुषी।।2.42.1।।
explanation: As long as the dust raised by the wheels of the chariot of Rama (who was departing to the forest) was visible, Dasaratha, the best of the Ikshvakus, could not withdraw his eyes (from  Rama).

content: यावद्राजा प्रियं पुत्रं पश्यत्यत्यन्तधार्मिकम्।तावद्व्यवर्धते वास्य धरण्यां पुत्रदर्शने।।2.42.2।।
explanation: So long as king Dasaratha was able to see his exceedingly virtuous and beloved  son (Rama), it appeared that his body kept rising from the earth to have a sight of his son.

content: न पश्यति रजोऽप्यस्य यदा रामस्य भूमिपः।तदाऽऽर्तश्च विषण्णश्च पपात धरणीतले।।2.42.3।।
explanation: When the king could no longer see even the dust, he fell on the ground, despondent and grief stricken.

content: तस्य दक्षिणमन्वागात्कौसल्या बाहुमङ्गना।वामं चास्यान्वगात्पार्श्वं कैकेयी भरतप्रिया।।2.42.4।।
explanation: Kausalya reached for the right hand of Dasaratha (to raise him up) and Kaikeyi the beloved (mother) of Bharata reached for his left.

content: तां नयेन च सम्पन्नो धर्मेण विनयेन च।उवाच राजा कैकेयीं समीक्ष्य व्यथितेन्द्रियः।।2.42.5।।
explanation: The king, endowed with rectitude, virtue and also humility, stared at  and said to Kaikeyi with pain.

content: कैकेयि मा ममाङ्गानि स्प्राक्षीस्त्वं दुष्टचारिणी।न हि त्वां द्रष्टुमिच्छामि न भार्या न च बान्धवी।।2.42.6।।
explanation: O Kaikeyi you are a woman of evil conduct. Do not touch my body. I do not wish to see you. You are not my wife or my relation.

content: ये च त्वामनुजीवन्ति नाहं तेषां न ते मम।केवलार्थपरां हि त्वां त्यक्तधर्मां त्यजाम्यहम्।।2.42.7।।
explanation: Your dependents have nothing to do with me nor I with them. I denounce you since you are a selfseeker without any sense off righteousness.

content: अगृह्णां यच्च ते पाणिमग्निं पर्यणयं च यत्।अनुजानामि तत्सर्वमस्मिन् लोके परत्र च।।2.42.8।।
explanation: I renounce the relationship established with you through marriage by taking your hand and circumambulating the fire, both in this world and in the next.

content: भरतश्चेत्प्रतीतः स्याद्राज्यं प्राप्येदमव्ययम्।यन्मे स दद्यात्पित्रर्थं मामां तद्दत्तमागमत्।।2.42.9।।
explanation: If Bharata feels pleased to secure this imperishable kingdom, then may his obsequial offerings at my funeral not reach me

content: अथ रेणुसमुध्वस्तं समुत्थाप्य नराधिपम्।न्यवर्तत तदा देवी कौशल्या शोककर्शिता।।2.42.10।।
explanation: Then Kausalya, emaciated due to sorrow, lifted the king who was thoroughly coated with dust and returned to the palace.

content: हत्वेव ब्राह्मणं कामात् स्पृष्ट्वाग्निमिव पाणिना।अन्वतप्यत धर्मात्मा पुत्रं सञ्चिन्त्य तापसम् ।।2.42.11।।
explanation: That virtuous Dasaratha, recalling (the sight of) his son with the robes of an ascetic, burned with remorse as if he had intentionally slain a brahmin or placed his hand in fire.

content: निवृत्त्यैव निवृत्त्यैव सीदतो रथवर्त्मसु।राज्ञो नातिबभौ रूपं ग्रस्तस्यांशुमतो यथा।।2.42.12।।
explanation: Turning back again and again at the trail of (Rama's) chariot, the grieving king appeared lustreless like the Sun in eclipse.

content: विललाप च दुःखार्तः प्रियं पुत्रमनुस्मरन्।नगरान्तमनुप्राप्तं बुध्वा पुत्रमथाब्रवीत्।।2.42.13।।
explanation: The griefstricken king began to lament thinking of his beloved son, and (suddenly) realizing that his son had crossed the limits of the city, said:

content: वाहननां च मुख्यानां वहतां तं ममात्मजम्।पदानि पथि दृश्यन्ते स महात्मा न दृश्यते।।2.42.14।।
explanation: I can see the marks of the hooves of the splendid horses carrying my son on the highway but not that magnanimous Rama.

content: यः सुखेषूपधानेषु शेते चन्दनरूषितः।वीज्यमानो महार्हाभिः स्त्रीभिर्मम सुतोत्तमः।।2.42.15।।स नूनं क्वचिदेवाद्य वृक्षमूलमुपाश्रितः।काष्ठं वा यदि वाश्मानमुपधाय शयिष्यते।।2.42.16।।
explanation: Rama, the best of all my sons who, smeared with sandalpaste and fanned by graceful women used to sleep (with his head) on comfortable cushions will surely, from now on, lie down somewhere at the foot of a tree, (his head) pillowed upon a piece of wood or stone.

content: उत्थास्यति च मेदिन्याः कृपणः पांसुकुण्ठितः।विनिश्श्वसन् प्रस्रवणात्करेणूनामिवर्षभः।।2.42.17।।
explanation: That unfortunate Rama, having been covered with dust, will get up from the ground sighing like a bull elephant rising from mount Prasravana.

content: द्रक्ष्यन्ति नूनं पुरुषा दीर्घबाहुं वनेचराः।राममुत्थाय गच्छन्तं लोकनाथमनाथवत्।।2.42.18।।
explanation: Surely the forestrovers will be gazing upon the longarmed Rama, protector of the world, as he rises (from the ground) and wanders in the jungle unprotected.

content: सा नूनं जनकस्येष्टा सुता सुखसदोचिता।कण्टकाक्रमणाक्लान्ता वनमद्य गमिष्यति।।2.42.19।।
explanation: Sita, beloved daughter of Janaka, who is accustomed to comforts, will now wander in the forest troubled by piercing thorns.

content: अनभिज्ञा वनानां सा नूनं भयमुपैष्यति।श्वापदानर्दितं श्रुत्वा गम्भीरं रोमहर्षणम्।।2.42.20।।
explanation: Sita who knows not the forest will now live in terror, listening to the hairraising, horrible roars of wild animals.

content: सकामा भव कैकेयि विधवा राज्यमावस।न हि तं पुरुषव्याघ्रं विना जीवितुमुत्सहे।।2.42.21।।
explanation: O Kaikeyi, your desire is fulfilled.  Rule the kingdom as a widow. Without Rama, the best of men, I don't desire to live.

content: इत्येवं विलपन् राजा जनौघेनाभिसंवृतः।अपस्नात इवारिष्टं प्रविवेश पुरोत्तमम्।।2.42.22।।
explanation: Thus the king, who looked like one after the inauspicious (funeral) bath, surrounded by streams of people entered the most beautiful city (Ayodhya) which portended misfortune.

content: शून्यचत्वरवेश्मान्तां संवृतापणदेवताम्।क्लान्तदुर्बलदुःखार्तां नात्याकीर्णमहापथाम्।।2.42.23।।तामवेक्ष्य पुरीं सर्वां राममेवानुचिन्तयन्।विलपन् प्राविशद्राजा गृहं सूर्य इवाम्बुदम्।।2.42.24।।
explanation: There the mansions and squares on the highways were all deserted. The temples and marketplaces were closed. The people were weak, fatigued and tormented with grief. The highways were not much crowded. Having seen such a sight of the city on all sides, lamenting and brooding over Rama, Dasaratha entered his palace like the Sun plunging into a cloud.

content: महाह्रदमिवाक्षोभ्यं सुपर्णेन हृतोरगम्।रामेण रहितं वेश्म वैदेह्या लक्ष्मणेन च।।2.42.25।।
explanation: The palace without Rama, Lakshmana and Sita, stood like a vast, unperturbed lake with serpents snatched away by Suparna (Garuda).

content: अथ गद्गदशब्दस्तु विलपन्मनुजाधिपः।उवाच मृदुमन्दार्थं वचनं दीनमस्वरम्।।2.42.26।।
explanation: Thereupon Dasaratha lamenting with his throat choked addressed (his attendants) in a low, feeble, melancholic, gentle voice:

content: कौशल्यायां गृहं शीघ्रं राममातुर्नयन्तु माम्।न ह्यन्यत्र ममाश्वासो हृदयस्य भविष्यति।।2.42.27।।
explanation: Take me quickly to the apartment of Rama's mother, Kausalya. There is no other place where my heart can find solace.

content: इति ब्रुवन्तं राजानमनयन् द्वारदर्शिनः।कौशल्याया गृहं तत्र न्यवेश्यत विनीतवत्।।2.42.28।।
explanation: Having heard the king, the doorkeepers took  him to the apartment of Kausalya and  there respectfully made him rest.

content: ततस्तस्य प्रविष्टस्य कौशल्याया निवेशनम्।अधिरुह्यापि शयनं बभूव लुलितं मनः।।2.42.29।।
explanation: His mind tossed restlessly although he entered Kausalya's palace and climbed into the couch.

content: पुत्रद्वयविहीनं च स्नुषयापि विवर्जितम्।अपश्यद्भवनं राजा नष्टचन्द्रमिवाम्बरम्।।2.42.30।।
explanation: To the king, the palace deserted by his two sons and his daughterinlaw, seemed like the sky without the Moon.

content: तच्च दृष्ट्वा महाराजो भुजमुद्यम्य वीर्यवान्।उच्चैस्स्वरेण चुक्रोश हा राघव जहासि माम्।।2.42.31।।
explanation: The valiant maharaja looked around that palace, lifted up his arms and shouted in a loud voice, Oh scion of the Raghus (Rama) you have forsaken me.

content: सुखिता बत तं कालं जीविष्यन्ति नरोत्तमाः।परिष्वजन्तो ये रामं द्रक्ष्यन्ति पुनरागतम्।।2.42.32।।
explanation: Oh how fortunate are those best of men who will live until that time to see Rama return and embrace him.

content: अथ रात्र्यां प्रपन्नायां कालरात्र्यामिवात्मनः।अर्धरात्रे दशरथः कौशल्यामिदमब्रवीत्।।2.42.33।।
explanation: In the middle of the night which, for him, felt like the night of death Dasaratha said to Kausalya thus:

content: रामं मेऽनुगता दृष्टिरद्यापि न निवर्तते।न त्वा पश्यामि कौसल्ये साधु मां पाणिना स्पृश।।2.42.34।।
explanation: O Kausalya, my sight that had followed Rama has not yet returned. I cannot see you clearly. Please touch me with your hand.

content: तं राममेवानुविचिन्तयन्तं समीक्ष्य देवी शयने नरेन्द्रम्।उपोपविश्याधिकमार्तरूपा विनिश्वसन्ती विललाप कृच्छ्रम्।।2.42.35।।
explanation: Having seen the king in bed brooding over Rama, the queen, (Kausalya), sitting by his side, sighed and lamented, deeply anguished. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे द्विचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortysecond sarga of Ayodhyakanda of  the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Lamentations of Kausalya.]ततः समीक्ष्य शयने सन्नं शोकेन पार्थिवम्।कौशल्या पुत्रशोकार्ता तमुवाच महीपतिम्।।2.43.1।।
explanation: Struck by the grief of her son's departure, Kausalya looked at the king who lay on the couch completely exhausted and said to him.

content: राघवे नरशार्दूले विषमुप्त्वाहिजिह्मगा।  विचरिष्यति कैकेयी निर्मुक्तेव हि पन्नगी।।2.43.2।।
explanation: Moving crookedly like a snake, Kaikeyi has released her venom on Rama, the best among men. Now she will move about freely like a sheserpent that has cast off its slough.

content: विवास्य रामं सुभगा लब्धकामा समाहिता।त्रासयिष्यति मां भूयो दुष्टाहिरिव वेश्मनि।।2.43.3।।
explanation: Having banished Rama, she is now happy with her desires fulfilled. And like a vicious serpent living in the house she will again frighten me.

content: अथ स्म नगरे रामश्चरन् भैक्षं गृहे वसेत्।कामकारो वरं दातुमपि दासं ममात्मजम्।।2.43.4।।
explanation: It would have been better had I offered her my son as a slave. He would have lived on in the house by doing his duties and begging his food in the city.

content: पातयित्वा तु कैकेय्या रामं स्थानाद्यथेष्टतः।प्रदिष्टो रक्षसां भागः पर्वणीवाहिताग्निना।।2.43.5।।
explanation: You have thrown away Rama from his place as per the whim of Kaikeyi, like the share of offering meant for gods given away to rakshasas by the sacrificers on the new Moon days.

content: गजराजगतिर्वीरो महाबाहुर्धनुर्धरः। वनमाविशते नूनं सभार्य स्सह लक्ष्मणः।।2.43.6।।
explanation: My mightyarmed son, a great archer and a hero, Rama whose gait is like that of the king of elephants, must be entering the forest along with his consort Sita and Lakshmana.

content: वने त्वदृष्टदुःखानां केकय्यानुमते त्वया।त्यक्तानां वनवासाय कान्ववस्था भविष्यति।।2.43.7।।
explanation: You have banished them as per the desire of Kaikeyi. What will be their plight in the forest, for they have never experienced any hardship earlier

content: ते रत्नहीनास्तरुणाः फलकाले विवासिताः।कथं वत्स्यन्ति कृपणाः फलमूलैः कृताशनाः।।2.43.8।।
explanation: Deprived of all costly things they have been banished at the tender age of youth, a time for enjoying their lives. How will they lead a miserable life subsisting on fruits and roots?

content: अपीदानीं स कालस्स्यान्मम शोकक्षय श्शिवः।सभार्यं यत्सह भ्रात्रा पश्येयमिह राघवम्।।2.43.9।।
explanation: Will there ever be that auspicious moment to end my sorrow? When I can see  Rama here along with his wife and brother?

content: श्रृत्वैवोपस्थितौ वीरौ कदायोध्या भविष्यति।यशस्विनी हृष्टजना सूच्छ्रितध्वजमालिनी।।2.43.10।।
explanation: When will the city of Ayodhya attain that glory when having heard that both the brave brothers have come back the people will rejoice and fill it with uplifted banners?

content: कदा प्रेक्ष्य नरव्याघ्रावरण्यात्पुनरागतौ।नन्दिष्यति पुरी हृष्टा समुद्र इव पर्वणि।।2.43.11।।
explanation: When will, like the swelling sea on a full Moon day, the city hail the return of Rama and Lakshmana, the best among men?

content: कदाऽयोध्यां महाबाहुः पुरीं वीरः प्रवेक्ष्यति।पुरस्कृत्य रथे सीतां वृषभो गोवधूमिव।।2.43.12।।
explanation: When will the mightyarmed hero (Rama) enter the city of Ayodhya with Sita in front in the chariot, like a bull following the cow?

content: कदा प्राणिसहस्राणि राजमार्गे ममात्मजौ।लाजैरवकिरिष्यन्ति प्रविशन्तावरिन्दमौ।।2.43.13।।
explanation: When will the people in their thousands shower the parched grain on the highway when my sons (Rama and Lakshmana), subduers of enemies, enter the city?

content: प्रविशन्तौ कदाऽयोध्यां द्रक्ष्यामि शुभकुण्डलौ।उदग्रायुधनिस्त्रिंशौ सश्रृङ्गाविव पर्वतौ।।2.43.14।।
explanation: When shall I see both of them wearing auspicious earrings and holding poweful weapons (bows) and swords high, like two mountain peaks?

content: कदासुमनसः कन्याद्विजातीनां फलानि च।प्रदिशन्तः पुरीं हृष्टाः करिष्यन्ति प्रदक्षिणम्।।2.43.15।।
explanation: When will I see them delightfully moving round the city with young brahmin girls offering them flowers and fruits.

content: कदा परिणतो बुद्ध्या वयसा चामरप्रभः।अभ्युपैष्यति धर्मज्ञस्त्रिवर्ष इव मां ललन्।।2.43.16।।
explanation: When will Rama, the knower of righteousness, possessing the lustre of gods, and fully mature in age and wisdom come back to me playfully like a threeyearold boy?

content: निस्संशयं मया मन्ये पुरा वीर कदर्यया।पातुकामेषु वत्सेषु मातृ़णां शातितास्स्तनाः।।2.43.17।।
explanation: O valiant one, in my previous birth I must have undoubtedly hacked off the udders of cows when the calves were thirsting for milk from their mothers.

content: साहं गौरिव सिंहेन विवत्सा वत्सला कृता।कैकेय्या पुरुषव्याघ्र बालवत्सेव गौर्बलात्।।2.43.18।।
explanation: O best of men I have been forcibly separated from my affectionate son by Kaikeyi just like a cow from its calf by a lion.

content: न हि तावद्गुणैर्जुष्टं सर्वशास्त्रविशारदम्।एकपुत्रा विना पुत्रमहं जीवितुमुत्सहे।।2.43.19।।
explanation: I cannot live without my only son who is adept in all scriptures and endowed with all virtues.

content: न हि मे जीविते किञ्चित्सामर्थ्यमिह कल्प्यते।अपश्यन्त्याः प्रियं पुत्रं महाबाहुं महाबलम्।।2.43.20।।
explanation: Without seeing my beloved son, longarmed and mighty, I have but little strength to live in this world.

content: अयं हि मां दीपयते समुत्थितःतनूजशोकप्रभवो हुताशनः।महीमिमां रश्मिभिरुद्धतप्रभःयथा निदाघे भगवान् दिवाकरः।।2.43.21।।
explanation: I am consumed by this blazing fire of grief caused by separation from my son like the earth scorched in summer by the Sungod with his oppressive raysइत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे त्रिचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortythird sarga of Ayodhyakanda of  the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Sumitra consoles Kausalya.]विलपन्ती तथा तां तु कौसल्यां प्रमदोत्तमाम्।इदं धर्मे स्थिता धर्म्यं सुमित्रा वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।2.44.1।।
explanation: While Kausalya, the best of women was thus lamenting, virtuous Sumitra spoke to her these righteous words:

content: तवार्ये सद्गुणैर्युक्तः पुत्र स्स पुरुषोत्तमः।किं ते विलपितेनैवं कृपणं रुदितेन वा।।2.44.2।।
explanation: My venerable lady, your son Rama is the greatest among men and is endowed with every virtue. Why do you lament in this way? Why do you weep bitterly?

content: यस्तवार्ये गतः पुत्रस्त्यक्त्वा राज्यं महाबलः।साधु कुर्वन् महात्मानं पितरं सत्यवादिनम्।।2.44.3।।शिष्टैराचरिते सम्यक्छश्वत्प्रेत्यफलोदये।रामो धर्मे स्थित श्रेष्ठो न स शोच्यः कदाचन।।2.44.4।।
explanation: In order to vindicate the words of his great and truthful father, O noble lady,your mighty son has renounced the kingdom and has gone (to the forest). He has stuck to the path so scrupulously followed by the wise, the everlasting results of which can be fully realised in the world to come. Such a peerless son is never to be grieved over.

content: वर्तते चोत्तमां वृत्तिं लक्ष्मणोऽस्मिन् सदानघः।दयावान् सर्वभूतेषु लाभस्तस्य महात्मनः।।2.44.5।।
explanation: Blameless Lakshmana, compassionate to all beings, has acted most nobly in this matter for the benefit of his great soul.

content: अरण्यवासे यद्दुःखं जानती वै सुखोचिता।अनुगच्छति वैदेही धर्मात्मानं तवात्मजम्।।2.44.6।।
explanation: The daughter of Videha (Sita) who was used to comforts has knowingly followed your virtuous son into the hardships of forest life.

content: कीर्तिभूतां पताकां यो लोके भ्रमयति प्रभुः।धर्मसत्यव्रतधनः किं न प्राप्तस्तवात्मजः।।2.44.7।।
explanation: Your allcompetent son who considers righteousness and truth as wealth, is waving  the flag of fame in this world. What is that which your son did not gain ?

content: व्यक्तं रामस्य विज्ञाय शौचं माहात्म्यमुत्तमम्।न गात्रमंशुभि स्सूर्य स्सन्तापयितुमर्हति।।2.44.8।।
explanation: Knowing Rama's sterling purity and greatness the Sun evidently dare not scorch his body with its rays.

content: शिवस्सर्वेषु कालेषु काननेभ्यो विनिस्सृतः।राघवं युक्तशीतोष्णस्सेविष्यति सुखोऽनिलः।।2.44.9।।
explanation: A pleasant yet moderately hot and cold breeze blowing through the woodlands will serve Rama at all seasons.

content: शयानमनघं रात्रौ पितेवाभिपरिष्वजन्।रश्मिभि स्संस्पृशन् शीतैश्चन्द्रमाह्लादयिष्यति।।2.44.10।।
explanation: While that sinless Rama sleeps at night, the Moon will comfort him by touching him with cool beams like a father embracing his son.

content: ददौ चास्त्राणि दिव्यानि यस्मै ब्रह्मा महौजसे।दानवेन्द्रं हतं दृष्ट्वा तिमिध्वजसुतं रणे।।2.44.11।।स शूरः पुरुषव्याघ्रः स्वबाहुबलमाश्रितः।असन्त्रस्तोऽप्यरणस्थो वेश्मनीव निवत्स्यति।।2.44.12।।
explanation: To the mighty, heroic Rama, that best of men, Brahmalike Viswamitra has bequeathed many divine weapons, seeing him slay Timidhwaja's son (Subahu), lord of demons, in the battle. He will stay fearless in the forest, relying on the strength of his own arms as though he were living in the palace.

content: यस्येषुपथमासाद्य विनाशं यान्ति शत्रवः।कथं न पृथिवी तस्य शासने स्थातुमर्हति।।2.44.13।।
explanation: When enemies who are targets of his arrows are destoyed, how can this earth, not stay under the command of Rama?

content: या श्री श्शौर्यं च रामस्य या च कल्याणसत्वता।निवृत्तारण्यवास स्स क्षिप्रं राज्यमवाप्स्यति।।2.44.14।।
explanation: On return from his sojourn in the forest, Rama, endowed with splendour, valour and a strength that brings wellbeing will quickly regain his kingdom.

content: सूर्यस्यापि भवेत्सूर्यो ह्यग्नेरग्नि प्रभोः प्रभुः।श्रियः श्रीश्च भवेदग्र्या कीर्तिः कीर्त्याः क्षमाक्षमा।।2.44.15।।दैवतं दैवतानां च भूतानां भूतसत्तमः। तस्य के ह्यगुणा देवि वने वाप्यथवा पुरे।।2.44.16।।
explanation: O Devi Rama is the Sun (light) of the Sun, fire (splendour) of the fire, master (command) of masters, prosperity of the prosperous, the fame of the famous, forbearance of the forbearing, god of the gods and supreme among all beings. Whether he dwells in the forest or in the city, he has no demerit whatsoever.

content: पृथिव्या सह वैदेह्या श्रिया च पुरुषर्षभः।क्षिप्रं तिसृभिरेताभि स्सह रामोऽभिषेक्ष्यते।।2.44.17।।
explanation: Rama, the best among men, will soon be coronated with these three namely the earth, the goddess of fortune and Sita.

content: दुःखजं विसृजन्त्यस्रं निष्क्रामन्तमुदीक्ष्य यम्।अयोध्यायां जनास्सर्वे शोकवेगसमाहताः।2.44.18।।कुशचीरधरं देवं गच्छन्तमपराजितम्।सीतेवानुगता लक्ष्मी स्तस्य किं नाम दुर्लभम्।।2.44.19।।
explanation: When the people of Ayodhya saw the godlike Rama departing, clad in robes of kusha and bark, they were moved to tears of grief. What is impossible for him who is unconquerable and whom Sita, like the goddess of fortune, follows.

content: धनुर्ग्रहवरो यस्य बाणखड्गास्त्रभृत्स्वयम्।लक्ष्मणो व्रजति ह्यग्रे तस्य किं नाम दुर्लभम्।।2.44.20।।
explanation: What is impossible for Rama ahead of whom moves Lakshmana, the best of archers, weilding swords, arrows and other weapons?

content: निवृत्तवनवासं तं द्रष्टासि पुनरागतम्।जहिशोकं च मोहं च देवि सत्यं ब्रवीमि ते।।2.44.21।।
explanation: I tell you the truth, Kausalya, that you will see Rama's return when the period of exile is complete. Hence give up your sorrow and delusion.

content: शिरसा चरणावेतौ वन्दमानमनिन्दितेपुनर्द्रक्ष्यसि कल्याणि पुत्रं चन्द्रमिवोदितम्।।2.44.22।।
explanation: O irreproachable and auspicious one you will see your son, like the rising Moon, touching your feet with his head.

content: पुनः प्रविष्टं दृष्ट्वा तमभिषिक्तं महाश्रियम्। समुत्स्रक्ष्यसि नेत्राभ्यां क्षिप्रमानन्दजं पयः।।2.44.23।।
explanation: Soon you will see him enthrouned shining in full glory on his return from exile while tears of joy will flow from your eyes.

content: मा शोको देवि दुःखं वा न रामे दृश्यतेऽशिवम्।क्षिप्रं द्रक्ष्यसि पुत्रं त्वं ससीतं सहलक्ष्मणम्।।2.44.24।।
explanation: Desist from grief or tear for Rama, O Devi nothing inauspicious will happen to him you will soon see your son along with Sita and Lakshmana.

content: त्वया शेषो जनश्चैव समाश्वास्यो यदाऽनघे।किमिदानीमिदं देवि करोषि हृदि विक्लबम्।।2.44.25।।
explanation: O sinless lady, O queen when you are overcome by fear, how can you console others?

content: नार्हा त्वं शोचितुं देवि यस्यास्ते राघवस्सुतः।न हि रामात्परो लोके विद्यते सत्पथे स्थितः।।2.44.26।।
explanation: O Kausalya,  with a son like Rama, you should not grieve. There is none in this world superior to Rama who stands steady in the path of virtue.

content: अभिवादयमानं तं दृष्ट्वा ससुहृदं सुतम्।मुदाऽश्रृ मोक्ष्यसे क्षिप्रं मेघलेखेव वार्षिकी।।2.44.27।।
explanation: Like a flake of cloud in monsoon, you are going to shed tears of joy soon seeing your son along with his friends bowing to you in reverence.

content: पुत्रस्ते वरदः क्षिप्रमयोध्यां पुनरागतः।पाणिभ्यां मृदुपीनाभ्यां चरणौ पीडयिष्यति।।2.44.28।।
explanation: Your son, bestower of boons, will soon return to Ayodhya and press your feet with his soft, tender hands.

content: अभिवाद्य नमस्यन्तं शूरं ससुहृदं सुतम्।मुदाऽस्रैः प्रोक्ष्यसि पुनर्मेघराजिरिवाचलम्।।2.44.29।।
explanation: While paying obeisance to you, you will drench your brave son, surrounded by friends, with tears of joy like a mass of clouds drenching the mountain.

content: आश्वासयन्ती विविधैश्च वाक्यैर्वाक्योपचारे कुशलाऽनवद्या।रामस्य तां मातरमेवमुक्त्वादेवी सुमित्रा विरराम रामा।।2.44.30।।
explanation: Irreproachable and skilful in the use of words, queen Sumitra of cheerful disposition fell silent after thus consoling Rama's mother in various ways.

content: निशम्य तल्लक्ष्मणमातृवाक्यंरामस्य मातुर्नरदेवपत्न्या:।सद्यश्शरीरे विननाश शोकःशरद्गतो मेघ इवाल्पतोयः।।2.44.31।।
explanation: On hearing the words of Lakshmana's mother the grief in the heart of the queen (Kausalya), mother of Rama, instantly disappeared like the autumnal cloud that holds but little rain. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे चतुश्चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyfourth sarga of Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama reaches the banks of Tamasa river.]अनुरक्ता महात्मानं रामं सत्यपराक्रमम्।अनुजग्मुः प्रयान्तं तं वनवासाय मानवाः।।2.45.1।।
explanation: When the highsouled Rama whose strength was his sense of truth set out for the forest, the faithful people followed him.

content: निवर्तितेऽपि च बलात्सुहृद्वर्गे च राजनि।नैव ते संन्यवर्तन्त रामस्यानुगता रथम्।।2.45.2।।
explanation: The king and the hosts of friends were forcibly sent back but they did not return. They continued to follow the chariot of Rama.

content: अयोध्यानिलयानां हि पुरुषाणां महायशाः।बभूव गुणसम्पन्नः पूर्णचन्द्र इव प्रियः।।2.45.3।।
explanation: The illustrious and virtuous Rama was as dear to the inhabitants of Ayodhya as the full Moon.

content: स याच्यमानः काकुत्स्थः स्वाभिः प्रकृतिभिस्तदा।कुर्वाणः पितरं सत्यं वनमेवान्वपद्यत।।2.45.4।।
explanation: Although entreated by his subjects (not to go) Rama proceeded to the forest  to make his father's vow come true.

content: अवेक्षमाणः सस्नेहं चक्षुषा प्रपिबन्निव।उवाच रामः स्नेहेन ताः प्रजाः स्वाः प्रजा इव।।2.45.5।।
explanation: Looking at the people with love as if they were his own children and as though drinking them with his glances, Rama appealed to them:

content: या प्रीतिर्बहुमानश्च मय्ययोध्यानिवासिनाम्।मत्प्रियार्थं विशेषेण भरते सा निवेश्यताम्।।2.45.6।।
explanation: O citizens of Ayodhya may the love and respect you have shown to please me be bestowed specially on Bharata

content: स हि कल्याणचारित्रः कैकेय्यानन्दवर्धनः।करिष्यति यथावद्वः प्रियाणि च हितानि च।।2.45.7।।
explanation: Bharata, enhancer of the delight of Kaikeyi, possesses an auspicious character. He will do for you everything appropriate, agreeable and beneficial.

content: ज्ञानवृद्धो वयोबालो मृदुर्वीर्यगुणान्वितः।अनुरूपः स वो भर्ता भविष्यति भयापहः।।2.45.8।।
explanation: Though tender in age Bharata is mature in intellect. Gentle, valiant and virtuous, he will dispel all your fears and act as a true protector.

content: स हि राजगुणैर्युक्तो युवराजः समीक्षितः।अपि चापि मया शिष्टैः कार्यं वो भर्तृशासनम्।।2.45.9।।
explanation: Endowed with kingly qualities, he is recognised as heirapparent. Therefore, as I did, all of  you should obey the order of the king.

content: न च सन्तप्येद्यथा चासौ वनवासं गते मयि।महाराजस्तथा कार्यो मम प्रियचिकीर्षया।।2.45.10।।
explanation: If you desire to please me, act in such a way that the king does not grieve after I have gone to the forest.

content: यथा यथा दाशरथि र्धर्म एवास्थितोऽभवत्।तथा तथा प्रकृतयो रामं पतिमकामयन्।।2.45.11।।
explanation: The more the son of Dasaratha (Rama) committed to righteousness, the more the subjects desired that he should be their king.

content: बाष्पेण पिहितं दीनं रामः सौमित्रिणा सह।चकर्षेव गुणैर्बद्ध्वा जनं पुरनिवासिनम्।।2.45.12।।
explanation: Rama along with Lakshmana attracted the citydwellers who, choked with tears, were looking miserable. It appeared they were bound with his virtues.

content: ते द्विजास्त्रिविधं वृद्धा ज्ञानेन वयसौजसा।वयः प्रकम्पशिरसो दूरादूचुरिदं वचः।।2.45.13।।
explanation: Those brahmins who were senior (to him) on three counts like age, wisdom and spirtuality spoke to him from a distance with their heads shaking with age:

content: वहन्तो जवना रामं भो भो जात्यास्तुरङ्गमाः।निवर्तध्वं न गन्तव्यं हिता भवत भर्तरि।।2.45.14।।
explanation: O horses of noble breed, turn back Do not carry your master swiftyly any farther. Do good to him.

content: कर्णवन्ति हि भूतानि विशेषेण तुरङ्गमाः।यूयं तस्मान्निवर्तध्वं याचनां प्रतिवेदिताः।।2.45.15।।
explanation: All animals, especially horses have a keen sense of hearing. Therefore, having listened to our entreaty, turn back.

content: धर्मतः स विशुद्धात्मा वीरः शुभदृढव्रतः।उपवाह्यस्तु वो भर्ता नापवाह्यः पुराद्वनम्।।2.45.16।।
explanation: Your master has a purity of heart. He is righteous, virtuous, brave and firm in resolve, carry him backward and not forward from the city into the forest.

content: एवमार्तप्रलापांस्तान् वृद्धान् प्रलपतो द्विजान्।अवेक्ष्य सहसा रामो रथादवततार ह।।2.45.17।।
explanation: Having seen the aged brahmins muttering pitiful lamentations in this manner, Rama immediately alighted from the chariot.

content: पद्भ्यामेव जगामाथ ससीत स्सहलक्ष्मणः।सन्निकृष्टपदन्यासो रामो वनपरायणः।।2.45.18।।
explanation: Then Rama along with Sita and Lakshmana began walking on foot with slow steps towards the forest.

content: द्विजातींस्तु पदातींस्तान् रामश्चारित्रवत्सलः।न शशाक घृणाचक्षुः परिमोक्तुं रथेन सः।।2.45.19।।
explanation: Rama a man of probity and compassion could not ride off in his chariot while those brahmins were trudging far behind.

content: गच्छन्तमेव तं दृष्ट्वा रामं सम्भ्रान्तचेतसः।ऊचुः परमसन्तप्ता रामं वाक्यमिदं द्विजाः।।2.45.20।।
explanation: Having seen Rama thus going towards the forest, those brahmins, highly agitated and distressed, said to him:

content: ब्राह्मण्यं सर्वमेतत्त्वां ब्रह्मण्यमनुगच्छति।द्विजस्कन्धाधिरूढास्त्वामग्नयोऽप्यनुयान्त्यमी।।2.45.21।।
explanation: This entire order of brahmins with the sacrificial fires on their hsoulders is following you, their wellwisher.

content: वाजपेयसमुत्थानि छत्राण्येतानि पश्य नः।पृष्ठतोऽनुप्रयातानि मेघानिव जलात्यये।।2.45.22।।
explanation: See these umbrellas acquired by us while performing Vajapeya sacrifice are following you like the clouds at the end of the rainy season.

content: अनवाप्तातपत्रस्य रश्मिसन्तापितस्य ते।एभिश्छायां करिष्यामः स्वैश्छत्रैर्वाजपेयिकैः।।2.45.23।।
explanation: You do not have a royal umbrella and you are scorched by the rays of the Sun. We will offer you shade with the umbrellas acquired during Vajapeya sacrifice.

content: या हि नः सततं बुद्धिर्वेदमन्त्रानुसारिणी।त्वत्कृते सा कृता वत्स वनवासानुसारिणी।।2.45.24।।
explanation: O dear child, our minds always pursue the study of vedic hymns. For your sake now they are made to follow the life in the forest.

content: हृदयेष्वेव तिष्ठन्ति वेदा ये नः परं धनम्।वत्स्यन्त्यपि गृहेष्वेव दाराश्चारित्ररक्षिताः।।2.45.25।।
explanation: The Vedas are our greatest wealth and they reside in our hearts. Our wives, protected by their fidelity, shall stay at home.

content: न पुनर्निश्चयः कार्यस्त्वद्गतौ सुकृता मतिः।त्वयि धर्मव्यपेक्षे तु किं स्याद्धर्मपथे स्थितम्।।2.45.26।।
explanation: We are not going to revoke our decision. We have made up our minds to follow you (into the forest). If you have no regard for this decision, then who will adhere to the path of righteousness?

content: याचितो नो निवर्तस्व हंसशुक्लशिरोरुहैः।शिरोभिर्निभृताचार महीपतनपांसुलैः।।2.45.27।।
explanation: O Rama, you are firm in your duty.We beseech you, our heads bowed with swanwhite hair and soiled with dust, to return to Ayodhya.

content: बहूनां वितता यज्ञा द्विजानां य इहागताः।तेषां समाप्तिरायत्ता तव वत्स निवर्तने।।2.45.28।।
explanation: Many of those brahmins who arrived here have commenced their sacrifices. O dear child, their consummation depends on your return.

content: भक्तिमन्ति हि भूतानि जङ्गमाजङ्गमानि च।याचमानेषु राम त्वं भक्तिं भक्तेषु दर्शय।।2.45.29।।
