content: अन्तःपुरेऽति संवृद्धान् व्याघ्रवीर्यबलान्वितान्।  दंष्ट्राऽऽयुधान्महाकायान् शुनश्चोपायनं ददौ।।2.70.23।।
explanation: He also gave him a gift of wellraised dogs of the inner apartment hugebodied with the strength and courage of tigers who used their fangs as weapons.

content: स दत्तं केकयेन्द्रेण धनं तन्नाभ्यनन्दत।भरतः कैकयीपुत्रो गमनत्वरया तदा।।2.70.24।।
explanation: All the wealth given by the king of Kekaya did not delight Bharata, son of Kaikeyi who was in a hurry to depart for Ayodhya.

content: बभूव ह्यस्य हृदये चिन्ता सुमहती तदा।त्वरया चापि दूतानां स्वप्नस्यापि च दर्शनात्।।2.70.25।।
explanation: Then his heart was filled with extreme anxiety due to the haste of the messengers to depart and also due to the dream he had.

content: स स्ववेश्माभ्यतिक्रम्य नरनागाश्वसंवृतम्।प्रपेदे सुमहच्छ्रीमान्राजमार्गमनुत्तमम्।।2.70.26।।
explanation: Prosperous Bharata on leaving his residence, passed through incomparable royal highway thronged with men, elephants and horses.

content: अभ्यतीत्य ततोऽपश्यदन्तःपुरमुदारधीः।ततस्तद्भरतश्श्रीमानाविवेशानिवारितः।।2.70.27।।
explanation: Then the nobleminded, prosperous Bharata, on leaving the  highway, saw  the inner apartment of the king which he entered unhindered.

content: स मातामहमापृच्छ्य मातुलं च युधाजितम्।रथमारुह्य भरतश्शत्रुघ्नसहितो ययौ।।2.70.28।।
explanation: Thus having taken leave of his maternal grandfather and uncle Yuddhajit, Bharata accompanied by Satrughna boarded the chariot and went along.

content: रथान्मण्डल चक्रांश्च योजयित्वा परश्शतम्।उष्ट्र गोऽश्वबलैर्भृत्या भरतं यान्तमन्वयुः।।2.70.29।।
explanation: And the servants harnessing more than a hundred chariots of wellrounded wheels and also camels, oxen and horses followed Bharata who started off.

content: बलेन गुप्तो भरतो महात्मा सहार्यकस्याऽत्मसमैरमात्यैः।आदाय शत्रुघ्नमपेतशत्रुर्गृहाद्ययौ सिद्ध इवेन्द्रलोकात्।।2.70.30।।
explanation: Under the protection of the army, the illustrious Bharata who was devoid of enemies, accompanied by ministers who were comparable to him and Satrughna, departed from his venerable grandfather's house like a siddha leaving the regions of Indra.      इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे सप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventieth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Bharata meets Kaikeyi -- hears from Kaikeyi about the demise of king Dasaratha and Rama's exile -- Vasistha calls upon Bharata to perform obsequies and get consecrated]अपश्यंस्तु ततस्तत्र पितरं पितुरालये।जगाम भरतो द्रष्टुं मातरं मातुरालये।।2.72.1।।
explanation: Not finding his father in his abode, Bharata went to see his mother in her apartment.

content: [Crossing many rivers, forests and territories Bharata reaches Ayodhya -- witnesses  scenes of dull desolation charged with an atmosphere of apprehensions -- enters the palace dejected]स प्राङ्मुखो राजगृहादभिनिर्याय राघवः।ततस्सुदामां द्युतिमान् सन्तीर्यावेक्ष्य तां नदीम्।।2.71.1।।ह्लादिनीं दूरपारां च प्रत्यक्स्रोतस्तरङ्गिणीम्।शतद्रूमतरच्छ्रीमान्नदीमिक्ष्वाकुनन्दनः।।2.71.2।।
explanation: Glorious and prosperous prince Bharata, the delight  of the  Ikshvaku race, set out from Rajagriha, took the eastern direction, and observing the course of the river Sudama crossed Hladini and Satadru rivers which were very wide and flowing westwards crested with waves.

content: अनुप्राप्तं तु तं दृष्ट्वा कैकेयी प्रोषितं सुतम्।उत्पपात तदा हृष्टा त्यक्त्वा सौवर्णमासनम्।।2.72.2।।
explanation: On seeing her son, who was sent away, presently arriving, the delighted Kaikeyi sprang up from her golden seat.

content: स प्राङ्मुखो राजगृहादभिनिर्याय राघवः।ततस्सुदामां द्युतिमान् सन्तीर्यावेक्ष्य तां नदीम्।।2.71.1।।ह्लादिनीं दूरपारां च प्रत्यक्स्रोतस्तरङ्गिणीम्।शतद्रूमतरच्छ्रीमान्नदीमिक्ष्वाकुनन्दनः।।2.71.2।।
explanation: Glorious and prosperous prince Bharata, the delight  of the  Ikshvaku race, set out from Rajagriha, took the eastern direction, and observing the course of the river Sudama crossed Hladini and Satadru rivers which were very wide and flowing westwards crested with waves.

content: स प्रविश्यैव धर्मात्मा स्वगृहं श्रीविवर्जितम्।भरतः प्रतिजग्राह जनन्याश्चरणौ शुभौ।।2.72.3।।
explanation: On entering home the righteous Bharata found it devoid of cheer and touched the auspicious feet of his mother (with reverence).

content: ऐलाधाने नदीं तीर्त्वा प्राप्य चापरपर्पटान्।शिलामकुर्वतीं तीर्त्वा आग्नेयं शल्यकर्षणम्।।2.71.3।।सत्यसन्धश्शुचिश्श्रीमान्प्रेक्षमाण श्शिलावहाम्।अत्ययात्स महाशैलान्वनं चैत्ररथं प्रति।।2.71.4।।
explanation: Bharata, ever true to his word, handsome and purehearted, reached Aparaparpata region and crossed river Satadru at Eladhana, the mountain in which river Silavaha originates. Then he traversed Salyakarsna regions in the northeast, observing the course of the Silavaha and went beyond the great mountains in the direction of the forest called Chaitraratha.

content: सा तं मूर्धन्युपाघ्राय परिष्वज्य यशस्विनम्।अङ्के भरतमारोप्य प्रष्टुं समुपचक्रमे।।2.72.4।।
explanation: Kaikeyi, gave her illustrious son Bharata a hug, kissed him on his forehead, made him rest on her lap and began her query.

content: ऐलाधाने नदीं तीर्त्वा प्राप्य चापरपर्पटान्।शिलामकुर्वतीं तीर्त्वा आग्नेयं शल्यकर्षणम्।।2.71.3।।सत्यसन्धश्शुचिश्श्रीमान्प्रेक्षमाण श्शिलावहाम्।अत्ययात्स महाशैलान्वनं चैत्ररथं प्रति।।2.71.4।।
explanation: Bharata, ever true to his word, handsome and purehearted, reached Aparaparpata region and crossed river Satadru at Eladhana, the mountain in which river Silavaha originates. Then he traversed Salyakarsna regions in the northeast, observing the course of the Silavaha and went beyond the great mountains in the direction of the forest called Chaitraratha.

content: अद्य ते कतिचिद्रात्र्य श्च्युतस्याऽर्यकवेश्मनः।अपि नाध्वश्रमशशीघ्रं रथेनापततस्तव।।2.72.5।।
explanation: How many nights have you spent (on the way) since you left your noble grandfather's residence? Hasn't the hurried journey (over such a long distance) on the chariot left you exhausted?

content: सरस्वतीं च गङ्गां च युग्मेन प्रतिपद्यच।उत्तरान्वीरमत्स्यानां भारुण्डं प्राविशद्वनम्।।2.71.5।।
explanation: Arriving at the confluence of Saraswati and Ganga and traversing the north of  Veeramatsya region, he entered the Bharunda forest.

content: आर्यकस्ते सुकुशली युधाजिन्मातुलस्तव।प्रवासाच्च सुखं पुत्र सर्वं मे वक्तुमर्हसि।।2.72.6।।
explanation: My son are your revered grandfather and your maternal uncle Yudhajit doing well? Did you have a pleasant time during the sojourn? You should tell me all this.

content: वेगिनीं च कुलिङ्गाख्यां ह्लादिनीं पर्वताऽऽवृताम्।यमुनां प्राप्य सन्तीर्णः बलमाश्वासयत्तदा।।2.71.6।।
explanation: He crossed the swiftflowing river known as Kulinga surrounded by hills and pleasing to the mind. Thereafter on crossing Yamuna he made his army rest on the otherside.

content: एवं पृष्टस्तु कैकेय्या प्रियं पार्थिवनन्दनः।आचष्ट भरत स्सर्वं मात्रे राजीवलोचनः।।2.72.7।।
explanation: Thus asked lovingly by his mother Kaikeyi, the lotuseyed Bharata, the king's delight  narrated everything to her.

content: सशीतीकृत्य तु गात्राणि क्लान्तानाश्वास्य वाजिनः।तत्र स्नात्वा च पीत्वा च प्रायादादाय चोदकम्।।2.71.7।।
explanation: The weary horses rested and cooled their bodies. And they bathed and drank. They set out again refreshed taking with them a store of water.

content: राजपुत्रो महारण्यमनभीक्ष्णोपसेवितम्।भद्रो भद्रेण यानेन मारुतः खमिवात्ययात्।।2.71.8।।
explanation: Then with the blessed prince (Bharata) on an excellent chariot, it (the army) moved through the vast and uninhabited forest like the god of wind passing through the sky.

content: अद्य मे सप्तमी रात्रिश्च्युतस्याऽर्यकवेश्मनः।अम्बायाः कुशली तात युधाजिन्मातुलश्च मे।।2.72.8।।
explanation: This is the seventh night since I left my noble grandsire's residence. My mother's father, king of Kekaya and my maternal uncle Yudhajit are doing well.

content: यन्मे धनं च रत्नं च ददौ राजा परन्तपः।परिश्रान्तं पथ्यभवत्ततोऽहं पूर्वमागतः।।2.72.9।।
explanation: The (horses carrying) the wealth including the gems which the king (of Kekaya), the subduer of enemies had bestowed on me were exhausted on the way. Therefore I have come in advance.

content: भागीरथीं दुष्प्रतरामंशुधाने महानदीम्।उपायाद्राघवस्तूर्णं प्राग्वटे विश्रुते पुरे।।2.71.9।।
explanation: Bharata, the descendant of Raghu, knowing that the mighty river Bhagirathi was difficult to cross at a place known as Anshudhana, quickly reached the famous city of Pragvata.

content: राजवाक्यहरैर्दूतैस्त्वर्यमाणोऽहमागतः।यदहं प्रष्टुमिच्छामि तदम्बा वक्तुमर्हति।।2.72.10।।
explanation: Urged upon by the messengers carrying out the orders of the king, I have come. You, O mother, should answer the questions. I wish to ask you.

content: स गङ्गां प्राग्वटे तीर्त्वा समायात्कुटिकोष्ठिकाम्।सबल स्तां स तीर्त्वाऽथ समायाद्धर्मवर्धनम्।।2.71.10।।
explanation: With Ganga at Pragvata city and river Kutikoshtika crossed along with his army, he  reached Dharmavardhana village.

content: शून्योऽयं शयनीयस्ते पर्यङ्को हेमभूषितः।न चायमिक्ष्वाकुजनः प्रहृष्टः प्रतिभाति मा।।2.72.11।।
explanation: Your goldbedecked couch, worthy of resting lies empty. None of the attendants of the Ikshvakus look cheerful.

content: तोरणं दक्षिणार्धेन जम्भूप्रस्थमुपागमत्।वरूथं च ययौ रम्यं ग्रामं दशरथात्मजः।।2.71.11।।
explanation: Having traversed the southern end of Torana, the son of Dasaratha (Bharata) reached  the beautiful Varutha village via Jambuprastha.

content: राजा भवति भूयिष्ठमिहाम्बाया निवेशने।तमहं नाद्य पश्यामि द्रष्टुमिच्छन्निहाऽगतः।।2.72.12।।
explanation: I had come here with the hope to see king Dasaratha who spends most of his time in my mother's residence. But today I do not see him .

content: तत्र रम्ये वने वासं कृत्वाऽसौ प्राङ्मुखो ययौ।उद्यानमुज्जिहानायाः प्रियका यत्र पादपाः।।2.71.12।।
explanation: He (Bharata) halted in that charming forest for a while, proceeded eastwards till he reached a place known as Ujjihana garden abounding in spriyaka trees.

content: पितुर्ग्रहीष्ये चरणौ तं ममाऽख्याहि पृच्छतः।आहोस्विदम्ब ज्येष्ठायाः कौसल्याया निवेशने।।2.72.13।।
explanation: I would like to pay obeisance at my father's feet. Will you answer my question, O mother, and tell me regarding his whereabouts? Or perchance could he be at the residence of my eldest mother Kausalya?

content: सालांस्तु प्रियकान्प्राप्य शीघ्रानास्थाय वाजिनः।अनुज्ञाप्याथ भरतः वाहिनीं त्वरितो ययौ।।2.71.13।।
explanation: After reaching the groves of sala and priyaka trees, Bharata harnessed the swiftrunning horses to the chariot and ordered his forces to proceed fast.

content: तं प्रत्युवाच कैकेयी प्रियवद्घोरमप्रियम्।अजानन्तं प्रजानन्ती राज्यलोभेन मोहिता।।2.72.14।।
explanation: In spite of knowing everything, Kaikeyi actuated by greed for the kingdom, broke the unpleasant and dreadful news as if it were pleasing to Bharata, who was ignorant of what had transpired.

content: वासं कृत्वा सर्वतीर्थे तीर्त्वा चोत्तानिकां नदीम्।अन्या नदीश्च विविधाः पार्वतीयैस्तुरङ्गमैः।।2.71.14।।हस्तिपृष्ठकमासाद्य कुटिकामत्यवर्तत।ततार च नरव्याघ्रो लौहित्ये स कपीवतीम्।।2.71.15।।
explanation: That tiger among men, Bharata halted at a place known as Sarvatirtha and crossed the Uttanika and various other rivers with the help of hillborn horses. He crossed the Kutika river on an elephant the river Kapivati at a place known as Lauhitya.

content: या गतिस्सर्वभूतानां तां गतिं ते पिता गतः।राजा महत्मा तेजस्वी यायजूकस्सतां गतिः।।2.72.15।।
explanation: Your highsouled, brilliant father ever engaged in performing sacrifices and a refuge for the virtuous people, went the inevitable way every living being must follow (attained heaven).

content: वासं कृत्वा सर्वतीर्थे तीर्त्वा चोत्तानिकां नदीम्।अन्या नदीश्च विविधाः पार्वतीयैस्तुरङ्गमैः।।2.71.14।।हस्तिपृष्ठकमासाद्य कुटिकामत्यवर्तत।ततार च नरव्याघ्रो लौहित्ये स कपीवतीम्।।2.71.15।।
explanation: That tiger among men, Bharata halted at a place known as Sarvatirtha and crossed the Uttanika and various other rivers with the help of hillborn horses. He crossed the Kutika river on an elephant the river Kapivati at a place known as Lauhitya.

content: तच्छ्रुत्वा भरतो वाक्यं धर्माभिजनवाञ्चुचिः।पपात सहसा भूमौ पितृशोकबलार्दितः।।2.72.16।।
explanation: On hearing these words, he (Bharata), born of a righteous race and endowed with purity of character was shattered by the immense grief of his father's demise and dropped down instantaneously on the floor.

content: एकसाले स्थाणुमतीं विनते गोमतीं नदीम्।कलिङ्गनगरे चापि प्राप्य सालवनं तदा।।2.71.16।।भरतः क्षिप्रमागच्छत्सुपरिश्रान्तवाहनः।
explanation: Bharata crossed the rivers Sthanumati at Ekasala and Gomati at Vinata villages. Thereafter as his horses were extremely tired he rested for a while in the sala forest in  Kalinganagara before he speedily set out (again).

content: हा हतोऽस्मीति कृपणां दीनां वाचमुदीरयन्।निपपात महाबाहुर्बाहू विक्षिप्य वीर्यवान्।।2.72.17।।
explanation: The mightyarmed, valiant Bharata, uttering pitiable words, evoking compassion. Alas, I am finished fell down at once throwing up his arms.

content: वनं च समतीत्याशुशर्वर्यामरुणोदये।।2.71.17।।अयोध्यां मनुना राज्ञा निर्मितां सन्ददर्श ह।
explanation: He passed quickly through the forest at night and at sunrise beheld the city of Ayodhya built by king Manu.

content: ततश्शोकेन संवीतः पितुर्मरणदुःखितः।विललाप महातेजा भ्रान्ताकुलितचेतनः।।2.72.18।।
explanation: Overwhelmed with grief, radiant Bharata reeling with delusion due to sorrow, lamented over the death of his father.

content: तां पुरीं पुरुषव्याघ्रस्सप्तरात्रोषितः पथि।।2.71.18।।अयोध्यामग्रतो दृष्ट्वा सारथिं वाक्यमब्रवीत्।
explanation: Having spent seven nights on his way, that tiger among men (Bharata) saw Ayodhaya before him. He said to the charioteer:

content: एतत्सुरुचिरं भाति पितुर्मे शयनं पुरा।शशिनेवामलं रात्रौ गगनं तोयदात्यये।।2.72.19।।
explanation: This couch of my father once used to shine like the spotless night sky irradiated by the autumnal Moon.

content: एषा नातिप्रतीता मे पुण्योद्याना यशस्विनी।।2.71.19।।अयोध्या दृश्यते दूरात्सारथे पाण्डुमृत्तिका।यज्वभिर्गुणसम्पन्नैर्ब्राह्मणैर्वेदपारगैः।।2.71.20।।भूयिष्ठमृद्धैराकीर्णा राजर्षिपरिपालिता।
explanation: O charioteer I am able to see Ayodhya of great renown from a  distance  but not so clearly that whiteclaycity of Ayodhya, with its sacred gardens ruled by several rajarsis, inhabited by numerous wealthy people, by virtuous brahmins and priests who perform sacrifices and who are wellversed in the Vedas.

content: तदिदं न विभात्यद्य विहीनं तेन धीमता।व्योमेव शशिना हीनमप्च्छुष्क इव सागरः।।2.72.20।।
explanation: But today this couch without my sagacious father no longer shines like the sky without the Moon or like the sea evaporated.

content: एषा नातिप्रतीता मे पुण्योद्याना यशस्विनी।।2.71.19।।अयोध्या दृश्यते दूरात्सारथे पाण्डुमृत्तिका।यज्वभिर्गुणसम्पन्नैर्ब्राह्मणैर्वेदपारगैः।।2.71.20।।भूयिष्ठमृद्धैराकीर्णा राजर्षिपरिपालिता।
explanation: O charioteer I am able to see Ayodhya of great renown from a  distance  but not so clearly that whiteclaycity of Ayodhya, with its sacred gardens ruled by several rajarsis, inhabited by numerous wealthy people, by virtuous brahmins and priests who perform sacrifices and who are wellversed in the Vedas.

content: बाष्पमुत्सृज्य् कण्ठेन स्वात्मना परमपीडितः। आच्छाद्य वदनं श्रीमद्वस्त्रेण जयतां वरः।।2.72.21।।
explanation: Bharata, the foremost among the victorious, clearing his tearchoked throat and covering his auspicious countenance with raiment, wept in profound distress with tears overflowing.

content: अयोध्यायां पुरा शब्दश्श्रूयते तुमुलो महान्।।2.71.21।।समन्तान्नरनारीणां तमद्य न श्रुणोम्यहम्।
explanation: I do not hear now, in Ayodhya the tumultous noise of men and women I used to hear earlier all over.

content: तमार्तं देवसङ्काशं समीक्ष्य पतितं भुवि।निकृत्तमिव सालस्य स्कन्धं परशुना वने।।2.72.22।।मत्तमातङ्गसङ्काशं चन्द्रार्कसदृशं भुवः।उत्थापयित्वा शोकार्तं वचनं चेदमब्रवीत्।।2.72.23।।
explanation: Anguished and griefstricken, he who resembled the gods, fell down on the ground like a trunk of the sala tree in the forest severed by an axe. Seeing her son who was like a mighty elephant or like the Sun or the Moon, Kaikeyi lifted him up from the ground and spoke these words:

content: उद्यानानि हि सायाह्ने क्रीडित्वोपरतैर्नरैः।।2.71.22।।समन्तात्परिधावद्भिः प्रकाशन्ते ममान्यथा।
explanation: I do not see people who with passion used to stroll in the parks early in the morning. I see no cheerfulness in any one.

content: तमार्तं देवसङ्काशं समीक्ष्य पतितं भुवि।निकृत्तमिव सालस्य स्कन्धं परशुना वने।।2.72.22।।मत्तमातङ्गसङ्काशं चन्द्रार्कसदृशं भुवः।उत्थापयित्वा शोकार्तं वचनं चेदमब्रवीत्।।2.72.23।।
explanation: Anguished and griefstricken, he who resembled the gods, fell down on the ground like a trunk of the sala tree in the forest severed by an axe. Seeing her son who was like a mighty elephant or like the Sun or the Moon, Kaikeyi lifted him up from the ground and spoke these words:

content: तान्यद्यानुरुदन्तीव परित्यक्तानि कामिभिः।।2.71.23।।अरण्यभूतेव पुरी सारथे प्रतिभाति मे।
explanation: O charioteer, people full of passion have abandoned the gardens. To me, the city looks like a forest as if weeping.

content: न ह्यत्र यानैर्दृश्यन्ते न गजैर्न च वाजिभिः।।2.71.24।।निर्यान्तो वाऽभियान्तो वा नरमुख्या यथापुरम्।
explanation: Important people mounted on elephants or horses are not seen going out of the city or coming in.

content: उत्तिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ किं शेषे राजपुत्र महायशः।त्वद्विधा नहि शोचन्ति सन्त स्सदसि सम्मताः।।2.72.24।।
explanation: O illustrious prince arise, arise. Why are you lying down on the floor? Learned people like you, who are worthy of honour in the assembly ought not to grieve like this.

content: दानयज्ञाधिकारा हि शीलश्रुतिवचोऽनुगा।बुद्धिस्ते बुद्धिसम्पन्न प्रभेवार्कस्य मन्दिरे।।2.72.25।।
explanation: O highly intelligent one, by your wisdom, virtuous conduct and scriptural knowledge you are entitled to dispense charity and perform sacrifices. You will always shine incessantly like light of the Sun.

content: उद्यानानि पुरा भान्ति मत्तप्रमुदितानि च।।2.71.25।।जनानां रतिसंयोगेष्वत्यन्तगुणवन्ति च।
explanation: Earlier the gardens used to reverberate with passionate songs of birds--places  appropriate for lovers seeking pleasures.

content: स रुदित्वा चिरं कालं भूमौ विपरिवृत्य च।जननीं प्रत्युवाचेदं शोकैर्बहुभिरावृतः।।2.72.26।।
explanation: Bharata engulfed in profuse sorrow wept for a long time rolling on the ground and then said these words in reply to his mother:

content: तान्येतान्यद्य पश्यामि निरानन्दानि सर्वशः।।2.71.26।।स्रस्तपर्णैरनुपथं विक्रोशद्भिरिव द्रुमैः।
explanation: Now the trees appear cheerless, the paths are full of dry leaves fallen all over. It appears as if the trees are crying.

content: अभिषेक्ष्यति रामं नु राजा यज्ञं नु यक्ष्यते।इत्यहं कृतसङ्कल्पो हृष्टो यात्रामयासिषम्।।2.72.27।।
explanation: Thinking that the king is about to consecrate Rama or perform some sacrifice, I undertook the journey in great delight.

content: नाद्यापि श्रूयते शब्दः मत्तानां मृगपक्षिणाम्।।2.71.27।।संरक्तां मधुरां वाणीं कलं व्याहरतां बहु।
explanation: I do not hear in the red tincture of the rising Sun the melodious voices of the freely moving animals and birds.

content: तदिदं ह्यन्यथा भूतं व्यवदीर्णं मनो मम।पितरं यो न पश्यामि नित्यं प्रियहिते रतम्।।2.72.28।।
explanation: Now everything has turned out to be different. My mind is shattered.I no longer behold my father who is ever intent on my welfare and happiness.

content: चन्दनागरुसम्पृक्तो धूपसम्मूर्छितोऽतुलः।।2.71.28।।प्रवाति पवन श्श्रीमान्किन्नुनाद्य यथापुरम्।
explanation: Why is it that the incomparable fragrance of sandal and incense that used to fill the nostrils, not blowing now in the prosperous city of Ayodhya?

content: अम्ब केनात्यगाद्राजा व्याघिना मय्यनागते।धन्या रामादयस्सर्वे यैः पिता संस्कृत स्स्वयम्।।2.72.29।।
explanation: O mother what ailment caused the king's death before I could return? How fortunate are Rama and others by whom the last rites of my father were performed

content: भेरीमृदङ्गवीणानां कोणसङ्घट्टितः पुनः।।2.71.29।।किमद्य शब्दो विरतस्सदा दीनगतिः पुरा।
explanation: Why is it that the sounds of musical instruments like mrudangas and veenas are not heard now? Why is the city filled with melancholy?

content: न नूनं मां महाराजः प्राप्तं जानाति कीर्तिमान्।उपजिघ्रेद्धि मूर्ध्नि तात स्सन्नम्य सत्वरम्।।2.72.30।।
explanation: Surely the illustrious maharaja is not aware of my arrival. Otherwise he would have quickly bent my head and kissed me on my forehead.

content: अनिष्टानि च पापानि पश्यामि विविधानि च।।2.71.30।।निमित्तान्यमनोज्ञानितेन सीदति  मे मनः।
explanation: Since I see many passing, inauspicious, sinful, ugly sights, my mind shrinks.

content: क्व स पाणिस्सुखस्पर्शस्तातस्याक्लिष्टकर्मणः।येन मां रजसा ध्वस्तमभीक्ष्णं परिमार्जति।।2.72.31।।
explanation: Where is that hand of my father of unwearied actions, the hand that would wipe away the dust from my person with a pleasant touch?

content: सर्वथा कुशलं सूत दुर्लभं मम बन्दुषु।।2.71.31।।तथाह्यसति सम्मोहे हृदयं सीदतीव मे।
explanation: I do not see anywhere, O charioteer the wellbeing, of my kinsmen. Hence I feel deluded and my heart is filled with grief.

content: यो मे भ्राता पिता बन्धुर्यस्य दासोऽस्मि धीमतः।तस्य मां शीघ्रमाख्याहि रामस्याक्लिष्टकर्मणः।।2.72.32।।
explanation: Announce at once my arrival to the wise Rama, the man of unwearied actions, my brother, father and friend whose slave I am.

content: विषण्ण श्श्रान्तहृदयस्त्रस्त स्सुलुलितेन्द्रियः।।2.71.32।।भरतः प्रविवेशाशु पुरीमिक्ष्वाकुपालिताम्।
explanation: Dejected and depressed at heart, with no control over his senses and his mind full of apprehension, Bharata swiftly entered the city of Ayodhya ruled by the  Ikshvakus.

content: पिता हि भवति ज्येष्ठो धर्ममार्यस्य जानतः।तस्य पादौ ग्रहीष्यामि स हीदानीं गतिर्मम।।2.72.33।।
explanation: To one who knows the ways of righteouness the elder brother is (like) the father. Indeed, he (Rama) is my refuge and I shall hold his feet now.

content: द्वारेण वैजयन्तेन प्राविशच्छ्रान्तवाहनः।।2.71.33।।द्वास्स्थैरुत्थाय विजयं पृष्टस्तै स्सहितो ययौ।
explanation: He entered the city through the gate known as Vaijayanta with his horses exhausted. The doorkeepers stood up and amidst cries of victory followed him in.

content: धर्मविद्धर्मनित्यश्च सत्यसन्धो दृढव्रतः।आर्यः किमब्रवीद्राजा पिता मे सत्यविक्रमः।।2.72.34।।
explanation: What did my father, the noble king, conversant with righteous conduct, true, to his vows, one who always conducted himself in a righteous manner, whose truth was his prowess (at the time of his death)?

content: स त्वनेकाग्रहृदयो द्वास्स्थं प्रत्यर्च्य तं जनम्।।2.71.34।।सूतमश्वपतेः क्लान्तमब्रवीत्तत्र राघवः।
explanation: Bewildered, that descendant of Raghu (Bharata), reciprocated the greetings of the gatekeepers and then addressed the exhausted charioteer, Ashwapati:

content: पश्चिमं साधु सन्देशमिच्छामि श्रोतुमात्मनः।इति पृष्टा यथातत्त्वं कैकेयी वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।2.72.35।।
explanation: I want to hear the exact words of my father's last message to me. Thus questioned (by Bharata), Kaikeyi related the exact facts:

content: किमहं त्वरयाऽनीतः कारणेन विनानघ।।2.71.35।।अशुभाशङ्कि हृदयं शीलं च पततीव मे।
explanation: O irreproachable one, why was I brought here in haste without any reason? My mind apprehends something inauspicious. I feel indisposed.

content: रामेति राजा विलपन् हा सीते लक्ष्मणेति च।स महात्मा परं लोकं गतो गतिमतां वरः।।2.72.36।।
explanation: The magnanimous king, the foremost of those who attained the excellent state after, death, went to the other world, lamenting 'O Rama, O Sita, O Lakshamana'.

content: श्रुता नो यादृशाः पूर्वं नृपतीनां विनाशने।।2.71.36।।आकारांस्तानहं सर्वानिहपश्यामि सारथे।
explanation: O charioteer I now see the very for ebodings I had heard in the past in connection with the death of  kings.

content: इमां तु पश्चिमां वाचं व्याजहार पिता तव।कालधर्मपरिक्षिप्तः पाशैरिव महागजः।।2.72.37।।
explanation: Your father, caught by the noose of death, like a great elephant bound by cords, uttered these last words:

content: सम्मार्जनविहीनानि परुषाण्युपलक्षये।।2.71.37।।असंयत कवाटानि श्रीविहीनानि सर्वशः।बलिकर्मविहीनानि धूपसम्मोदनेन च।।2.71.38।।अनाशितकुटुम्बानि प्रभाहीनजनानि च।अलक्ष्मीकानि पश्यामि कुटुम्बिभवनान्यहम्।।2.71.39।।
explanation: I see the unswept homes of householders standing dirty with doors not closed. There is no beauty anywhere. No one offers oblations (at the time of worship). There is no   fragrance of burning incense. The families have no food to eat. The people look cheerless. I see inauspiciousness everywhere.

content: सिद्धार्थास्ते नरा राममागतं सह सीतया।लक्ष्मणं च महाबाहुं द्रक्ष्यन्ति पुनरागतम्।।2.72.38।।
explanation: 'Those men who will see Rama returning home along with Sita and mightyarmed Lakshmana, will have their desires fulfilled.'

content: सम्मार्जनविहीनानि परुषाण्युपलक्षये।।2.71.37।।असंयत कवाटानि श्रीविहीनानि सर्वशः।बलिकर्मविहीनानि धूपसम्मोदनेन च।।2.71.38।।अनाशितकुटुम्बानि प्रभाहीनजनानि च।अलक्ष्मीकानि पश्यामि कुटुम्बिभवनान्यहम्।।2.71.39।।
explanation: I see the unswept homes of householders standing dirty with doors not closed. There is no beauty anywhere. No one offers oblations (at the time of worship). There is no   fragrance of burning incense. The families have no food to eat. The people look cheerless. I see inauspiciousness everywhere.

content: तच्छ्रुत्वा विषसादैव द्वितीयाप्रियशंसनात्।विषण्णवदनो भूत्वा भूयः पप्रच्छ मातरम्।।2.72.39।।
explanation: Bharata was more distraught on hearing the words that conveyed the second unpleasant tidings. With downcast countenance, he again enquired of his mother thus:

content: सम्मार्जनविहीनानि परुषाण्युपलक्षये।।2.71.37।।असंयत कवाटानि श्रीविहीनानि सर्वशः।बलिकर्मविहीनानि धूपसम्मोदनेन च।।2.71.38।।अनाशितकुटुम्बानि प्रभाहीनजनानि च।अलक्ष्मीकानि पश्यामि कुटुम्बिभवनान्यहम्।।2.71.39।।
explanation: I see the unswept homes of householders standing dirty with doors not closed. There is no beauty anywhere. No one offers oblations (at the time of worship). There is no   fragrance of burning incense. The families have no food to eat. The people look cheerless. I see inauspiciousness everywhere.

content: अपेतमाल्यशोभानि ह्यसम्मृष्टाजिराणि च।देवागाराणि शून्यानि न चाभान्ति यथापुरम्।।2.71.40।।
explanation: The temples stand devoid of the beauty of floral offerings. The floors of front yards are left unswept and unsmeared. They look deserted, devoid of brightness of the past.

content: क्व चेदानीं स धर्मात्मा कौसल्यानन्दवर्धनः।लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा सीतया च समं गतः।।2.72.40।।
explanation: Where has righteous Rama who enhances the delight of Kausalya along with his  brother Lakshmana and Sita gone now?

content: तथा पृष्टा यथातत्त्वमाख्यातुमुपचक्रमे।मातास्य सुमहद्वाक्यं विप्रियं प्रियशङ्कया।।2.72.41।।
explanation: Thus questioned, his mother started relating the exact events, presuming them to be pleasant tidings (for Bharata).

content: देवतार्चाः प्रविद्धाश्च यज्ञगोष्ठ्यस्तथाविधाः।माल्यापणेषु राजन्ते नाद्य पण्यानि वा तथा।।2.71.41।।
explanation: The offerings to deities have been dispensed with. There are no groups of people   performing the usual holy sacrifices. The markets where garlands were sold now stand without them.

content: स हि राजसुतः पुत्र चीरवासा महावनम्।दण्डकान्सह वैदेह्या लक्ष्मणानुचरो गतः।।2.72.42।।
explanation: O my son, prince Rama attired in garments of bark along with Sita and followed by Lakshmana left for the great Dandaka forest.

content: दृश्यन्ते वणिजोऽप्यद्य न यथापूर्वमत्रवै।ध्यानसंविग्नहृदयाः नष्टव्यापारयन्त्रिताः।।2.71.42।।
explanation: Even traders seem restrained by the loss of business. They are not seen as before concentrating on their trade.

content: तच्छ्रुत्वा भरतस्त्रस्तो भ्रातुश्चारित्रशङ्कया।स्वस्य वंशस्य महात्म्यात्प्रष्टुं समुपचक्रमे।।2.72.43।।
explanation: Conscious of the glory of his race, Bharata continued to enquire if there was any unrighteous conduct on the part of his brother.

content: देवायतनचैत्येषु दीनाः पक्षिगणास्तथा।।2.71.43।।मलिनं चाश्रुपूर्णाक्षं दीनं ध्यानपरं कृशम्।सस्त्रीपुंसं च पश्यामि जनमुत्कण्ठितं पुरे।।2.71.44।।
explanation: I see groups of birds frequenting the temples. The sanctuaries appear dispirited. The people in the city, both men and women look dull, emaciated, pitiable with throats choked. Their eyes are filled with tears and minds absorbed in distressing thoughts.

content: कच्चिन्न ब्राह्मणधनं हृतं रामेण कस्यचित्।कच्चिन्नाढ्यो दरिद्रो वा तेनापापो विहिंसितः।।2.72.44।।
explanation: I hope Rama did not seize the wealth of any brahmin nor did any harm to an innocent person, whether rich or poor.

content: देवायतनचैत्येषु दीनाः पक्षिगणास्तथा।।2.71.43।।मलिनं चाश्रुपूर्णाक्षं दीनं ध्यानपरं कृशम्।सस्त्रीपुंसं च पश्यामि जनमुत्कण्ठितं पुरे।।2.71.44।।
explanation: I see groups of birds frequenting the temples. The sanctuaries appear dispirited. The people in the city, both men and women look dull, emaciated, pitiable with throats choked. Their eyes are filled with tears and minds absorbed in distressing thoughts.

content: कच्चिन्न परदारान्वा राजपुत्रोऽभिमन्यते।कस्मात्स दण्डकारण्ये भ्रूणहेव विवासितः।।2.72.45।।
explanation: I hope he did not covet another man's wife. Like a sinner who had slain a child in embryo why has he been banished to Dandaka forest?

content: इत्येवमुक्त्वा भरतस्सूतं तं दीनमानसः।तान्यनिष्टान्ययोध्यायां प्रेक्ष्य राजगृहं ययौ।।2.71.45।।
explanation: With these words said to the charioteer, Bharata, having seen such ominous sights in Ayodhya,  proceeded to the king's palace with a depressed heart.

content: अथास्य चपला माता तत्स्वकर्म यथातथम्।तेनैव स्त्रीस्वभावेन व्याहर्तुमुपचक्रमे।।2.72.46।।
explanation: Then the capricious mother, with the same feminine disposition which she had displayed earlier, started giving a faithful account of all her deeds.

content: तां शून्यशृङ्गाटकवेश्मरथ्यां रजोऽरुणद्वारकवाटयन्त्राम्।दृष्ट्वा पुरीमिन्द्रपुरप्रकाशां दुःखेन सम्पूर्णतरो बभूव।।2.71.46।।
explanation: As he (Bharata) beheld the city of Ayodhya that once had the lustre of the city of Indra, now with its crossroads, houses and highways all deserted, the fittings (nuts and bolts) on the doors red with dust,  he was overwhelmed with grief.

content: एवमुक्ता तु कैकेयी भरतेन महात्मना।उवाच वचनं हृष्टा मूढा पण्डितमानिनी।।2.72.47।।
explanation: On hearing the words of great Bharata, that foolish woman Kaikeyi thinking herself to be wise, cheerfully said:

content: बहूनि पश्यन्मनसोऽप्रियाणि यान्यन्यदा नास्य पुरे बभूवुः।अवाक्छिरा दीनमना नहृष्टः पितुर्महात्मा प्रविवेश वेश्म।।2.71.47।।
explanation: Having witnessed many unpleasant things that had never happened before, the  magnanimous Bharata who was looking cheerless and dejected entered his father's palace with his head bent down. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे एकसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventyfirst sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: न ब्राह्मणधनं किञ्चिद्धृतं रामेण कस्यचित्कश्चिन्नाढ्यो दरिद्रो तेनापापो विहिंसितः।न रामः परदारांश्च चक्षुर्भ्यामपि पश्यति।।2.72.48।।
explanation: Rama did not rob any brahmin of even a little wealth nor did he harm any innocent man, whether rich or poor. He never casts his eyes on another's wife.

content: मया तु पुत्र श्रुत्वैव रामस्यैवाभिषेचनम्।याचितस्ते पिता राज्यं रामस्य च विवासनम्।।2.72.49।।
explanation: My son, I on hearing of Rama's consecration asked your father to confer the kingdom on you and banish Rama.

content: स स्ववृत्तिं समास्थाय पिता ते तत्तऽथाकरोत्।रामश्च सह सौमित्रिः प्रेषितस्सह सीतया।।2.72.50।।
explanation: Your father, faithful to his word, banished Rama along with Lakshmana and Sita.

content: तमपश्यन्प्रियंपुत्रं महीपालो महायशाः।पुत्रशोकपरिद्यूनः पञ्चत्वमुपपेदिवान्।।2.72.51।।
explanation: The renowned ruler of the earth (king Dasaratha), unable to behold (the sorry state of) his beloved son and stricken by filial grief, merged into the five elements (died).

content: त्वयात्विदानीं धर्मज्ञ राजत्वमवलम्ब्यताम्।त्वत्कृते हि मया सर्वमिदमेवं विधं कृतम्।।2.72.52।।
explanation: O knower of dharma, assume kingship now. It is only for your sake that all this has been done by me.

content: मा शोकं मा च सन्तापं धैर्यमाश्रय पुत्रक।त्वदधीना हि नगरी राज्यं चैतदनामयम्।।2.72.53।।
explanation: My son, give up sorrow and agony and take recourse to courage. This city as well as the kingdom, free from all obstacles, is under your control.

content: तत्पुत्र शीघ्रं विधिना विधिज्ञैर्वसिष्ठमुख्यै स्सहितो द्विजेन्द्रैः।सङ्काल्य राजानमदीनसत्त्वमात्मानमुर्व्यामभिषेचयस्व।।2.72.54।।
explanation: Therefore, my son, under the guidance of Vasistha and other noble brahmins, wellversed in rituals, quickly perform the funeral obsequies in accordance with tradition and without getting depressed in spirit, get yourself coronated as lord of this earth.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे द्विसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventysecond sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Bharata grieves over his misfortune -- accuses Kaikeyi in so many words -- reveals his decision to bring back Rama to Ayodhya and serve him.] सश्रूत्वा तु पितरं वृत्तं भ्रातरौ च विवासितौ।भरतो दुःखसन्तप्त इदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।2.73.1।।
explanation: On hearing about the demise of the father and his two brothers sent in exile, Bharata  overtaken by sorrow spoke thus:

content: किं नु कार्यं हतस्येह मम राज्येन शोचतः।विहीनस्याथ पित्रा च भ्रात्रा पितृसमेन च।।2.73.2।।
explanation: Bereft of my father and my brother who was like a father to me, of what avail is this kingdom to me when I am grieving and fallen into misfortunes?

content: दुःखे मे दुःखमकरोर्व्रणे क्षारमिवादधाः।राजानं प्रेतभावस्थं कृत्वा रामं च तापसम्।।2.73.3।।
explanation: You have caused the death of the king and reduced Rama to an ascetic. You have piled one sorrow over sorrow on me like rubbing salt to the wound

content: कुलस्य त्वमभावाय कालरात्रिरिवाऽगता।अङ्गारमुपगूह्य स्म पिता मे नावबुद्धवान्।।2.73.4।।
explanation: You have come here for the destruction of this race, like a fatal night. My father did not realize that he was embracing a live charcoal.

content: मृत्युमापादितो पिता त्वया मे पापदर्शिनि।सुखं परिहृतं मोहात्कुलेऽस्मिन्कुलपांसनि।।2.73.5।।
explanation: O woman of sinful thoughts, you have brought about the death of my father. O obloquy of the race, by your folly you have deprived this family of its happiness.

content: त्वां प्राप्य हि पिता मेऽद्य सत्यसन्धो महायशाः।तीव्रदुःखाभिसन्तप्तो वृत्तो दशरथो नृपः।।2.73.6।।
explanation: My father king Dasaratha who is bound to truth and highly renowned, having come under your influence and tormented by intense grief has departed from this world.

content: विनाशितो महाराजः पिता मे धर्मवत्सलः।कस्मात्प्रव्राजितो रामः कस्मादेव वनं गतः।।2.73.7।।
explanation: Why was my father the righteous maharaja killed? Why was Rama exiled into the forest?

content: कौसल्या च सुमित्रा च पुत्रशोकाभिपीडिते।दुष्करं यदि जीवेतां प्राप्य त्वां जननीं मम।।2.73.8।।
explanation: Tormented by the grief of separation from their sons, it is difficult for Kausalya and Sumitra to survive under you, O my mother.

content: ननुत्वार्योऽपि धर्मात्मा त्वयि वृतिमनुत्तमाम्।वर्तते गुरुवृत्तिज्ञो यथा मातरि वर्तते।।2.73.9।।
explanation: My noble and righteous brother (Rama), who is well aware of his duties to the elders conducted himself before you as he would before his own mother.

content: तथा ज्येष्ठा हि मे माता कौसल्या दीर्घदर्शिनी।त्वयि धर्मं समास्थाय भगिन्यामिव वर्तते।।2.74.10।।
explanation: In the same way my eldest mother the farsighted Kausalya, too adhered to righteousness and conducted herself towards you like a sister.

content: तस्याः पुत्रं कृताऽत्मानं चीरवल्कलवाससम्। प्रस्थाप्य वनवासाय कथं पापे न शोचसि।।2.73.11।।
explanation: You have forced Kausalya's son, so pure in mind, to wear garments made of bark and dwell in the forest. Do you not feel remorse for it, O perverse wretch?

content: अपापदर्शनं शूरं कृतात्मानं यशस्विनम्।प्रव्राज्य चीरवसनं किन्नु पश्यसि कारणम्।।2.73.12।।
explanation: The glorious, valiant, selfpossessed (Rama) had never contemplated evil. What possible reason do you have for sending him, clothed in bark, into exile?

content: लुब्धाया विदितो मन्ये न तेऽहं राघवं प्रति।तथाह्यनर्धो राज्यार्थं त्वयाऽनीतो महानयम्।।2.73.13।।
explanation: Being avaricious, you are, I think, unaware of my devotion to Rama. This great calamity has been brought about by you for (your greed for) the kingdom.

content: अहं हि पुरुषव्याघ्रावपश्यन्रामलक्ष्मणौ।केन शक्तिप्रभावेन राज्यं रक्षितुमुत्सहे।।2.73.14।।
explanation: When Rama and Lakshmana, the best of men stay away from me, by virtue of what mighty power am I competent to protect this kingdom?

content: तं हि नित्यं महाराजो बलवन्तं महाबलः।उपाश्रितोऽभूद्धर्मात्मा मेरुर्मेरुवनं यथा।।2.73.15।।
explanation: The mighty and righteous maharaja used to rely upon the powerful Rama just as mount Meru depends on the forest surrounding it for its protection.

content: सोऽहं कथमिमं भारं महाधुर्यसमुद्धृतम्।दम्योधुरमिवाऽऽसाद्य वहेयं केनचौजसा।। 2.73.16।।
explanation: Like a young untrained bullock that cannot carry the weight fit for a great bull, with what strength can I bear this burden?

content: अथवा मे भवेच्छक्तिर्योगैर्बुद्धिबलेन वा।सकामां न करिष्यामि त्वामहं पुत्रगर्धिनीम्।।2.73.17।।
explanation: If I gather the strength (to carry the burden) either by employing the four expedients (available to a king against an enemy) or by the power of intellect, I will not allow you, covetous of your son, to fulfil your ambition.

content: न मे विकाङ्क्षा जायेत त्यक्तुं त्वां पापनिश्चयाम्।यदि रामस्य नावेक्षा त्वयि स्यान्मातृवत्सदा।।2.73.18।।
explanation: Had Rama not treated you as his own mother I would not have the slightest hesitation to renounce you, a lady of sinful disposition.

content: उत्पन्नातु कथं बुद्धिस्तवेयं पापदर्शिनि।साधुचारित्रविभ्रष्टे पूर्वेषां नो विगर्हिता।।2.73.19।।
explanation: O woman of sinful thoughts fallen from virtuous conduct, how did you entertain this thought reproachable to our ancestors?

content: अस्मिन्कुले हि पूर्वेषां ज्येष्ठो राज्येऽभिषिच्यते।अपरे भ्रातरस्तस्मिन्प्रवर्तन्ते समाहिताः।।2.73.20।।
explanation: In our race only the eldest son is installed in the kingdom and the other brothers behave with utmost respect towards him.

content: न हि मन्ये नृशंसे त्वं राजधर्ममवेक्षसे।गतिं वा न विजानासि राजवृत्तस्य शाश्वतीम्।।2.73.21।।
explanation: O cruel one I suppose neither have you any respect for the royal tradition nor are you aware of the everlasting benefit that ensues in following the royal traditon.

content: सततं राजवृत्ते हि ज्येष्ठो राज्येऽभिषिच्यते।राज्ञामेतत्समं तत्स्यादिक्ष्वाकूणां विशेषतः।।2.73.22।।
explanation: According to the established law of royalty, the eldest son is invariably crowned in the kingdom. This is true of all kings. This is a special tradition of the kings of the Ikshvaku race.

content: तेषां धर्मैकरक्षाणां कुलचारित्रशोभिनाम्।अद्य चारित्रशौण्डीर्यं त्वां प्राप्य विनिवर्तितम्।।2.73.23।।
explanation: As for the Ikshvaku kings, righteousness is their sole protection. They follow the ancestral traditions befitting the noble race. This tradition has been topsyturvied by admitting you into the family.

content: तवापि सुमहाभागा जनेन्द्राः कुलपूर्वगाः।बुद्धेर्मोहः कथमयं सम्भूतस्त्वयि गर्हितः।।2.73.24।।
explanation: Even the kings in your ancestral family were highly distinguished men. How did this condemnable deflection originate in your mind?

content: न तु कामं करिष्यामि तवाऽहं पापनिश्चये।त्वया व्यसनमारब्धं जीवितान्तकरं मम।।2.73.25।।
explanation: O woman of sinful disposition, I on my part will not fulfil your cherished desire. You have started a distressing deed to bring an end to my existence.

content: एषत्विदानीमेवाहमप्रियार्थं तवानघम्।निवर्तयिष्यामि वनाद्भ्रातरं स्वजनप्रियम्।।2.73.26।।
explanation: To cause a great discomfiture for you, right now I shall bring back my faultless brother, the beloved of his people, from the forest.

content: निवर्तयित्वा रामं च तस्याहं दीप्ततेजसः।दासभूतो भविष्यामि सुस्थिरेणान्तरात्मना।।2.73.27।।
explanation: With the effulgent Rama brought back, I shall serve him with a  steadfast mind.

content: इत्येवमुक्त्वा भरतो महात्मा प्रियेतरैर्वाक्यगणैस्तुदंस्ताम्।शोकातुरश्चापि ननाद भूयः सिंहो यथा पर्वतगह्वरस्थः।।2.73.28।।
explanation: Having inflicted on his mother these unpleasant words in this manner, the highsouled Bharata, overwhelmed with grief, roared again like a lion in a mountaincave.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे त्रिसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventythird sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Bharata reproaches his mother -- decides to restore the glory of Ayodhya -- vows to get back Rama]तां तथा गर्हयित्वा तु मातरं भरतस्तदा।रोषेण महताऽविष्टः पुनरेवाब्रवीद्वचः।।2.74.1।।
explanation: Overtaken by great wrath, Bharata reproached his mother and then said to her again:

content: राज्याद्भ्रंशस्व कैकेयि नृशंसे दुष्टचारिणि।परित्यक्ता च धर्मेण मा मृतं रुदती भव।।2.74.2।।
explanation: O cruel Kaikeyi of wicked conduct, you may be deprived of the kingdom. Abandoned by righteousness, you shall be weeping for me after my death.

content: किन्नु तेऽदूषयद्राजा रामो वा भृशधार्मिकः।ययोर्मृत्युर्विवासश्च त्वत्कृते तुल्यमागतौ।।2.74.3।।
explanation: Death for the king and exile for Rama, similar fate for both, have befallen on your account. What possible harm, either the king or the highly virtuous Rama has done to you?

content: भ्रूणहत्यामसि प्राप्ता कुलस्यास्य विनाशनात्।कैकेयि नरकं गच्छ मा च भर्तु स्सलोकताम्।।2.74.4।।
explanation: O Kaikeyi by destroying this race you have earned the demerit of killing an embryo and shall enter hell. You shall never attain the same state of living, in the  afterworld of your husband.

content: यत्त्वया हीदृशं पापं कृतं घोरेण कर्मणा।सर्वलोकप्रियं हित्वा ममाप्यापादितं भयम्।।2.74.5।।
explanation: That by doing this horrible deed you have committed a great sin of renouncing Rama, the beloved of all worlds. Therefore I am overtaken by fear.

content: त्वत्कृते मे पिता वृत्तो रामश्चारण्यमाश्रितः।अयशो जीवलोके च त्वयाऽहं प्रतिपादितः।।2.74.6।।
explanation: You have caused my father's death and Rama's exile. As for me, I have obtained ignominy in this world.

content: मातृरूपे ममामित्रे नृशंसे राज्यकामुके।न तेऽह मभिभाष्योऽस्मि दुर्वृत्ते पतिघातिनि।।2.74.7।।
explanation: O cruel woman, O woman of vicious character you are an enemy assuming a mother's form, lustful for kingdom. You are a murderess (of your husband) and I shall never speak to you.

content: कौसल्या च सुमित्रा च याश्चान्या मम मातरः।दुःखेन महताऽविष्टास्त्वां प्राप्य कुलदूषिणीम्।।2.74.8।।
explanation: As you have vitiated the race, my mothers Kausalya and Sumitra are overwhelmed with great sorrow.

content: न त्वमश्वपतेः कन्या धर्मराजस्य धीमतः।राक्षसी तत्र जाताऽसि कुलप्रध्वंसिनी पितुः।।2.74.9।।यत्त्वया धार्मिको रामो नित्यं सत्यपरायणः।वनं प्रस्थापितो दुःखात्पिता च त्रिदिवं गतः।।2.74.10।।
explanation: As you sent virtuous Rama, ever devoted to truth, into the forest, my father died out of grief (due to separation from  his son). Therefore, you are not the true daughter of the righteous and sagacious king Aswapati but a demoness born there to destroy your father's race.

content: यत्प्रधानाऽसि तत्पापं मयि पित्रा विनाकृते।भ्रातृभ्यां च परित्यक्ते सर्वलोकस्य चाप्रिये।।2.74.11।।
explanation: The sin you have committed with a particular objective has affected me and (as a result) I am left without my father. I am abandoned by my brothers. I am hated by every one in this entire world.

content: कौसल्यां धर्मसंयुक्तां वियुक्तां पापनिश्चये।कृत्वा कं प्राप्स्यसे त्वद्य लोकं निरयगामिनि।।2.74.12।।
explanation: O woman of sinful convictions you will go to hell. You have separated righteous Kausalya from her son. For having committed such a sin, what afterworld awaits you  (is not known)?

content: किं नावबुध्यसे क्रूरे नियतं बन्धुसंश्रयम्।ज्येष्ठं पितृसमं रामं कौसल्यायाऽत्मसम्भवम्।।2.74.13।।
explanation: O cruel one why do you not realise that Rama, born of Kausalya, is the eldest son and equal to my father? He is selfrestrained and a refuge to his kith and kin.

content: अङगप्रत्यङगजः पुत्रो हृदयाच्चापि जायते।तस्मात्प्रियतमो मातुः प्रिया एव तु बान्धवाः।।2.74.14।।
explanation: A son born from every limb, big or small, and from the heart is the most beloved of all for his mother while the other relatives are only loving ones.

content: अन्यदा किल धर्मज्ञा सुरभि स्सुरसम्मता।वहमानौ ददर्शोर्व्यां पुत्रौ विगतचेतसौ।।2.74.15।।
explanation: It is said that once upon a time Surabhi, the divine cow, highly respected by the gods and conversant with righteous ways, beheld her two sons who fainted due to fatigue while carrying the burden of the ploughs.

content: तावर्धदिवसे श्रान्तौ दृष्ट्वा पुत्रौ महीतले।रुरोद पुत्रशोकेन बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणा।।2.74.16।।
explanation: On seeing her two sons lying on earth exhausted, she wailed in distress for them with her eyes filled with tears.

content: अधस्ताद्व्रजतस्तस्याः सुरराज्ञो महात्मनः।बिन्दवः पतिता गात्रे सूक्ष्मा स्सुरभिगन्धिनः।।2.74.17।।
explanation: The fine drops of her fragnant tears trickled down the body of the great king of the gods (Indra).

content: इन्द्रोऽप्यश्रुनिपातं तं स्वगात्रे पुण्यगन्धिनम्।सुरभिं मन्यते दृष्ट्वा भूयसीं तां सुरेश्वरः।।2.74.18।।
explanation: When Indra, lord of the gods, saw those tears of holy fragrance fallen on his body he understood that the tears were shed by the venerated Kamadhenu.

content: निरीक्षमाण श्शक्रस्तां ददर्श सुरभिं स्थिताम्।आकाशे विष्ठितां दीनां रुदन्तीं भृशदुःखिताम्।।2.74.19।।
explanation: While looking around Indra beheld Kamadhenu in intense pain stationed in the sky,   looking distressed and miserable, and wailing.

content: तां दृष्ट्वा शोकसन्तप्तां वज्रपाणिर्यशस्विनीम्।इन्द्रः प्राञ्जलिरुद्विग्न स्सुरराजोऽब्रवीद्वचः।।2.74.20।।
explanation: The king of the gods, Indra, wielder of thunderbolt, saw the renowned Kamadhenu consumed with grief. Alarmed, he said to her with palms joined in reverence:

content: भयं कच्छिन्न चास्मासु कुतश्चिद्विद्यते महत्।कुतोनिमत्तश्शोकस्ते ब्रूहि सर्वहितैषिणि।।2.74.21।।
explanation: 'O holy cow fear not. You wish the welfare of all, Has any great calamity befallen us from any quarter? I hope not. What is the reason for your sorrow? Tell me'.

content: एवमुक्ता तु सुरभि स्सुरराजेन धीमता।प्रत्युवाच ततो धीरा वाक्यं वाक्यविशारदा।।2.74.22।।
explanation: On hearing the sagacious Indra, king of the gods, Kamadhenu, proficient in speech, calmly replied:

content: शान्तं पापं न वः किञ्चित्कुतश्चिदमराधिपः।अहं मग्नौ तु शोचामि स्वपुत्रौ विषमे स्थितौ।।2.74.23।।एतौ दृष्ट्वा कृशौ दीनौ सूर्यरश्मिप्रतापितौ।बाध्यमानौ बलीवर्धौ कर्षकेण सुराधिप।।2.74.24।।
explanation: 'God forbid, O Indra, lord of the Immortals no calamity has befallen you from any quarter. Only I am in trouble. I am weeping for these pair of bulls, my own sons who are in difficulty. When I see them scorched by the rays of the Sun, miserable, emaciated and weeping, beaten by a ploughman, I am immersed in grief'.

content: ममकायात्प्रसूतौ हि दुःखितौ भारपीडितौ।यौ दृष्ट्वा परितप्येऽहं नास्ति पुत्रसमः प्रियः।।2.74.25।।
explanation: 'These bulls were born from my body and they are oppressed by the burden. Having seen their anguish, I am extremely grieved. There is none so dear as a son'.

content: यस्याः पुत्रसहस्रैस्तु कृत्स्नं व्याप्तमिदं जगत्।तां दृष्ट्वा रुदतीं शक्रो न सुतान्मन्यते परम्।।2.74.26।।
explanation: The wishfulfilling cow (Kamadhenu) had innumerable sons spread all over the world. When Indra saw that Kamadhenu too was weeping for her sons, he concluded 'there is no one greater than a son'.

content: सदाऽप्रतिमवृत्तायाः लोकधारणकाम्यया।श्रीमत्या गुणनित्याया स्स्वभावपरिचेष्टया।।2.74.27।।यस्याः पुत्रसहस्राणि साऽपि शोचति कामधुक्।किं पुनर्या विना रामं कौसल्या वर्तयिष्यति।।2.74.28।।
explanation: Wishing always to nourish the worlds Kamadhenu conducts herself with an unequalled character. In accordance with her nature, she has imbibed in herself eminent virtues. She is endowed with all prosperity. In spite of her thousand sons, she is weeping thus for her two bulls, what can one say of Kausalya separated from her only son Will she be her normal self again?'

content: एकपुत्रा च साध्वी च विवत्सेयं त्वया कृता।तस्मात्त्वं सततं दुःखं प्रेत्य चेह च लप्स्यसे।।2.74.29।।
explanation: This pious lady is blessed with only one son and (now) has been rendered childless by you. Therefore, you shall experience grief in this world and hereafter.

content: अहं ह्यपचितिं भ्रातुः पितुश्च सकलामिमाम्।वर्धनं यशसश्चापि करिष्यामि न संशयः।।2.74.30।।
explanation: As for me, I shall do whatever is necessary for the atonement of the improper conduct shown towards my father and brother and for enhancement of my fame. There is no doubt  about it.

content: अनाययित्वा तनयं कौसल्याया महाबलम्।स्वयमेव प्रवेक्ष्यामि वनं मुनिनिषेवितम्।।2.74.31।।
explanation: If I fail to bring back the mighty son of  Kausalya, I shall enter the forest frequented by ascetics.

content: न ह्यहं पापसङ्कल्पे पापे पापं त्वया कृतम्।शक्तो धारयितुं पौरैरश्रुकण्ठै र्निरीक्षितः।।2.74.32।।
explanation: O vicious one, O evilintentioned one being watched by the citizens with their throats choked with tears of grief, I cannot endure the burden of the sin committed by you.

content: सा त्वमग्निं प्रविश वा स्वयं वा दण्डकान्विश।रज्जुं बधान वा कण्ठे न हि तेऽन्यत्परायणम्।।2.74.33।।
explanation: Jump into the fire or go to Dandaka forest or hang yourself. There is no other recourse for you.

content: अहमप्यवनीं प्राप्ते रामे सत्यपराक्रमे।कृतकृत्यो भविष्यामि विप्रवासितकल्मषः।।2.74.34।।
explanation: When Rama who has truth as his prowess accepts the kingdom, I shall have accomplished my purpose at last and I shall be free from all blemishes.

content: इति नाग इवारण्ये तोमराङ्कुशचोदितः।पपात भुवि सङ्कृद्धो निश्श्वसन्निव पन्नगः।।2.74.35।।
explanation: In this way like an elephant driven by prods and goads in the forest, highly enraged Bharata hissing like a serpent dropped down on the ground.

content: संरक्तनेत्र श्शिथिलाम्भरस्तदा विधूतसर्वाभरणः परन्तपः।बभूव भूमौ पतितो नृपात्मजश्शचीपतेः केतुरिवोत्सवक्षये।।2.74.36।।
explanation: Prince Bharata, the scorcher of enemies, with bloodshot eyes, raiment in disarray, ornaments tossed about lay fallen on the ground like the banner of Indra (husband of Sachi) at the close of the festival of flaghoisting.  इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे चतुस्सप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventyfourth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Bharata and Satrughna meet griefstricken Kausalya -- Kausalya reproaches Bharata harshly -- Bharata appeases Kausalya and curses himself -- Kausalya gets convinced of Bharata's conviction.]दीर्घकालात्समुत्थाय संज्ञां लब्ध्वा च वीर्यवान्।नेत्राभ्यामश्रुपूर्णाभ्यां दीनामुद्वीक्ष्य मातरम्।।2.75.1।।सोऽमात्यमध्ये भरतो जननीमभ्यकुत्सयत्।
explanation: On regaining his senses after a long time, the valiant Bharata looked at his unfortunate mother whose eyes were filled with tears, and condemned her amidst the counsellors.

content: राज्यं न कामये जातु मन्त्रये नापि मातरम्।।2.75.2।।अभिषेकं न जानामि योऽभूद्राज्ञा समीक्षितः।विप्रकृष्टेह्यहं देशे शत्रुघ्नसहितोऽवसम्।।2.75.3।।
explanation: Neither did I ever desire the kingdom nor did I ever consult my mother in this regard and I am not even aware of the consecration that was planned by the king for I was away in a distant country with Satrughna.

content: वनवासं न जानामि रामस्याहं महात्मनः।विवासनं वा सौमित्रे स्सीतायाश्च यथाऽभवत्।।2.75.4।।
explanation: I knew nothing of the banishment of great Rama nor did I know how Lakshmana or Sita had gone on exile.

content: तथैव क्रोशतस्तस्य भरतस्य महात्मनः।कौसल्या शब्दमाज्ञाय सुमित्रामिदमब्रवीत्।।2.75.5।।
explanation: As magnanimous Bharata was wailing, Kausalya recognised his voice and said to Sumitra:

content: आगतः क्रूरकार्यायाः कैकेय्या भरतस्सुतः।तमहं द्रष्टुमिच्छामि भरतं दीर्घदर्शिनम्।।2.75.6।।
explanation: Bharata, the farsighted son of Kaikeyi of cruel deeds has come and I wish to see him.

content: एवमुक्त्वा सुमित्रां सा विवर्णा मलिना कृशा।प्रतस्थे भरतो यत्र वेपमाना विचेतना।।2.75.7।।
explanation: Having said so to Sumitra, Kausalya trembling and almost lifeless, emaciated, sullied and turned pallid set out for the place where Bharat was.

content: स तु रामानुजश्चापि शत्रुघ्नसहितस्तदा।प्रतस्थे भरतो यत्र कौसल्याया निवेशनम्।।2.75.8।।
explanation: But at the same time Bharata, the younger brother of Rama accompanied by Satrughna  proceeded to the place where Kausalya resided.

content: तत श्शत्रुघ्नभरतौ कौसल्यां प्रेक्ष्य दुःखितौ।पर्यष्वजेतां दुःखार्तां पतितां नष्टचेतसाम्।।2.75.9।।रुदन्तौ रुदतीं दुःखात्समेत्यार्यां मनस्स्विनीम्।
explanation: Then agonised Bharata and Satrughna, beholding that venerable, noblehearted, griefstricken, weeping Kausalya who was  almost semiconscious overcome with grief, approached her with great sorrow and hugged her.

content: भरतं प्रत्युवाचेदं कौसल्या भृशदुःखिता।।2.75.10।।इदं ते राज्यकामस्य राज्यं प्राप्तमकण्टकम्।संप्राप्तं बत कैकेय्या शशीघ्रं क्रूरेण कर्मणा।।2.75.11।।
explanation: Looking at Bharata, the deeply afflicted Kausalya said, The kingdom which you had desired has been acquired without any obstacle. Alas Kaikeyi had quickly secured it for you  through her crooked act.

content: प्रस्थाप्य चीरवसनं पुत्रं मे वनवासिनम्।कैकेयी कं गुणं तत्र पश्यति क्रूरदर्शिनी।।2.75.12।।
explanation: What advantage did cruel Kaikeyi visualize in sending away my son to dwell in the forest  wearing robes of bark?

content: क्षिप्रं मामपि कैकेयी प्रस्थापयितुमर्हति।हिरण्यनाभो यत्रास्ते सुतो मे सुमहायशाः।।2.75.13।।
explanation: Kaikeyi should send me also without any delay to that place where my illustrious  Rama with golden navel dwells.

content: अथवा स्वयमेवाहं सुमित्रानुचरा सुखम्।अग्निहोत्रं पुरस्कृत्य प्रस्थास्ये यत्र राघवः।।2.75.14।।
explanation: Or else I, accompanied by Sumitra, shall go happily on my own holding the sacred fire in front to that place where Rama dwells.

content: कामं वा स्वयमेवाद्य तत्र मां नेतुमर्हसि।यत्रासौ पुरुषव्याघ्रः पुत्रो मे तप्यते तपः।।2.75.15।।
explanation: Or, you should now take me personally to that place where, my son Rama, the best among men, is performing austerities.

content: इदं हि तव विस्तीर्णं धनधान्यसमाचितम्।हस्त्वश्वरथसम्पूर्णं राज्यं निर्यातितं तया।।2.75.16।।
explanation: This vast kingdom, with all its abundance of wealth and grain, elephants, horses and chariots has been delivered to you by her.

content: इत्यादिबहुभिर्वाक्यैः क्रूरैः सम्भर्त्सितोऽनघः।विव्यथे भरतस्तीव्रं व्रणे तुद्येव सूचिना।।2.75.17।।
explanation: Thus reproached by many a harsh word, like needle pricking a wound, the sinless Bharata was intensely pained.

content: पपात चरणौ तस्यास्तदा सम्भ्रान्तचेतनः।विलप्य बहुधाऽसंज्ञो लब्धसंज्ञस्ततः स्थितः।।2.75.18।।
explanation: (Having heard these words), his senses reeling, he became unconscious, lamented profusaly and fell at her feet. And on regaining his senses, he stood motionless.

content: एवं विलपमानां तां भरतः प्राञ्जलिस्तदा।कौसल्यां प्रत्युवाचेदं शोकैर्बहुभिरावृताम्।।2.75.19।।
explanation: As Kausalya was lamenting in this manner, overwhelmed with deep grief, Bharata, his palms joined in reverence, replied her in these words:

content: आर्ये कस्मादजानन्तं गर्हसे मामकिल्बिषम्।विपुलां च मम प्रीतिं स्थिरां जानासि राघवे।।2.75.20।।
explanation: O noble lady unaware (of what had happened), I am guiltless. Why do you upbraid me? You know well my profound, steadfast affection for Raghava (Rama).

content: कृता शास्त्रानुगा बुद्धिर्माभूत्तस्य कदाचन।सत्यसन्ध स्सतां श्रेष्ठो यस्याऽर्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.21।।
explanation: Did not the one who counselled the banishment of my noble brother who is steadfast and bound by truth and virtue, ever adhered to scriptures?(or)My noble brother (Rama), the best among the virtuous, bound to truth, is banished. Let not such thought occur at any time to one who steadfastly adheres to scriptures

content: प्रेष्यं पापीयसां यातु सूर्यञ्च प्रतिमेहतु।हन्तु पादेन गां सुप्तां यस्याऽर्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.22।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother, Rama be cursed with the sin of undergoing servitude in the hands of most sinful of men, the sin of passing urine facing the Sun and of kicking a sleeping cow.

content: कारयित्वा महत्कर्म भर्ता भृत्यमनर्थकम्।अधर्मो योऽस्य सोऽस्यास्तु यस्याऽर्योऽनुमतेगतः।।2.75.23।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the demerit of unrighteousness in the same way as a master who gets a difficult work done by a servant without remuneration.

content: परिपालयमानस्य राज्ञो भूतानि पुयत्रवत्।ततस्नु दुह्यतां पापं यस्याऽर्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.24।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the sin in the same way as a man  acting treacherously against a king who rules like a father and protects his subjects like his own children, acquires.

content: बलिषड्भागमुद्धृत्य नृपस्यारक्षतः प्रजाः।अधर्मो योऽस्य सोऽस्यास्तु यस्यार्थोऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.25।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire unrighteousness in the same way as a king who, having received one sixth of the income as tax from people does not protect them

content: संश्रुत्य च तपस्विभ्यस्सत्रे वै यज्ञदक्षिणाम्।तां विप्रलपतां पापं यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.26।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the sin in the same way as a person acquires for having promised the ascetics the required offering at a sacrifice and later denies them

content: हस्त्यश्वरथसम्बाधे युद्धे शस्त्रसमाकुले।मा स्म कार्षीत्सतां धर्मं यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.27।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the demerit in the same way as a person, who having gone to the battleground abundantly provided with elephants, horses, chariots and weapons fails to discharge the duty (of a fighter)

content: उपदिष्टं सुसूक्ष्मार्थं शास्त्रं यत्नेन धीमता।स नाशयतु दुष्टात्मा यस्याऽर्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.28।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire demerit in the same way as an evilhearted person who forever destroys the subtle meaning of the scriptures imparted carefully by a sagacious preceptor

content: मा च तं व्यूढबाह्वंसं चन्द्रार्कसमतेजसम्।द्राक्षीद्राज्यस्थमासीनं यस्यार्योऽनुमतेगतः।।2.75.29।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother be highly unfortunate like me in not being able to behold that longarmed and broadshoulderd one seated on the throne and resembling both the Sun and the Moon in radiance

content: पायसं कृसरं छागं वृथा सोऽश्नातु निर्घृणः।गुरूंश्चाप्यवजानातु यस्याऽर्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.30।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the demerit in the same way as a person, who partakes the sweet milkrice, sesamerice and goat's flesh without purpose (without invoking and offering it to the gods) and disrespects the teachers

content: गाश्च स्पृशतु पादेन गुरून्परिवदेत्स्वयम्।मित्रे द्रुह्येत सोऽत्यन्तं यस्याऽर्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.31।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the sin in the same way a person who kicks the cows abuses elders and causes great offence to his friends

content: विश्वासात्कथितं किञ्चित्परिवादं मिथः क्वचित्।विवृणोतु स दुष्टात्मा यस्याऽर्योऽमते गतः।।2.75.32।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother, acquire the sin in the same way as a wickedminded person, who divulges the words of abuse secretly confided in him by his friends.

content: अकर्ता ह्यकृतज्ञश्च त्यक्ताचाऽत्मा निरपत्रपः।लोके भवतु विद्विष्टो यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.33।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother be hated universally as one who never helps any one, who is ungrateful, shameless and as one who has committed the sin of suicide

content: पुत्रैर्दारैश्च भृत्यैश्च स्वगृहे परिवारितः।स एको मृष्टमश्नातु यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.34।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother  acquire the sin in the same way as one who, although surrounded by wife, children and servants, eats the delicacies all alone without sharing acquires.

content: अप्राप्य सदृशान् दाराननपत्यः प्रमीयताम्।अनवाप्य क्रियां धर्म्यां यस्याऽर्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.35।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother die without winning a worthy wife and without begetting offspring and without performing religious deeds

content: माऽत्मनस्सन्ततिं द्राक्षीत्स्वेषु दारेषु दुःखितः।आयुस्समग्रमप्राप्य यऽस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.36।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother live an entire life of anguish without begetting children through his wife or without seeing his own children

content: राजस्त्रीबालवृद्धानां वधे यत्पापमुच्यते।भृत्यत्यागे च यत्पापं तत्पापं प्रतिपद्यताम्।।2.75.37।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the same sin as one acquires for murdering a king, a woman, children and the aged and deserting dependents

content: लाक्षया मधुमांसेन लोहेन च विषेण च।सदैव बिभृयाद्भृत्यान्यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.38।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the same sin as one who supports his wife and children by trafficking in lac, wine, meat and metal and poison acquires

content: सङ्ग्रमे समुपोढे स्म शत्रुपक्षभयङ्करे।पलायामानो वध्येत यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.39।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the same sin like a warrior, dreadful to the enemy side who will be slain while fleeing from the war at its peak

content: कपालपाणिः पृथिवीमटतां चीरसंवृतः।भिक्षमाणो यथोन्मत्तो यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.40।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother, wander this earth, begging alms, holding a human skull like an insane man dressed in rags

content: मद्ये प्रसक्तो भवतु स्त्रीष्वक्षेषु च नित्यशः।कामक्रोधाभिभूतस्तु यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.41।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother be always addicted to wine, women and gambling and be swayed by desire and anger

content: मास्म धर्मे मनो भूयादधर्मं स निषेवताम्।अपात्रवर्षी भवतु यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.42।।
explanation: May the mind of that man who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother not be established in virtue May he practise unrighteousness and confer charity on the unworthy

content: सञ्चितान्यस्य वित्तनि विविधानि सहस्रशः।दस्युभिर्विप्रलुप्यन्तां यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.43।।
explanation: May that man's accumulated extensive posssessions of various kinds of wealth be  snatched away by thieves in thousands of ways if he had counselled the exile of my esteemed brother

content: उभे सन्ध्ये शयानस्य यत्पापं परिकल्प्यते।तच्चपापं भवेत्तस्य यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.44।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the extent of demerit fixed for a person, who sleeps at the hour of twilight of dawn and dusk

content: यदग्निदायके पापं यत्पापं गुरतल्पगे।मित्रद्रोहे च यत्पापं तत्पापं प्रतिपद्यताम्।।2.75.45।।
explanation: May that one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the sin in the same way as a person who sets fire to human settlements, violates the preceptors's bed and betrays his friend

content: देवतानां पित्रूणां च मातापित्रोस्तथैव च।मा स्म कार्षीत्स शुश्रूषां यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.46।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother, acquire the sin in the same way as a person who fails to show obedience to the gods and the ancestors and to serve his parents

content: सतां लोकात्सतां कीर्त्या स्सञ्जुष्टात्कर्मणस्तथा।भ्रश्यतु क्षिप्रमद्यैव यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.47।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother be expelled  this very moment from the world approved by virtuous men, from their renown and from their (noble) actions

content: अपास्य मातृशुश्रूषामनर्थे सोऽवतिष्ठताम्।दीर्घबाहुर्महावक्षा: यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.48।।
explanation: The one who counselled the exile of my noble, longarmed and broadchested brother be banished like the one who commited the sin of leaving the ministration to his mother and engaging himself in purposeless acts

content: बहुपुत्रो दरिद्रश्च ज्वररोगसमन्वितः।स भूयात्सतत क्लेशी यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.49।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother be always miserable with many sons, poverty and fever and disease

content: आशामाशंसमानानां दीनानामूर्ध्वचक्षुषाम्।अर्थिनां वितथां कुर्याद्यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.50।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the sin in the same way a person disappoints who miserable mendicants seeking alms and looking up to him for help

content: मायया रमतां नित्यं परुषः पिशुनोऽशुचिः।राज्ञो भीतस्त्वधर्मात्मा यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.51।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the sin in the same way as a person, who is abusive, niggardly, impure, unrighteous and always afraid of being caught by the king, and lives by cheating others, acquires

content: ऋतुस्नातां सतीं भार्यामृतुकालानुरोधिनीम्।अतिवर्तेत दुष्टात्मा यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.52।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the sin in the same way as a wickedminded person who neglects his chaste wife observing the menstrual period unfavourable for conception and had bathed after menstruation  acquires

content: सधर्मदारान्परित्यज्य परदारान्निषेवताम्।त्यक्तधर्मरतिर्मूढो यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.53।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the sin in the same way a foolish person who abandons righteous conduct and  forsakes his rightfully married wife and resorts to other man's wife acquires

content: विप्रलुप्तप्रजातस्य दुष्कृतं ब्राह्मणस्य यत्।तदेव प्रतिपद्येत यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.54।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the same sin like that of a lowbred brahmin who commits an irreversible sin acquires

content: पानीयदूषके पापं तथैव विषदायके।यत्तदेकस्स लभतां यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.55।।
explanation: May the sin of polluting drinking water and administering poison to others be put together and be incurred by the man who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother

content: ब्राह्मणायोद्यतां पूजां विहन्तु कलुषेन्द्रियः।बालवत्सां च गां दोग्धु यस्यार्यो ऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.56।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the sin in the same way a person with befouled senses disturbs the offerings of worship kept ready for a brahmin and milks the cow having a young calf acquires.

content: तुर्ष्णार्तं सति पानीये विप्रलम्भेन योजयेत्।लभेत तस्य यत्पापं यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.57।।
explanation: May the one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the sin in the same way a person who in possession of water does not give it to one suffering from thirst acquires it

content: भक्त्या विवदमानेषु मार्गमाश्रित्य पश्यतः।तस्य पापेन युज्येत यस्यार्योऽनुमते गतः।।2.75.58।।
explanation: May that one who counselled the exile of my esteemed brother acquire the sin in the same way a person acquires while giving onesided judgement between divided religious disputants

content: विहीनां पतिपुत्राभ्यां कौसल्यां पार्थिवात्मजः।एवमाश्वासयन्नेव दुःखार्तो निपपात ह।।2.75.59।।
explanation: While thus appeasing Kausalya deprived of her husband and son, Bharata, filled with grief, fell down at her feet.

content: तथा तु शपथैः कष्टै श्शपमानमचेतनम्।भरतं शोकसन्तप्तं कौसल्या वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।2.75.60।।
explanation: Kausalya said these words to Bharata who fell unconscious, consumed with grief, while swearing on painful oaths.

content: मम दुःखमिदं पुत्र भूयस्समुपजायते।शपथै श्शपमानो हि प्राणानुपरुणत्सि मे।।2.75.61।।
explanation: O son by swearing on oaths, you are choking the very breath of my life and my suffering has grown still more.

content: दिष्ट्या न चलितो धर्मादात्मा ते सहलक्ष्मणः।वत्स सत्यप्रतिज्ञो ते सतां लोकमवाप्स्यसि।।2.75.62।।
explanation: O dear child, fortunately your mind is unswerved from righteousness. You being truthful to your promise shall attain the world of virtuous men along with Lakshmana.

content: इत्युक्त्वा चाङ्कमानीय भरतं भ्रातृवत्सलम्।परिष्वज्य महाबाहुं रुरोद भृशदुःखिता।।2.75.63।।
explanation: After having addressed Bharata, who was affectionate towards his brother that way, Kausalya  drew the mightyarmed one onto her lap and hugged him and cried out with extreme grief.

content: एवं विलपमानस्य दुःखार्तस्य महात्मनः।मोहाच्च शोकसम्रोधाद्बभूव लुलितं मनः।।2.75.64।।
explanation: Afflicted by sorrow and lamenting thus, great Bharata's mind became unsteady owing to swooning and  besieged by grief.

content: लालप्यमानस्य विचेतनस्य प्रणष्टबुद्धे: पतितस्य भूमौ।मुहुर्मुहुर्निश्श्वसतश्च घर्मं सा तस्य शोकेन जगाम रात्रिः।।2.75.65।।
explanation: That night passed off in grief for Bharata, who fell on the ground with his mind clouded and his senses lost. He lamented again and again, heaving deep, warm sighs. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे पञ्चसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventyfifth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Bharata performs funeral rites of king Dasaratha on the bank of Sarayu.]तमेवं शोकसन्तप्तं भरतं कैकयी सुतम्।उवाच वदतां श्रेष्ठो वसिष्ठ श्श्रेष्ठवागृषिः।।2.76.1।।
explanation: Vasistha, the most eloquent and the best of ascetics said to Bharata, the son of Kaikeyi who was tormented with grief:

content: अलं शोकेन भद्रं ते राजपुत्र महायशः।प्राप्तकालं नरपतेः कुरु संयानमुत्तमम्।।2.76.2।।
explanation: O prince of great renown, may God bless you It is not proper on your part to grieve. It is time to perform the funeral rites of the king in the best way possible.

content: वसिष्ठस्य वच श्शृत्वा भरतो धारणां गतः।प्रेतकार्याणि सर्वाणि कारयामास धर्मवित्।।2.76.3।।
explanation: On hearing the words of Vasistha, dutiful Bharata regained his steadiness and engaged in the performance of the funeral rites.

content: उद्धृतं तैलसंरोधात्सतु भूमौ निवेशितम्।आपीतवर्णवदनं प्रसुप्तमिव भूमिपम्।।2.76.4।।संवेश्य शयने चाग्य्रे नानारत्नपरिष्कृते।ततो दशरथं पुत्रो विललाप सुदुःखितः।।2.76.5।।
explanation: The mortal remains of king Dasaratha, protector of the earth, was taken out of the oil container and placed on the floor. His pale, yellow face appeared as if he was asleep. Thereafter it was laid upon a magnificent couch adorned with every kind of gem. On seeing Dasaratha in that state  Bharata lamented in extreme distress.

content: किं ते व्यवसितं राजन् प्रोषिते मय्यनागते।विवास्य रामं धर्मज्ञं लक्ष्मणं च महाबलम्।।2.76.6।।
explanation: What have you done, O king, between my absence and my arrival? You have banished the righteous Rama and the valiant Lakshmana.

content: क्व यास्यसि महाराज हित्वेमं दुःखितं जनम्।हीनं पुरुषसिंहेन रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा।।2.76.7।।
explanation: O great king Where will you go leaving me who is bewailing for having been left by Rama, the lion among men and a man of pious deeds?

content: योगक्षेमं तु ते राजन् कोऽस्मिन्कल्पयिता पुरेत्वयि प्रयाते स्वस्तात रामे च वनमाश्रिते।।2.76.8।।
explanation: O king O father you have gone to heaven and Rama has taken shelter in the forest now. Who will take care of the welfare and security of your city?

content: विधवा पृथिवी राजन् स्त्वया हीना न राजते।हीनचन्द्रेव रजनी नगरी प्रतिभाति मा।।2.76.9।।
explanation: O king bereft of you, the earth (kingdom) is widowed and has lost its radiance. The city appears to me like a moonless night.

content: एवं विलपमानं तं भरतं दीनमानसम्।अब्रवीद्वचनं भूयो वसिष्ठस्तु महामुनिः।।2.76.10।।
explanation: To Bharata who was thus lamenting with a dejected mind, the great ascetic Vasistha once again said:

content: प्रेतकार्याणि यान्यस्य कर्तव्यानि विशां पतेः।तान्यव्यग्रं महाबाहो क्रियान्तामविचारितम्।।2.76.11।।
explanation: O mightyarmed prince, the funeral rites that are required to be performed for the departed king ought to be done carefully without any shortcomings.

content: तथेति भरतो वाक्यं वसिष्ठस्याभिपूज्य तत्।ऋत्विक्पुरोहिताचार्यान् स्त्वरयामास सर्वशः।।2.76.12।।
explanation: Bharata said, 'Be it so' in obedience to Vasistha, who hastened up the learned Vedic scholars, family priests and preceptors to perform various rites.

content: ये त्वग्नयो नरेन्द्रेस्य चाग्न्यगाराद्बहिष्कृताः।ऋत्विग्भिर्याजकैश्चैव ते आह्रियन्त यथाविधि।।2.76.13।।
explanation: The sacrificial fire of the king has been put outside the firesanctuary in accordance with the ritual precepts and were withdrawn by the attendants and priests wellversed in Vedic lore.

content: शिबिकायामथा़ऽरोप्य राजानं गतचेतसम्।बाष्पकण्ठा विमनसस्तमूहुः परिचारकाः।।2.76.14।।
explanation: Thereafter the attendants raised the mortal remains of the deceased king onto a litter, with dejected minds, throats choked with tears and carried him away.

content: हिरण्यं च सुवर्णं च वासांसि विविधानि च।प्रकिरन्तो जना मार्गं नृपतेरग्रतो ययुः।।2.76.15।।
explanation: The people went ahead of the king's body strewing on the way gold of brilliant colour and different kinds of garments.

content: चन्दनागरुनिर्यासान् सरलं पद्मकं तथा।देवदारूणि चाहृत्य क्षेपयन्ति तथापरे।।2.76.16।।गन्धानुच्चावचांश्चान्यां स्तत्र गत्वाथ भूमिपम्।तत्र संवेशयामासुश्चितामध्ये तमृत्विजः।।2.76.17।।
explanation: In this way others brought sandal, agaru and fragrant gum gugul, the resin of balsa tree and woods of sarala, padmaka and devadaru and built a pyre and strew many kinds of fragrant substances on it. Thereafter the priests laid the mortal remains of the king in the centre of the pyre.

content: तदा हुताशनं हुत्वा जेपुस्तस्य तदृत्विजः।जगुश्च ते यथाशास्त्र तत्र सामानि सामगाः।।2.76.18।।
explanation: Then the priests offering oblations to the king's fire, intoned prayers. The reciters of Sama Veda sang the hymns in accordance with the sacred scriptures.

content: शिबिकाभिश्च यानैश्च यथार्हं तस्य योषितः।नगरा न्निर्ययुस्तत्र वृद्धैः परिवृता स्तदा।।2.76.19।।
explanation: Then in accordance with their rank and surrounded by aged guards, the wives of  king Dasaratha departed for that place from the city in palanquins and other carriages.

content: प्रसव्यं चापि तं चकुः ऋत्विजोऽग्निचितं नृपम्।स्त्रियश्च शोकसन्तप्ताः कौसल्याप्रमुखास्तदा।।2.76.20।।
explanation: Then the priests and other women led by Kausalya who was consumed with grief circumambulated the pyre in the reverse direction as the king's body was engulfed by flames.

content: क्रौञ्चीनामिव नारीणां निनादस्तत्र शुश्रुवे।आर्तानां करुणं काले क्रोशन्तीनां सहस्रशः।।2.76.21।।
explanation: At that time, piteous cries of distressed women in their thousands like the piercing cries of female kraunchas (birds) were heard.

content: ततो रुदन्त्यो विवशाविलप्य च पुनः पुनः।यानेभ्यस्सरयूतीरमवतेरुर्वराङ्गनाः।।2.76.22।।
explanation: Thereafter, the courtesans weeping uncontrollably and, lamenting again and again, alighted from carriages on the bank of the river Sarayu.

content: कृत्वोदकं ते भरतेन सार्धं नृपाङ्गना मन्त्रिपुरोहिता श्च।पुरंप्रविश्याश्रुपरीतनेत्राः भूमौ दशाहं व्यनयन्त दुःखम्।।2.76.23।।
explanation: The wives of the king, counsellors and priests along with Bharata offered waterlibation and entered the city with tearful eyes. They spent the tenday  mourning period sleeping on the ground (floor) in great grief.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे षटसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventysixth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [On the thirteenth day Bharata drops down in agony while picking up the bones of his deceased father -- Bharata and Satrughna once again plunge in grief -- Vasistha and Sumanthra console them]ततो दशाहेऽतिगते कृतशौचो नृपात्मजः।द्वादशेऽहनि सम्प्राप्ते श्राद्धकर्माण्यकारयत्।।2.77.1।।
explanation: Having observed the tenday mourning period, Bharata purified himself on the twelfth day and got the shraddha rites (obsequies) performed.

content: ब्राह्मणेभ्यो ददौ रत्नं धनमन्नं च पुष्कलम्।वासांसि च महार्हाणि रत्नानि विविधानि च।।2.77.2।।
explanation: During the shraddha ceremony (obsequies) Bharata bestowed on brahmins precious stones, wealth, large quantities of rice, highly valuable garments and various gems.

content: बास्तिकं बहु शुक्लं च गाश्चापि शतशस्तथा।दासीदासं च यानं च वेश्मानि सुमहान्ति च।।2.77.3।।ब्राह्मणेभ्यो ददौ पुत्रो राज्ञस्तस्यौर्ध्वदैहिकम्।
explanation: At the time of performing the rites pertaining to the other world, Bharata bestowed on brahmins herds of white goats, cows in hundreds, male and female servants and spacious houses and carriages.

content: ततः प्रभातसमये दिवसेऽथ त्रयोदशे।।2.77.4।।विललाप महाबाहुर्भरत श्शोकमूर्छितः।शब्दापिहितकण्ठस्तु शोधनार्थमुपागतः।।2.77.5।।चितामूले पितुर्वाक्यमिदमाह सुदुःखितः।
explanation: Thereafter at the hour of dawn on the thirteenth day mightyarmed Bharata visited the cemetery to perform the purificatory ceremony. Approaching the place of the funeral pyre of his father, he lamented in the intensity of grief:

content: तात यस्मिन्निसृष्टोऽहं त्वया भ्रातरि राघवे।।2.77.6।।तस्मिन्वनं प्रव्रजिते शून्ये त्यक्तोऽस्म्यहं त्वया।
explanation: O dear father, my brother Rama to whom you have entrusted me has been sent to the forest now and I am  left in a vacuum.

content: यस्या गतिरनाथायाः पुत्रः प्रवाजितो वनम्।तामम्बां तात कौसल्यां त्यक्त्वा त्वं क्व गतो नृप।।2.77.7।।
explanation: Where have you gone, my king my father, forsaking mother Kausalya who is without a protector and whose only support Rama, her son has been sent away to the forest?

content: दृष्ट्वा भस्मारुणं तच्च दग्धास्थि स्थानमण्डलम्।।2.77.8।।पितु श्शरीरनिर्वाणं निष्टनन्विषसाद सः।
explanation: Having seen the circular place, looking reddishbrown with burnt bones and ashes, where his father's body was consumed by fire, Bharata started crying aloud in deep despondency.

content: स तु दृष्ट्वा रुदन् दीनः पपात धरणीतले।।2.77.9।।उत्थाप्यमानश्शक्रस्य यन्त्रध्वज इव च्युतः।
explanation: On seeing the cremation ground desolate Bharata collapsed sobbing on the ground like a fastened flag staff of Indra, which fell as it was being raised.

content: अभिपेतुस्ततस्सर्वे तस्यामात्याश्शुचिव्रतम्।।2.77.10।।अन्तकाले निपतितं ययातिमृषयो यथा।
explanation: Immediately all his counsellors ran towards him like the ascetics who raised Yayati, a man of pious vows, when he fell down at the final hour.

content: शत्रुघ्न श्चापि भरतं दृष्ट्वा शोकम् परिप्लुतः।।2.77.11।।विसंज्ञो न्यपतद्भूमौ भूमिपालमनुस्मरन्।
explanation: Beholding Bharata, Satrughna also plunged in grief remembering the king, and fell unconscious on the ground.

content: उन्मत्त इव निश्चेता विललाप सुदुःखितः।।2.77.12।।स्मृत्वा पितुर्गुणाङ्गानि तानि तानि तथा तथा।
explanation: Recollecting the many virtues of his father again and again, like a madman, Satrughna, mentally unsteady, lamented in profound sorrow.

content: मन्थराप्रभवस्तीव्रः कैकेयीग्राहसङ्कुलः।।2.77.13।।वरदानमयोऽक्षोभ्योऽमञ्जयच्छोकसागरः।
explanation: With Manthara as the source, Kaikeyi as a crocodile, this terrible sea of sorrow which has submerged all of us lies unruffled.

content: सुकुमारं च बालं च सततं लालितं त्वया।।2.77.14।।क्व तात भरतं हित्वा विलपन्तं गतो भवान्।
explanation: Where have you gone dear father, leaving the lamenting Bharata, so young and tender, who was always your darling?

content: ननु भोज्येषु पानेषु वस्त्रेष्वाभरणेषु च।।2.77.15।।प्रवारयसि नस्सर्वान् तन्नः कोऽन्यः करिष्यति।
explanation: You used to make all of us choose delicious food, drinks, garments and ornaments. Who else will do that now?

content: अवदारणकाले तु पृथिवी नावदीर्यते।।2.77.16।।या विहीना त्वया राज्ञा धर्मज्ञेन महात्मना।
explanation: You are a righteous and mighty king and without you, this earth would have been broken into pieces. But it does not.

content: पितरि स्वर्गमापन्ने रामे चारण्यमाश्रिते।।2.77.17।।किं मे जीवितसामर्थ्यं प्रवेक्ष्यामि हुताशनम्।
explanation: With my father ascended to heaven and Rama gone to the forest, where is the strength in me to live? I shall enter the blazing fire.

content: हीनो भ्रात्रा च पित्रा च शून्यामिक्ष्वाकुपालिताम्।।2.77.18।।अयोध्यां न प्रवेक्ष्यामि प्रवेक्ष्यामि तपोवनम्।
