content: किमिहाऽगमने कार्यं तव राज्यं प्रशासतः।एतदाचक्ष्व मे सर्वं न हि मे शुद्ध्यते मनः।।2.90.10।।
explanation: Why have you come here when you ought to be ruling the kingdom? Tell me everything about this. My mind is not clear in this matter.

content: सुषुवे यममित्रघ्नं कौसल्यानऽन्दवर्धनम्।भ्रात्रा सह सभार्यो यश्चिरं प्रव्राजितो वनम्।।2.90.11।।नियुक्तः स्त्रीनियुक्तेन पित्रा योऽसौ महायशाः।वनवासी भवेतीह समाः किल चतुर्दश।।2.90.12।।कच्छिन्न तस्यापापस्य पापं कर्तुमिहेच्छसि।अकण्टकं भोक्तुमना राज्यं तस्यानुजस्य च।।2.90.13।।
explanation: Rama, destroyer of enemies and enhancer of the delight of his mother Kausalya, has been banished to the forest for a long time along with his wife and brother. That illustrious one has been ordered by his father to live in the forest for fourteen years through the pursuasion of a woman. To enjoy the kingdom without obstacles do you intend to cause any harm to that irreproachable Rama and his brother?

content: एवमुक्तो भरद्वाजं भरतः प्रत्युवाच ह।पर्यश्रुनयनो दुःखाद्वाचा संसज्जमानया।।2.90.14।।
explanation: At these words, Bharata, eyes filled with tears of grief, replied to Bharadwaja in a   stumbling voice:

content: हतोऽस्मि यदि मामेवं भगवानपि मन्यते।मत्तो न दोषमाशङ्के नैवं मामनुशास्तु हि।2.90.15।।
explanation: When one so venerable like you too misunderstands me, I am gone. There is no danger for him from me. Do not rebuke me this way.

content: न चैतदिष्टं माता मे यदवोचन्मदन्तरे।नाहमेतेन तुष्टश्च न तद्वचनमाददे।।2.90.16।।
explanation: I do not approve of whatever my mother said in my absence. I am not happy with those words and I do not accept them.

content: अहं तु तं नरव्याघ्रमुपयातः प्रसादकः।प्रतिनेतुमयोध्यां च पादौ तस्याभिवन्दितुम्।।2.90.17।।
explanation: I have come to worship the feet of Rama, the best of men and persuade him to return to Ayodhya.

content: त्वं मामेवंगतं मत्वा प्रसादं कर्तुमर्हसि।शंस मे भगवन्रामः क्व सम्प्रति महीपतिः।।2.90.18।।
explanation: O venerable one in consideration of the circumstances I am in, be kind to me and tell me the whereabouts of Rama, lord of the earth.

content: वशिष्ठादिभिः ऋत्विग्भिर्याचितो भगवांस्ततः।उवाच तं भरद्वाजः प्रसादाद्भरतं वचः।2.90.19।।
explanation: Likewise besought by Vasistha and other priests, the venerable Bharadwaja was pleased to tell Bharata:

content: त्वय्येतत्पुरुषव्याघ्र युक्तं राघववंशजे।गुरुवृत्तिर्दमश्चैव साधूनामनुयायिता।।2.90.20।।
explanation: O best of men (Bharata) your conduct towards the preceptors, your selfrestraint and devotion to the virtuous are all in keeping with those born in the race of Raghu.

content: जाने चैतन्मनस्थं ते दृढीकरणमस्त्विति।अपृच्छं त्वां तथाऽत्यर्थं कीर्तिं समभिवर्धयन्।।2.90.21।।
explanation: I am aware of the feelings in your heart. Even then I enquired in order to confirm it  and to further your fame.

content: जाने च रामं धर्मज्ञं ससीतं सहलक्ष्मणम्।असौ वसति ते भ्राता चित्रकूटे महागिरौ।।2.90.22।।
explanation: I know your brother who is conversant with righteousness is living on Chitrakuta mountain with Sita and Lakshmana.

content: श्वस्तु गन्तासि तं देशं वसाद्य सह मन्त्रिभिः।एतन्मे कुरु सुप्राज्ञ कामं कामार्थकोविद।।2.90.23।।
explanation: O supremely sagacious prince gifted with the knowledge of kama (desire) and artha (wealth), tomorrow you go, but to night stay here with your ministers and fulfil my desire.

content: ततस्तथेत्येवमुदारदर्शनः प्रतीतरूपो भरतोऽब्रवीद्वचः।चकार बुद्धिं च तदा तदाश्रमे निशानिवासाय नराधिपाऽत्मजः।।2.90.24।।
explanation: A man of liberal disposition, Bharata expressed his intention, saying, 'Be it so'. Then the prince made up him mind to spend the might in that hermitage. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे नवतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the ninetieth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Bharadwaja extends elaborate hospitality to Bharata and his entourage -- Invokes Visvakarma to make necessary arrangements.]कृतबुद्धिं निवासाय तत्रैव स मुनिस्तदा।भरतं कैकयीपुत्रमातिथ्येनन्यमन्त्रयत्।।2.91.1।।
explanation: With the decision of Bharata, son of Kaikeyi, to stay there for the night, sage Bharadwaja extended to him all hospitality.

content: अब्रवीद्भरतस्त्वेनं नन्विदं भवता कृतम्।पाद्यमर्घ्यं तथाऽतिथ्यं वने यदुपपद्यते।।2.91.2।।
explanation: Bharata said to Bharadwaja, You have already extended the hospitality in offering water for washing the feet with and of arghya befitting a guest as available in the forest.

content: अथोवाच भरद्वाजो भरतं प्रहसन्निव।जाने त्वां प्रीतिसंयुक्तं तुष्येस्त्वं येन केनचित्।।2.91.3।।
explanation: Bharadwaja then said to Bharata with a gentle smile, I know you are full of love and content with whatever is offered you.

content: सेनायास्तु तवैतस्याः कर्तुमिच्छामि भोजनम्।मम प्रीतिर्यथारूपा तथार्हो मनुजर्षभ।।2.91.4।।
explanation: O Bharata, the best of men, I want to treat your army with food. This will please me and I hope you will act accordingly.

content: किमर्थं चापि निक्षिप्य दूरे बलमिहागतः।कस्मान्नेहोपयातोऽसि सबलः पुरुषर्षभः।।2.91.5।।
explanation: Why did you, O Bharata, the best of men, station your army at a distance before coming here? Could you not approach me along with your army?

content: भरतः प्रत्युवाचेदं प्राञ्जलिस्तं तपोधनम्।ससैन्यो नोपयातोऽस्मि भगवन्भगवद्भयात्।।2.91.6।।
explanation: With folded palms (in reverence), Bharata said to sage Bharadwaja whose penance was his wealth: I did not approach you with the army for fear of you, O venerable one.

content: राज्ञा च भगवन्नित्यं राजपुत्रेण वा सदा।यत्नतः परिहर्तव्या विषयेषु तपस्विनः।।2.91.7।।
explanation: O venerable one a king or a prince ought to intentionally avoid those places occupied by ascetics.

content: वाजिमुख्या मनुष्याश्च मत्ताश्च वरवारणाः।प्रच्छाद्य भगवन्भूमिं महतीमनुयान्ति माम्।।2.91.8।।
explanation: O venerable sage spirited horses, men and mighty rutting elephants follow me covering a wide expanse of land.

content: ते वृक्षानुदकं भूमिमाश्रमेषूटजां स्तथा।न हिंस्युरिति तेनाऽहमेक एव समागतः।।2.91.9।।
explanation: Lest the army should damage the huts, trees, land, and defile the water in the ashram, I came here alone.

content: आनीयतामितस्सेनेत्याज्ञप्तः परमर्षिणा।ततस्तु चक्रे भरतस्सेनायास्समुपागमम्।।2.91.10।।
explanation: Thus commanded the great ascetic, 'Let the army be brought here'. Accordingly, Bharata ordered the army to come.

content: अग्निशालां प्रविश्याथ पीत्वाऽपः परिमृज्य च।आतिथ्यस्य क्रियाहेतोर्विश्वकर्माणमाह्वयत्।।2.91.11।।
explanation: Then Bharadwaja entered the fire sanctuary, sipped water and washed his hands with water and invoked Visvakarma to provide hospitality.

content: आह्वये विश्वकर्माणमहं त्वष्टारमेव च।आतिथ्यं कर्तुमिच्छामि तत्र मे संविधीयताम्।।2.91.12।।
explanation: I intend to provide hospitality for which I am invoking Visvakarma and Tvastara who builds houses. Let adequate arrangements be made.

content: आह्वये लोकपालांस्त्रीन् देवान् शक्रमुखांस्तथा।आतिथ्यं कर्तुमिच्छामि तत्र मे संविधीयताम्।।2.91.13।।
explanation: I invoke the three deities, guardians of the four quarters headed by Indra to extend hospitality (to Bharata). Let them make adequate arrangements in this regard.

content: प्राक्स्रोतसश्च या नद्यः प्रत्यक्स्रोतस एव च।पृथिव्यामन्तरिक्षे च समायान्त्वद्य सर्वशः।।2.91.14।।
explanation: Let the rivers flowing towards the east, and the west, flowing on the earth and in the sky, flowing everywhere reach here and now.

content: अन्या स्रवन्तु मैरेयं सुरामन्यास्सुविष्ठिताम्।अपरा श्चोदकं शीतमिक्षुकाण्डरसोपमम्।।2.91.15।।
explanation: Let some rivers flow with liquor made of datepalms, some with wellprepared wine and some with cool water which tastes like sugarcane juice.

content: आह्वये देवगन्धर्वान्विश्वावसुहहाहुहून्।तथैवाप्सरसो देवीर्गन्धर्वीश्चापि सर्वशः।।2.91.16।।
explanation: I invoke the gandharvas, Visvavasu, Ha Ha and Hu Hu, and also goddesses like gandharvas (heavenly musicians) and apsaras (nymphs) from all regions.

content: घृताचीमथ विश्वाचीं मिश्रकेशीमलंबुसाम्।नागदन्तां च हेमां च हिमामद्रिकृतस्थलाम्।।2.91.17।।
explanation: I summon also Grutachi, Visvachi, Misrakesi, Alambusa, Nagadantha, Hema and Hima whose abode is on the mountain.

content: शक्रं याश्चोपतिष्ठन्ति ब्रह्माणं याश्च योषितः।सर्वास्तुम्बुरुणा सार्धमाह्वये सपरिच्छदाः।।2.91.18।।
explanation: I invoke all the women who attend on Indra and Bramha along with tumbur with all their (musical) instruments.

content: वनं कुरुषु यद्दिव्यं वासोभूषणपत्रवत्।दिव्यनारीफलं शश्वत्तत्कौबेरमिहैतु च।।2.91.19।।
explanation: Let Kubera's divine forest situated in the land of Kurus, where leaves serve as raiment and ornaments and celestial women as its fruits come here.

content: इह मे भगवान् सोमो विधत्तामन्नमुत्तमम्।भक्ष्यंभोज्यं च चोष्यं च लेह्यं च विविधं बहु।।2.91.20।।
explanation: Let the blessed Moon furnish me with excellent food of every kind -- solid, liquid, soft and those which are to be sucked and licked in great variety and quantity.

content: विचित्राणि च माल्यानि पादपप्रच्युतानि च।सुरादीनि च पेयानि मांसानि विविधानि च।।2.91.21।।
explanation: Let her furnish me with manycoloured garlands of fresh flowers from trees, wines and other drinks and meat of different kinds.

content: एवं समाधिना युक्तस्तेजसाऽप्रतिमेन च।शीक्षास्वरसमायुक्तं तपसा चाब्रवीन्मुनिः।।2.91.22।।
explanation: The valiant ascetic of incomparable lustre and power of penance in profound meditation said this in an accent in conformity with Vedic instruction.

content: मनसा ध्यायतस्तस्य प्राङ्मुखस्य कृताञ्जलेः।आजग्मुस्तानि सर्वाणि दैवतानि पृथक्पृथक्।।2.91.23।।
explanation: As Bharadwaja with folded palms was thus meditating with his face turned eastward, all the deities appeared there one by one.

content: मलयं दर्दुरं चैव ततस्स्वेदनुदोऽनिलः।उपस्पृश्य ववौ युक्त्या सुप्रियात्मा सुखश्शिवः।।2.91.24।।
explanation: Meanwhile, soft auspicious and pleasant breeze passing over Malaya and Dardura mountains, comforting and cooling the sweat, began to blow.

content: ततोऽभ्यवर्षन्त घना दिव्याः कुसुमवृष्टयः।दिव्यदुन्दुभिघोषश्च दिक्षु सर्वासु शुश्रुवे।।2.91.25।।
explanation: Then divine clouds rolled in and showered celestial flowers. The sounds of heavenly gongs could be heard in every direction.

content: प्रववुश्चोत्तमा वाता ननृतुश्चाप्सरोगणाः।जगुश्च देवगन्धर्वा वीणाः प्रमुमुचुस्स्वरान्।।2.91.26।।
explanation: Gentle breeze began to blow. Troops of apsaras danced. Gandharvas and gods sang and the lyres rang.

content: स शब्दो द्यां च भूमिं च प्राणिनां श्रवणानि च।विवेशोच्चरितश्श्लक्ष्णस्समो लयसमन्वितः।।2.91.27।।
explanation: That soft, melodious, rhythmic and wellmodulated sound entered the heaven and earth as well as the ears of all living beings.

content: तस्मिन्नुपरते शब्दे दिव्ये श्रोत्र सुखे नृणाम्।ददर्श भारतं सैन्यं विधानं विश्वकर्मणः।।2.91.28।।
explanation: When the celestial sounds pleasing to the ears of men had subsided, the army of Bharata beheld the wonderful creations of Visvakarma.

content: बभूव हि समा भूमिस्समन्तात्पञ्चयोजना।शाद्वलैर्भहुभिश्चन्ना नीलवैढूर्यसन्निभैः।।2.91.29।।
explanation: The ground was levelled on every side for five yojanas and covered with several grass lawns resembling lapis lazuli (blue sapphire) and cat's eye.

content: तस्मिन्बिल्वाः कपित्थाश्च पनसा बीजपूरकाः।आमलक्यो बभूवुश्च चूताश्च फलभूषणाः।।2.91.30।।
explanation: There the best of fruitbearing trees like bilva trees, woodapple trees, citrons, emblic myrobalan trees and mango trees laden with fruits sprang up.

content: उत्तरेभ्यः कुरुभ्यश्च वनं दिव्योपभोगवत्।आजगाम नदी दिव्या तीरजैर्भहुभिर्वृता।।2.91.31।।
explanation: From the forests of the northern Kuru kingdom, with all delights of heaven, a divine river with innumerable trees that grow on river banks came into existence.

content: चतुश्शालानि शुभ्राणि शालाश्च गजवाजिनाम्।हर्म्यप्रासादसम्बाधास्तोरणानि शुभानि च।।2.91.32।।
explanation: Bright quadrangles, stables for elephants and horses, auspicious arch ways for palaces and mansions sprang up.

content: सितमेघनिभं चापि राजवेश्म सुतोरणम्।दिव्यमाल्यकृताकारं दिव्यगन्धसमुक्षितम्।।2.91.33।।चतुरश्रमसंबाधं शयनासनयानवत्।दिव्यैस्सर्वरसैर्युक्तं दिव्यभोजनवस्त्रवत्।।2.91.34।।उपकल्पितसर्वान्नं धौतनिर्मलभाजनम्।क्लुप्तसर्वासनं श्रीमत्स्वास्तीर्णशयनोत्तमम्।।2.91.35।।
explanation: An auspicious royal palace with splendid archs resembling white clouds sprang up. It was sprinkled with celestial perfumes and adorned with beautiful garlands. That royal palace forming a quadrangle was furnished with couches, seats and carriages and furnished with celestial drinks of every kind, delicious food and splendid garments. It was stocked with food of every variety in clean and spotless vessels. Seats for every one and magnificent couches covered with excellent bedstead were arranged.

content: प्रविवेश महाबाहुरनुज्ञातो महर्षिणा।वेश्म तद्रत्नसम्पूर्णं भरतः कैकयीसुतः।।2.91.36।।
explanation: Longarmed Bharata, son of Kaikeyi entered that palace full of jewels with the permission of the great sage.

content: अनुजग्मुश्च तं सर्वे मन्त्रिणस्सपुरोहिताः।बभूवुश्च मुदा युक्ता दृष्ट्वा तं वेश्मसंविधिम्।।2.91.37।।
explanation: All the ministers, priests followed him and were glad to see the arrangement in that mansion.

content: तत्र राजासनं दिव्यं व्यजनं छत्रमेव च।भरतो मन्त्रिभिस्सार्धमभ्यवर्तत राजवत्।।2.91.38।।
explanation: There where stood an exquisite throne, a fan and a parasol Bharata stayed in the company of ministers.

content: आसनं पूजयामास रामायाभिप्रणम्य च।वालव्यजनमादाय न्यषीदत्सचिवासने।।2.91.39।।
explanation: He bowed in reverence and worshipped the throne (as though Rama were seated there). Taking hold of a fan made of yak's tail he sat in a minister's seat.

content: आनुपूर्व्यान्निषेदुश्च सर्वे मन्त्रिपुरोहिताः।ततस्सेनापतिः पश्चात्प्रशास्ताच निषेदतुः।।2.91.40।।
explanation: First the ministers and priests took their respective seats in accordance with their rank, and then the army chief and finally the supervisor of the camp.

content: तत स्तत्र मुहूर्तेन नद्यः पायसकर्दमाः।उपातिष्ठन्त भरतं भरद्वाजस्य शासनात्।।2.91.41।।
explanation: Rivers filled with payasam (rice cooked in milk and sugar) in the shape of mud flowed towards Bharata at the command of Bharadwaja.

content: तासामुभयतः कूलं पाण्डुमृत्तिकलेपनाः।रम्याश्चावसधा दिव्या ब्रह्मणस्तु प्रसादजा:।।2.91.42।।
explanation: On both the banks of those rivers, charming, celestial houses plastered with white clay appeared by the grace of Brahma.

content: तेनैव च मूहूर्तेन दिव्याऽभरणभूषिताः।आगुर्विंशतिसाहस्राः ब्रह्मणा प्रहिताः स्त्रियः।।2.91.43।।
explanation: At that very moment twenty thousand women adorned with beautiful ornaments sent by Brahma presented themselves.

content: सुवर्णमणिमुक्तेन प्रवालेन च शोभिताः।आगुर्विंशतिसाहास्राः कुबेरप्रहिताः स्त्रियः।।2.91.44।।
explanation: Twenty thousand women adorned with gold, gems and corals sent by Kubera came.

content: याभिर्गृहीतः पुरुषस्सोन्माद इव लक्ष्यते।आगुर्विंशतिसाहस्रा नन्दनादप्सरोगणाः।।2.91.45।।
explanation: Troops of twenty thousand apsaras by whom any man when taken hold of in their arms could be intoxicated with intense passion, came from Nandana gardens.

content: नारदस्तुम्भुरुर्गोपः प्रवरास्सूर्यवर्चसः।एते गन्धर्वराजानो भरतस्याग्रतो जगुः।।2.91.46।।
explanation: There along with Narada, Tumburu and Gopa, distinguished kings of the gandharvas, looking bright like the Sun, began to sing in the presence of Bharata.

content: अलम्बुसा मिश्रकेशी पुण्डरीकाऽथ वामना।उपानृत्यंस्तु भरतं भरद्वाजस्य शासनात्।।2.91.47।।
explanation: Thereafter, the apsaras, Alambusa, Misrakesi, Pundarika and Vamana danced near Bharata at the command of Bharadwaja.

content: यानि माल्यानि देवेषु यानि चैत्ररथे वने।प्रयागे तान्यदृश्यन्त भरद्वाजस्य शासनात्।।2.91.48।।
explanation: The garlands of the gods available in Chitraratha's (Kubera's) garden could not match those obtained under the orders of Bharadwaja.

content: बिल्वा मार्दङ्गिका आसन् शम्याग्राहा विभीतकाः।अश्वत्था नर्तकाश्चासन्भरद्वाजस्य शासनात्।।2.91.49।।
explanation: At the command of Bharadwaja, bilva trees acted as drummers, vibhitaka trees as cymbalists and the pipal trees as dancers.

content: ततस्सरलतालाश्च तिलका नक्तमालकाः।प्रहृष्टास्तत्र सम्पेतुः कुब्जा भूत्वाऽथ वामनाः।।2.91.50।।
explanation: Thereafter pine, palmyra, tilaka, and naktamala trees were transformed into hunchbacks and dwarfs and moved about in great delight.

content: शिंशुपामलकीजम्ब्वो याश्चान्याः काननेषु ताः मालती मल्लिका जातिर्याश्चान्याः कानने लताः।प्रमदाविग्रहं कृत्वा भरद्वाजाश्रमेऽवदन्।।2.91.51।।
explanation: Asohka, emblic myrobalan and all other trees found in the forest malati, mallika and jati creepers assumed the form of women, came over to the hermitage of Bharadwaja and said:

content: सुरास्सुरापाः पिबत पायसं च बुभुक्षिताः।।2.91.52।।मांसानि च सुमेध्यानि भक्ष्यन्तां यावदिच्छथ।।2.91.53।।
explanation: 'O wine drinkers, drink as much as you can those who are hungry partake payasam and sacred meat'.

content: उच्छाद्य स्नापयन्ति स्म नदीतीरेष वल्गुषु।अप्येकमेकं पुरषं प्रमदास्सप्त चाष्ट च।।2.91.54।।
explanation: Every single warrior was attended by seven or eight women who applied oil and massaged his body and bathed him on the lovely banks of the river.

content: संवाहन्त्यस्समापेतुर्नार्यो रुचिरलोचनाः।परिमृज्य तथाऽन्योन्यं पाययन्ति वराङ्गनाः।।2.91.55।।
explanation: Some women with beautiful eyes quickly approached them for massaging. The  best of ladies wiped their bodies dry and gave each other wine to drink.

content: हयान् गजान् खारानुष्ट्रान्तथैव सुरभेस्सुतान्।अभोजयन्वाहनपास्तेषां भोज्यं यथाविधि।।2.91.56।।
explanation: The attendants of draughtanimals fed the horses, elephants, donkeys, camels and oxen their appropriate food.

content: इक्षूंश्च मधुलाजांश्च भोजयन्ति स्म वाहनान्।इक्ष्वाकुवरयोधानां चोदयन्तो महाबला:।।2.91.57।।
explanation: The draughtaimals of the illustrious warriors of Ikshvaku kings were urged by the highly energetic attendants to eat more and more of parched grain mixed with sugarcane and honey.

content: नाश्वबन्धोऽश्वमाजानान्नगजं कुञ्जरग्रहः।मत्तप्रमत्तमुदिता चमूः सा तत्र संबभौ।।2.91.58।।
explanation: The horserider no longer recognised the horse or the mahout the elephant and the whole army was inebriated with drinking and pleasure.

content: तर्पितास्सर्वकामैस्ते रक्तचन्दनरूषिताः।अप्सरोगणसंयुक्तास्सैन्या वाचमुदैरयन्।।2.91.59।।
explanation: All the armymen with their desires gratified and anointing their bodies with red sandal paste surrounded by apsaras exclaimed.

content: नैवायोध्यां गमिष्यामो नगमिष्याम दण्डकान्।कुशलं भरतस्यास्तु रामस्यास्तु तथा सुखम्।।2.91.60।।
explanation: We will neither return to Ayodhya, nor enter Dandaka (forest). May Bharata and Rama be happy.

content: इति पादातयोधाश्च हस्त्यश्वारोहबन्धकाः।अनाथास्तं विधिं लब्ध्वा वाचमेतामुदीरयन्।।2.91.61।।
explanation: Having enjoyed the hospitality of Bharadwaja the foot soldiers, horse and elephant riders made utterances ignoring their leaders.

content: संम्प्रहृष्टा विनेदुस्ते नरास्तत्र सहस्रशः।भरतस्यानुयातारस्स्वर्गोऽयमिति चाब्रुवन्।।2.91.62।।
explanation: The exceedingly delighted soldiers of Bharata's retinue in their thousands cried out with excitement This is the very heaven.

content: नृत्यन्ति स्म हसन्ति स्म गायन्ति स्म च सैनिकाःसमन्तात्परिधावन्ति माल्योपेतास्सहस्रशः।।2.91.63।।
explanation: Those thousands of soldiers wearing flower garlands ran about dancing, singing, and laughing.

content: ततो भुक्तवतां तेषां तदन्नममृतोपमम्।दिव्यानुद्वीक्ष्य भक्ष्यां स्तानभवद्भक्षणे मतिः।।2.91.64।।
explanation: Glancing at the ambrosial food, a desire arose in the minds of those soldiers to eat once again although they had already partaken it.

content: प्रेष्याश्चेट्यश्च वध्वश्च बलस्थाश्च सहस्रशः।बभूवुस्ते भृशं दृप्तास्सर्वे चाहतवाससः।।2.91.65।।
explanation: Messengers, maidservants, female attendants, and soldiers -- all of them in their thousands dressed in fresh garments felt exceedingly proud of themselves.

content: कुञ्जराश्च खरोष्ट्राश्च गोऽश्वाश्च मृगपक्षिणः।बभूवुस्सुभृतास्तत्र नान्यो ह्यन्यमकल्पयत्।।2.91.66।।
explanation: There the elephants, donkeys and camels, cows and horses and also beasts and birds were wellnourished. No one troubled the other.

content: नाऽशुक्लवासा स्तत्राऽसीत्क्षुधितो मलिनोऽपि वा।रजसा ध्वस्तकेशो वा नरः कश्चिददृश्यत।।2.91.67।।
explanation: In that army there was none who could be seen without wearing garments of sparkling white, who was hungry or dirty or with decayed hair.

content: आजैश्चापि च वाराहैर्निष्ठानवरस़ञ्चयैः।फलनिर्यूह संसिद्दैस्सूपैर्गन्ध रसान्वितैः।।2.91.68।।पुष्पध्वजवतीः पूर्णाश्शुक्लस्यान्नस्य चाभितः।ददृशुर्विस्मितास्तत्रनरा लौहीस्सहस्रशः।।2.91.69।।
explanation: There the soldiers beheld in amazement thousands of iron containers decked with flags and flowers and filled with white rice, mutton, pork, choicest condiments, fruit juice, fragrant and tasty soup.

content: बभूवुर्वनपार्श्वेषु कूपाः पायसकर्दमाः।ताश्चकामदुघा गावो द्रुमाश्चासन्मधुश्च्युतः।।2.91.70।।
explanation: Along the edge of the forest, wells were filled with thick payasam. There were wishfulfilling cows and honeydripping trees.

content: वाप्यो मैरेयपूर्णाश्च मृष्टमांसचयैर्वृताः।प्रतप्तपिठरैश्चापि मार्गमायूरकौक्कुटैः।।2.91.71।।
explanation: The wells were found filled with datepalm liquor and surrounded by pots of well cooked meat of peacocks, chicken and other animals.

content: पात्रीणां च सहस्राणि स्थालीनां नियुतानि च।न्यर्बुधानि च पात्राणि शातकुम्भमयानि च।।2.91.72।।स्थाल्यः कुम्भ्य करम्भ्य श्च दधिपूर्णास्सुसंस्कृताः।यौवनस्थस्य गौरस्य कपित्थस्य सुगन्धिनः।।2.91.73।।ह्रदाः पूर्णा रसालस्य दध्नश्श्वेतस्य चापरे।बभूवुः पायसस्यान्ये शर्करायावसञ्चयाः।।2.91.74।।
explanation: There were thousands of pots, lakhs of plates, crores of vessels -- all made of gold and filled with wellgarnished food. Curd was kept in earthern pots like jugs and jars and pots with a wide mouth. Tanks were formed, some filled with white curd of good flavour and of the colour of woodapple, some with white curd blended with spices and some with payasam and heaps of barely powder mixed with sugar.

content: कल्कान्चूर्णकषायांश्च स्नानानि विविधानि च।ददृशुर्भाजनस्थानि तीर्थेषु सरतां नराः।।2.91.75।।
explanation: The soldiers saw on the river banks at landing places levigated powder, fragrant powder and extracts and other bathing requisites of different kinds stored in receptacles.

content: शुक्लानंशुमतश्चापि दन्तधावनसञ्चयान्।शुक्लांश्चन्दनकल्कांश्च समुद्गेष्ववतिष्ठतः।।2.91.76।।दर्पणापरिमृष्टांश्च वाससां चापि सञ्चयान्।पादुकोपानहां चैव युग्मानिच सहस्रशः।।2.91.77।।आञ्जनीः कङ्कतान्कूर्चान् शस्त्राणि च धनूंषि च।मर्मत्राणानि चित्राणि शयनान्यासनानि च।।2.91.78।।प्रतिपानह्रदान्पूर्णन्खरोष्ट्रगजवाजिनाम्।अवगाह्यसुतीर्थांश्चह्रदान् सोत्पलपुष्करान्।2.91.79।।आकाश वर्णप्रतिमान् स्वच्छतोयान्सुखप्लवान्।नीपवैडूर्यवर्णांश्च मृदून्यवससञ्चयान्।निर्वापार्थान् पशूनां ते ददृशुस्तत्र सर्वशः।।2.91.80।।
explanation: There the soldiers beheld on every side stacks of toothbrushing sticks, white and bristled, white lumps of sandal paste placed in dishes made of leaves, well cleaned mirrors, collection of clothes, several pairs of footwear, collyrium boxes, combs, brushes for cleaning moustaches, weapons, parasoles, bows and shining armour, different kinds of couches, and seats. There were pools of drinking water for donkeys, camels, elephants and horses and excellent landing places filled with flowering lotuses and water lilies. The lakes were of transparent waters resembling the hue of the sky easy and comfortable for swimming. There they saw heaps of soft grass as green as sapphire and kadamva trees for animals to refresh themselves under.

content: व्यस्मयन्त मनुष्यास्ते स्वप्नकल्पं तदद्भुतम्।दृष्ट्वाऽतिथ्यं कृतं तादृग्भरतस्य महर्षिणा।।2.91.81।।
explanation: The men were amazed when they beheld the wonderful hospitality extended by maharshi Bharadwaja to Bharata, as if all this happened in a dream world.

content: इत्येवं रममाणानां देवानामिव नन्दने।भरद्वाजाश्रमे रम्ये सा रात्रिर्व्यत्यवर्तत।।2.91.82।।
explanation: As they were enjoying themselves in Bharadwaja's hermitage like the gods in the garden of Indra the night wore off.

content: प्रतिजग्मुश्च ता नद्यो गन्धर्वाश्च यथागतम्।भरद्वाजमनुज्ञाप्य ताश्च सर्वा वराङ्गनाः।।2.91.83।।
explanation: Those rivers, the gandharvas and all those lovely women took leave of sage Bharadwaja and returned to where they had come from.

content: तथैव मत्ता मदिरोत्कटा नरास्तथैव दिव्यागरुचन्दनोक्षिताः।तथैव दिव्या विविधास्स्रगुत्तमाः पृथक्प्रकीर्णा मनुजैः प्रमर्दिताः।।2.91.84।।
explanation: Even after the departure of the gandharvas the soldiers who had consumed limitless liquor were still inebriated. The divine agaru and sandalwood smeared on their bodies still remained. Several splendid garlands crushed by them were strewn all over.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्य अयोध्याकाण्डे एकनवतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the ninetyfirst sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Bharata takes leave of Bharadwaja -- departs for mount Chitrakuta.]ततस्तां रजनीमुष्य भरतस्सपरिच्छदः। कृतातिथ्यो भरद्वाजं कामादभिजगाम ह।।2.92.1।।
explanation: Bharata with his retinue received the hospitality and spent the night at Bharadwaja's ashram. Then he approached Bharadwaja on his own.

content: तं ऋषिः पुरुषव्याघ्रं प्राञ्जलिं प्रेक्ष्य चाऽगतम्।हुताग्निहोत्रो भरतं भरद्वाजोऽभ्यभाषत।।2.92.2।।
explanation: Seeing Bharata, the best among men, who stood with folded palms, sage Bharadwaja, who had just completed his firesacrifice, said to him:

content: कच्चिदत्र सुखा रात्रिस्तवास्मद्विषये गता। समग्रस्ते जनः कच्चिदातिथ्ये शंस मेऽनघ।।2.92.3।।
explanation: O sinless one hope, you spent the night at our hermitage well? Tell me whether all your people enjoyed the hospitality?

content: तमुवाचाञ्जलिं कृत्वा भरतोऽभिप्रणम्य च। आश्रमादभिनिष्क्रान्तमृषिमुत्तमतेजसम्।।2.92.4।।
explanation: Bharata saluted with folded palms the sage of great powers. And emerging from the hermitage, replied:

content: ससुखोषितोऽस्मि भगवन्समग्रबलवाहनः।  तर्पितस्सर्वकामैश्च सामात्यो बलवत्त्वया।।2.92.5।।
explanation: O holy one, I with my ministers and the entire army of men and animals passed the night happily. All our desires have been gratified by you.

content: अपेतक्लमसन्तापा स्सुभिक्षास्सुप्रतिश्रयाः। अपि प्रेष्यानुपादाय सर्वे स्म सुसुखोषिताः।।2.92.6।।
explanation: All of us including the messengers were released from fatigue and heat. We were wellfed and wellhoused and the night was wellspent.

content: आमन्त्रयेऽहं भगवन् कामं त्वामृषिसत्तमः। समीपं प्रस्थितं भ्रातुर्मैत्रेणेक्षस्व चक्षुषा।।2.92.7।।
explanation: O venerable one O excellent of the ascetics I seek your leave. As I am proceeding to see my brother, bless me with a kindly look.

content: आश्रमं तस्य धर्मज्ञ धार्मिकस्य महात्मनः। आचक्ष्व कतमो मार्गः कियानिति च शंस मे।।2.92.8।।
explanation: O knower of righteousness Tell me which path leads to the hermitage of that righteous and magnanimous one (Rama)? And how far is it (from here)?

content: इति पृष्टस्तु भरतं भ्रातृदर्शनलालसम्। प्रत्युवाच महातेजा भरद्वाजो महातपाः।।2.92.9।।
explanation: Thus questioned, the great sage, brilliant Bharadwaja replied to Bharata who was yearning to see his brother:

content: भरतार्धतृतीयेषु योजनेष्वजने वने। चित्रकूटो गिरिस्तत्र रम्यनिर्झरकाननः।।2.92.10।।
explanation: O Bharata, three and a half yojanas from here in the lonely forest stands mount Chitrakuta, with its charming streams and woodlands

content: उत्तरं पार्श्वमासाद्य तस्य मन्दाकिनी नदी। पुष्पितद्रुमसञ्छन्ना रम्यपुष्पितकानना।।2.92.11।।
explanation: On its northern side flows the river Mandakini which is densely covered with flowering trees and lovely blossoming woods (on its banks).

content: अनन्तरं तत्सरितश्चित्रकूटश्च पर्वतः। तयोः पर्णकुटी तात तत्र तौ वसतो ध्रुवम्।।2.92.12।।
explanation: O dear child, beyond that river lies mount Chitrakuta on which there is a hut made of leaves where, for sure, they both dwell.

content: दक्षिणेनैव मार्गेण सव्यदक्षिणमेव वा। गजवाजिरथाकीर्णां वाहिनीं वाहिनीपते।।2.92.13।। वाहयस्व महाभाग ततो द्रक्ष्यसि राघवम्।
explanation: O distinguished lord of the army, if you lead your army full of elephants, horses and chariots through the southern path or towards the southwest, you will come across Rama there.

content: प्रयाणमिति तच्छ्रुत्वा रजराजस्य योषितः। हित्वा यानानि यानार्हाः ब्राह्मणं पर्यवारयन्।।2.92.14।।
explanation: When they heard about the journey, the wives of Dasaratha descended from their chariots worthy of them and stood around the brahmin, Bharadwaja.

content: वेपमाना कृशा दीना सह देव्या सुमित्रया।  कौसल्या तत्र जग्राह कराभ्यां चरणौ मुनेः।।2.92.15।।
explanation: Among them was Kausalya, trembling, emaciated and desolate, along with Sumitra.  They grasped the feet of sage Bharadwaja with their hands.

content: असमृद्धेन कामेन सर्वलोकस्य गर्हिता। कैकेयी तस्य जग्राह चरणौ सव्यपत्रपा।।2.92.16।।
explanation: Kaikeyi with her unfulfilled desire and despised in all the worlds overcome with shame, also grasped his feet.

content: तं प्रदक्षिणमागम्य भगवन्तं महामुनिम्।  अदूरार्भरतस्यैव तस्थौ दीनमनास्तदा।।2.92.17।।
explanation: She reverently circumambulated that great and divine ascetic and stood not far away from Bharata with a sad heart.

content: ततः पप्रच्छ भरतं भरद्वाजो दृढव्रतः। विशेषं ज्ञातुमिच्छामि मात्रूणां तव राघव।।2.92.18।।
explanation: Then Bharadwaja, firm in his vows, said to Bharata, I want to know about your mothers individually.

content: एवमुक्तस्तु भरतो भरद्वाजेन धीमता। उवाच प्राञ्जलिर्भूत्वा वाक्यं वचनकोविदः।।2.92.19।।
explanation: Thus asked by the sagacious Bharadwaja, Bharata, proficient in speech, replied with palms folded in reverence:

content: यामिमां भगवन् दीनां शोकानशनकर्शिताम्। पितुर्हि महिषीं देवीं देवतामिव पश्यसि।।2.92.20।। एषा तं पुरषव्याघ्रं सिंहविक्रान्तगामिनम्। कौसल्या सुषुवे रामं धातारमदितिर्यथा।।2.92.21।।
explanation: O venerable sage, this queen you are looking at, forlorn and emaciated due to grief and fasting, and who resembles a goddess is Kausalya, the principal queen of my father. As Aditi bore Dhata, she bore Rama, the best among men who walks with the powerful stride of a lion.

content: अस्या वामभुजं श्लिष्टा यैषा तिष्ठति दुर्मनाः। कर्णिकारस्य शाखेव शीर्णपुष्पा वनान्तरे।।2.92.22।। एतस्यास्तु सुतौ देव्याः कुमारौ देववर्णिनौ। उभौ लक्ष्मणशत्रुघ्नौ वीरौ सत्यपराक्रमौ।।2.92.23।।
explanation: This lady plunged in grief, resembling the branch of a karnikara tree in the midst of the forest with blossoms withered and leaning on the left arm of Kausalya, is queen Sumitra, mother of two heroes, comparable to gods in beauty and possessing true prowess -- Lakshmana and Satrughna.

content: यस्याः कृते नरव्याघ्रौ जीवनाशमितो गतौ। राजपुत्रविहीनश्च स्वर्गं दशरथो गतः।।2.92.24।। क्रोधनामकृतप्रज्ञां दृप्तां सुभगमानिनीम्। ऐश्वर्यकामां कैकेयीमनार्यामार्यारूपिणीम्।।2.92.25।। ममैतां मातरं विद्धि नृशंसां पापनिश्चयाम्। यतोमूलं हि पश्यामि व्यसनं महदात्मनः।।2.92.26।।
explanation: She is my mother Kaikeyi who is irascible, lacks the power of discrimination, proud, boastful of her beauty, ambitious of wealth, ignoble in the guise of a noble woman, wicked and intent on sinful acts. Behold her. You may know that because of her,  Rama and Lakshmana the best of men entered the forest which may cause their destruction and king Dasaratha attained heaven. She alone is the root of this great calamity that I am presently confronting.

content: इत्युक्त्वा नरशार्दूलो बाष्पगद्गदया गिरा। स निश्स्वास ताम्राक्षो नागः कृद्ध इव श्वसन्।।2.92.27।।
explanation: Thus spoke Bharata, the best of men, with his eyes reddened and voice choked with sobs and  hissing like a king cobra.

content: भरद्वाजो महर्षिस्तं ब्रुवन्तं भरतं तथा। प्रत्युवाच महाबुद्धिरिदं वचनमर्थवत्।।2.92.28।।
explanation: Hearing the words of Bharata, the great sage, wise Bharadwaja replied with meaningful words:

content: न दोषेणावगन्तव्या कैकेयी भरत त्वया। रामप्रव्राजनं ह्येतत्सुखोदर्कं भविष्यति।।2.92.29।।
explanation: O Bharata, you should not find fault with Kaikeyi. Rama's banishment will prove a great source of happiness in future (for mankind).

content: देवानां दानवानां च ऋषीणां भावितात्मनाम्। हितमेव भविष्यद्धि रामप्रव्राजनादिह।।2.92.30।।
explanation: Banishment of Rama will bring about the welfare of the gods, the demons, and the sages of purified souls.

content: अभिवाद्य तु संसिद्धः कृत्वा चैनं प्रदक्षिणम्। आमन्त्र्य भरत स्सैन्यं युज्यतामित्यचोदयत्।।2.92.31।।
explanation: Having paid obeisance, the accomplished Bharata circumambulated sage Bharadwaja, look leave of him, and ordered his army to get ready.

content: ततो वाजिरथान्युक्तान् दिव्यान्हेमपरिष्कृतान्। अध्यारोहत्प्रयाणार्थी बहून्बहुविधो जनः।।2.92.32।।
explanation: Different groups of people intending to depart harnessed excellent horsechariots decorated with gold.

content: गजकन्या गजाश्चैव हेमकक्ष्याः पताकिनः। जीमूता इव घर्मान्ते सघोषास्सम्प्रतस्थिरे।।2.92.33।।
explanation: The male and female elephants wearing golden girths and decorated with pennants,  set forth with their bells sounding like thunderclouds at the end of summer.

content: विविधान्यपि यानानि महन्ति च लघूनि च। प्रययु स्सुमहार्हाणि पादै रेव पदातयः।।2.92.34।।
explanation: Various types of costly carriages, large and small, set forth, while the infantry marched on.

content: अथ यानप्रवेकैस्तु कौसल्याप्रमुखाः स्त्रियः। रामदर्शनकाङ्क्षिण्यः प्रययुर्मुदितास्तदा।।2.92.35।।
explanation: The women headed by Kausalya, eager to see Rama, proceeded delightfully in distinguished carriages.

content: चन्द्रार्कतरुणाभासां निर्युक्तां शिबिकां शुभाम्। आस्थाय प्रययौ श्रीमान्भरत स्सपरिच्छदः।।2.92.36।।
explanation: Magnanimous Bharata got into an auspicious palanquin of the splendour of the Sun and the Moon kept ready and proceeded amidst escorts.

content: सा प्रयाता महासेना गजवाजिरथाकुला। दक्षिणां दिशमावृत्य महामेघ इवोत्थितः।।2.92.37।। वनानि तु व्यतिक्रम्य जुष्टानि मृगपक्षिभिः। गङ्गायाः परवेलायां गिरिष्वपि नदीषु च।।2.92.38।।
explanation: That vast army teeming with elephants, horses and chariots proceeded southward spreading like a lofty cloud that had risen in the sky, traversing through the forests full of birds and beasts, passing through the mountains and streams on the other side of the river Ganga.

content: सा सम्प्रहृष्टद्विपवाजियोधा वित्रासयन्ती मृगपक्षिसङ्घान्। महद्वनं तत्प्रतिगाहमाना रराज सेना भरतस्य तत्र।।2.92.39।।
explanation: Bharata's army of soldiers, elephants and horses, all in high spirits, looked splendid while entering the forest full of frightening flocks of birds and beasts.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे द्विनवतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the ninetysecond sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Bharata's Journey to Chitrakuta -- Bharata observes signs of smoke and presumes it to be the hermitage of Rama -- Bharata, Vasistha and Satrughna move forward towards the hermitage.]तया महत्या यायिन्या ध्वजिन्या वनवासिनः। अर्दिता यूथपा मत्ताः सयूथास्सम्प्रदुद्रुवुः।।2.93.1।।
explanation: On seeing the great army marching, the exited leaders of herds of elephants inhabiting the forest were frightened and ran off with their herds.

content: ऋक्षाः पृषतसङ्घाश्च रुरवश्च समन्ततः। दृश्यन्ते वनराजीषु गिरिष्वपि नदीषु च।।2.93.2।।
explanation: Bears, herds of dappled gazelle and antelopes could be seen everywhere in the stretches of the forest, also on the mountains and on the river banks.

content: स सम्प्रतस्थे धर्मात्मा प्रीतो दशरथात्मजः। वृतो महत्या नादिन्या सेनया चतुरङ्गया।।2.93.3।।
explanation: Bharata the righteous son of Dasaratha, proceeded with great delight in the company of the clamouring army of four divisions.

content: सागरौघनिभा सेना भरतस्य महात्मनः। महीं सञ्छादयामास प्रावृषि द्यामिवाम्बुदः।।2.93.4।।
explanation: The army of the magnanimous Bharata, resembling the waves of the ocean, covered the earth as the clouds cover the sky during the rainy season.

content: तुरङ्गौघैरवतता वारणैश्च महाजवैः।अनालक्ष्या चिरं कालं तस्मिन्काले बभूव भूः।।2.93.5।।
explanation: At that moment, a multiutde of swift horses and elephants spread out with great speed and the surface of the earth became invisible for a long time.

content: स यात्वा दूरमध्वानं सुपरिश्रान्तवाहनः। उवाच भरत श्श्रीमान् वसिष्ठं मन्त्रिणां वरम्।।2.93.6।।
explanation: With his draught animals extremely wearied by covering a great distance, the majestic Bharata said to Vasistha, the best of counsellors:

content: यादृशं लक्ष्यते रूपं यथा चैव श्रुतं मया।व्यक्तं प्राप्ताः स्म तं देशं भरद्वाजो यमब्रवीत्।।2.93.7।।
explanation: Looking at these surroundings and from what I had heard, it is clear that we have reached the region indicated by Bharadwaja.

content: अयं गिरिश्चित्रकूट इयं मन्दाकिनी नदी। एतत्प्रकाशते दूरान्नीलमेघनिभं वनम्।।2.93.8।।
explanation: This mountain is Chitrakuta and this river, Mandakini. The forest shines from a distance like a blue cloud.

content: गिरे स्सानूनि रम्याणि चित्रकूटस्य सम्प्रति। वारणैरवमृद्यन्ते मामकै पर्वतोपमैः।।2.93.9।।
explanation: The enchanting ridges of mount Chitrakuta are now trampled by my mountainlike elephants.

content: मुञ्चन्ति कुसुमान्येते नगाः पर्वतसानुषु।नीला इवातपापाये तोयं तोयधरा घनाः।।2.93.10।।
explanation: The trees on the mountain ridges are shedding flowers, like dense blue rainclouds showering water at the end of summer.

content: किन्नराचरितं देशं पश्य शत्रुघ्न पर्वतम्। मृगैस्समन्तादाकीर्णं मकरैरिव सागरम्।।2.93.11।।
explanation: O Satrughna, behold this mountain frequented by kinneras and abounding in animals like great crocodiles in the ocean.

content: एते मृगगणा भान्ति शीघ्रवेगाः प्रचोदिताः। वायुप्रविद्धा श्शरदि मेघराजिरिवाम्बरे।।2.93.12।।
explanation: Incited by the clamour of the army, these swiftrunning herds of deer expelled from their retreats resemble mass of clouds in the autumnal sky shattered by the wind.

content: कुर्वन्ति कुसुमापीडान् शिरस्सु सुरभीनमी। मेघप्रकाशैः फलकैर्दाक्षिणात्या यथा नराः।।2.93.13।।
explanation: Like the people of the south, the trees on the mountain ridges with branches, brilliant like clouds, are crowned with fragrant flowers as adornments.

content: निष्कूजमिव भूत्वेदं वनं घोरप्रदर्शनम्। अयोध्येव जनाकीर्णा सम्प्रति प्रतिभाति मा।।2.93.14।।
explanation: This forest, dreadful in appearance was devoid of twittering of birds. But now it appears to me like Ayodhya thronged with people.

content: खुरैरुदीरितो रेणुर्दावं प्रच्छाद्य तिष्ठति। तं वहत्यनिल श्श्रीघ्रं कुर्वन्निव मम प्रियम्।।2.93.15।।
explanation: While the dust kicked by the hooves of the horses enveloped the forest, the wind, as if to please me, is quickly blowing them away.

content: स्यन्दनांस्तुरगोपेतान्सूतमुख्यै रधिष्ठितान्। एतान्सम्पततश्श्रीघ्रं पश्य शत्रुघ्न कानने।।2.93.16।।
explanation: Behold, O Satrughna, these chariots, commanded by excellent charioteers,  harnessed with horses are flying through the forest.

content: एतान्वित्रासितान्पश्यबर्हिणः प्रियदर्शनान्। एतमाविशत श्श्रीघ्रमधिवासं पतत्रिणः।।2.93.17।।
explanation: Behold, these lovely frightened peacocks and other birds hurriedly entering their nests.

content: अतिमात्रमयं देशो मनोज्ञः प्रतिभाति मे। तापसानां निवासोऽयं व्यक्तं स्वर्गपथो यथा।।2.93.18।।
explanation: Being the abode of ascetics, this region looks very charming like the pathway to heaven.

content: मृगा मृगीभिः सहिता बहवः पृषता वने।  मनोज्ञरूपा दृश्यन्ते कुसुमैरिव चित्रिताः।।2.93.19।।
explanation: In this forest many a dappled deer with their mates looking as if painted with flowers are seen wandering about with a charming appearance.

content: साधु सैन्याः प्रतिष्ठन्तां विचिन्वन्तु च कानने। यथा तौ पुरुषव्याघ्रौ दृश्येते रामलक्ष्मणौ।।2.93.20।।
explanation: Let the soldiers set out and properly search the forest till such time the best of men, Rama and Lakshmana, are found.

content: भरतस्य वचश्श्रुत्वा पुरुषाश्शस्त्रपाणयः। विविशु स्तद्वनं शूरा धूमं च ददृशु स्ततः।।2.93.21।।
explanation: Hearing the words of Bharata, those valiant warriors with weapons in their hands entered the forest. Therafter, they observed a spiral of smoke rising.

content: ते समालोक्य धूमाग्रमूचुर्भरतमागताः। नामनुष्ये भवत्यग्नि र्व्यक्तमत्रैव राघवौ।।2.93.22।।
explanation: Having seen the column of smoke, they returned and informed Bharata, saying, 'In a place bereft of men, fire cannot exist. Clearly Rama and Lakshmana must be here only.'

content: अथ नाऽत्र नरव्याघ्रौ राजपुत्रौ परन्तपौ। अन्ये रामोपमा स्सन्ति व्यक्तमत्र तपस्विनः।।2.93.23।।
explanation: In case the two princes, Rama and Lakshmana, the best of men, and subduers of enemies are not residing here then evidently it must be some other ascetics like Rama.

content: तच्छ्रुत्वा भरतस्तेषां वचनं साधुसम्मतम्। सैन्यानुवाच सर्वांस्तानमित्रबलमर्दनः।।2.93.24।।
explanation: Having heard these words acceptable to the pious, Bharata, the crusher of enemy forces, addressed the entire army:

content: यत्ता भवन्तस्तिष्ठन्तु नेतो गन्तव्यमग्रतः। अहमेव गमिष्यामि सुमन्त्रो गुरुरेव च।।2.93.25।।
explanation: All of you carefully watch here. Do not proceed any further. Sumantra, the preceptor and myself shall go forward.

content: एवमुक्ता स्ततस्सर्वे तत्र तस्थुः समन्तः। भरतो यत्र धूमाग्रं तत्र दृष्टिं समादधात्।।2.93.26।।
explanation: At this command, all of them halted. Then Bharata fixed his gaze on the source of the smoke.

content: व्यवस्थिता या भरतेन सा चमूर्निरीक्षमाणाऽपि च भूमिमग्रतः। बभूव हृष्टा न चिरेण जानती प्रियस्य रामस्य समागमं तदा।।2.93.27।।
explanation: The army thus halted by Bharata, gazing at the space before them rejoiced at the thought that not long before they would rejoin their beloved Rama.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे त्रिनवतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the ninetythird sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama shares with Sita his delight of the beautiful nature around Chitrakuta mountain.]दीर्घकालोषित स्तस्मिन्गिरौ गिरिवनप्रियः।वैदेह्याः प्रियमाकाङ्क्षन्स्वं च चित्तं विलोभयन्।।2.94.1।।अथ दाशरथिश्चित्रं चित्रकूटमदर्शयत्।भार्याममरसङ्काश श्शचीमिव पुरन्दरः।।2.94.2।।
explanation: Rama, resembling the gods, who had been living there for long developed a liking for the mountains and forests. With a desire to please Sita and his own mind, he showed her the wonderful Chitrakuta mountain as Indra did to his wife Sachi.

content: दीर्घकालोषित स्तस्मिन्गिरौ गिरिवनप्रियः।वैदेह्याः प्रियमाकाङ्क्षन्स्वं च चित्तं विलोभयन्।।2.94.1।।अथ दाशरथिश्चित्रं चित्रकूटमदर्शयत्।भार्याममरसङ्काश श्शचीमिव पुरन्दरः।।2.94.2।।
explanation: Rama, resembling the gods, who had been living there for long developed a liking for the mountains and forests. With a desire to please Sita and his own mind, he showed her the wonderful Chitrakuta mountain as Indra did to his wife Sachi.

content: न राज्याद्भ्रंशनं भद्रे न सुहृद्भिर्विनाभवः।मनो मे बाधते दृष्ट्वा रमणीयमिमं गिरिम्।।2.94.3।।
explanation: O gentle one, when I behold this lovely mountain, neither the expulsion from the kingdom nor being away from friends pains my mind.

content: पश्येममचलं भद्रे नानाद्विजगणायुतम्।शिखरैः खमिवोद्विद्धैर्धातुमद्भिर्विभूषितम्।।2.94.4।।
explanation: O auspicious one, you may behold this mountin abounding in flocks of birds of every kind and its peaks adorned wtih minerals and as if piercing the sky.

content: केचिद्रजतसङ्काशाः केचित्क्षतजसंनिभाः।पीतमाञ्जिष्टवर्णाश्च केचिन्मणिवरप्रभाः।।2.94.5।।पुष्यार्ककेतकाभाश्च केचिज्ज्योतीरसप्रभाः।विराजन्तेऽचलेन्द्रस्य देशा धातुविभूषिताः।।2.94.6।।
explanation: This mountain with its peaks is adorned with various minerals. Some of the regions have the radiance of silver and bronze, some look bloodred or maddercrimson, some sparkle like the rarest of gems while others shine like topaz or crystal or a flower of ketaka plant or shimmer like stars and quicksilver.

content: नानामृगगणद्वीपितरर्क्ष्वृक्षगणैर्वुतः।अदुष्टैर्भात्ययं शैलो बहुपक्षिसमायुतः।।2.94.7।।
explanation: This mount Chitrakuta is swarmed by flocks of birds and herds of several kinds of animals like tigers, panthers and bears of every kind giving up their cruel nature.

content: आम्रजम्ब्वसनैर्लोध्रैः प्रियालैः पनसैर्धवैः।अङ्कोलैर्भव्यतिनिशैर्बिल्वतिन्दुक वेणुभिः।।2.94.8।।काश्मर्यरिष्टवरुणैर्मधूकैस्तिलकैस्तथा।बदर्यामलकैर्नीपैर्वेत्रधन्वनबीजकैः।।2.94.9।।पुष्पवद्भिः फलोपेतैश्छायावद्भिर्मनोरमैः।एवमादिभिराकीर्णः श्रियं पुष्यत्ययं गिरिः।।2.94.10।।
explanation: This mountain is spread over with various kinds of flowering trees and trees laden with fruits, shady and enchanting, mango, roseapples, asanas, lodhras, priyalas, jackfruit trees, dhavas, ankolas, lovely tinisas, bilva trees, tinduka and bamboo, kashmaya, arishta and varuna, madhukas, tilaka trees, badari and myrobalan trees, nipa trees, cane, danvas, and promegranate trees, the mountain looks splendid.

content: शैलप्रस्थेषु रम्येषु पश्येमान् रोमहर्षणान्।किन्नरान् द्वन्द्वशो भद्रे रममाणान्मनस्विनः।।2.94.11।।
explanation: O auspiciouslooking one, behold these highspirited kinneras in pairs who are sporting on the picturesque hill plateaus causing thrills.

content: शाखावसक्तान् खड्गांश्च प्रवराण्यम्बराणि च।पश्य विद्याधरस्त्रीणां क्रीडोद्धेशान्मनोरमान्।।2.94.12।।
explanation: Behold the captivating sporting retreats of Vidyadharis, with their swords and best garments hung on the branches of the trees.

content: जलप्रपातैरुद्भेदैर्निष्यन्दैश्च क्वचित्क्वचित्।स्रवद्भिर्भात्ययं शैल स्स्रवन्मद इव द्विपः।।2.94.13।।
explanation: Behold a waterfall here and a fountain there gushing from the earth and in other places, the mountain looks like an elephant rutting ichor.

content: गुहासमीरणो गन्धान्नानापुष्पभवान्वहन्।घ्राणतर्पणमभ्येत्य कं नरं न प्रहर्षयेत्।।2.94.14।।
explanation: The breeze from the caves carrying the fragrance of many flowers is satisfying the sense of smell. Who will not find it delightful?

content: यदीह शरदोऽनेकास्त्वया सार्धमनिन्दिते।लक्ष्मणेन च वत्स्यामि न मां शोकः प्रधक्ष्यति।।2.94.15।।
explanation: O flawless one, if I am to live here for many years to come with you and Lakshmana, no grief will consume me.

content: बहुपुष्पफले रम्ये नानाद्विजगणायुते।विचित्रशिखरे ह्यस्मिन्रतवानस्मि भामिनि।।2.94.16।।
explanation: O lovely Sita, I am enamoured of this delightful mountain with its enchanting peaks laden with abundance of flowers and fruits and flocked by different kinds of birds.

content: अनेन वनवासेन मया प्राप्तं फलद्वयम्।पितुश्चानृणता धर्मे भरतस्य प्रियं तथा।।2.94.17।।
explanation: By living in the forest I have achieved a twofold benefitdischarge of debt of my father with regard to righteousness and causing happiness to Bharata.

content: वैदेहि रमसे कच्चिच्चित्रकूटे मया सह।पश्यन्ती विविधान्भावान्मनोवाक्कायसम्मतान्।।2.94.18।।
explanation: O Sita, are you enjoying by being with me here on this Chitrakuta and observing various objects gratifying to the body, mind and speech?

content: इदमेवामृतं प्राहू राज्ञि राजर्षयः परे।वनवासं भवार्थाय प्रेत्य मे प्रपितामहाः।।2.94.19।।
explanation: My greatgrandfathers and ancient royal sages used to say that living in the forest is like enjoying nectar for a king for the best existence after death.

content: शिला श्शैलस्य शोभन्ते विशाला श्शतशोऽभितः।बहुला बहुलैर्वर्णैर्नीलपीतसितारुणैः।।2.94.20।।
explanation: Several hundreds of massive rocks of the mountain look splendid all around, in  blueblack, yellow, white and red colours.

content: निशिभान्त्यचलेन्द्रस्य हुताशनशिखा इव।ओषध्यः स्वप्रभालक्ष्म्या भ्राजमाना स्सहस्रशः।।2.94.21।।
explanation: Herbs in thousands on this king of the hills shine in the night with the splendour of  their own lustre, like flames of fire.

content: केचित् क्षयनिभा देशाः केचिदुद्यानसन्निभाः।केचिदेकशिला भान्ति पर्वतस्यास्य भामिनि।।2.94.22।।
explanation: O lovely Sita Some regions of the mountain look like dwellingplaces, some others are like flowergardens and some are shining like a single rock.

content: भित्त्वेव वसुधां भाति चित्रकूटस्समुत्थितः।चित्रकूटस्य कूटोऽसौ दृश्यते सर्वत श्शुभः।।2.94.23।।
explanation: This Chitrakuta mountain stands erect as if it has arisen by splitting open the earth and its peak looks graceful from every side.

content: कुष्ठस्थगरपुन्नाग भूर्जपत्रोत्तरच्छदान्।कामिनां स्वास्तरान्पश्य कुशेशयदलायुतान्।।2.94.24।।
explanation: Behold those excellent couches of lovers spread with leaves of kustha, sthagara, punnaga and bhurja and covered with lotus petals.

content: मृदिताश्चापविद्धाश्च दृश्यन्ते कमलस्रजः।कामिभिर्वनिते पश्य फलानि विविधानि च।।2.94.25।।
explanation: O Lady, behold those lotus garlands crushed and cast aside by lovers and also many fruits (tasted by them and) lying there.

content: वस्वौकसारां नलिनीमत्येतीवोत्तरान्कुरून्।पर्वतश्चित्रकूटोऽसौ बहुमूलफलोदकः।।2.94.26।।
explanation: This Chitrakuta mountain, with abundance of roots, fruits and water surpasses in beauty Vasvaukasara, the capital city of Kubera or Nalini, his celestial garden or the land of Uttarakuru.

content: इमं तु कालं वनिते विजह्रिवांस्त्वया च सीते सह लक्ष्मणेन च।रतिं प्रपत्स्ये कुलधर्मवर्धनीं सतां पथि स्वैर्नियमैः परैः स्थितः।।2.94.27।।
explanation: O my beloved Sita, by spending time with you and Lakshmana following the path of the virtuous with utmost restraint and by enhancing the righteousness of my race, I shall obtain great felicity.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे चतुर्नवतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the ninetyfourth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama describes to Sita the beauty of mountains, rivers, birds and animals at Chitrakuta.]अथ शैलाद्विनिष्क्रम्य मैथिलीं कोसलेश्वरः।अदर्शयच्छुभजलां रम्यां मन्दाकिनीं नदीम्।।2.95.1।।
explanation: Then Rama, the lord of Kosala, descended from the mountain and showed Sita the charming river Mandakini of sacred waters.

content:
अब्रवीच्च वरारोहां चारुचन्द्रनिभाननाम्।

विदेहराजस्य सुतां रामो राजीवलोचनः।।2.95.2।।
explanation: Lotus-eyed Rama said to the heavy-hipped daughter of the king of Videha, whose face resembled the beautiful Moon.

content: विचित्रपुलिनां रम्यां हंससारससेविताम्।कमलैरुपसम्पन्नां पश्य मन्दाकिनीं नदीम्।।2.95.3।।
explanation: Look at this enchanting river Mandakini with its variegated sandbanks frequented by geese and swans and adorned with lotuses.

content: नानाविधैस्तीररुहै र्वृतां पुष्पफलद्रुमैः।राजन्तीं राजराजस्य नलिनीमिव सर्वतः।।2.95.4।।
explanation: See this river sparkling with trees of every kind laden with fruits and flowers growing on its banks. Everywhere it resembles the lake Nalini of Kubera.

content: मृगयूथनिपीतानि कलुषाम्भांसि साम्प्रतम्।तीर्थानि रमणीयानि रतिं सञ्जनयन्ति मे।।2.95.5।।
explanation: The herds of deer have just drunk water by descending down the landing places and the waters are still turbid. This sight produces great pleasure in me.

content: जटाजिनधराः काले वल्कलोत्तरवाससः।ऋषय स्त्ववगाहन्ते नदीं मन्दाकिनीं प्रिये।।2.95.6।।
explanation: O my beloved rishis with matted locks and wearing deer skins and bark of trees as upper cloth bathe in the river Mandakini for performing morning ablutions in time.

content: आदित्यमुपतिष्ठन्ते नियमादूर्ध्वबाहवः।एते परे विशालाक्षि मुनय स्संशितव्रताः।।2.95.7।।
explanation: O largeeyed Sita, some other ascetics of rigid austerities worship the sungod according to tradition, lifting up their arms and invoking the Sun.

content: मारुतोद्धूतशिखरैः प्रनृत्त इव पर्वतः।पादपैः पत्रपुष्पाणि सृजद्भिरभितो नदीम्।।2.95.8।।
explanation: With the trees whose tops are swayed by the wind, the mountain was as if dancing, shedding leaves and flowers all around the river.

content: चिन्मणिनिकाशोदां क्वचित्पुलिनशालिनीम्।क्वचित्सिद्धजनाकीर्णां पश्य मन्दाकिनीं नदीम्।।2.95.9।।
explanation: Behold this river Mandakini whose waters here are transparent like crystals, there sparkling with sand dunes and elsewhere crowded with siddhas.

content: निर्धूतान्वायुना पश्य विततान्पुष्पसञ्चयान्।पोप्लूयमानानपरान्पश्य त्वं जलमध्यगान्।।2.95.10।।
explanation: Look at the scattered heaps of flowers shaken off by the wind and large quantities of flowers floating on the waters.

content: तांश्चातिवल्गुवचसो रथाङ्गाह्वयना द्विजाः।अधिरोहन्ति कल्याणि निष्कूजन्त श्शुभा गिरः।।2.95.11।।
explanation: O my auspicious Sita, sweetvoiced Chakravaka birds singing in most pleasant tones are alighting on those heaps of flowers.

content: दर्शनं चित्रकूटस्य मन्दाकिन्याश्च शोभने।अधिकं पुरवासाच्च मन्ये तव च दर्शनात्।।2.95.12।।
explanation: My lovely Sita, I consider watching this mount Chitrakuta and river Mandakini in your presence more delightful than living in Ayodhya.

content: विधूतकलुषै स्सिद्धैस्तपोदमशमान्वितैः।नित्यविक्षोभितजलां विगाहस्व मया सह।।2.95.13।।
explanation: The waters of river Mandakini is perpetually agitated by siddhas who are endowed with asceticism, selfrestraint and tranquillity and who are cleansed of sins by taking bath in the river. Plunge with me into this river.

content: सखीवच्च विगाहस्व सीते मन्दाकिनीं नदीम्।कमलान्यवमज्जन्ती पुष्कराणि च भामिनि।।2.95.14।।
explanation: O lovely Sita, like a companion plunge into this river Mandakini, submerging the red and white lotuses, and enjoy sporting.

content: त्वं पौरजनवद्व्यालानयोध्यामिव पर्वतम्।मन्यस्व वनिते नित्यं सरयूवदिमां नदीम्।।2.95.15।।
explanation: O my lovely lady Always think this river Mandakini as Sarayu and this mount Chitrakuta as Ayodhya and these wild animals as its inhabitants.

content: लक्ष्मणश्चापि धर्मात्मा मन्निदेशे व्यवस्थितः।त्वं चानुकूला वैदेहि प्रीतिं जनयथो मम।।2.95.16।।
explanation: With righteous Lakshmana obedient and you, O Sita, agreeable to me, you both bring me great pleasure.

content: उपस्पृशंस्त्रिषवणं मधुमूलफलाशनः।नायोध्यायैन राज्याय स्पृहयेऽद्य त्वया सह।।2.95.17।।
explanation: Bathing thrice in your company at the time of prayers and partaking honey, roots and fruits, I do not yearn either for Ayodhya or for the kingdom.

content: इमांहि रम्यां मृगयूथशालिनीं निपीततोयां गजसिंहवानरैः।सुपुष्पितां पुष्पभरैरलङ्कृतां नसोऽस्ति य स्स्यान्न गतक्लम स्सुखी।।2.95.18।।
explanation: With this enchanting Mandakini teeming with herds of deer, whose waters are drunk by elephants, lions and monkeys, decorated with heaps of flowers fallen from the trees in full bloom, who will not feel happy and free from fatigue.

content: इतीव रामो बहुसङ्गतं वचः प्रियासहाय स्सरितं प्रति ब्रुवन्।चचार रम्यं नयनाञ्जनप्रभं स चित्रकूटं रघुवंशवर्धनः।।2.95.19।।
explanation: Rama, the perpetuator of the Raghu dynasty, describing the river Mandakini at length appropriately in this manner, wandered in the company of his beloved consort on mount Chitrakuta looking black like collyrium.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे पञ्चनवतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the ninetyfifth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama hears the sounds of the army approaching the hermitage -- alerts Lakshmana to make sure -- recognition of the army as that of Bharata's -- Lakshmana mistakes Bharata's intentions.]तां तथा दर्शयित्वा तु मैथिलीं गिरिनिम्नगाम्।निषसाद गिरिप्रस्थे सीतां मांसेन छन्दयन्।।2.96.1।।
explanation: Rama showed Sita, the princess of Mithila the river Mandakini flowing in the mountain, gratified her by offering meat (to eat) and sat on the mountain slope.

content: इदं मेध्यमिदं स्वादु निष्टप्तमिदमग्निना।एवमास्ते स धर्मात्मा सीतया सह राघवः।।2.96.2।।
explanation: Offering Sita several kinds of preparations to eat, righteous Rama, seated in her company remarked, This meat is savoury, this meat roasted on fire is sacred.

content: तथा तत्राऽसतस्तस्य भरतस्यौपयायिनः।सैन्यरेणुश्च शब्दश्च प्रादुरास्तां नभस्पृशौ।।2.96.3।।
explanation: Now as Rama was sitting there, the tumult and the dust raised by the approaching army of Bharata reached the sky.

content: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे त्रस्ता श्शब्देन महता ततः।अर्दिता यूथपा मत्ता स्सयूथा दुद्रुवुर्दिशः।।2.96.4।।
explanation: Meanwhile, the mighty leaders of the elephantherds were agitated, and frightened by the loud noise, fled away from there in different directions.

content: स तं सैन्यसमुद्धूतं शब्दं शुश्राव राघवः।तां श्च विप्रद्रुतान्सर्वान्यूथपानन्ववैक्षत।।2.96.5।।
explanation: Rama heard the sound generated by the army and saw those leaders of herds fleeing away.

content: तांश्च विद्रुवतो दृष्ट्वा तं च श्रुत्वा च निस्वनम्।उवाच राम स्सौमित्रिं लक्ष्मणं दीप्ततेजसम्।।2.96.6।।
explanation: Seeing those animals fleeing and hearing the clamour, Rama addressed Lakshmana,  son of Sumitra, who was blazing with energy.

content: हन्त लक्ष्मण पश्येह सुमित्रासुप्रजास्त्वया।भीमस्तनितगम्भीरस्तुमुलः श्रूयते स्वनः।।2.96.7।।
explanation: O Lakshmana, the worthy son of Sumitra, fearful and tumultuous clamour like rumbling sound of clouds is heard. What a wonder Go and see.

content: गजयूथानि वाऽरण्ये महिषा वा महावने।वित्रासिता मृगा स्सिंहै स्सहसा प्रद्रुता दिशः।।2.96.8।।
explanation: Herds of elephants and buffaloes in the great woods and wild beasts frightened by lions are running in different directions.

content: राजा वा राजपुत्रो वा मृगयामटते वने।अन्यद्वा श्वापदं किञ्चित्सौमित्रे ज्ञातुमर्हसि।।2.96.9।।
explanation: O Lakshmana, do ascertain if any king or prince has come for hunting or whether any ferocious animal has entered this forest, shouldn't you?

content: सुदुश्चरो गिरिश्चायं पक्षिणामपि लक्ष्मण।सर्वमेतद्यथातत्त्वमचिरात् ज्ञातुमर्हसि।।2.96.10।।
explanation: O Lakshmana, this mountain is highly inaccessible even to birds. Find out exactly and quickly what this is all about.

content: स लक्ष्मण स्सन्त्वरित स्सालमारुह्य पुष्पितम्।प्रेक्षमाणो दिश स्सर्वाः पूर्वां दिशमुदैक्षत।।2.96.11।।
explanation: Lakshmana hurriedly climbed a flowering sala tree, surveyed in all directions and fixed his gaze on the east.

content: उदङ्मुखः प्रेक्षमाणो ददर्श महतीं चमूम्।रथाश्वगजसम्बाधां यत्तैर्युक्तां पदातिभिः।।2.96.12।।
explanation: Turning his face to the north, he beheld a vast army consisting of chariots, elephants and horses and a wellequipped infantry.

content: तामश्वगजसम्पूर्णां रथध्वजविभूषिताम्।शशंस सेनां रामाय वचनं चेदमब्रवीत्।।2.96.13।।
explanation: He (Lakshmana) informed Rama about the army full of horses and elephants and decorated with chariotbanners and said these words:

content: अग्निं संशमयत्वार्य स्सीता च भजतां गुहाम्।सज्यं कुरुष्व चापं च शरांश्च कवचं तथा।।2.96.14।।
explanation: O noble one, put out the sacred fire (Agnihotra) and let Sita take refuge in the cave. String your bow and keep the arrows ready. Put on your armour.

content: तं रामः पुरुषव्याघ्रो लक्ष्मणं प्रत्युवाच ह।अङ्गावेक्षस्व सौमित्रे कस्येमां मन्यसे चमूम्।।2.96.15।।
explanation: Rama the best among men replied to Lakshamana, Oh, Lakshmana, look properly and tell me to whom do you think this army might belong

content: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण लक्ष्मणो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।दिधक्षन्निव तां सेनां रुषितः पावको यथा।।2.96.16।।
explanation: Hearing the words of Rama, enraged Lakshmana, like a flaming fire as if he would reduce the army to ashes, replied:

content: सम्पन्नं राज्यमिच्छंस्तु व्यक्तं प्राप्याभिषेचनम्।आवां हन्तुं समभ्येति कैकेय्या भरतस्सुतः।।2.96.17।।
explanation: It is evident that Kaikeyi's son Bharata, who has been consecrated, is coming to slay both of us desiring the prosperous kingdom (to be without obstacles).

content: एष वै सुमहाञ्छ्रीमान्विटपी सम्प्रकाशते।विराजत्युद्गतस्कन्धं कोविदारध्वजो रथे।।2.96.18।।
explanation: There on that chariot, is a banner shining brilliantly with the emblem of a lofty majestic Kovidara tree with a large trunk.

content: असौ हि सुमहास्कन्धो विटपी च महाद्रुमः।विराजते महासैन्ये कोविदारध्वजो रथे।।2.96.19।।
explanation: There the emblem of the great Kovidara tree of very large trunk spread with many branches shines brilliantly atop the chariot.

content: भजन्त्येते यथाकाममश्वानारुह्य शीघ्रगान्।एते भ्राजन्ति संहृष्टा गजानारुह्य सादिनः।।2.96.20।।
explanation: These men mounted on swiftlymoving horses are following the post. The riders of elephants  mounted on the elephants look cheerful.

content: गृहीतधनुषौ चावां गिरिं वीर श्रयावहै।अथवेहैव तिष्ठाव स्सन्नद्धावुद्यतायुधौ।।2.96.21।।
explanation: O mighty warrior, let both of us take up the bows and station ourselves on this mountain or we shall stay here itself armed with weapons fully prepared for the battle.

content: अपि नौ वशमागच्छेत्कोविदारध्वजो रणे।अपि द्रक्ष्यामि भरतं यत्कृते व्यसनं महत्।।2.96.22।।त्वया राघव सम्प्राप्तं सीतया च मया तथा।
explanation: O Rama, will this Kovidara emblem come into our possession in the battle? Can I see Bharata, the cause of the calamity that has befallen you, Sita and me?

content: यन्निमित्तं भवान्राज्याच्छ्युतो राघव शाश्वतात्।।2.96.23।।सम्प्राप्तोऽयमरिर्वीर भरतो वध्य एव मे।
explanation: O that mighty warrior Bharata, on whose account you have been banished from the perpetual kingdom, comes here as a foe and as for me, he deserves to be slain.

content: भरतस्य वधे दोषं नाहं पश्यामि राघव।पूर्वापकारिणं हत्वा न ह्यधर्मेण युज्यते।।2.96.24।।
explanation: O Rama, I do not see anything  wrong in slaying Bharata. In killing one who had done harm is not an act of unrighteousness.

content: पूर्वापकारी भरतस्त्यक्तधर्मश्च राघव।एतस्मिन्निहते कृत्स्नामनुशाधि वसुन्धराम्।।2.96.25।।
explanation: O Rama, Bharata has abandoned righteousness and has harmed you. When he is slain, you shall rule over the whole earth.

content: अद्य पुत्रं हतं संख्ये कैकेयी राज्यकामुका।मया पश्येत्सुदुःखार्ता हस्तिभग्नमिव द्रुमम्।।2.96.26।।
explanation: Let that Kaikeyi, greedy for the kingdom, see in great anguish her son who shall be slain by me today in a battle like a tree felled by an elephant.

content: कैकेयीं च वधिष्यामि सानुबन्धां सबान्धवाम्।कलुषेणाद्य महता मेदिनी परिमुच्यताम्।।2.96.27।।
explanation: I shall also slay Kaikeyi with her attendants and relations. Let the earth be cleansed of the great sin today.

content: अद्येमं संयतं क्रोधमसत्कारं च मानद।मोक्ष्यामि शत्रुसैन्येषु कक्षेष्विव हुताशनम्।।2.96.28।।
explanation: O protector of honour, today I shall vent my suppressed anger and dishonour on the enemy's army like a fire on the thicket.

content: अद्यैतच्छित्रकूटस्य काननं निशितै श्शरैः।छिन्दञ्चत्रुशरीराणि करिष्ये शोणितोक्षितम्।।2.96.29।।
explanation: Today I shall rend the bodies of enemies with my sharpened arrows and spatter the forest of Chitrakuta mountain with their blood.

content: शरैर्निर्भिन्नहृदयान्कुञ्जरांस्तुरगांस्तथा।श्वापदाः परिकर्षन्तु नरांश्च निहतान्मया।।2.96.30।।
explanation: Let the wild beasts drag away the elephants, horses and men to be killed by me with their hearts transfixed with my arrows.

content: शराणां धनुषश्चाहमनृणोऽस्मिन्महावने।ससैन्यं भरतं हत्वा भविष्यामि न संशयः।।2.96.31।।
explanation: Having slain Bharata and his army in this great forest, I shall doubtless discharge my debt to my arrows and bow. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे षण्णवतितमस्सर्गः।Thus ends the ninetysixth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama's correction of Lakshmana's judgement -- Bharata's army encamped round Chitrakuta.]सुसंरब्धं तु सौमित्रिं लक्ष्मणं क्रोधमूर्छितम्।रामस्तु परिसान्त्व्याथ वचनं चेदमब्रवीत्।।2.97.1।।
explanation: Thereafter, Rama pacified Lakshmana, son of Sumitra who was violently agitated. He said to him who had swooned with rage:

content: किमत्र धनुषा कार्यमसिना वा सचर्मणा।महेष्वासे महाप्राज्ञे भरते स्वयमागते।।2.97.2।।
explanation: When sagacious Bharata of great strength has come here, where is the need for a bow or a sword or a shield.

content: पितुस्सत्यं प्रतिश्रुत्य हत्वा भरतमागतम्।किं करिष्यामि राज्येन सापवादेन लक्ष्मण।।2.97.3।।
explanation: O Lakshmana, having sworn that I would make father's word true, what shall I do with the kingdom earned slanderously by slaying Bharata who has come (to see me)?

content: यद्द्रव्यं बान्धवानां वा मित्राणां वा क्षये भवेत्।नाहं तत्प्रतिगृह्णीयां भक्षान्विषकृतानिव।।2.97.4।।
explanation: I shall never accept any wealth obtained by destroying kith and kin or friends which is akin to taking food prepared with poison.

content: धर्ममर्थं च कामं च पृथिवीं चापि लक्ष्मण।इच्छामि भवतामर्थे एतत् प्रतिशृणोमि ते।।2.97.5।।
explanation: O Lakshmana, on the oath of righteousness, I wish wealth and pleasure as well as this kingdom for the sake of you all.

content: भ्रात्रूणां संग्रहार्थं च सुखार्थं चापि लक्ष्मण।राज्यमप्यहमिच्छामि सत्येनाऽयुधमालभे।।2.97.6।।
explanation: O Lakshmana, I desire this kingdom only for the unity and happiness of my brothers. I swear on the weapon I hold.

content: नेयं मम मही सौम्य दुर्लभा सागराम्बरा।न हीच्छेयमधर्मेण शक्रत्वमपि लक्ष्मण।।2.97.7।।
explanation: O gentle Lakshmana, lordship of this earth with the sea as its garment is not difficult to obtain (for me). But I do not desire even Indrahood by unrighteous means.

content: यद्विना भरतं त्वां च शत्रुघ्नं चापि मानद।भवेन्मम सुखं किञ्चिद्भस्म तत्कुरुतां शिखी।।2.97.8।।
explanation: O protector of honour even if there were to be some happiness which I could enjoy without you, Bharata, and Satrughna, let it be reduced to ashes by fire.

content: मन्येऽहमागतोऽयोध्यां भरतो भ्रातृवत्सलः।मम प्राणात्प्रियतरः कुलधर्ममनुस्मरन्।।2.97.9।।श्रुत्वा प्रव्राजितं मां हि जटावल्कलधारिणम्।जानक्यासहितं वीर त्वया च पुरुषर्षभ।।2.97.10।।स्नेहेनाऽक्रान्तहृदय श्शोकेनाकुलितेन्द्रियः।द्रष्टुमभ्यागतो ह्येष भरतो नान्यथाऽगतः।।2.97.11।।
explanation: O best among men, O valiant one I think Bharata who is affectionate towards his brothers and who is dearer to me than my life, must have returned to Ayodhya and has heard that I had been exiled along with you and Janaki, wearing barks and matted locks. Remembering the duties of the race with an afflicted mind and with agitated senses he has come here to see me. He has not come with any other intention.

content: अम्बां च कैकयीं रुष्य परुषं चाप्रियं वदन्।प्रसाद्य पितरं श्रीमार्नाज्यं मे दातुमागतः।।2.97.12।।
explanation: Auspicious Bharata, angry with Kaikeyi and having spoken to her unpleasant, bitter words and having propitiated our father, has come here to offer me the kingdom.

content: प्राप्तकालं यदेषोऽस्मान्भरतो द्रष्टुमिच्छति।अस्मासु मनसाऽप्येष नाप्रियं किञ्चिदाचरेत्।।2.97.13।।
explanation: Finding the time appropriate, Bharata has come to see us. Even in his mind he would have never thought of causing any harm to us in any way.

content: विप्रियं कृतपूर्वं ते भरतेन कदा नु किम्।ईदृशं वा भयं तेऽद्य भरतं योऽत्र शङ्कसे।।2.97.14।।
explanation: Why are you suspicious of Bharata? Has he done anything disagreeable to you any time in the past?

content: न हि ते निष्ठुरं वाच्यो भरतो नाप्रियं वचः।अहं ह्यप्रियमुक्त स्स्यां भरतस्याप्रिये कृते।।2.97.15।।
explanation: You must not speak any harsh or unpleasant words against Bharata. If you do, they will be deemed to be directed against me.

content: कथं नु पुत्राः पितरं हन्युः कस्यां चिदापदि।भ्राता वा भ्रातरं हन्यात्सौमित्रे प्राणमात्मनः।।2.97.16।।
explanation: Whatever be the calamity, O Lakshmana, how will sons slay their father, or a brother kill his own brother who is as dear to him as his own life?

content: यदि राज्यस्य हेतोस्त्वमिमां वाचं प्रभाषसे।वक्ष्यामि भरतं दृष्ट्वा राज्यमस्मै प्रदीयताम्।।2.97.17।।
explanation: If you are saying all these words only for the sake of the kingdom, then I shall ask Bharata when I see him to offer this kingdom to you.

content: उच्यमानोऽपि भरतो मया लक्ष्मण तद्वचः।राज्यमस्मै प्रयच्छेति बाढमित्येव वक्ष्यति।।2.97.18।।
explanation: O Lakshmana if I earnestly exhort Bharata to offer this kingdom to you, then on hearing those words, he would say, 'Certainly so'.

content: तथोक्तो धर्मशीलेन भ्रात्रा तस्य हिते रतः।लक्ष्मणः प्रविवेशेव स्वानि गात्राणि लज्जया।।2.97.19।।
explanation: Having heard the words uttered by his brother, Rama of virtuous disposition, Lakshmana who was devoted to his brother's welfare, shrank.

content: तद्वाक्यं लक्ष्मण श्श्रुत्वा व्रीलितः प्रत्युवाच ह।त्वां मन्ये द्रष्टुमायातः पिता दशरथ स्स्वयम्।।2.97.20।।
explanation: Hearing the words of Rama, Lakshmana was abashed and said I think it is our father, king Dasaratha who has come here personally to see you.

content: व्रीलितं लक्ष्मणं दृष्ट्वा राघवः प्रत्युवाच ह।एष मन्ये महाबाहुरिहास्मान्द्रष्टुमागतः।।2.97.21।।
explanation: Observing Lakshmana's abashment, Rama said I think the mightyarmed king Dasaratha has come to see all of us here.

content: अथवा नौ ध्रुवं मन्ये मन्यमान स्सुखोचितौ।वनवासमनुध्याय गृहाय प्रतिनेष्यति।।2.97.22।।
explanation: Or rather having thought of the adversities of dwelling in a forest and also by realising  that both of us are accustomed to comforts, I think he has certainly come to take us back home.

content: इमां वाप्येष वैदेहीमत्यन्तसुखसेविनीम्।पिता मे राघव श्श्रीमान्वनादादाय यास्यति।।2.97.23।।
explanation: Our father, the prosperous Dasaratha, after withdrawing this princess Vaidehi who is brought up in luxury from the forest (to Ayodhya), will return.

content: एतौ तौ सम्प्रकाशेते गोत्रवन्तौ मनोरमौ।वायुवेगसमौ वीर जवनौ तुरगोत्तमौ।।2.97.24।।
explanation: O valiant warrior, you can see those two splendid horses of high pedigree, charming, swift and equal to wind in speed are shining (in the army).

content: स एष सुमहाकायः कम्पते वाहिनीमुखे।नागश्शत्रुञ्जयो नाम वृद्धस्तातस्य धीमतः।।2.97.25।।
explanation: There is that huge and aged elephant named Satrunjaya which belogns to our sagacious father proceeding at the head of the army.

content: पितुर्दिव्यं महाबाहो संशयो भवतीह मे।।2.97.26।।
explanation: I do not see, O longarmed one that splendid white canopy of my father, wellrespected by men. And this gives rise to doubts in my mind.

content: वृक्षाग्रादवरोह त्वं कुरु लक्ष्मण मद्वचः।इतीव रामो धर्मात्मा सौमित्रिं तमुवाच ह।।2.97.27।।
explanation: Get off the treetop, O Lakshmana, and do what I say said the righteous Rama.

content: अवतीर्य तु सालाग्रात्तस्मात्स समितिञ्जयः।लक्ष्मणः प्राञ्जलिर्भूत्वा तस्थौ रामस्य पार्श्वतः।।2.97.28।।
explanation: Lakshmana, the conqueror of foes, descended from the top of the sala tree and stood by the side of Rama with folded palms.

content: भरतेनापि सन्दिष्टा सम्मर्दो न भवेदिति।समन्तात्तस्य शैलस्य सेना वासमकल्पयत्।।2.97.29।।
explanation: Let not the hermitage be crowded commanded Bharata, and the army encamped  around the mountain.

content: अध्यर्धमिक्ष्वाकुचमूर्योजनं पर्वतस्य सा।पार्श्वे न्यविशदावृत्य गजवाजिरथाकुला।।2.97.30।।
explanation: Bharata's army full of horses, elephants and chariots covering a distance of more than one and a half yojanas encamped by the side of the mountain.

content: सा चित्रकूटे भरतेन सेना धर्मं पुरस्कृत्य विधूय दर्पम्।प्रसादनार्थं रघुनन्दनस्य विराजते नीतिमता प्रणीता।।2.97.31।।
explanation: The army brought by Bharata, the great moralist, was shining around Chitrakuta mountain following dharma, and casting off all pride, in order to please Rama.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे सप्तनवतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the ninetyseventh sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Bharata's joy on locating the hermitage of Sri Rama.]निवेश्य सेनां तु विभुः पद्भ्यां पादवतां वरः।अभिगन्तुं स काकुत्थ्समियेष गुरुवर्तकम्।।2.98.1।।
explanation: On encamping the army, lord Bharata, the best among men, wished to approach on foot Rama who was devoted to his father.

content: निविष्टमात्रे सैन्ये तु यथोद्देशं विनीतवत्।भरतो भ्रातरं वाक्यं शत्रुघ्नमिदमब्रवीत्।।2.98.2।।
explanation: After the army encamped in the assigned places, Bharata said to his brother Satrughna thus:

content: क्षिप्रं वनमिदं सौम्य नरसङ्घै स्समन्ततः।लुब्धैश्च सहितैरेभि स्त्वमन्वेषितुमर्हसि।।2.98.3।।
explanation: O dear Satrughna, you should explore this forest quickly along with groups of our people and  hunters as well.

content: गुहो ज्ञातिसहस्रेण शरचापासिधारिणा।समन्वेषतु काकुत्स्थमस्मिन् परिवृतस्स्वयम्।।2.98.4।।
explanation: Let Guha, surrounded by a thousand kinsmen and armed with bows, arrows and swords look for Rama.

content: अमात्यै स्सह पौरैश्च गुरुभिश्च द्विजातिभिः।वनं सर्वं चरिष्यामि पद्भ्यां परिवृत स्स्वयम्।।2.98.5।।
explanation: 'I myself shall go on foot surrounded by ministers, citizens, preceptors and brahmins and search the entire forest.

content: यावन्न रामं द्रक्ष्यामि लक्ष्मणं वा महाबलम्।वैदेहीं च महाभागां न मे शान्तिर्भविष्यति।।2.98.6।।
explanation: 'I shall not rest in peace until I see Rama, powerful Lakshmana and illustrious princess of Videha (Sita).

content: यावन्न चन्द्रसङ्काशं द्रक्ष्यामि शुभमाननम्। भ्रातुः पद्मपलाशाक्षं न मे शान्तिर्भविष्यति।।2.98.7।।
explanation: I shall not attain peace until I see my brother, Rama whose auspicious countenance looks radiant as the Moon and whose eyes as lotuspetals.

content: यावन्न चरणौ भ्रातुः पार्थिवव्यञ्जनान्वितौ।शिरसा धारयिष्यामि न मे शान्तिर्भविष्यति।।2.98.8।।
explanation: Peace shall not come to me until I hold on my head the feet of my brother, the insignia of royalty.

content: यावन्न राज्ये राज्यार्हः पितृपैतामहे स्थितः।अभिषेकजलक्लिन्नो न मे शान्तिर्भविष्यति।।2.98.9।।
explanation: I shall not attain peace until Rama, who is worthy of this kingdom, is sprinkled with the holy water of coronation and assumes the ancestral kingdom.

content: सिद्धार्थः खलु सौमित्रिर्यश्चन्द्रविमलोपमम्।मुखं पश्यति रामस्य राजीवाक्षं महाद्युति।।2.98.10।।
explanation: Lakshmana, one who beholds the highly effulgent countenance of Rama, resembling the spotless Moon and whose eyes resemble red lotuses, is blessed indeed

content: कृतकृत्या महाभागा वैदेही जनकात्मजा।भर्तारं सागरान्तायाः पृथिव्या यानुगच्छति।।2.98.11।।
explanation: Sita, the illustrious daughter of Janaka and princess of Videha, has accomplished her purpose by following Rama, the lord of this earth bounded by the ocean.

content: सुभगश्चित्रकूटोऽसौ गिरिराजोपमो गिरिः।यस्मिन्वसति काकुत्स्थः कुबेर इव नन्दने।।2.98.12।।
explanation: Like Kubera in the Nandana garden, Rama lives here on mount Chitrakuta which is indeed blessed like the Himalaya, king of the mountains.

content: कृतकार्यमिदं दुर्गं वनं व्यालनिषेवितम्।यदध्यास्ते महातेजा राम श्शस्त्रभृतां वरः।।2.98.13।।
explanation: Fortunate is this inaccessible forest which is inhabited by wild animals to have become the dwelling place of the most radiant Rama, the foremost among the wielders of weapons.

content: एवमुक्त्वा महातेजा भरतः पुरषर्षभः।पद्भ्यामेव महाबाहुः प्रविवेश महाद्वनम्।।2.98.14।।
explanation: Having said thus, the best of men, mightyarmed and highly energetic Bharata entered the great forest on foot.

content: स तानि द्रुमजालानि जातानि गिरिसानुषु।पुष्पिताग्राणि मध्येन जगाम वदतां वरः।।2.98.15।।
explanation: Bharata, the best among the eloquent, made his way amidst multitude of trees grown on mountain slopes with their tops in full bloom.

content: स गिरेश्चित्रकूटस्य सालमासाद्य पुष्पितम्।रामाश्रमगतस्याग्नेर्ददर्श ध्वजमुच्छ्रितम्।।2.98.16।।
explanation: Having reached a flowering sala tree atop Chitrakuta mountain, he beheld a lofty banner of smoke rising from the fire burning in Rama's hermitage.

content: तं दृष्ट्वा भरत श्रीमान्मुमोद सह बान्धवः।अत्र राम इति ज्ञात्वा गतः पारमिवाम्भसः।।2.98.17।।
explanation: On seeing the smoke, majestic Bharata in the company of relatives concluded that Rama was staying there and rejoiced like a man who had reached the other bank of the river.

content: स चित्रकूटे तु गिरौ निशम्यव रामाश्रमं पुण्यजनोपपन्नम्।गुहेन सार्धं त्वरितो जगाम पुनर्निवेश्यैव चमूं महात्मा।।2.98.18।।
explanation: Having heard of Rama's hermitage on the Chitrakuta mountain inhabited by pious men, magnanimous Bharata, commanded his army to stay at a distance, and quickly proceeded with Guha.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे अष्टनवतितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the ninetyeighth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Bharata sees Rama seated in the hermitage with matted hair and bark robes with Sita nearby -- Bharata's lamentation.]निविष्टायां तु सेनायामुत्सुको भरतस्तदा।जगाम भ्रातरं द्रष्टुं शत्रुघ्नमनुदर्शयन्।।2.99.1।।
explanation: Eager to see his brother, Bharata encamped the army and set out showing the hermitage to Satrughna.

content: ऋषिं वसिष्ठं सन्दिश्य मातृ़र्मे शीघ्रमानय।इति त्वरितमग्रे स जगाम गुरुवत्सलः।।2.99.2।।
explanation: Bharata, deeply devoted towards elders, indicated to sage Vasistha to bring along the mothers, and  proceeded ahead quickly.

content: सुमन्त्रस्त्वपि शत्रुघ्नमदूरादन्वपद्यत।रामदर्शनजस्तर्षो भरतस्येव तस्य च।।2.99.3।।
explanation: Sumantra, who was overeager, like Bharata, to see Rama, followed Satrughna who was not far from him.

content: गच्छन्नेवाथ भरतस्तापसालय संस्थिताम्।भ्रातुः पर्णकुटीं श्रीमानुटजं च ददर्श ह।। 2.99.4।।
explanation: While walking, Bharata beheld a hut made of leaves looking like a hermit's cottage.

content: शालायास्त्वग्रत स्तस्या ददर्श भरत स्तदा।काष्ठानि चावभग्नानि पुष्पाण्युपचितानि च।।2.99.5।।
explanation: In front of that hut Bharata beheld shattered logs of wood and also flowers plucked.

content: स लक्ष्मणस्य रामस्य ददर्शाऽश्रममीयुषः।कृतं वृक्षेष्वभिज्ञानं कुशचीरैः क्वचित्क्वचित्।।2.99.6।।
explanation: Bharata beheld here and there knots of kusa grass and strips of bark tied on trees as signs to ascertain the way to the hermitage of Rama and Lakshmana.

content: ददर्श वने तस्मिन्महत स्सञ्चयान्कृतान्।मृगाणां महिषाणां च करीषै शशीतकारणात्।।2.99.7।।
explanation: He also beheld large heaps of dried cakes of dung of buffaloes and deer for use against cold in the forest.

content: गच्छन्नेव महाबाहुर्द्युतिमान्भरत स्तदा।शत्रुघ्नं चाब्रवीद्धृष्टस्तानमात्यांश्च सर्वशः।।2.99.8।।
explanation: Walking on, the longarmed, effulgent and delighted Bharata said to Satrughna and the ministers surrounding him:

content: मन्ये प्राप्ताः स्म तं देशं भरद्वाजो यमब्रवीत्।नातिदूरे हि मन्येऽहं नदीं मन्दाकिनीमितः।।2.99.9।।
explanation: We must have reached the region about which Bharadwaja had spoken. I think river Mandakini is not far from here.

content: उच्चैर्बद्धानि चीराणि लक्ष्मणेन भवेदयम्।अभिज्ञानकृतः पन्था अकाले गन्तुमिच्छता।।2.99.10।।
explanation: Here are long bark garments fastened on lofty places as marks of identification left by Lakshmana, to locate the path at odd times which may be needed while going out.

content: इदं चोदात्तदन्तानां कुञ्जराणां तरस्विनाम्।शैलपार्श्वे परिक्रान्तमन्योन्यमभिगर्जताम्।।2.99.11।।
explanation: This must be the place on the hillside on which mighty tuskers wander about trumpeting and charging at one another.

content: यमेवाधातुमिच्छन्ति तापसा स्सततं वने।तस्यासौ दृश्यते धूम स्सङ्कुलः कृष्णवर्त्मनः।।2.99.12।।
explanation: Here is the thick smoke emanating from the blacktrailed fire maintained perpetually by the ascetics living in the forest.

content: अत्राहं पुरुषव्याघ्रं गुरुसत्कारकारिणम्।आर्यं द्रक्ष्यामि संहृष्टो महर्षिमिव राघवम्।।2.99.13।।
explanation: I shall see here with a delighted heart the venerable Rama, the best of men, who renders great hospitality (to elders) and who resembles a maharshi.

content: अथ गत्वा मुहूर्तन्तु चित्रकूटं स राघवः।मन्दाकिनीमनुप्राप्तस्तं जनं चेदमब्रवीत्।।2.99.14।।
explanation: Bharata walked for a short distance towards mount Chitrkuta when he reached river Mandakini. And then said to his ministers:

content: जगत्यां पुरषव्याघ्र आस्ते वीरासने रतः।जनेन्द्रो निर्जनं प्राप्य धिङ्मे जन्म सजीवितम्।।2.99.15।।
explanation: Rama, the lord of men, a tiger among men, is sitting on the ground in a 'heroic' (yogic) posture in this secluded forest. O fie upon my birth and my life

content: मत्कृते व्यसनं प्राप्तो लोकनाथो महाद्युतिः।सर्वान्कामान्परित्यज्य वने वसति राघवः।।2.99.16।।
explanation: Effulgent Rama, the lord of the world, had to renounce all desires and undergo this calamity of living in the forest on my account.

content: इति लोकसमाक्रुष्टः पादेष्वद्य प्रसादयन्।रामस्य निपतिष्यामि सीताया लक्ष्मणस्य च।।2.99.17।।
explanation: Reviled by the world, I shall now fall at the feet of Sita, Rama and Lakshmana seeking their grace.

content: एवं संविलपं स्तस्मिन्वने दशरथात्मजः।ददर्श महतीं पुण्यां पर्णशालां मनोरमाम्।।2.99.18।।सालतालाश्वकर्णानां पर्णैर्बहुभिरावृताम्।विशालां मृदुभिस्तीर्णां कुशैर्वेदिमिवाध्वरे।।2.99.19।।शक्रायुधनिकाशैश्च कार्मुकैर्भारसाधनैः।रुक्मपृष्ठैर्महासारै श्शोभितां शत्रुबाधकैः।।2.99.20।।अर्क रश्मि प्रतीकाशैर्घोरैस्तूणीगतैश्शरैः।शोभितां दीप्तवदनै स्सर्पैर्भोगवतीमिव।।2.99.21।।महारजतवासोभ्यामसिभ्यां च विराजिताम्।रुक्मबिन्दुविचित्राभ्यां चर्मभ्यां चापि शोभिताम्।।2.99.22।।गोधाङ्गुळित्रैरासक्तैश्चित्रैः काञ्चनभूषितैः।अरिसंघैरनाधृष्यां मृगै स्सिंहगुहा मिव।।2.99.23।।
explanation: Lamenting in this way Bharata beheld in that forest an excellent, sacred and enchanting hut covered with a lot of leaves of sala, palmyra and aswakarna trees like a sacrificial altar spread with soft kusa grass. Goldplated bows that resembled the thunderbolt of Indra, powerful and capable of achieving great targets and oppressing the enemies, adorned the hut. Arrows glittering like the rays of the Sun, were dreadful, with blazing heads and stored in quivers adorned it like the hooded serpents illumining the city of Bhogavati (in the nether world).
