content: स्कन्धावारनिवेशेन तेन तस्य महात्मनः।हयहस्तिकरीषैश्च उपमर्दः कृतो भृशम्।।2.117.3।।
explanation: Due to the encampment of the army of the magnanimous Bharata (here), this place has been filled with the dung of horses and elephants and made exceedingly dirty.

content: तस्मादन्यत्र गच्छाम इति सञ्चिन्त्य राघवः।प्रातिष्ठत स वैदेह्या लक्ष्मणेन च सङ्गतः।।2.117.4।।
explanation: We shall, therefore, go to some other place, having resolved thus, Rama accompanied by Sita and Lakshmana set forth.

content: सोऽत्रेराश्रममासाद्य तं ववन्दे महायशाः।तं चापि भगवानत्रिः पुत्रवत्प्रत्यपद्यत।।2.117.5।।
explanation: Having reached the hermitage of the revered sage Atri, illustrious Rama prostrated before him and Atri also received him as his son.

content: स्वयमातिथ्यमादिश्य सर्वमन्यत्सुसत्कृतम्।सौमित्रिं च महाभागां सीतां च समसान्त्वयत्।।2.117.6।।
explanation: That sage Atri himself extended to Rama the hospitality befitting him in all possible ways and treated Lakshmana and highly virtuous Sita with kind words.

content: पत्नीं च समनुप्राप्तां वृद्धामामन्त्र्य सत्कृताम्।सान्त्वयामास धर्मज्ञः सर्वभूतहिते रतः।।2.117.7।।
explanation: Conversant in the ways of righteousness and eagaged in the welfate of all beings, sage Atri called out his aged wife who is revered by all and spoke kind words to her.

content: आनसूयां महाभागां तापसीं धर्मचारिणीम्प्रतिगृह्णीष्व वैदेहीमब्रवीदृषिसत्तमः।रामाय चाऽचचक्षे तां तापसीं धर्मचारिणीम्।।2.117.8।।
explanation: Atri, who was excellent among the sages said to his ascetic wife who was highly virtuous and an adherent of righteousness, Welcome Sita. Thereafter, he related to Rama a story about his asetic wife who follows the ways of righteousness.

content: दश वर्षाण्यनावृष्ट्या दग्धे लोके निरन्तरम्।।2.117.9।।यया मूलफले सृष्टे जाह्नवी च प्रवर्तिता।उग्रेण तपसा युक्ता नियमैश्चाप्यलङ्कृता।।2.117.10।।दश वर्ष सहास्राणि तया तप्तं महत्तपः।अनसूया व्रतै स्स्नाता प्रत्यूहाश्च निवर्तिताः।।2.117.11।।देवकार्यनिमित्तं च यया सन्त्वरमाणया।दशरात्रं कृता रात्रि स्सेयं मातेव तेऽनघ।।2.117.12।।
explanation: O blameless one (Rama), once this world was consecutively ravaged by drought for ten years. It was the virtuous Anasuya who created roots and fruits and caused Ganga to flow. She was engaged in severe mortifications and selfimposed religious observances. She practised severe asceticism for ten thousand years bathed in her vows. Solicited on behalf of the gods, she removed all impediments and converted ten nights into one. She is like a your mother to you.

content: दश वर्षाण्यनावृष्ट्या दग्धे लोके निरन्तरम्।।2.117.9।।यया मूलफले सृष्टे जाह्नवी च प्रवर्तिता।उग्रेण तपसा युक्ता नियमैश्चाप्यलङ्कृता।।2.117.10।।दश वर्षसहास्राणि यया तप्तं महत् तपः।अनसूया व्रतै स्स्नाता प्रत्यूहाश्च निवर्तिताः।।2.117.11।।देवकार्यनिमित्तं च यया सन्त्वरमाणया।दशरात्रं कृता रात्रि स्सेयं मातेव तेऽनघ।।2.117.12।।
explanation: O blameless one (Rama), once this world was consecutively ravaged by drought for ten years. It was the virtuous Anasuya who created roots and fruits and caused Ganga to flow. She was engaged in severe mortifications and selfimposed religious observances. She practised severe asceticism for ten thousand years bathed in her vows. Solicited on behalf of the gods, she removed all impediments and converted ten nights into one. She is like a your mother to you.

content: दश वर्षाण्यनावृष्ट्या दग्धे लोके निरन्तरम्।।2.117.9।।यया मूलफले सृष्टे जाह्नवी च प्रवर्तिता।उग्रेण तपसा युक्ता नियमैश्चाप्यलङ्कृता।।2.117.10।।दश वर्ष सहास्राणि तया तप्तं महत्तपः।अनसूया व्रतै स्स्नाता प्रत्यूहाश्च निवर्तिताः।।2.117.11।।देवकार्यनिमित्तं च यया सन्त्वरमाणया।दशरात्रं कृता रात्रि स्सेयं मातेव तेऽनघ।।2.117.12।।
explanation: O blameless one (Rama), once this world was consecutively ravaged by drought for ten years. It was the virtuous Anasuya who created roots and fruits and caused Ganga to flow. She was engaged in severe mortifications and selfimposed religious observances. She practised severe asceticism for ten thousand years bathed in her vows. Solicited on behalf of the gods, she removed all impediments and converted ten nights into one. She is like a your mother to you.

content: तामिमां सर्वभूतानां नमस्कार्यां यशस्विनीम् अभिगच्छतु वैदेही वृद्धामक्रोधनां सदा।अनसूयेति या लोके कर्मभिः ख्यातिमागता।।2.117.13।।
explanation: 'She is renowned throughout this world for her deeds as Anasuya, (one who is free from anger). Aged, illustrious she is free frm anger, worthy of adoration by all beings. Let Sita approach her'.

content: एवं ब्रुवाणं तमृषिं तथेत्युक्त्वा स राघवः।सीतामुवाच धर्मज्ञामिदं वचनमुत्तमम्।।2.117.14।।
explanation: Hearing those words of the sage, Rama said be it so and said to righteous Sita these choice words.

content: राजपुत्रि श्रुतमिदं मुनेरस्य समीरितम्।श्रेयोऽर्थमात्मनश्शीघ्रमभिगच्छ तपस्विनीम्।।2.117.15।।
explanation: O princess, you have heard the message of the sage. Without delay approach the ascetic (Anasuya) for your welfare.

content: सीता त्वेतद वचः श्रुत्वा राघवस्य हितैषिणः।तामत्रिपन्तीं धर्मज्ञामभिचक्राम मैथिली।।2.117.16।।
explanation: Having heard the words of Rama, intended for her welfare, Sita, daughter of the king of Mithila, approached the consort of Atri (Devi Anasuya), knower of righteousness, and reverently circumambulated her.

content: शिथिलां वलितां वृद्धां जरापाण्डुरमूर्धजाम्।सततं वेपमानाङ्गीं प्रवाते कदलीं यथा।। 2.117.17।।तां तु सीता महाभागामनसूयां पतिव्रताम्।अभ्यवादयदव्यग्रा स्वं नाम समुदाहरत्।।2.117.18।।
explanation: Highly chaste and fortunate Anasuya was very old and feeble. Her skin was wrinkled and her hair turned grey due to old age. Her body was constantly trembling like a plantain tree in a stormy wind. Pronouncing her name to such Anasuya, Sita made obeisance to her with utmost concentration.

content: शिथिलां वलितां वृद्धां जरापाण्डुरमूर्धजाम्।सततं वेपमानाङ्गीं प्रवाते कदलीं यथा।। 2.117.17।।तां तु सीता महाभागामनसूयां पतिव्रताम्।अभ्यवादयदव्यग्रा स्वंनाम समुदाहरत्।।2.117.18।।
explanation: Highly chaste and fortunate Anasuya was very old and feeble. Her skin was wrinkled and her hair turned grey due to old age. Her body was constantly trembling like a plantain tree in a stormy wind. Pronouncing her name to such Anasuya, Sita made obeisance to her with utmost concentration.

content: अभिवाद्य च वैदेही तापसीं तामनिन्दिताम्।बद्धाञ्जलिपुटा हृष्टा पर्यपृच्छदनामयम्।।2.117.19।।
explanation: Sita offered her obeisance to the blameless ascetic, Anasuya, folding her palms and enquired of her wellbeing in delight.

content: ततस्सीतां महाभागां दृष्ट्वा तां धर्मचारिणीम्।सान्त्वयन्त्यब्रवीद्धृष्टा दिष्ट्या धर्ममवेक्षसे।।2.117.20।।
explanation: Anasuya was delighted  to see the glorious Sita who was always engaged in righteous acts and  said in kind words, You are fortunate. You are observing your rightful duty.

content: त्यक्त्वा ज्ञातिजनं सीते मानमृद्धं च भामिनि।अवरुद्धं वने रामं दिष्ट्या त्वमनुगच्छसि।।2.117.21।।
explanation: O noble Sita, by the grace of heaven you are following Rama, forsaking your kinsmen and wealth and confining yourself to the forest.

content: नगरस्थो वनस्थो वा पापो वा यदि वा शुभः।यासां स्त्रीणां प्रियो भर्ता तासां लोका महोदयाः।।2.117.22।।
explanation: One who is devoted to her husband, whether he be in the city or in the forest, whether  he is sinful or virtuous, will attain the most prosperous worlds.

content: दुश्शीलः कामवृत्तो वा धनैर्वा परिवर्जितः।स्त्रीणामार्यस्वभावानां परमं दैवतं पतिः।।2.117.23।।
explanation: For a woman of noble nature her husband, whether he be licentious or of bad character or devoid of riches, is her supreme lord.

content: नातो विशिष्टं पश्यामि बान्धवं विमृशन्त्यहम्।सर्वत्र योग्यं वैदेहि तपः कृतमिवाव्ययम्।।2.117.24।।
explanation: O Sita, on reflection I know of none who is a better friend than the husband. He, like an imperishable penance, once acquired is never lost.

content: न त्वेवमवगच्छन्ति गुणदोषमसत्त्स्रियः।कामवक्तव्यहृदया भर्तृनाथाश्चरन्ति याः।।2.117.25।।
explanation: Those wicked women whose minds are overpowered by carnal desires, ranging at will as lords of their husbands, do not understand about vice and virtue.

content: प्राप्नुवन्त्य यशश्चैव धर्मभ्रंशं च मैथिलि।अकार्यवशमापन्नाः स्त्रियो याः खलु तद्विधाः।।2.117.26।।
explanation: O Sita, those women  under the control of unworthy acts are dislodged from the path of righteousness and get infamy.

content: त्वद्विधास्तु गुणैर्युक्ता दृष्ट लोक परावराः। स्त्रिय स्स्वर्गे चरिष्यन्ति यथा धर्मकृतस्तथा।।2.117.27।।
explanation: Women like you who are endowed with virtues and can distinguish between good and bad in this world, like those who  perform  virtuous deeds, will move about in heaven.

content: तदेवमेनं त्वमनुव्रता सती पतिव्रतानां समयानुवर्तिनी।भव स्वभर्तु स्सहधर्मचारिणी यशश्च धर्मं च तत स्समाप्स्यसि।।2.117.28।।
explanation: Therefore, always following your husband, upholding the traditions of chaste women, carrying out worthy and timely duties, be a virtuous wife to your husband. You will thus obtain renown and virtue.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे सप्तदशोत्तरशततमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the hundredseventeenth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Sita relates the story of her marriage to Anasuya -- Anasuya bestows Sita with divine gifts.]सात्वेवमुक्ता वैदेही अनसूयाऽनसूयया। प्रतिपूज्य वचो मन्दं प्रवक्तुमुपचक्रमे।।2.118.1।।
explanation: When Anasuya thus addressed Vaidehi who is free from any malice, she worshipped  Anasuya  and started speaking in a gentle tone.

content: नैतदाश्चर्यमार्याया यन्मां त्वमभिभाषसे। विदितन्तु ममाप्येतद्यथा नार्याः पतिर्गुरुः।।2.118.2।।
explanation: It is no wonder that a noble lady like you should  instruct me this way. It is known to me that a husband is a guru to his wife.

content: यद्यप्येष भवेद्भर्ता ममाऽर्ये वृत्तवर्जितः।अद्वैधमुपचर्तव्यस्तथाप्येष मया भवेत्।।2.118.3।।
explanation: O noble lady, even if my husband is devoid of good conduct, he should be obeyed without showing any hesitation.

content: किं पुनर्यो गुणश्लाघ्य स्सानुक्रोशो जितेन्द्रियः।स्थिरानुरागो धर्मात्मा मातृवत्पितृवत्प्रियः।।2.118.4।।
explanation: What to speak of a husband if he is worthy of applause for his virtues, is compassionate, a subduer of the senses, righteous and ever affectionate like a mother and a father?

content: यां वृत्तिं वर्तते रामः कौसल्यायां महाबलः।तामेव नृपनारीणामन्यासामपि वर्तते।।2.118.5।।
explanation: Mighty Rama shows the same behaviour and treatment towards the other consorts of the king as he does towards his own mother Kausalya.

content: सकृद्दृष्टास्वपि स्त्रिषु नृपेण नृपवत्सलः।मातृवद्वर्तते वीरो मानमुत्सृज्य धर्मवित्।।2.118.6।।
explanation: Heroic Rama is affectionate towards king Dasaratha and is conversant with righteousness. Renouncing the sense of selfrespect he honours all the women on whom his father had cast his glance even once just as his own mother.

content: आगच्छन्त्याश्च विजनं वनमेवं भयावहम्।समाहितं मे श्वश्र्वा च हृदये तद्धृतं महत्।।2.118.7।।
explanation: When departing for this frightful and desolate forest, the great (advice) imparted by my motherinlaw is firmly fixed in my mind.

content: पाणिप्रदानकाले च यत्पुरात्वग्नि सन्निधौ।अनुशिष्टा जनन्याऽस्मि वाक्यं तदपि मे धृतम्।।2.118.8।।
explanation: When I have been taught by my mother earlier, at the time of bestowal of my hand to Rama in the presence of the sacrificial fire (as witness) is etched in my mind.

content: नवीकृतं तु तत्सर्वं वाक्यैस्ते धर्मचारिणि।पतिशुश्रूषणान्नार्यास्तपो नान्यद्विधीयते।।2.118.9।।
explanation: O righteous one (Anasuya), after listening to your words the instructions given by my motherinlaw and my mother are renewed (remembered again). For a woman, no other penance is laid down (in scriptures) except service to her husband.

content: सावित्री पतिशुश्रूषां कृत्वा स्वर्गे महीयते।तथावृत्तिश्च याता त्वं पतिशुश्रूषया दिवम्।।2.118.10।।
explanation: Having served her husband (faithfully), Savitri is honoured in heaven. You also, by following the same path of serving your husband, shall reach the heaven.

content: वरिष्ठा सर्वनारीणामेषा च दिवि देवता।रोहिणी न विनाचन्द्रं मुहूर्तमपि दृश्यते।।2.118.11।।
explanation: Rohini, the very best among all women and the goddess of heaven, is never seen in the sky separated from the moon even for a moment.

content: एवंविधाश्च प्रवराः स्त्रियो भर्तृदृढव्रताः।देवलोके महीयन्ते पुण्येन स्वेन कर्मणा।।2.118.12।।
explanation: Execellent women such as these, firm in their vows to their husband are highly revered in the world of gods through their own meritorious deeds.

content: ततोऽनसूया संहृष्टा श्रुत्वोक्तं सीतया वचः।शिरस्याघ्राय चोवाच मैथिलीं हर्षयन्त्युत।।2.118.13।।
explanation: Thereafter hearing Sita's words, Anasuya affectionately kissed her forehead and said this in order to make her happy:

content: नियमैर्विविधैराप्तं तपो हि महदस्ति मे।तत्संश्रित्य बलं सीते छन्दये त्वां शुचिव्रते।।2.118.14।।
explanation: O Sita of pure conduct, I have great ascetic power obtained through practising various austerities. With its strength I shall give what you want for your enjoyment.

content: उपपन्नं मनोज्ञं च वचनं तव मैथिलि।प्रीता चास्म्युचितं किं ते करवाणि ब्रवीहि मे।।2.118.15।।
explanation: O Sita, I am glad to hear your befitting and pleasing words. Tell me what appropriate  thing you desire and I shall give you.

content:
तस्यास्तद्  वचनं श्रूत्वा विस्मिता मन्दविस्मया।

कृतमित्यब्रवीत् सीता तपोबलसमन्विताम्।।2.118.16।।
explanation:
On hearing her words Sita was surprised. With a gentle smile she said, to Anasuya who was endowed with ascetic power, 'I think you have already granted me the
boons'.

content: सा त्वेवमुक्ता धर्मज्ञा तया प्रीततराऽभवत्।सफलं च प्रहर्षं ते हन्त सीते करोम्यहम्।।2.118.17।।
explanation: When Sita said so, Anasuya who knew her righteous duty was immensely pleased. and replied, 'What a joy I shall make the words you have spoken come true'.

content: इदं दिव्यं वरं माल्यं वस्त्रमाभरणानि च।अङ्गरागं च वैदेहि महार्हं चानुलेपनम्।।2.118.18।।मया दत्तमिदं सीते तव गात्राणि शोभयेत्।अनुरूपमसंक्लिष्टं नित्यमेव भविष्यति।।2.118.19।।
explanation: O princess of Videha, O  Sita, I bestow on you this best garland of the gods, raiment, jewellery, fragrant unguents, and precious ointment for anointing your body with. All this will beautify your limbs. It is convenient (to use) and will never fade.

content: अङ्गरागेण दिव्येन लिप्ताङ्गी जनकात्मजे।शोभयिष्यसि भर्तारं यथा श्रीर्विष्णुमव्ययम्।।2.118.20।।
explanation: O daughter of Janaka, you will enhance the glory of your husband by anointing your body with this divine, fragrant unguent to your body like Lakshmi enhancing the glory of eternal Visnu.

content: सा वस्त्रमङ्गरागं च भूषणानि स्रजस्तथा।मैथिली प्रतिजग्राह प्रीतिदानमनुत्तमम्।।2.118.21।।
explanation: That princess from Mithila accepted the incomparable gifts of love, the raiment, fragrant unguents, jewellery and also the garland.

content: प्रतिगृह्य च तत्सीता प्रीतिदानं यशस्विनी।श्लिष्टाञ्जलिपुटा तत्र समुपास्त तपोधनाम्।।2.118.22।।
explanation: Illustrious Sita accepted the gifts of love and with palms folded in reverence sat beside her, an ascetic.

content: तथा सीतामुपासीनामनसूया दृढव्रता।वचनं प्रष्टुमारेभे काञ्चित्प्रियकथामनु।।2.118.23।।
explanation: Anasuya who was firm in her vows commenced to ask Sita this way about a certain tale (that was close to her heart).

content: स्वयं वरे किल प्राप्ता त्वमनेन यशस्विना।राघवेणेति मे सिते कथा श्रुतिमुपागता।।2.118.24।।
explanation: O Sita, I have heard that you have been won by the illustrious Rama in the swayamvara. At least that is the story which reached my ears.

content: तां कथां श्रोतुमिच्छामि विस्तरेण च मैथिलि।यथाऽनुभूतं कार्त्स्न्येन तन्मे त्वं वक्तुमर्हसि।।2.118.25।।
explanation: O daughter of Mithila, I would like to hear the story in detail. You should tell me the whole story as you experienced it.

content: एवमुक्ता तु सा सीता तां ततो धर्मचारिणीम्।श्रूयतामिति चोक्त्वा वै कथयामास तां कथाम्।।2.118.26।।
explanation: 'Listen' said Sita, thus addressed, and began relating the story to Anasuya, a performer of austerities.

content: मिथिलाधिपतिर्वीरो जनको नाम धर्मवित्।क्षत्रधर्मे ह्यभिरतो न्यायतश्शास्ति मेदिनीम्।।2.118.27।।
explanation: There is a king in Mithila, Janaka by name. He is heroic and is conversant with  righteousness. Engaged in the duties of a kshatriya, he is rules the earth with justice.

content: तस्य लाङ्गलहस्तन्य कर्षतः क्षेत्रमण्डलम्।अहं किलोत्थिता भित्वा जगतीं नृपतेस्सुता।।2.118.28।।
explanation: When he was ploughing the circular plot of land for performing a sacrifice, it is said I emerged from the earth by breaking it and therefore I became his dauhghter.

content: स मां दृष्ट्वा नरपतिर्मुष्टिविक्षेपतत्परः।पांसुकुण्ठितसर्वाङ्गीं जनको विस्मितोऽभवत्।।2.118.29।।
explanation: Engaged in sowing fistfuls of seeds, king Janaka found me covered with dust and was astonished.

content: अनपत्येन च स्नेहादङ्कमारोप्य च स्वयम्।ममेयं तनयेत्युक्त्वा स्नेहो मयि निपातितः।।2.118.30।।
explanation: As he had no children, he, on his own accord, lifted me up and placing me on his lap, saying, This is my daughter, he began showering (lots of) love on me.

content: अन्तरिक्षे च वागुक्ताऽप्रतिमाऽमानुषी किल।एवमेतन्नरपते धर्मेण तनया तव।।2.118.31।।
explanation: 'O king, she is an incomparable divine being. By right she is your daughter'. These were the words (Janaka) heard from out of the sky.

content: ततः प्रहृष्टो धर्मात्मा पिता मे मिथिलाधिपः।अवाप्तो विपुलां बुद्धिं मामवाप्य नराधिपः।।2.118.32।।
explanation: Thereafter, my father and the righteous lord of Mithila was delighted in possessing  me when a noble thought struck his mind.

content: दत्ता चास्मीष्टवद्देव्यै ज्येष्ठायै पुण्यकर्मणा।तया सम्भाविता चास्मि स्निग्धया मातृसौहृदात्।।2.118.33।।
explanation: Bestowed as the choicest one of meritorious acts on the chief queen, I was brought up by her, by nature affectionate, with the love of a mother.

content: पतिसंयोगसुलभं वयो दृष्ट्वा तु मे पिता।चिन्तामभ्यगमद्धीनो वित्तनाशादिवाधनः।।2.118.34।।
explanation: When my father saw I had attained  the marriageable age, he was immersed in sorrow like an indigent man who had lost all his wealth.

content: सदृशाच्चापकृष्टाच्च लोके कन्यापिता जनात्।प्रधर्षणामवाप्नोति शक्रेणापि समो भुवि।।2.118.35।।
explanation: Even though he was an Indra on earth, as a father of  an unmarried girl he would be humiliated by men who are his equal or inferior in this world.

content: तां धर्षणामदूरस्थां दृष्ट्वा चात्मनि पार्थिवः।चिन्तार्णवगतः पारं नाससादाप्लवो यथा।।2.118.36।।
explanation: Having perceived that the humiliation is not very far, king Janaka was plunged in a sea of sorrow like one who cannot reach the shore without a float.

content: अयोनिजां हि मां ज्ञात्वा नाध्यगच्छद्विचिन्तयन्।सदृशं चानुरूपं च महीपालः पतिं मम।।2.118.37।।
explanation: The ruler of the earth knew that I was not born from a woman's womb, and could not find a suitable husband for me after deep reflection.

content: तस्य बुद्धिरियं जाता चिन्तयानस्य सन्ततम्।स्वयंवरं तनूजायाः करिष्यामीति धीमतः।।2.118.38।।
explanation: After constantly pondering over the matter, the wise king arrived at the decision to perform a swayamvara for his daughter.

content: महायज्ञे तदा तस्य वरुणेन महात्मना।दत्तं धनुर्वरं प्रीत्या तूणी चाक्षयसायकौ।।2.118.39।।
explanation: Magnanimous Varuna out of his affection had given him, on the occasion of a great sacrifice, an excellent bow with inexhaustible arrows and a pair of quivers.

content: असञ्चाल्यं मनुष्यैश्च यत्नेनापि च गौरवात्।तन्न शक्ता नमयितुं स्वप्नेष्वपि नराधिपाः।।2.118.40।।
explanation: Because of its weight, no human could move that bow despite great effort nor were the kings capable of bending it even in their dreams.

content: तद्धनुः प्राप्य मे पित्रा व्याहृतं सत्यवादिना।समवाये नरेन्द्राणां पूर्वमामन्त्र्य पार्थिवान्।।2.118.41।।
explanation: My truthful father, after having acquired the bow, invited all the princes and placed the great bow before them in the assembly where he declared:

content: इदं च धनुरुद्यम्य सज्यं यः कुरुते नरः।तस्य मे दुहिता भार्या भविष्यति न संशयः।।2.118.42।।
तच्च दृष्ट्वा धनुश्श्रेष्ठं गौरवाद्गिरिसन्निभम्। अभिवाद्य नृपा जग्मुरशक्तास्तस्य तोलने।।2.118.43।।
explanation: Beholding the mighty bow resembling a mountain in weight, the kings, unable to lift it, paid their homage and left.

content: सुदीर्घस्य तु कालस्य राघवोऽयं महाद्युतिः।विश्वामित्रेण सहितो यज्ञं द्रष्टुं समागतः।।2.118.44।।लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा राम स्सत्यपराक्रमः।
explanation: After a long time, resplendent Rama whose prowess was truth, arrived along with  his brother Lakshman and sage Viswamitra in order to witness the sacrifice.

content: विश्वामित्रस्तु धर्मात्मा मम पित्रा सुपूजितः।।2.118.45।।प्रोवाच पितरं तत्र भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।
explanation: Having accepted the honour extended by my father, righteous Viswamitra spoke to him about those two brothers, Rama and Lakshmana.

content: सुतौ दशरथस्येमौ धनुर्दर्शकाङ्क्षिणौ।धनुर्दर्शय रामाय राजपुत्राय दैविकम्।।2.118.46।।
explanation: 'Both these sons of king Dasaratha wish to see the bow. Show the divine bow to prince  Rama'.

content: इत्युक्तस्तेन विप्रेण तद्धनुस्समुपानयत्।।2.118.47।।निमेषान्तरमात्रेण तदाऽनम्य महाबलः।ज्यां समारोप्य झडिति पूरयामास वीर्यवान्।।2.118.48।।
explanation: At the words of that ascetic, my father brought out the bow. Mighty and valiant Rama bent it and strung it and drew it in the twinkling of an eye.

content: तेन पूरयता वेगान्मध्ये भग्नं द्विधा धनुः।तस्य शब्दो भवद्भीमः पतितस्याशनेरिव।।2.118.49।।
explanation: When Rama was stringing the bow with force, it was broken into two in the middle and fell down with a dreadful sound like that of thunder.

content: ततोऽहं तत्र रामाय पित्रा सत्याभिसन्धिना।निश्चिता दातुमुद्यम्य जलभाजनमुत्तमम्।।2.118.50।।
explanation: Then, my father steadfast in truth, held a vessel of pure water and declared his decision to offer me to Rama.

content: दीयमानां न तु तदा प्रतिजग्राह राघवः।अविज्ञाय पितुश्छन्दमयोध्याऽधिपतेः प्रभोः।।2.118.51।।
explanation: Then Rama did not accept the offer of my father straightaway before he knew the opinion of his father Dasaratha,  king of Ayodhya.

content: तत श्श्वशुरमामन्त्र्य वृद्धं दशरथं नृपम्।मम पित्रा त्वहं दत्ता रामाय विदितात्मने।।2.118.52।।
explanation: Thereafter, my fatherinlaw, the aged king Dasaratha was invited and my father  offered me to Rama  known for his sagacity.

content: मम चैवानुजा साध्वी ऊर्मिला प्रियदर्शना।भार्यार्थे लक्ष्मणस्यापि दत्ता पित्रा मम स्वयम्।।2.118.53।।
explanation: My father, on his own accord, bestowed Urmila, my younger sister of chaste and of  pleasing appearance as wife to Lakshmana.

content: एवं दत्ताऽस्मि रामाय तदा तस्मिन्स्वयंवरे।अनुरक्ताऽस्मि धर्मेण पतिं वीर्यवतां वरम्।।2.118.54।।
explanation: In this way my father bestowed me on Rama in that swayamvara and I remain devoted to my husband who is the foremost among the valiant in treading the path of  righteousness.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अयोध्याकाण्डे अष्टादशोत्तरशततमस्सर्गः।Thus ends the one hundredeighteenth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Rama, Lakshmana and Sita take leave of Atri and Anasuya -- enter the Dandaka forest.]अनसूया तु धर्मज्ञा श्रुत्वा तां महतीं कथाम्।पर्यष्वजत बाहुभ्यां शिरस्याघ्राय मैथिलीम्।।2.119.1।।
explanation: Then righteous Anasuya, having heard the great story of Sita, kissed her on the forehead and embraced her with both the arms.

content: व्यक्ताक्षरपदं चित्रं भाषितं मधुरं त्वया।यथा स्वयंवरं वृत्तं तत्सर्वं हि श्रुतं मया।।2.119.2।।रमेऽहं कथया ते तु दृढं मधुरभाषिणि।
explanation: You have related wonderfully and sweetly your Swayamvara with each word and each syllable uttered clearly. I have heard everything as it happened. O sweetspeaking Sita, I have greatly enjoyed your story.

content: रविरस्तङ्गतश्श्रीमानुपोह्य रजनीं शिवाम्।।2.119.3।।दिवसं प्रतिकीर्णानामाहारार्थं पतत्रिणाम्।सन्ध्याकाले निलीनानां निद्रार्थं श्रूयते ध्वनिः।।2.119.4।।
explanation: The resplendent Sun has set. The auspcious night is drawing near. The birds who forage far and wide for food during the day return to their nests to rest for the night. You can hear them twittering.

content: एते चाप्यभिषेकार्द्रा मुनयः कलशोद्यताः।सहिता उपवर्तन्ते सलिलाप्लुतवल्कलाः।।2.119.5।।
explanation: The sages also  are returning in groups with waterpitchers filled with water and their bark robes soaked with water after their ceremonial bath.

content: ऋषीणामग्निहोत्रेषु हुतेषु विधिपूर्वकम्।कपोताङ्गारुणो धूमो दृश्यते पवनोद्धतः।।2.119.6।।
explanation: The ascetics have duly offered oblations to the fire in Agnihotra sacrifices and the smoke, tawny like the pigeon's body, emanates wafted by the wind.

content: अल्पपर्णा हि तरवो घनीभूतास्समन्ततः।विप्रकृष्टेन्द्रिये देशेऽस्मिन्न प्रकाशन्ति वै दिशः।।2.119.7।।
explanation: The trees with sparse leaves all over have grown dense, the quarters in the distant region are no longer discernible by the senses.

content: रजनीचरसत्त्वानि प्रचरन्ति समन्ततः।तपोवनमृगा ह्येते वेदितीर्थेषु शेरते।।2.119.8।।
explanation: The night rangers have started moving everywhere and the deer in the penance  grove are beginning to sleep around the sacred altars.

content: सम्प्रवृत्तानिशा सीते नक्षत्रसमलङ्कृता।ज्योत्स्नाप्रावरणश्चन्द्रो दृश्यतेऽभ्युदितोऽम्बरे।।2.119.9।।
explanation: O Sita, adorned with stars, the night has commenced. You can see the moon rising in the sky spreading his mantle of light.

content: गम्यतामनुजानामि रामस्यानुचरी भव।कथायन्त्या हि मधुरं त्वयाऽहं परितोषिता।।2.119.10।।
explanation: With my permission you may go now and be a companion of Rama. I am thoroughly contented  with your story told so sweetly.

content: अलङ्कुरु च तावत्त्वं प्रत्यक्षं मम मैथिलि।प्रीतिं जनय मे वत्से दिव्यालङ्कारशोभिता।।2.119.11।।
explanation: O Sita, adorn yourself in my presence. Dear child, permit me the pleasure of  adorning  you with these divine ornaments.

content: सा तथा समलङ्कृत्य सीता सुरसुतोपमा।प्रणम्य शिरसा तस्यै रामं त्वभिमुखी ययौ।।2.119.12।।
explanation: Sita, adorned, looked like the daughter of a god. She bowed at the feet of Anasuya in reverence and set out to meet Rama.

content: तथा तु भूषितां सीतां ददर्श वदतां वरः।राघवः प्रीतिदानेन तपस्विन्या जहर्ष च।।2.119.13।।
explanation: Rama, the most eloquent among men, saw Sita adorned, and rejoiced at the gifts of love given by the ascetic Anasuya.

content: न्यवेदयत्ततस्सर्वं सीता रामाय मैथिली।प्रीतिदानं तपस्विन्या वसनाभरणस्रजम्।।2.119.14।।
explanation: Sita the princess of Mithila related everything to Rama and showed him the gifts of love given by ascetic Anasuya -- raiment, jewellery and garlands.

content: प्रहृष्टस्त्वभवद्रामो लक्ष्मणश्च महारथः।मैथिल्यास्सत्क्रियां दृष्ट्वा मानुषेषु सुदुर्लभाम्।।2.119.15।।
explanation: Rama the great charioteer and Lakshmana were exceedingly gratified to see the honour conferred on Sita, rare among mortals.

content: ततस्तां शर्वरीं प्रीतः पुण्यां शशिनिभाननः।अर्चितस्तापसै स्सिद्धैरुवास रघुनन्दनः।।2.119.16।।
explanation: Thereafter, the descendant of Raghu, whose countenance resembled the Moon, having received the hospitality of the accomplished ascetics, passed that holy night in delight.

content: तस्यां रात्र्यां व्यतीतायामभिषिच्य हुताग्निकान्।आपृच्छेतां नरव्याघ्रौ तापसान्वनगोचरान्।।2.119.17।।
explanation: Night over, the two best men, Rama and Lakshmana, after their ablution took leave of the ascetics inhabiting the forest who offered morning oblations to the fire .

content: तावूचुस्ते वनचरास्तापसा धर्मचारिणः।वनस्य तस्य सञ्चारं राक्षसैस्समभिप्लुतम्।।2.119.18।।
explanation: The righteous ascetics dwelling in the forest informed both Rama and Lakshmana  that  part of the forest infested by demons.

content: रक्षांसि पुरुषादानि नानारूपाणि राघव।वसन्त्यस्मिन्महारण्ये व्यालाश्च रुधिराशनाः।।2.119.19।।
explanation: O Rama, this great forest is haunted by carnivorous demons who can assume any form and by blooddrinking wild animals.

content: उच्छिष्टं वा प्रमत्तं वा तापसं धर्मचारिणम्।अदन्त्यस्मिन्महारण्ये तान्निवारय राघव।।2.119.20।।
explanation: O Rama, in this great forest demons will devour the  ascetics if they find them impure or intoxicated or indolent. Prevent them.

content: एष पन्था महर्षीणां फलान्याहरतां वने।अनेन तु वनं दुर्गं गन्तुं राघव ते क्षमम्।।2.119.21।।
explanation: O Rama, this is the one path in the forest used by the ascetics to gather fruits. You can safely cross the otherwise impassable forest through this path.

content: इतीव तैः प्राञ्जलिभिस्तपस्विभिर्द्विजैः कृतस्वस्त्ययनः परन्तपः।वनं सभार्यः प्रविवेश राघवस्सलक्ष्मणस्सूर्य इवाभ्रमण्डलम्।।2.119.22।।
explanation: The ascetics offered their blessings to Rama the tormentor of enemies. Thereafter, accompanied by his wife and Lakshmana, he entered the great forest like the Sun entering the mass of clouds. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे श्रीमद्वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये चतुर्विंशत्सहस्रिकायां संहितयां श्रीमदयोध्याकाण्डे एकोनविंशत्युत्तरशततमस्सर्गः।।   Thus ends the hundrednineteenth sarga in Ayodhyakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
